15. Too much candy ______ the child's teeth.

16. As the dog grew older, its health ______.

17. When one makes a mistake, the ______ thing to do is to correct it.





第三部分

decrease　［dɪˈkriːs］

v. 减少〈同 lessen〉

例 Bob's influence on the committee slowly decreased after he caused the accident. 在鲍勃造成这起事故之后，他对委员会的影响力逐渐降低。

记 de（往下）+crease（增长）→使负增长→减少



* * *



deduce　［dɪˈdjuːs］

v. 推断

例 I couldn't deduce whether he thought the idea was a good one or not. 我无法断言他是否会认为这是一个好主意。

记 de（往下）+duce（引导）→往下引导→推断，演绎

联 deduction n. 推论；扣除；deductive adj. 推论的，演绎的



* * *



default　［dɪˈfɔːlt］

v. 不履行（某种责任）；违约

例 People who default on their mortgage repayments may lose their houses. 抵押贷款违约者可能会失去他们的房子。

记 de（往下）+fault（错误）→错误下去→违约



* * *



defeat　［dɪˈfiːt］

v. 击败〈同 beat〉

例 The debate team defeated its rival. 辩论队战胜了他们的对手。



* * *



defect　［ˈdiːfekt; dɪˈfekt］

n. 缺点，瑕疵〈同 flaw〉

例 I bought these shoes cheaply because they have a slight defect. 我以很便宜的价格买到了这双鞋，因为鞋上有一点瑕疵。

联 defective adj. 有缺陷的



* * *



defence　［dɪˈfens］

n. 防卫；防卫物〈同 protection〉

例 The town's defences are weak and it may fall to the enemy. 这个城市的防御非常薄弱，可能会沦陷。



* * *



definite　［ˈdefɪnət］

adj. 清楚的；明确的〈同 distinct; exact〉

例 Roger needs to know the definite arrival time so he can meet his friend on time at the airport. 罗杰需要知道确切的抵达时间，以便准时到机场接朋友。

联 definitely adv. 明确地，肯定地



* * *



delegate

［ˈdelɪɡət］ n. 代表〈同 representative〉

例 She was our delegate at the party conference. 她是我们在党内会议中的代表。

［ˈdelɪɡeɪt］ vt. 委派，授权〈同 authorize〉

例 I've been delegated to organize the weekly meetings. 我被委派组织每周的会议。



* * *



delete　［dɪˈliːt］

vt. 删除〈同 remove〉

例 The editor deleted the incorrect sentence from the manuscript. 编辑删除了手稿中的错误句子。



* * *



deliberate　［dɪˈlɪbərət］



adj. ① 深思熟虑的

例 We made a deliberate decision to live apart for a while. 我们作出了分居一段时间的慎重决定。

② 故意的〈同 intentional〉

例 While many people think that the plane crash was an accident, Tom is convinced that it was a deliberate plan. 虽然有许多人都认为这次空难是一场事故，但汤姆坚信这是一个蓄谋已久的阴谋。

记 de（表否定）+liber（自由）+ate→非自由的→故意的

第四部分

delicate　［ˈdelɪkət］

adj. ① 脆的，易损的；娇弱的〈同 fragile〉

例 Peaches have delicate skin which is easily bruised. 桃子有着娇嫩的外皮，很容易被擦伤。

② 精致的；细腻的〈同 ethereal; sensitive〉

例 Repairing this is going to be a very delicate operation. 维修这件东西需要高度精细的操作。

记 de+lic（=lick 舔）+ate→一舔就坏→易损的



* * *



delicious　［dɪˈlɪʃəs］

adj. 美味的，可口的〈同 tasty〉

例 The smell of delicious fresh bread beckoned the hungry boy. 美味的新鲜面包散发出的香味，吸引着那个饥肠辘辘的男孩。

记 de+lic（=lick 舔）+ious→舔了再舔→美味的



* * *



democracy　［dɪˈmɒkrəsi］

n. 民主政治，民主主义

例 Democracy is spreading around the world in various forms. 民主正在以不同的形式在全球传播。

联 democrat n. 民主党人



* * *



demonstrate　［ˈdemənstreɪt］

vt. 演示；论证〈同 show〉

例 The salesman demonstrated how the special vacuum cleaner worked. 销售员演示了这种特殊的真空吸尘器如何工作。

联 demonstration n. 实证；示范



* * *



dense　［dens］

adj. 密集的，浓厚的〈同 thick〉

例 The airport was closed because of the dense fog. 机场因大雾关闭了。

联 densely adv. 浓密地，浓厚地



* * *



deny　［dɪˈnaɪ］

vt. ① 否认，否定〈同 disavow〉

例 It was obvious that Kitty had eaten all the cookies but she denied it when her mother asked her. 很明显，基蒂吃光了所有饼干，可当她妈妈问她的时候，她却矢口否认。

② 剥夺，拒绝…的要求〈同 deprive〉

例 The state denied the elderly man a driver's license. 该州拒绝给那位老人发驾照。



* * *



depart　［dɪˈpɑːt］

vi. 离开，出发〈同 take off, leave〉

例 The next train to the airport departs from Platform 3. 下一列去往机场的火车从3号站台发车。

记

de（离开）+part（分开）→离开

联 departure n. 启程，出发，离开



* * *



deposit　［dɪˈpɒzɪt］

vt. ① 堆积，沉淀〈同 set down〉

例 The sand was deposited on the sea floor when the current died down. 水流退去之后，沙子沉积在海床上。

② 放置；寄存〈同 place〉

例 Tom deposited his luggage at the hotel. 汤姆把他的行李寄存在酒店里。

联 depositor n. 存款人；deposition n. 沉积作用，沉积物；depositary n. 受托人；贮藏所



* * *



depressed　［dɪˈprest］



adj. 沮丧的；萧条的〈同 dejected〉

例 This organization provides educational assistance to the children living in economically depressed communities. 该机构为居住在经济状况不佳的社区的孩子们提供教育补助。

记 de（往下）+press（压）+ed→往下压→情绪低落的→沮丧的；萧条的



* * *



depression　［dɪˈpreʃən］

n. ① 不景气，萧条期〈同 recession〉

例 Many people lost their fortune during the Great Depression. 在大萧条期间，许多人倾家荡产。

② 沮丧，消沉〈同 sadness〉

例 I'm beginning to get over the deep depression I felt about losing my job. 我开始克服失业带来的深度抑郁。

记 来自depress：de（向下）+press（压）→压制

联 depressant n. 镇静剂；depressive adj. 郁闷的

Lesson 9




音频



预备测验



找出与句子中划线单词意义最相近的词。

1. How to dispose of nuclear waste is an international issue clouded by controversy.

(A) recycle



(B) get rid of



(C) select

2. The library discarded all its old magazines.

(A) got rid of



(B) sold



(C) took away

3. Paper derives its name from the papyrus plant.

(A) shortens



(B) chooses



(C) obtains

4. When telephone calls are transmitted by satellite, a dim echo can often be heard on the line.

(A) weak



(B) static



(C) harsh

5. Major faults in the earth's crust can be detected by the use of fossil sequences.

(A) revealed



(B) identified



(C) unearthed





第一部分

derive　［dɪˈraɪv］

vt. 得到，获取；源于〈同 obtain〉

例 He derives a lot of pleasure from meeting new people. 他从认识新朋友当中获得许多乐趣。

记 de（分离）+rive（=river 河流）→从河里引水→获取；源于

联 derivative n. 派生的事物，派生词；derivation n. 由来，出处



* * *



descend　［dɪˈsend］

v. ① 传下，遗传

例 The noble qualities descend to me from my father. 我的贵族气质遗传自我的父亲。

② 下降〈同 go down〉

例 The bird descended quickly to capture the worm that crawled out of a hole. 那只鸟快速往下飞来捕捉那只爬出洞口的虫子。

记 de（向下）+scend（爬）→爬下→下降

联 descendant n. 后代，后裔；descent n. 下降；血统



* * *



description　［dɪˈskrɪpʃən］

n. 描写，描述

例 The advertisement's description was very misleading. 那则广告的描述非常具有误导性。



* * *



desert

［ˈdezət］ n. 沙漠

例 The hot dry sand of the desert burned our feet. 沙漠中炙热干燥的沙子烫伤了我们的脚。

［dɪˈzɜːt］ vt. 遗弃〈同 forsake〉

例 He deserted his first wife and married a new one. 他抛弃了第一任妻子，又重新娶了一位。

联 deserted adj. 荒芜的，荒废的



* * *



deserve　［dɪˈzɜːv］

vt. 应得〈同 be worthy of〉

例 After five years at college, I think I deserve a good job. 经过五年的大学学习，我认为自己应该得到一份好工作。

联 undeserved adj. 不应得的；不该受的



* * *



design　［dɪˈzaɪn］



n. 设计，图案〈同 pattern〉

例 The design on John's new jacket is beautiful. 约翰的新夹克上的图案非常漂亮。



* * *



desirable　［dɪˈzaɪərəbəl］

adj. 令人向往的；令人满意的〈同 appealing〉

例 I envy Bette because her job is so desirable. 我嫉妒贝特，因为她找的工作太理想了。

记 desir（=desire 欲望）+able→能满足欲望的→令人满意的

联 undesirable adj. 令人不快的



* * *



desperate　［ˈdespərət］

adj. 不顾一切的，拼死的；令人绝望的〈同 hopeless〉

例 The situation was desperate but not hopeless. 这种情形令人绝望，但也不是毫无希望。

记 de（去掉）+sper（希望）+ate→去掉希望的→令人绝望的

联 desperately adv. 迫切地；危急地；desperation n. 绝望



* * *



destination　［ˌdestɪˈneɪʃən］

n. 目的地〈同 terminus〉

例 Our tour destination is New York. 我们旅行的目的地是纽约。



* * *



detect　［dɪˈtekt］

vt. 察觉，发觉；探测〈同 discern; explore〉

例 I detected a tinge of sadness in his voice. 我在他的声音中察觉到一丝淡淡的忧伤。

联 detective n. 侦探 adj. 侦探的；detectable adj. 可发觉的；可查明的；detection n. 察觉

第二部分

determination　［dɪˌtɜːmɪˈneɪʃən］

n. 决心；果断〈同 resolution〉

例 They are pursuing their aims with dogged determination. 他们以坚定的决心追求自己的目标。



* * *



devise　［dɪˈvaɪz］

vt. 设计；发明〈同 create〉

例 The government devised a scheme to house the refugees. 政府制订了一个收容难民的计划。

联 deviser n. 设计者



* * *



devote　［dɪˈvəʊt］

vt. 投入于，献身于〈同 dedicate〉

例 She devoted all her spare time to fishing. 她把所有的业余时间都用在钓鱼上了。

联 devoted adj. 热心的，非常忠实的；devotion n. 热爱，忠诚



* * *



diagram　［ˈdaɪəɡræm］

n. 图表〈同 graph〉

例 He followed the instructions on the diagram. 他遵照图表中的说明（进行操作）。



* * *



dialect　［ˈdaɪəlekt］

n. 方言，土话

例 My grandfather spoke a rural Greek dialect. 我爷爷说的是希腊乡下的方言。



* * *



dictate　［dɪkˈteɪt］

vt. 规定；决定，确定〈同 prescribe〉

例 The tennis club rules dictate that suitable footwear must be worn on the courts. 这家网球俱乐部的章程规定，在球场上必须穿适合的鞋子。



* * *



diet　［ˈdaɪət］



n. 饮食，食物 〈同 nutritional plan〉

例 Human beings need a diet which includes adequate protein. 人类需要富含蛋白质的食物。

vi. 节食，忌食

例 A fat person ought to diet and go for a walk daily. 肥胖的人应该节食，并每天坚持散步。

联 dietary adj. 饮食的；dieter n. 节食者，减肥者；dietitian n. 营养学家；dietetics n. 营养学



* * *



digest　［dɪˈʤest; daɪˈʤest］

vt. 消化〈同 assimilate〉

例 Certain people find that they cannot digest meat easily. 某些人发现自己很难消化肉类。

联 digestion n. 消化；digestive adj. 消化的，有助消化的



* * *



dim　［dɪm］

adj. 暗淡的，模糊的〈同 weak〉

例 The light is too dim for me to read easily. 灯光太暗了，我没法阅读。



* * *



dimension　［dɪˈmenʃən; daɪˈmenʃən］

n. 尺寸；尺度〈同 measure〉

例 The estate agent's brochure specifies the dimensions of each room. 房产经纪人的小册子里详细列明了每个房间的面积。

联 dimensional adj. 空间的

第三部分

dip　［dɪp］

v. 浸，蘸，沾〈同 immerse〉

例 Originally, matches were narrow strips of wood whose tips were dipped in kerosene. 最初，火柴都是一端浸了煤油的细木条。



* * *



diplomatic　［ˌdɪpləˈmætɪk］

adj. 外交的；老练的〈同 tactful〉

例 Diplomatic negotiations generally take place in embassies or in the foreign offices of the countries where ambassadors are accredited. 外交谈判通常在大使馆或者在大使被认可的国家的办公室中举行。

记 来自名词diplomat（外交家，外交官）



* * *



discard　［dɪˈskɑːd］

vt. 丢弃〈同 jettison, get rid of〉

例 When he purchased a new coat, he discarded his old one. 他买了新衣服，就丢掉了旧衣服。



* * *



discharge

［dɪsˈtʃɑːʤ］ vt. 释放；排出〈同 release〉

例 Large amount of dangerous waste is discharged daily by the factory. 这家工厂每天都在排放大量的有害废弃物。

［ˈdɪstʃɑːʤ］ n. 流出；排放出的物体〈同 emission〉

例 It has been claimed that the discharge from the nuclear plant is entirely safe. 据称，核电站的排放物是完全安全的。



* * *



discipline　［ˈdɪsəplɪn］

n. ① 纪律；训练〈同 regulation, constraint; training〉

例 Children who have had no discipline are often hard to teach. 不遵守纪律的孩子通常很难教。

② 学科〈同 field, subject〉

例 The student chose the discipline of mathematics. 那个学生选择了数学这门学科。

联 subdiscipline n.（学科的）分支，分科；disciplined adj. 遵守纪律的



* * *



discount



［ˈdɪskaʊnt］ n. 折扣〈同 deduction〉

例 Since the product was defective, the manager agreed to a discount. 由于这件商品存在缺陷，因此经理同意打折。

［dɪsˈkaʊnt］ vt. 不全信，对…持怀疑态度〈同 doubt〉

例 The police discounted what the informer said. 警方对线人的话持怀疑态度。



* * *



disgust　［dɪsˈɡʌst］

n. 厌恶，嫌恶〈同 repulsion〉

例 The horror film filled Mike with disgust. 那部恐怖电影让迈克感到恶心。

联 disgusted adj. 厌烦的；厌恶的；disgusting adj. 令人厌恶的



* * *



dismiss　［dɪsˈmɪs］

vt. 解散；摒除（思想、感情等）〈同 send away; eliminate〉

例 Believing in John's love for her, she dismissed the notion that he might be unfaithful. 她相信约翰对她的爱，于是打消了他可能不忠诚的想法。



* * *



disorder　［dɪsˈɔːdə(r)］

n. 杂乱，紊乱

例 The whole office was in a state of disorder—she couldn't find a thing. 整间办公室一片混乱——她一件东西也找不到。

记 dis（不）+order（正常状态）→不是正常状态→杂乱，紊乱

联 disorderly adj. 混乱的



* * *



display　［dɪsˈpleɪ］

vt. 陈列；显示〈同 exhibit〉

例 The permit should be clearly displayed in the front window. 应把许可证醒目地摆放在前窗位置。

n. 陈列，展览；显示〈同 demonstration〉

例 The museum's display of ancient jewelry attracted many visitors. 博物馆举办的古代珠宝展览吸引了许多参观者。

第四部分

dispose　［dɪˈspəʊz］

v. 处理，处置（of）〈同 cope with, settle〉

例 Nuclear waste is often disposed of in the ocean. 处理核废料的方式通常是投入海洋。

联 disposed adj. 有…倾向的



* * *



dispute



［dɪˈspjuːt; ˈdɪspjuːt］ n. 争论，纠纷〈同 disagreement〉

例 The worker did not think his salary was high enough and had a dispute with the boss. 那名工人认为自己的工资不够高，于是与老板发生了争执。

［dɪˈspjuːt］ vt. 争论，争执；对…提出质疑〈同 argue〉

例 Critics have disputed the official unemployment figures. 评论家们对官方的失业数据提出质疑。



* * *



dissolve　［dɪˈzɒlv］

vt. 使溶解〈同 melt〉

例 Some kinds of medicine have to be dissolved in water before being taken. 有一些药品在服用之前，必须用水溶解。



* * *



distinct　［dɪˈstɪŋkt］

adj. 明确的，确实的；不同的〈同 definite〉

例 The twins may look alike, but they have quite distinct personalities. 那对双胞胎看起来很像，但他们却有着迥然不同的个性。

联 distinctly adv. 明显地，清楚地；不同地



* * *



distinction　［dɪˈstɪŋkʃən］

n. ① 差别，特性〈同 difference〉

例 The only distinction between the twins is their eye color. 那对双胞胎唯一的区别是他们眼睛的颜色。

② 显赫，声望〈同 luster〉

例 The awards added distinction to the author's reputation. 这些奖项让这位作家更加有声望。



* * *



distinguish　［dɪsˈtɪŋɡwɪʃ］

vt. 区别，辨认〈同 characterize〉

例 The little girl forgot to wear her glasses and could not distinguish between the rope and a snake. 那个小女孩忘了戴眼镜，结果分不清绳子和蛇。

联 distinguished adj. 著名的；显赫的



* * *



distress　［dɪˈstres］

n. 悲痛，不幸，穷困〈同 discomfort〉

例 Although she said she was okay, her face showed her distress over the death of her boyfriend. 虽然她说自己没事，但从她的脸色能看出男朋友的离世给她带来的悲痛。



* * *



distribute　［dɪˈstrɪbjuːt］

vt. 分配；分发，散布〈同 disseminate〉

例 Someone dressed in a rabbit costume distributes leaflets to passersby. 有个穿着兔子服装的人向行人发传单。

联 distribution n. 分发，分配



* * *



disturb　［dɪˈstɜːb］

vt. 打扰，扰乱〈同 bother〉

例 Every morning the birds disturb my sleep. 每天早上，那些鸟都会打扰我睡觉。

联 undisturbed adj. 没受干扰的，安静的；disturbance n. 骚动，动乱



* * *



diverse　［daɪˈvɜːs］

adj. 不同的；变化多的〈同 various〉

例 Even though the topography of different areas of the southwestern United States is diverse, the weather patterns are quite similar. 虽然美国西南部不同地区的地形多种多样，但天气模式却非常相似。

记 di（两个，双）+verse（转）→向两个方向转开→不同的

联 diversify vt. 使多样化；diversified adj. 多样化的；diversification n. 多样化；diversity n. 差异，多样性

Exercise 3　从第二栏中选出第一栏各词的同义词。





COLUMN Ⅰ COLUMN Ⅱ

Lesson 10




音频



预备测验



找出与句子中划线单词意义最相近的词。

1. Horseback riding embraces both the skill of handling a horse and the mastery of diverse riding styles.

(A) fosters

(B) emphasizes

(C) includes

2. The dominant theme in the music is of tranquility and peacefulness.

(A) major

(B) final

(C) copious

3. Mrs. McClain is always economical.

(A) very dear

(B) costly

(C) thrifty

4. The eagle usually captures its prey on the ground but may then carry it off to eat it elsewhere.

(A) in seclusion

(B) in its nest

(C) in another place

5. The otters seem to be drifting around the bay.

(A) sailing fast

(B) moving aimlessly

(C) inflating





第一部分

domestic　［dəˈmestɪk］

adj. ① 家里的；家养的〈同 house-hold〉

例 The police called the fight between the husband and wife a domestic matter. 警方说夫妻吵架是家庭内部的事。

② 本国的，国内的

例 The President excels at both domestic and international matters. 总统处理国内事务和国际事务均非常出色。

记 dom（= house 家）+ estic→家里的

联 domesticate v. 驯养



* * *



dominant　［ˈdɒmɪnənt］

adj. 支配的，占优势的〈同 major，important〉

例 In many pieces of music there is a dominant theme on which the rest of the composition is centered. 许多音乐作品中都有一个占主导地位的主题，其他部分均围绕这个主题展开。

记 domin（统治，支配）+ ant→占统治地位的→支配的

联 dominance n. 绝对优势；predominant adj. 主要的，支配地位的



* * *



dominate　［ˈdɒmɪneɪt］

vt. 统治，支配，控制〈同 prevail over，monopolize〉

例 The arbitrary old man dominates the whole family. 那个专制的老人控制着整个家族。



* * *



dose　［dəʊs］

n.（药的）剂量，(一）服

例 Janet took a dose of medicine every four hours. 珍妮特每四个小时吃一剂药。

联 dosage n. 剂量



* * *



dot　［dɒt］

vt. 星罗棋布于〈同 scatter〉

例 The sky is dotted with innumerable stars at night. 夜晚的天空点缀着数不清的星星。

n. 点，圆点

例 The full stop at the end of this sentence is a dot. 本句结尾的句号是个点。



* * *



downtown　［ˌdaʊnˈtaʊn］

adv./adj. 在市区（的），往市区（的）

例 We are going to a downtown restaurant tonight. 我们今晚要去市里的一家饭店。



* * *



draft　［drɑːft］

n. 草图，草稿〈同 sketch〉

例 Let's make a rough draft of the letter. 我们在写信之前先大致打个草稿吧。

vt. 起草〈同 draw up〉

例 Draft a proposal and we can discuss it at the meeting before any decisions are made. 先起草一份方案，我们便可在会上讨论后再作决定。



* * *



drain　［dreɪn］

v.（使）流走，（使）排光〈同 draw out〉

例 We drained the pond and filled it with fresh water. 我们把池塘里的水排干，然后注满了清水。

n. 排水；消耗〈同 waste〉

例 Not having anybody to rent my room is a serious drain on my financial resources. 没有人租我的房间，这严重影响了我的收入来源。

记 d+rain→把雨水排掉→排水

联 drainage n. 排水；排出物



* * *



drift　［drɪft］

vi. 漂流；漂泊〈同 move aimlessly〉

例 Janet spent the year drifting around Europe. 珍妮特用了一年时间，在欧洲四处漂泊。

联 driftwood n. 浮木；snowdrift n. 雪堆



* * *



drown　［draʊn］



v. 溺死，淹死；淹没

例 Heavy rain drowned the newly planted fields. 大雨淹没了新种植的农田。



自我检测


从第一部分中选出最适当的词填入空格内。

6. The leaky pen left ______ of ink on the tablecloth.

7. Bill wrote the first ______ of his paper.

8. The prospect of automobile imports has prompted ______ manufacturers to offer financial incentives to buyers in order to stay competitive.

9. I live 14 miles away from my ______office.

10. The exhausted swimmer ______ in the sea.

11. The sailboat ______ toward shore.





第二部分

due　［djuː; (US)duː］

adj. 预期的，到期的〈同 payable〉

例 This bill was due two weeks ago, but I forgot to pay it. 这个账单两周之前就到期了，但我忘记支付了。

联 overdue adj. 迟到的，过期的



* * *



dull　［dʌl］

adj. 钝的；（感觉或理解）迟钝的〈同 blunt〉

例 The butcher sharpened the dull knife. 屠夫把那把钝刀磨得锋利了。



* * *



dumb　［dʌm］

adj. 哑的〈同 mute〉

例 She's been deaf and dumb since birth. 她是天生的聋哑人。

联 dumbbell-like adj. 哑铃形状的



* * *



dump　［dʌmp］



vt. 倾卸，倾倒

例 Who dumped all these books on my desk? 是谁把这些书扔到我桌子上的？



* * *



durable　［ˈdjʊərəbl］

adj. 持久的；耐用的〈同 lasting〉

例 Our friendship has proven to be durable because it is based on mutual respect and honesty. 事实证明，我们的友谊是持久的，因为它建立在相互尊重和诚实的基础之上。

联 duration n. 持续时间



* * *



dynamic　［daɪˈnæmɪk］

adj. 动力的；动态的〈同 changing〉

例 The markets are dynamic and a company must learn to adapt itself to this fact. 市场是动态的，公司必须学会适应。

记 dynam（力量）+ic→动力的

联 dynamics n. 动力学；aerodynamics n. 空气动力学；thermodynamics n. 热力学



* * *



earnest　［ˈɜːnɪst］

adj. 认真的；热心的〈同 serious〉

例 The earnest student studied constantly. 那个认真的学生不断地学习。



* * *



echo　［ˈekəʊ］

v. 发出回声；反射

例 The hills echoed his shout. 大山传来他叫喊的回声。

n. 回声，回音

例 An echo bounced off the bluff . 从悬崖上传回一阵回音。



* * *



economical　［ˌiːkəˈnɒmɪkəl］

adj. 经济的；节俭的〈同 thrifty, saving〉

例 Comparing prices is an economical way to shop for groceries. 购买食品杂货时，比较价格是一种省钱的方式。

记 economic（节约的）+al→节俭的

联 economics n. 经济学



* * *



edit　［ˈedɪt］

vt. 编辑，校订

例 You must edit this video before it goes on television. 这段视频在电视上播放之前，你必须对其进行编辑。

联 edition n. 版本，版；editor n. 编辑，编者；editorial n. 社论



自我检测


从第二部分中选出最适当的词填入空格内。

12. It was a ______ refrigerator, but it finally broke.

13. Using coupons is an ______ way to shop for groceries.

14. A big truck ______ the sand into the backyard.

15. The mountains ______ the thunder.

16. The audience applauded the ______ dancers.

17. Janet is always ______; she saves every penny she can.





第三部分

efficient　［ɪˈfɪʃənt］

adj. 生效的；能干的，有效率的〈同 effective〉

例 The financial analyst found efficient ways for the company to save money. 财务分析师发现了帮公司省钱的有效途径。

记 ef+fici（效果，效率）+ent→有效率的

联 efficiency n. 效率，功效



* * *



elaborate

［ɪˈlæbərət］ adj. 精细的，精心的；详尽的〈同 detailed〉

例 The judge wrote an elaborate proposal for a new law. 法官撰写了一个详细的新法律提案。

［ɪˈlæbəreɪt］ vt. 详细阐述〈同 detail〉

例 I understand the basic idea, but could you elaborate on that？我理解基本意思，但你能详细说明一下吗？

记 e（出）+labor（劳动）+ate→（努力）劳动做出来的→精细的

联 elaborately adv. 精心地，精细地；elaboration n. 精心计划，精巧



* * *



elastic　［ɪˈlæstɪk］

adj. 有弹性的〈同 pliant〉

例 Rubber can be made so elastic that it will stretch more than nine times its normal length. 塑料可以做得非常有弹性，甚至可以拉伸到正常长度的九倍以上。

记 e+last（延长）+ic→可延长出去的→有弹性的

联 elasticity n. 弹力，弹性；inelastic adj. 无弹性的



* * *



elegant　［ˈelɪɡənt］

adj. 雅致的；优雅的〈同 refined〉

例 Janet is an elegant woman. 珍妮特是一位优雅的女士。

记 e+leg（=lect 选）+ant→选出的→好的→雅致的

联 elegance n. 优雅，高雅



* * *



elementary　［ˌelɪˈmentri］

adj. 基本的，初级的〈同 basic〉

例 I took a course in elementary chemistry. 我上了一门基础化学课程。



* * *



eliminate　［ɪˈlɪmɪneɪt］

vt. 排除，剔除〈同 eradicate，remove〉

例 The teacher eliminated mistakes from the student's essay. 老师挑出了学生论文中的错误。

记 e+limin（门槛）+ate→扔出门槛→剔除

联 elimination n. 排除，除去；eliminable adj. 可消除的



* * *



elsewhere　［ˌelsˈwɛə(r)］

adv. 在别处〈同 in another place〉

例 My house keys are not where I thought I left them last night. I will have to search elsewhere to find them. 我家的钥匙不在我印象中昨晚上放的地方。我得去别处找找。



* * *



embarrass　［ɪmˈbærəs］



vt. 使尴尬，使困窘〈同 humiliate〉

例 I was embarrassed by his comments about my poor clothes. 他说我的衣服非常破旧，这话让我非常尴尬。

联 embarrassment n. 困窘；阻碍



* * *



embrace　［ɪmˈbreɪs］

vt. ① 包含 〈同 include〉

例 This course embraces several different aspects of psychology. 这门课包含了心理学的几个不同方面。

② 拥抱；欣然接受〈同 welcome〉

例 You'd be a fool not to embrace an opportunity as good as that. 如果你不抓住这么好的机会，那你就是个傻瓜。

记 em（=in 进）+brace（胳膊）→搂进胳膊里→拥抱



* * *



emerge　［ɪˈmɜːʤ］

vi. 出现，浮现

例 What emerged from the sea was a huge whale. 大海中浮出来的是一头巨大的鲸。

记 e（出）+merge（吞没）→被吞没的东西又露出来了→出现，浮现

联 emergence n. 出现，形成

第四部分

emergency　［ɪˈmɜːʤənsi］

n. 紧急情况，突然事件

例 The earthquake created an emergency. 地震引发了紧急情况。



* * *



emit　［ɪˈmɪt］

vt. 发出，放射〈同 give off〉

例 Exhaust pipes emit fumes. 排气管排放废气。

记 e+mit（送）→送出→发出，放射

联 emissive adj. 发射的



* * *



emotion　［ɪˈməʊʃən］

n. 情绪，强烈的情感〈同 feeling〉

例 Janet's poems usually have a lot of emotion. 珍妮特的诗通常包含强烈的情感。

联 emotional adj. 情绪的，情感的



* * *



emphasize　［ˈemfəsaɪz］

vt. 强调，着重〈同 stress〉

例 I tried to emphasize the importance of good grades to Tom. 我试着向汤姆强调好成绩的重要性。

联 emphasis n. 强调，重点；emphatic adj. 用力的，显著的



* * *



employ　［ɪmˈplɔɪ］

vt. ① 雇用〈同 hire〉

例 Do you have the authority to employ these people? 你有聘用这些人的权力吗？

② 用，使用〈同 use〉

例 Susan employed all the resources available to her. 苏珊利用了可以获得的所有资源。

联 employee n. 雇员；employer n. 雇主，老板；employment n. 雇用；使用



* * *



enclose　［ɪnˈkləʊz］

vt. ① 装入，放入封套〈同 include〉

例 Please enclose a check with your order. 请随订单附上一张支票。

② 围绕〈同 surround〉

例 The park that encloses the monument has recently been enlarged. 围绕纪念碑而建的公园最近扩建了。



* * *



encounter　［ɪnˈkaʊntə(r)］



vt. 遭遇，遇到〈同 face〉

例 While skipping school, the naughty boy encountered his principal at the mall. 那个淘气的男孩在逃学去购物中心时遇到了校长。

记 en（=in 进）+counter（对着）→对着撞进→遇到



* * *



endure　［ɪnˈdjʊə(r）; (US)ɪnˈdʊər］

vt. ① 承受，忍受〈同 tolerate〉

例 Dr. Hardy was confident that he could endure the hardships of space travel. 哈迪博士自信自己能够承受艰苦的太空之旅。

② 耐久〈同 last〉

例 This old car won't endure forever. 这辆旧汽车不可能一直开下去。

联 enduring adj. 持久的，不朽的；endurance n. 忍耐（力），持久（力）



* * *



engage　［ɪnˈgeɪʤ］

v. 从事；参加（in）〈同 participate in〉

例 She didn't want to engage in a conflict with her manager. 她不想参与到和经理的冲突中。

联 engagement n. 约会；婚约



* * *



enhance　［ɪnˈhɑːns; (US)ɪnˈhæns］

vt. 提高，增加〈同 improve〉

例 Small improvements enhance the value of the house. 小小的改进提高了这栋房子的价值。

Lesson 11




音频



预备测验



找出与句子中划线单词意义最相近的词。

1. Harvard, established at Cambridge, Massachusetts in 1636, is the oldest college in America.

(A) built

(B) originated

(C) founded

2. One percent of the Chinese population speaks Cantonese（广东话）exclusively.

(A) mainly

(B) only

(C) voluptuously

3. Arna Wendell Bontemps' novel God Sends Sunday was adapted for the stage in 1946 as a musical play entitled St. Louis Woman.

(A) named

(B) chosen for

(C) including

4. Lewis and Clark's expedition was organized to explore Louisiana and the land beyond to the Pacific Ocean.

(A) photograph

(B) map

(C) investigate

5. Liquid pressure is exerted equally in all directions.

(A) operated

(B) exhausted

(C) applied





第一部分

enormous　［ɪˈnɔːməs］

adj. 极大的，庞大的〈同 tremendous〉

例 An enormous variety of information may be obtained from a large daily newspaper. 从一份大的日报可以获得大量的信息。

记 e（出）+norm（正常）+ous→超出了正常大小的→极大的

联 enormity n. 巨大；穷凶极恶



* * *



enterprise　［ˈentəpraɪz］

n. 事业，企业〈同 company〉

例 The new enterprise will require additional staff and equipment. 这家新企业需要额外的员工和设备。

联 enterpriser n. 企业家；enterprising adj. 有事业心的，有进取心的



* * *



entertainment　［ˌentəˈteɪnmənt］



n. 娱乐；招待〈同 amusement〉

例 Who will provide the entertainment for the child's party? 谁来为孩子的派对作好招待工作？



* * *



enthusiasm　［ɪnˈθjuːzɪæzəm; (US)ɪnˈθuːzɪæzəm］

n. 热心，热情〈同 ardor〉

例 Janet's enthusiasm for gardening is evident from all of these beautiful flowers. 看这些美丽的花就知道，珍妮特对园艺的热情是非常明显的。

联 enthusiastic adj. 热心的；满腔热情的；enthusiast n. 热心者，狂热者



* * *



entitle　［ɪnˈtaɪtəl］

v. ① 取名为，叫做〈同 name〉

例 That book is entitled Gone With the Wind. 那本书被命名为《飘》。

② 赋予权利〈同 authorize〉

例 This paper entitles my lawyer to handle all my legal affairs. 这份文件授权我的律师全权处理我的所有法律事务。

联 entitled adj. 有资格的



* * *



entry　［ˈentri］

n. ① 进入；入口〈同 admission〉

例 There is a back entry into the house. 这栋房子有一个后门。

② 条目〈同 item〉

例 The bookkeeper checked that all the entries in the record books were correct. 经图书管理员检查，记录簿中的所有条目都是正确的。



* * *



environment　［ɪnˈvaɪərənmənt］

n. 环境，外界

例 The working environment at this factory is not healthy. 这家工厂的工作环境不健康。



* * *



envy　［ˈenvi］

n./vt. 羡慕；嫉妒

例 Tom tried to ignore his feelings of envy when Bill bought a new car. 当比尔买了新车的时候，汤姆尽量不起嫉妒心。

联 envious adj. 嫉妒的；羡慕的



* * *



equal　［ˈiːkwəl］

adj. 相等的，同样的〈同 same〉

例 Put an equal amount of sugar into both bowls. 在两个碗里放入等量的糖。

vt. 等于，比得上

例 Two plus three equals five. 二加三等于五。

联 equality n. 同等，平等



* * *



equation　［ɪˈkweɪʒən］

n. 相等，平衡；方程式，等式〈同 balance〉

例 In an equation, the “=” symbol means “is equal to”. 在等式中，“=”符号的意思是“等于”。



自我检测


从第一部分中选出最适当的词填入空格内。

6. 5+4=9 is a simple ______ .

7. An ______ amount of money was used to eliminate the pollution.

8. My friend ______ my good fortune.

9. He read a book ______ Morning Glory.

10. The office is quite bright and airy—it's a pleasant working ______ .

11. Don't forget this is a commercial ______ —we're here to make money.





第二部分

equivalent　［ɪˈkwɪvələnt］

adj. 相等的，等同的；等值的〈同 comparable〉

例 There are an equivalent number of apples and oranges in the basket. 篮子里有相同数量的苹果和橘子。

记 equi（平等）+val（=value 价值）+ent→价值相等的→等值的

联 equivalence n. 同等，等值



* * *



erase　［ɪˈreɪz; (US)ɪˈreɪs］

v. 擦掉，抹去〈同 remove〉

例 I couldn't erase the horrible accident from my mind. 我无法将那次可怕的事故从我的脑海中抹去。

记 e+rase（擦）→擦掉

联 erasure n. 擦掉，消除；erasable adj. 可消除的，可抹去的



* * *



erect　［ɪˈrekt］

vt. 使竖立；建立，创立〈同 stand；set up〉

例 Within the past decade, many skyscrapers have been erected in this city. 在过去十年里，许多摩天大楼在这座城市拔地而起。

记 e+rect（正，直）→直立出来→竖立

联 erection n. 设立；直立，竖立



* * *



essential　［ɪˈsenʃəl］

adj. 绝对必要的；本质的，根本的〈同 necessary〉

例 Maintaining standards is essential to our good reputation. 坚持标准对于我们的良好信誉非常关键。

记 es（出）+sent（感觉）+ial→感觉出来的→绝对必要的



* * *



establish　［ɪˈstæblɪʃ］

vt. ① 建立，设立〈同 found〉

例 The college established a scholarship for poor students. 这所学院为贫困学生设立了奖学金。

② 确立；使被承认，认可

例 Janet established herself as an international business leader after years of hard work. 珍妮特经过多年的辛苦工作，终于成为一家跨国公司的领导。



* * *



estate　［ɪˈsteɪt］



n. 财产；不动产〈同 property〉

例 Margaret Brent, because of her skill in managing estates, became one of the largest landholders in Maryland. 玛格雷特•布伦特凭借自己的房地产管理能力，成为马里兰州最大的土地所有者之一。

联 real estate 房地产



* * *



estimate　［ˈestɪmeɪt］

vt. 估计〈同 assess〉

例 I estimate that Tom will be promoted to department manager. 我估计汤姆将晋升为部门经理。

联 underestimate vt. 低估，看轻；overestimate vt. 评价过高



* * *



evaluate　［ɪˈvæljʊeɪt］

vt. 评价；估价〈同 judge〉

例 The assessor evaluated the plot of land before Anne sold it. 安妮卖地之前，估价员对这块地进行了评估。



* * *



evaporate　［ɪˈvæpəreɪt］

v.（使）蒸发；消失〈同 vaporize〉

例 His high spirits soon evaporated. 他高昂的情绪很快就消失了。

记 e+vapor（蒸发）+ate→蒸发

联 evaporation n. 蒸发；消失；evaporable adj. 易蒸发的；挥发性的



* * *



evolve　［ɪˈvɒlv］

v. 进化，发展〈同 develop〉

例 Some people think that humans evolved from monkeys. 有些人认为，人是从猴子进化而来的。

联 evolution n. 发展，演变；evolutionary adj. 发展的，进化的；evolvement n. 发展，进化

13. My donations to both charities were ______.

14. I can only estimate the value of my ______.

15. Gasoline quickly ______ when exposed to air.

16. Please ______ that word from the blackboard.

第三部分

exaggerate　［ɪɡˈzæʤəreɪt］

v. 夸大，夸张〈同 overstate〉

例 Keep to the facts and don't exaggerate. 严格遵照事实，不要夸大其词。

记 ex（出）+ag（一再）+ger（带）+ate→一再带出不实的话→夸张

联 exaggeration n. 夸张；exaggerative adj. 夸张的



* * *



exceed　［ɪkˈsiːd］

vt. 超越，胜过〈同 surpass〉

例 I never exceed the speed limit on the highway. 我在高速公路上开车从来不超速。

联 exceedingly adv. 非常地，极度地



* * *



excess

［ˈekses］ adj. 过度的，额外的〈同 extra〉

例 Don't bring excess baggage on this trip. 这次旅行不要带太多的行李。

［ɪkˈses］ n. 过量，超过

例 The car reached speeds in excess of 90 miles per hour. 那辆车的时速超过了90英里。

联 excessive adj. 过多的，过分的



* * *



exchange　［ɪksˈtʃeɪnʤ］



n./vt. 兑换，交换〈同 substitute〉

例 Most Americans exchange gifts at Christmas. 大多数美国人在圣诞节的时候会交换礼物。



* * *



exclaim　［ɪkˈskleɪm］

vt. 呼喊；惊叫

例 When interrupted, David exclaimed that he wanted to be left alone. 在被打扰的时候，汤姆大声喊着说自己想要单独待一会儿。

联 exclamation n. 惊呼，感叹



* * *



exclude　［ɪkˈskluːd; ekˈskluːd］

vt. 把…排除在外，排斥（from）〈同 leave...out of〉

例 Excluding grain from your diet will be detrimental to your health. 吃饭时不吃谷物将对你的健康有害。

记 ex（出）+clude（关闭）→关出去→排斥

联 exclusion n. 排除，逐出；exclusive adj. 排他的，单一的



* * *



exclusively　［ɪkˈskluːsɪvli］

adv. 完全地，仅仅地〈同 only〉

例 Monopoly refers to the fact that a commercial product or service is exclusively controlled or nearly so. 垄断是指一种产品或服务被独家控制或几乎被独家控制。



* * *



excursion　［ɪkˈskɜːʃən; (US)ɪkˈskɜːrʒən］

n. 远足，游览〈同 trip〉

例 We took an excursion to Alaska on a cruise ship. 我们乘坐游轮去阿拉斯加旅行。

记 ex（出）+curs（跑）+ion→跑出去→远足

联 excurse vi. 远足，短程旅行



* * *



execute　［ˈeksɪkjuːt］

vt. 完成，实施，执行〈同 carry out〉

例 The workers executed the foreman's orders and finished the job quickly. 工人们执行工头的命令，很快就完成了工作。



* * *



executive　［ɪɡˈzekjutɪv］

adj. 行政的〈同 administrative〉

例 In the United States, the President is the executive head of the nation. 在美国，总统是国家的行政首领。

n. 执行者；经理，主管人员

例 The chief executive called a meeting of the company's board of directors. 首席执行官召开了一次公司董事会会议。

记 ex（出来）+ecut（跟随）+ive→跟着命令做出来→执行者

第四部分

exert　［ɪɡˈzɜːt］

vt. 运用，行使，施加〈同 apply〉

例 The chairman exerted more influence on the committee than anyone else did. 主席对委员会施加的影响要超过其他任何人。

记 ex（出）+ert（力量）→出力→施加

联 exertion n. 尽力，努力



* * *



exhaust　［ɪɡˈzɔːst］



vt. 用尽，耗尽，使精疲力竭〈同 use up〉

例 The long climb to the top of the mountain exhausted our strength. 经过长时间才爬到山顶，我们都精疲力竭。

n. 排气，排气装置

例 Car exhaust fumes are the cause of much pollution. 汽车尾气是造成许多污染的原因。

联 exhausting adj. 用尽的，令人疲乏不堪的；exhaustive adj. 耗尽的，彻底的；exhausted adj. 耗尽的，疲惫的



* * *



expand　［ɪkˈspænd］

v. 扩大，膨胀；扩张〈同 dilate〉

例 Heat causes air to expand. 加热会导致空气膨胀。

联 expansion n. 扩张，发展



* * *



explode　［ɪkˈspləʊd］

vi. 爆炸；爆发〈同 erupt〉

例 The red balloon exploded when I popped it with a pin. 我用大头针一扎，那个红气球就爆炸了。

联 explosion n. 爆发，爆炸



* * *



exploit　［ɪkˈsplɔɪt］

vt. 开拓；开采，开发〈同 open up〉

例 We need to make sure that we exploit our talents as fully as possible. 我们要保证尽量充分地开发我们的才能。

记 ex（出）+ploit（=plic 重叠）→开发出跟从前不重叠的东西→开发

联 exploitation n. 开发，开采；exploitable adj. 可开发的，可利用的；exploiter n. 剥削者



* * *



explore　［ɪkˈsplɔː(r)］

vt. ① 探险，勘探〈同 investigate〉

例 The adventurer explored a dangerous underground cave. 探险家探索了一个危险的地下岩洞。

② 仔细检查，探究〈同 examine〉

例 Frank explored several science reports for answers to his homework. 弗兰克仔细查阅了几份科学报告，来寻找家庭作业的答案。

记 ex（出）+plore（流出）→使隐藏的流出来→探险，勘探

联 explorer n. 探险家，探测者；exploration n. 勘察；探究



* * *



explosive　［ɪkˈspləʊsɪv］

adj. 爆炸的；易爆发的

例 Dynamite is highly explosive. 炸药极易爆炸。

n. 炸药

例 The explosives in the car luckily did not explode and everyone was safe. 幸运的是汽车里的爆炸物并未爆炸，所有人都很安全。



* * *



extend　［ɪkˈstend］

v. 延长；扩大〈同 stretch〉

例 Tom extended the telescope to its full length. 汤姆把望远镜延伸到最大长度。

联 extension n. 延伸；extensive adj. 广泛的



* * *



exterior　［ɪkˈstɪərɪə(r)］

n. 外部，外表〈同 outside〉

例 Under his exterior there may lie a heart of gold. 在他的外表之下，可能有一颗金子般的心。

记 ext（外）+erior→来自外面的→外部



* * *



external　［ɪkˈstɜːnəl; ekˈstɜːnəl］

adj. 外部的；表面的 〈同 exterior〉

例 The crab's external shell must be removed before you eat the meat inside. 必须先剥去螃蟹的外壳，才能吃到里面的肉。

记 ext（外）+ernal→外部的

联 externalize v. 使外表化；使具体化

Lesson 12




音频



预备测验



找出与句子中划线单词意义最相近的词。

1. New chemical processes now make it feasible to separate four or five different mineral substances from copper ore.

(A) plausible

(B) allowable

(C) practicable

2. Large passenger planes usually carry weather instruments with which to forecast storms.

(A) impede

(B) divert

(C) predict

3. Unlike gorillas（大猩猩）, a horde of chimpanzees（黑猩猩）seems always to travel in unbroken single file, one member closely following another.

(A) rank

(B) row

(C) line

4. Do you know why the wings of an airplane are flexible?

(A) pliant

(B) urban

(C) upset

5. Herons nest and roost in flocks, but hunt for food alone.

(A) cycles

(B) groups

(C) threes





第一部分

fabric　［ˈfæbrɪk］

n. ① 织物，布〈同 cloth〉

例 The sofa is covered with a soft cotton fabric. 沙发上盖着一块柔软的棉布。

② 结构，构造〈同 structure〉

例 It is necessary to protect the fabric of civilized society. 保护文明社会的结构是非常有必要的。



* * *



facility　［fəˈsɪləti］

n. 设施，设备〈同 equipment〉

例 The bathroom facilities will be closed today for repairs. 卫生间设施将在今天停用，进行维修。

联 facilitate v. 使容易，帮助



* * *



faculty　［ˈfækəlti］



n. ① 全体教员；全体从业人员〈同 staff〉

例 That university has an excellent faculty. 那所大学拥有非常雄厚的师资力量。

② 才能，能力〈同 ability〉

例 Helen was recommended because of her strong academic faculties. 海伦因学术能力很强而获得推荐。



* * *



fade　［feɪd］

vi. ① 逐渐消失〈同 disappear〉

例 As soon as the police arrived, the crowd faded away. 警方刚刚到达，人群便逐渐散去了。

② 褪色；枯萎〈同 lose color; wither〉

例 Over the years, the bright red carpet faded to pink. 经过这些年，亮红色的地毯褪色成了粉红色。



* * *



faint　［feɪnt］

adj. 微弱的；模糊的；无力的〈同 dim; feeble〉

例 The professor spoke so fast that Christopher only had a faint idea of what he was saying. 教授说得太快了，克里斯托弗对他的话只有一点模糊的概念。

联 faintly adv. 微弱地；模糊地



* * *



fame　［feɪm］

n. 名声，名望〈同 reputation〉

例 Because of the president's fame, everyone recognized him. 这位总裁很有名气，每个人都认识他。



* * *



familiar　［fəˈmɪlɪə(r)］

adj. 熟悉的；常见的〈同 well known; common〉

例 I think I am lost because nothing here looks familiar. 我觉得我迷路了，因为这里的一切看起来都很陌生。

联 familiarize vt. 使熟悉



* * *



famine　［ˈfæmɪn］

n. 饥荒，饥饿〈同 starvation〉

例 Unless it rains this week, the loss of crops could result in a famine. 如果本周不下雨，粮食歉收将导致饥荒。



* * *



famous　［ˈfeɪməs］

adj. 著名的〈同 well-known〉

例 Abraham Lincoln is a very famous U.S. President. 亚伯拉罕•林肯是一位非常著名的美国总统。



* * *



fancy　［ˈfænsi］

adj. 新奇的；花哨的〈同 novel〉

例 This dress is too fancy. Do you have anything simpler? 这条裙子太花哨了。你这里有没有更朴素点的？

联 fanciful adj. 爱空想的

第二部分

fantasy　［ˈfæntəsi］

n. 幻想；白日梦〈同 dream〉

例 Look! The novel is full of nothing but fantasy. 看！这部小说里全都是幻想。

联 fantasia n. 幻想曲；fantastic adj. 怪诞的；极出色的；fantasize v. 空想，幻想，做白日梦



* * *



farewell　［fɛəˈwel］

n. 辞别，再见；送别会〈同 goodbye〉

例 Anne's farewell at the bus terminal was quite sad; nearly all the people cried. 在汽车站为安妮举行的送别会非常令人伤心；几乎所有人都哭了。



* * *



fascinating　［ˈfæsɪneɪtɪŋ］

adj. 迷人的，醉人的〈同 engrossing〉

例 The sea is full of treasures—all kinds of strange fascinating organisms. 大海里处处都是宝——有各种奇怪的、迷人的生物。

记 来自fascinate（迷住，使人神魂颠倒）：fascin（捆住）+ate→用魅力把人捆住了→迷住

联 fascination n. 魅力；入迷，着迷



* * *



fatal　［ˈfeɪtəl］

adj. 致命的〈同 deadly, mortal〉

例 The doctor told the patient he had a fatal disease and only had two months to live. 医生告诉患者他得了绝症，只能再活两个月。

记 fat（=fate 命运）+al→致命的

联 fatalism n. 宿命论；fatality n. 天命；致命性



* * *



fatigue　［fəˈtiːɡ］

n. 疲乏，劳累〈同 weariness〉

例 Increasing numbers of people in high-powered jobs are suffering from fatigue and stress-related illnesses. 越来越多担任高层职位的人感觉疲惫不堪，并且出现与压力有关的疾病。



* * *



feasible　［ˈfiːzəbəl］

adj. 切实可行的〈同 practicable〉

例 This is an entirely feasible proposal. I suggest we adopt it. 这是一项完全可行的提议。我建议予以采纳。

记 feas（=fact 做）+ible→能做的→切实可行的

联 unfeasible adj. 不能实行的，行不通的；feasibility n. 可行性



* * *



female　［ˈfiːmeɪl］



n./adj. 女性（的），女人（的）

例 Breast cancer is more common in females than in males. 乳腺癌在女性中的发病率要高于男性。

联 feminine adj. 阴性的，女性的；feminism n. 女权运动；feminist n. 女权主义者



* * *



fertile　［ˈfɜːtaɪl; (US)ˈfɜːrtəl］

adj. ① 肥沃的，富饶的；能繁殖的〈同 rich〉

例 The farmers have used this fertile land to plant rice and tomatoes. 农民们利用这块肥沃的土地种植水稻和西红柿。

② 主意多的，有创造力的〈同 creative〉

例 The meeting was quite fertile, with a number of fine ideas being discussed. 会议成果显著，大家对很多好的想法进行了讨论。

联 infertile adj. 不肥沃的，贫瘠的，不结果实的；fertilize vt. 施肥于，使肥沃；fertilizer n. 肥料（尤指化学肥料）



* * *



festive　［ˈfestɪv］

adj. 欢宴的；节日的

例 The Christmas celebration brought a festive atmosphere to the small town. 圣诞节庆祝活动给这座小城镇带来了节日气氛。

记 fest（=feast 节日）+ive→节日的

联 festival n. 节日



* * *



fetch　［fetʃ］

vt. 接来；取来，(去）拿来〈同 bring〉

例 My antique car fetched me $75,000 at the auction. 我的古董车拍卖了75,000美元。

15. I suffered from mental ______ because of stress in my job.

16. We hold a ______ dinner for our professor.

第三部分

fiber　［ˈfaɪbə(r)］

n. 纤维；光纤

例 Different fibers have different uses, and can be found in both clothing and food. 不同的纤维有不同的用处，在衣服和食物中都能找到。



* * *



fierce　［fɪəs］



adj. 凶猛的〈同 ferocious〉

例 We saw fierce tigers at the zoo. 我们在动物园里见到了凶猛的老虎。



* * *



file　［faɪl］

n. ① 档案〈同 document〉

例 I accidentally dropped a stack of files, and all the papers fell out. 我不小心掉了一摞档案，里面的所有文件都掉了出来。

② 行列，纵队〈同 line〉

例 All the ships are sailing in single file. 所有船只成一列纵队向前航行。

v. 把文件（或资料）归档〈同 arrange〉

例 I filed the reports in the drawer. 我把抽屉里的报告进行了归档。



* * *



filter　［ˈfɪltə(r)］

vt. 过滤〈同 strain〉

例 We filter our drinking water. 我们过滤我们的饮用水。

n. 过滤器

例 The filter of a cigarette helps prevent some of the harmful substances from entering the body. 香烟的过滤嘴有助于防止有害物质进入身体。



* * *



finance　［ˈfaɪnæns］

n. 财政，拨款〈同 funding〉

例 We've had some difficulty raising finances for the project. 我们在为这个项目融资时遇到了麻烦。

vt. 资助〈同 subsidize〉

例 Joe financed his girlfriend's study abroad, but she never came back. 乔资助他女朋友出国留学，结果她一去不复返了。

联 financial adj. 财政的；financing n. 筹措资金



* * *



flame　［fleɪm］

n. 火焰，光辉〈同 blaze〉

例 Flames roared out of the burning house. 火焰从那栋着火的房子里蹿出来。



* * *



flash　［flæʃ］

n. 闪光；闪现〈同 flare〉

例 It is common knowledge that a flash of lightning is seen before a clap of thunder is heard. 先看到闪电，后听到雷声，这是常识。

vi. 闪光；反射〈同 sparkle〉

例 The driver flashed the blinker to indicate a left turn. 司机打转向灯来示意要向左转。

联 flashlight n. 手电筒；闪光灯



* * *



flavor　［ˈfleɪvə(r)］

n. 味，风味〈同 taste〉

例 The drink has the flavor of grapes. 这杯饮料有葡萄的味道。

vt. 加香味于〈同 season〉

例 Joey's mom flavored the chicken with sugar to make it sweet. 乔伊的妈妈用糖来给鸡肉调味，让它变得香甜。

联 flavoring n. 香料，调味品；flavorful adj. 充满…味道的，可口的



* * *



flee　［fliː］

v. 逃跑〈同 escape〉

例 The thieves fled when they heard the alarm. 小偷们听到警报声便逃走了。



* * *



flexible　［ˈfleksəbəl］

adj. 易弯曲的，柔软的；变通的〈同 pliant, elastic〉

例 Janet easily bent the flexible wire into a loop. 珍妮特很轻松就把软线弯成了一个圈。

联 flexibility n. 灵活性

第四部分

float　［fləʊt］



v. 漂浮，使漂浮〈同 drift along〉

例 A small boat floated on the surface of the lake. 一艘小船漂浮在湖面上。



* * *



flock　［flɒk］

n.（禽、畜等的）群；大量〈同 group〉

例 The flock of swallows flew south for the cold winter. 这群燕子飞到南方去度过寒冷的冬天。

v. 蜂拥，群集〈同 gather〉

例 The crowd flocked around the movie star. 人群聚集在这个电影明星周围。



* * *



flourish　［ˈflʌrɪʃ］

vi. 繁荣，茂盛；健康成长〈同 thrive〉

例 The orange trees flourished in the sun. 橘子树在阳光下长得很茂盛。



* * *



fluent　［ˈfluːənt］

adj. 流利的，流畅的

例 This job requires you to be fluent in English and Spanish. 这份工作要求你能流利地说英语和西班牙语。



* * *



focus　［ˈfəʊkəs］

n. 焦距；（兴趣活动等的）中心〈同 center〉

例 Please adjust the focus before you look through the telescope. 在通过望远镜观察之前，请调整焦距。

v. 聚焦，注视〈同 center〉

例 The photographer focused the lens and then took the picture. 摄影师先对准镜头的焦距，然后再拍照。



* * *



forecast　［ˈfɔːkɑːst］

n. 预测；预报〈同 prediction〉

例 When asked if he thought we would win, the coach refused to make a forecast. 当教练被问及是否认为我们会赢时，他拒绝进行预测。

v. 预报；预测〈同 predict〉

例 The weatherman forecasts snow for tomorrow, so bring a warm jacket. 天气预报员预报明天有雪，所以带件暖和的外套吧。



* * *



forgive　［fəˈɡɪv］

vt. 原谅，饶恕〈同 pardon〉

例 Can you ever forgive me for insulting you? I will never do it again. 你能原谅我对你的无礼吗？我再也不会那么做了。



* * *



format　［ˈfɔːmæt］

n. 模式，格式〈同 structure, pattern〉

例 The format of Jack's essay was not what the teacher had asked for and so he got a zero for it. 杰克论文的格式不符合老师的要求，所以他得了零分。

联 formation n. 形成；编队



* * *



formula　［ˈfɔːmjʊlə］

n. 公式；规则

例 We had to learn chemical formulae at school. 我们在学校里得学习化学公式。



* * *



fountain　［ˈfaʊntən］

n. 泉水，喷泉

例 The fountain is lit with colorful lights at night. 到了晚上，喷泉便被五彩缤纷的灯光照亮了。

Lesson 13




音频



预备测验



找出与句子中划线单词意义最相近的词。

1. Mary frosted the cake.

(A) served

(B) iced

(C) split

2. Medieval cities grew rapidly when they had harbors nearby.

(A) merchants

(B) castles

(C) ports

3. Solar energy is generated as protons（质子）fuse to form helium atoms.

(A) bred

(B) conceived

(C) produced

4. Most of the hills in Kansas have gentle slopes, but some of them are very steep.

(A) moderate

(B) rocky

(C) sheer

5. The colonists obtained a charter that granted them the right to settle in the New World.

(A) guaranteed

(B) taught

(C) gave





第一部分

fraction　［ˈfrækʃən］

n. ① 小部分，少量〈同 segment〉

例 Tom Cruise is not the leading actor in this movie so you only see him for a fraction of the time. 汤姆•克鲁斯不是这部电影的主角，所以你会看到他在电影里只出现了很短的时间。

② 分数

例 If you convert 0.25 into a fraction, you get 1/4. 如果将0.25换算成分数，就是1/4。



* * *



fragment　［ˈfræɡmənt］

n. 碎片，破片〈同 piece〉

例 The glass fell on the floor and broke into fragments. 那块玻璃掉在地板上，摔成了碎片。

记 frag（=fract 断裂）+ ment（名词后缀）→裂成碎片→碎片

联 fragmentary adj. 零碎的，不完整的



* * *



freight　［freɪt］



n. 货物；货运〈同 cargo〉

例 The company is responsible to send the freight to you by truck. 公司负责用卡车把货物运送给你。

vt. 装货；运送〈同 load, carry〉

例 Grapes from this region are freighted all over the world. 这个地区出产的葡萄被运送到世界各地。

联 freighter n. 货车



* * *



friction　［ˈfrɪkʃən］

n. ① 摩擦〈同 rub〉

例 The wheel has been worn smooth due to friction. 由于摩擦，车轮已经被磨平了。

② 冲突，不和〈同 conflict〉

例 At this time when harmony is essential, we cannot afford to have any friction in our group. 这个时候，和谐才是最重要的，因此我们小组再也不能产生任何冲突了。

联 fricative adj. 由摩擦而产生的；摩擦音的



* * *



frost　［frɒst］

n. 霜；霜冻〈同 ice crystal〉

例 Matt had to clean the frost off his car windows before he could drive. 马特开车之前要先把车窗上的霜清除掉。

vi. 结霜；结冰〈同 ice〉

例 The windscreen of my car frosts over during the night. 在夜间，我的汽车挡风玻璃结冰了。

联 defrost vt. 使…解冻，将…除霜；vi.（冰、霜）解冻



* * *



frown　［fraʊn］

vi. 皱眉；不赞成，反对〈同 scowl; disapprove〉

例 Smoking is frowned upon in many restaurants. 许多餐厅不允许吸烟。



* * *



frustrate　［frʌˈstreɪt; (US)ˈfrʌstreɪt］

v. ① 挫败，破坏〈同 disconcert〉

例 The warden frustrated the prisoners' attempt to escape by adding more guards. 监狱长增加了更多守卫，让囚犯们越狱的图谋落空了。

② 使沮丧〈同 depress〉

例 What frustrated her was that she did not get a high score on the final test. 令她沮丧的是自己在最终测试没得到高分。

联 frustration n. 挫败，挫折；frustrating adj. 令人沮丧的



* * *



fuel　［fjuːəl］

n. 燃料

例 The scientist predicted America would run out of fuel within 20 years. 这位科学家预测，美国将在20年内耗尽燃料。

v. 加燃料；激起

例 Quit arguing with Bao! You'll only fuel his anger. 别跟包争论了！你这样只会让他更加愤怒。



* * *



functional　［ˈfʌŋkʃənəl］

adj. 功能的；有用的〈同 useful〉

例 My bike is not luxurious, but it is still functional. 我的自行车不算高级，但功能依然完好。

联 multifunctional adj. 多功能的；functioning n. 运转，操作



* * *



fundamental　［ˌfʌndəˈmentəl］

adj. 基础的，基本的〈同 basic〉

例 The refugees were too poor to meet their fundamental needs for life. 这些难民太穷了，甚至连自己生活的基本需求都无法满足。

第二部分

funeral　［ˈfjuːnərəl］

n. 葬礼；出殡行列

例 Hundreds of people attended the senator's funeral. 数百人参加了这个议员的葬礼。



* * *



furnish　［ˈfɜːnɪʃ］

vt. 装备；提供〈同 provide〉

例 The travel agency furnished me with the information that I needed for my trip. 旅行社为我提供了旅行必需的信息。

联 furnishing n. 供应；家具，(室内）陈设品；furniture n. 家具



* * *



gang　［ɡæŋ］

n. 队；一帮（罪犯）〈同 group〉

例 After work, John went bowling with a gang of friends. 下班后，约翰与一群朋友去打保龄球。



* * *



gauge　［ɡeɪʤ］



vt. 测量，计量；评价〈同 measure〉

例 I could not gauge how many miles the town was from the farm. 我无法测无法量出这个小镇距离农场有多少英里。

n. 量规，量表；测量仪器

例 The gauge showed that the steam temperature was normal. 仪表显示，蒸示蒸汽温度正常。



* * *



gear　［ɡɪə(r)］

n. 齿轮，传动装置

例 Gears serve to transfer power and change the direction of rotation. 传动装置的作用是传送动力和改变旋转方向。

v. 使适合，使一致

例 In time of war, the country's economy must be geared to wartime requirements. 在战争时期，国家的经济必须加以调整以适应战时需要。



* * *



generate　［ˈʤenəreɪt］

vt. 造成；产生〈同 make happen; produce〉

例 The power of moving water can be used to generate electricity. 流水的力量可以用于发电。

记 gener（产生）+ate→产生

联 generative adj. 有生殖力的；regenerate adj. 新生的 v.（使）再生



* * *



generous　［ˈʤenərəs］

adj. 慷慨的；富饶的；大量的〈同 magnanimous〉

例 Not everyone looking for gold in those days was greedy—some people were generous and helpful. 在当时，并非所有淘金的人都是贪婪的——有些人就非常慷慨和乐于助人。

记 gener（出生，产生）+ous→(不断）产生→大量的

联 generosity n. 慷慨；generously adv. 大方地，丰富地



* * *



gentle　［ˈʤentəl］

adj. 温和的；文雅的〈同 moderate；kind〉

例 The little girl was very gentle when she played with the baby kitten. 那个小女孩在与小猫玩的时候非常温柔。



* * *



genuine　［ˈʤenjuːɪn］

adj. 真正的，真实的；真诚的〈同 authentic〉

例 The suitcase was made of genuine leather. 这个手提箱是用真皮制成的。

记 genu（产生）+ine→产生的→来源真实的→真正的



* * *



geometry　［ʤɪˈɒmətri］

n. 几何学

例 Geometry demands lots of reasoning. 几何学需要大量的推理。

联 geometric adj. 几何的；几何学的



* * *





自我检测


从第二部分中选出最适当的词填入空格内。

12. My necklace is made of ______ pearls.

13. The hotel ______ towels and sheets.

14. The Smiths moved from the inner city to the suburbs because they were afraid of ______ .

15. The ______ ceremony was very sad.

16. I thanked my aunt for her ______ offer to help me go to college.

17. Tom is very ______ with his kids.





第三部分

germ　［ʤɜːm］

n. 细菌〈同 bacteria〉

例 Germs collect on surfaces that people have touched. 细菌聚集在人们触摸过的物体的表面。



* * *



gesture　［ˈʤestʃə(r)］



n. 姿态，手势；表示

例 With a gesture of his hand, the waiter indicated where I should sit. 服务生做了一个手势，示意我应该坐在哪里。



* * *



glimpse　［glɪmps］

n. 一瞥，一看〈同 glance〉

例 I caught a glimpse of the murderer before he jumped out of the running train. 就在杀人凶手跳出疾驰的火车之前，我瞥见了他。

v. 瞥见，看一眼〈同 catch sight of〉

例 He glimpsed himself in the looking-glass. 他朝镜子里看了自己一眼。



* * *



glorious　［ˈɡlɔːrɪəs］

adj. 光荣的；壮丽的；极好的〈同 beautiful；splendid〉

例 Since it is such a glorious day, let's go to the beach to take a walk. 既然今天天气这么好，我们去沙滩散散步吧。

记 来自名词glory（光荣）

联 glory n. 光荣；glorify vt. 使光荣；赞美



* * *



glue　［ɡluː］

n. 胶；胶水〈同 adhesive〉

例 Jimmy pulled off the dried glue that was stuck to his fingers. 吉米撕下粘在手指上的已经干了的胶水。

vt. 粘贴；黏合〈同 stick〉

例 Anne glued the pieces of the broken vase back together. 安妮把那些花瓶的碎片重新粘在了一起。



* * *



goal　［ɡəʊl］

n. 目标〈同 objective〉

例 His goal is to receive his Ph.D. in electrical engineering. 他的目标是获得电气工程学专业的博士学位。



* * *



grab　［ɡræb］

vt. 攫取，抓住〈同 grasp〉

例 The poor boy grabbed his chance to become a millionaire. 那个穷小子抓住了成为百万富翁的机会。



* * *



grace　［ɡreɪs］

n. 优美；风度〈同 elegance〉

例 We all admired the athletes' grace as they ran. 我们都很欣赏运动员在奔跑时的风采。

联 disgrace vt. 玷污；gracefully adv. 优雅地



* * *



grand　［ɡrænd］

adj. 壮观的，显赫的〈同 wonderful〉

例 We held a grand celebration for her success. 我们为她的成功举行了一场盛大的庆祝会。

联 grandeur n. 庄严；伟大



* * *



grant　［ɡrɑːnt］

vt. 同意；准予；拨款〈同 give〉

例 The foundation granted $10,000 to the art project. 基金会给这个艺术项目拨款10,000美元。



自我检测


从第三部分中选出最适当的词填入空格内。

18. Anne's ______ was to become a lawyer.

19. The cathedral in our town is a very ______ building.

20. The famous celebrity refused to ______ the reporter an interview.

21. Mary kicked the assailant（攻击者）who had ______ her from behind.

22. Please accept this gift as a ______of my thanks.

23. We all admired the shop manager's ______ as she was criticized by the angry customer.





第四部分

gratitude　［ˈɡrætɪtjuːd; (US)ˈgrætɪtuːd］

n. 感谢，感激〈同 thankfulness〉

例 My grandparents will always have my gratitude for sending me money while I was in college. 在我上大学期间，我祖父母经常给我寄钱，这让我一辈子都感激不尽。



* * *



gravity　［ˈgrævəti］

n. ① 地心引力

例 It's gravity that causes an apple to fall on your head when you are sitting under an apple tree. 当你坐在一棵苹果树下时，能使苹果掉在你头上的是地心引力。

② 严肃，一本正经〈同 seriousness〉

例 We could tell we were in serious trouble from the gravity of her expression. 从她严肃的表情我们可以判断出，这次我们有大麻烦了。



* * *



greedy　［ˈɡriːdi］

adj. 贪婪的〈同 avaricious〉

例 George is a very greedy man. The more money you give him, the more he wants. 乔治是个非常贪婪的人。你给他的钱越多，他想要的就更多。



* * *



grind　［ɡraɪnd］

vt. 磨碎，碾碎 〈同 crush〉

例 Because the diamond is the hardest naturally occurring substance, it is used in industry for cutting, grinding, and boring other hard materials. 由于钻石是天然生成的最坚硬的物质，因此在工业上常用来对其他坚硬材料进行切割、磨削和钻孔。



* * *



grip　［ɡrɪp］

v. 紧握，紧抓〈同 grasp〉

例 I gripped the railings as l walked down the stairs. 我下楼梯的时候紧紧抓着栏杆。



* * *



guarantee　［ˌɡærənˈtiː］

vt. 保证，担保〈同 assure〉

例 No one can guarantee that you will pass the exam if you don't work hard. 如果你不努力学习，谁也不敢保证你能通过考试。

联 guaranty n. 【律】保证，保证书；担保物



* * *



gymnastics　［ʤɪmˈnæstɪks］



n. 体操；体育

例 Olympic arenas have been built for swimming and gymnastics. 游泳和体操项目的奥运会场馆已经建好了。

联 gymnastic adj. 体操的；体育的；gymnasium n. 体育馆；健身房；gymnast n. 体操运动员



* * *



halt　［hɔːlt; hɒlt］

n./vt.（使）停止〈同 stop〉

例 I was jolted out of my sleep by the sudden halt of the train. 火车突然停止，把我从睡梦中晃醒了。

联 halting adj. 犹豫的；蹒跚的；结结巴巴的



* * *



handsome　［ˈhænsəm］

adj. ① 英俊的；美观的〈同 good-looking〉

例 The handsome actor got lots of attention from the audience. 那位帅气的演员得到了观众的许多关注。

② 慷慨的，可观的〈同 considerable〉

例

After graduating with an MBA, Janet found a good job with a handsome salary. 获得MBA学位之后，珍妮特找到了一份报酬丰厚的好工作。



* * *



harbor　［ˈhɑːbə(r)］

n. 海港〈同 port〉

例

Our city has two harbors for ships that come from the south or the north. 我们市有两个港口，分别供来自南方和北方的船只停泊。

Lesson 14




音频



预备测验



找出与句子中划线单词意义最相近的词。

1. We can harness the power of the wind to generate electricity.

(A) acknowledge

(B) worship

(C) utilize

2. Abraham Lincoln was born in a humble log cabin.

(A) clean

(B) shabby

(C) modern

3. A cultured pearl is made by inserting a tiny bead inside an oyster.

(A) inputting

(B) rotating

(C) heating

4. Like children learning a language, birds imitate the songs of their elders.

(A) study

(B) pronounce

(C) mimic

5. Because of harsh weather conditions，more than a dozen states in the United States were declared disaster areas in 1977.

(A) severe

(B) bizarre

(C) moist





第一部分

harmony　［ˈhɑːməni］

n. 协调，融洽〈同 coordination〉

例 Members of the choir blended their voices in perfect harmony. 合唱团的成员十分和谐地将他们的声音融合在一起。



* * *



harness　［ˈhɑːnɪs］

vt. 利用（河流、瀑布等）产生动力；利用〈同 utilize〉

例 People have harnessed the sun's energy since ancient times. 从远古时代起，人类便一直在利用太阳的能量。



* * *



harsh　［hɑːʃ］

adj. ① 粗糙的；刺耳的，刻薄的〈同 coarse；acid〉

例 The sweater is not comfortable because the material is too harsh. 这件毛衣穿着不舒服，因为它的材料太粗糙了。

② 严厉的；严酷的，恶劣的〈同 severe〉

例 Dissenters were usually severely punished under the emperor's harsh rule. 在国王严酷的统治下，异见者们通常会受到严厉的惩罚。

联 harshness n. 严酷，恶劣



* * *



hazard　［ˈhæzəd］



n. 危险；危害物〈同 danger〉

例 A high incidence of lung disease is one of the known hazards of smoking. 肺病的高发病率是已知的吸烟的危害之一。

联 hazardous adj. 危险的，冒险的



* * *



heal　［hiːl］

vt. 康复，治愈 vi. 愈合〈同 cure〉

例 The wound soon healed under the care of the nurse. 在护士的护理下，伤口很快便愈合了。

联 healing adj. 有治疗功用的



* * *



heap　［hiːp］

n. 堆；大量，许多〈同 pile〉

例 Don't leave your dirty laundry in a heap in the middle of the floor! 别把你的脏衣服成堆地放在地板中间！

v. 堆积〈同 pile up〉

例 The miser heaped up great wealth. 那个守财奴积累了巨大的财富。



* * *



hint　［hɪnt］

n. 提示，线索〈同 clue〉

例 Mary gave Bill a hint about his birthday present to let him guess. 关于比尔的生日礼物，玛丽给了他一个线索让他猜。



* * *



historic　［hɪˈstɒrɪk; (US)hɪsˈtɔːrɪk］

adj. 历史上著名的；有历史意义的

例 During her summer vacation, Janet visited some places of historic interest in China, such as the Imperial Palace and the Summer Palace. 在暑假期间，珍妮特参观了中国的许多历史古迹，例如故宫和颐和园。

联 historian n. 历史学家；编年史家



* * *



horizon　［həˈraɪzən］

n. 地平线；眼界，视野〈同 range〉

例 People once believed that the length of the earth ended at the ocean's horizon. 人们曾经相信，海平线便是大地的尽头。

联 horizontal adj. 水平的



* * *



host　［həʊst］

n. 主人；节目主持人

例 The host asked his guests to come to the table for dinner. 主人邀请客人们到餐桌用餐。

v. 做东道主，主办；招待（客人）〈同 entertain〉

例 Janet always hosts guests at their house, while John only sits there and eats. 珍妮特经常在家里招待客人，而约翰却只会坐在那里吃东西。

联 hostess n. 女主人；饭店（或旅店）女老板



自我检测


从第一部分中选出最适当的词填入空格内。

6. The ______ towel irritated my skin.

7. If you give me a ______, I am sure that I can guess the answer.

8. Time will ______ your sorrows by and by.

9. Which country will ______ the next Olympic Games？

10. At daybreak, the sun rose over the ______.

11. We hoped the quarrel would not disrupt the ______ that existed between the brothers.





第二部分

hostile　［ˈhɒstaɪl; (US)ˈhɑːstəl］

adj. 敌对的，不友好的〈同 unfriendly〉

例 The trade minister placed an embargo on goods from the hostile country. 贸易部长对来自敌对国家的货物实行禁运。

记 host（敌人）+ ile→敌对的

联 hostility n. 敌意，敌对



* * *



humble　［ˈhʌmbəl］

adj. 低下的，卑贱的；谦逊的；简陋的〈同 meek〉

例 After Peter hit Rob, Rob was always humble in front of Peter. 自从被彼得打了之后，罗布在彼得面前就一直低声下气的。

记 hum（地）+ble→接近地的→低下的

联 humility n. 谦逊



* * *



identical　［aɪˈdentɪkəl］



adj. 同一的；完全相同的〈同 matching〉

例 The twins' appearance was identical, but each had a distinct personality. 那对双胞胎的外貌完全相同，但两个人却有着截然不同的个性。

记 ident（相同）+ical→同一的



* * *



identify　［aɪˈdentɪfaɪ］

vt. 识别，认出；鉴定〈同 detect〉

例 I could not identify my umbrella among a hundred others. 我无法从100把伞里面认出我的伞。

记 ident（相同）+ify→使对上号→识别，认出

联 identification n. 辨认；鉴定；identifiable adj. 可辨认的



* * *



identity　［aɪˈdentəti］

n. 身份〈同 individuality〉

例 The identity of the special guest was only revealed an hour before he arrived. 特别来宾的身份直到他到达的一个小时前才揭晓。



* * *



idle　［ˈaɪdəl］

adj. 闲置的；（指人）无所事事的，懒惰的

例 The workers were idle during the strike and so was the expensive machinery in the factory. 工人们在罢工期间无事可做，工厂里那些昂贵的机器同样被闲置。



* * *



illustrate　［ˈɪləstreɪt］

vt.（用图或例子）说明，阐明〈同 state〉

例 To illustrate how the heart circulates blood through the body, the teacher described how a pump works. 为了说明心脏如何使血液在全身循环流动，老师描述了水泵的工作原理。

记 il（进入）+lustr（明亮的）+ate→使内容更明了→(用图或例子）说明

联 illustration n. 例证；插图



* * *



imitate　［ˈɪmɪteɪt］

vt. 仿效，模仿〈同 mimic，emulate〉

例 Decide what you want to do; don't just imitate others. 决定自己想要做什么，不要一味地模仿其他人。

联 imitation n. 模仿；仿制品



* * *



immense　［ɪˈmens］

adj. 巨大的；无边的〈同 enormous〉

例 The square is dominated by an immense statue of the President. 一尊巨大的总统雕像屹立在广场上。

记 im（不）+mense（=measure 测量）→大得无法测量的→巨大的

联 immensity n. 无限；巨大



* * *



immigrant　［ˈɪmɪɡrənt］

n.（自外国移入之）移民〈同 alien〉

例 Illegal immigrants are sent back across the border if they are caught. 非法移民如果被抓住，会被从边境遣送回国。



自我检测


从第二部分中选出最适当的词填入空格内。

12. I ______ Max as the thief who stole my bicycle.

13. The students laughed when I ______ a child.

14. From the mountaintop you can see the ______ valley.

15. Jerry MacGuire was a very ______ writer; he even refused to accept the honor when he won the National Writing Award.

16. The ______ hours of a holiday frequently provide the best time to go shopping.

17. The first and second editions of this book are ______, so the publisher won't make any modification.





第三部分

impact　［ˈɪmpækt］

n. ① 影响〈同 influence〉

例 Your lectures have had a powerful impact on my thinking. 您的课对我的思想产生了重要的影响。

② 撞击，冲击

例 The car crumpled upon impact against the solid brick wall. 那辆汽车撞上硬砖墙后变得不成样子了。

记 im（起强调作用）+pact（压）→使劲压→撞击，冲击



* * *



implement

［ˈɪmplɪmənt］ n. 工具，器具〈同 tool〉

例 In your training course for dental assistant, you will become familiar with many of the implements that dentists use. 在牙科助理的培训课程中，你会熟悉牙科医生所用的许多工具。

［ˈɪmplɪment］ vt. 实行，实施〈同 carry out〉

例 I am unwilling to implement this plan until I have assurances that it has the full approval of officials. 我不愿意执行这个计划，除非我确信这个计划已经得到官方的完全批准。



* * *



impose　［ɪmˈpəʊz］

vt. 把…强加于；施加影响 vi. 利用；打扰〈同 force〉

例 Are you sure it's all right for me to come tonight? I don't want to impose on you. 你确定我今晚来没问题吗？我不想打扰到你。

联 imposition n. 强迫接受



* * *



inclined　［ɪnˈklaɪnd］

adj. ① 倾向…的〈同 preferring〉

例 Sally is usually inclined to eat salad, not pizza. 莎莉通常倾向于吃沙拉，而不是比萨。

② 倾斜的；有坡度的〈同 sloping〉

例 Be careful when you ski down because the mountain is steeply inclined. 你往山下滑雪的时候要小心，因为这个山坡非常陡。



* * *



incredible　［ɪnˈkredəbəl］

adj. 难以置信的，惊人的〈同 unbelievable〉

例 On stage Aretha Franklin sings with incredible energy, zest, and strength. 艾瑞莎•富兰克林在舞台上唱歌时，充满了惊人的能量、热情和力量。

记 in（不）+cred（相信）+ible→难以置信的



* * *



indifferent　［ɪnˈdɪfrənt］

adj. 不感兴趣的，漠不关心的〈同 apathetic〉

例 Because she felt no desire to marry, she was indifferent to his constant proposals. 因为她没有结婚的欲望，所以对他的屡次求婚无动于衷。

记 in（不）+ different（不同的）→没有不同的→对任何事都同样不感兴趣→漠不关心的

联 indifference n. 冷漠，不关心



* * *



indispensable　［ˌɪndɪˈspensəbəl］

adj. 不可缺少的，必需的〈同 essential〉

例 Air, food and water are indispensable for life. 空气、食物和水是生存不可缺少之物。

记 in（不）+ dispensable（不必要的）→不是不必要的→必需的



* * *



individual　［ˌɪndɪˈvɪdjʊəl］

n. 个人，个体〈同 person〉

例 Every individual has certain rights which must never be taken away. 每个人都享有某些不能被剥夺的权利。

adj. 个别的，单独的〈同 separate〉

例 Each individual table is finished by hand. 每一张桌子都是手工制成的。

联 individualism n. 个人主义；individually adv. 个别地



* * *



inevitable　［ɪnˈevɪtəbəl］

adj. 不可避免的，必然的〈同 unavoidable〉

例 When you eat too much and don't exercise, it is inevitable that you will gain weight. 如果你吃得太多，又不锻炼，增肥肯定是不可避免的。

记 in（不）+evitable（可避免的）→不可避免的

联 inevitability n. 必然性



* * *



infant　［ˈɪnfənt］



n. 婴儿，幼儿〈同 baby〉

例 Susan laid the infant down for a nap. 苏珊把婴儿放下睡个午觉。

联 infancy n. 幼年



自我检测


从第三部分中选出最适当的词填入空格内。

18. In China, grandparents play ______ roles in raising grandchildren.

19. The ______ needs gentle care day and night.

20. In western countries, each ______ has full freedom to do whatever he likes, on condition that the action will not harm others.

21. Rebecca got ______ success in business two years after she got her MBA degree as a result of hard work.

22. Mike is ______ to others. He only cares about his own interest.

23. Janet likes to think herself. She doesn't want others to ______ their ideas on her.





第四部分

infect　［ɪnˈfekt］

v. ①（疾病）传染〈同 contaminate〉

例 All the tomato plants are infected with a virus. 所有番茄植株都感染了一种病毒。

② 使受影响，感染

例 Mahatma Gandhi's struggle for freedom infected the whole nation. 圣雄甘地为自由进行的斗争感染了整个国家。

联 infection n. 传染（病）；infectious adj. 传染性的，易传染的



* * *



infinite　［ˈɪnfɪnət］

adj. 无限的，无穷的

例 The universe is theoretically infinite. 从理论上来说，宇宙是无限的。

记 in（无）+ fin（结束）+ ite→没有结束的→无穷的

联 infinity n. 无限，无穷大；infinitesimal adj. 无限小的 n. 无限小



* * *



inflation　［ɪnˈfleɪʃən］

n. 通货膨胀

例 The country's inflation became so serious that many families stopped eating at restaurants and only ate at home. 这个国家的通货膨胀变得太严重了，以至于许多家庭不再去饭店吃饭，而是只在家里做饭吃。



* * *



influence　［ˈɪnflʊəns］

n. 影响力；影响

例 Violence on TV may turn out to be a potent influence on some young people. 结果证明，电视上的暴力可能会对年轻人产生很大的影响。

vt. 影响，改变〈同 affect〉

例 Media coverage is directly influencing how the public responds to the war. 媒体报道直接影响着公众对战争的反应。

联 influential adj. 有影响的



* * *



ingredient　［ɪnˈɡriːdɪənt］



n. 原料；成分〈同 component〉

例 Flour, milk, butter and yeast are some ingredients in bread. 面粉、牛奶、黄油和酵母是制作面包的几种原料。



* * *



inhabitant　［ɪnˈhæbɪtənt］

n. 居民，住户〈同 resident〉

例 San Francisco's Chinese community, comprising 67,000 inhabitants, is the largest concentration of Chinese outside of Asia. 旧金山的华人社区共有67,000名居民，是亚洲之外最大的华人聚集地。



* * *



inherit　［ɪnˈherɪt］

vt. 继承〈同 succeed〉

例 Every person inherits some qualities from his forefathers. 每个人都从祖先那里继承了一些品质。

联 inheritance n. 遗产



* * *



initial　［ɪˈnɪʃəl］

adj. 最初的，初始的〈同 foremost〉

例 Woodcutting, the initial form of printmaking, appeared in Europe at the beginning of the 15th century. 版画制作的原始形式——木雕——在15世纪初出现在欧洲。

联 initially adv. 最初，开始；initiate vt. 创始；提出



* * *



innocent　［ˈɪnəsənt］

adj. 无辜的，清白的；天真的〈同 naive〉

例 It was an innocent remark. I didn't mean to hurt his feelings. 这话没有恶意。我并不想伤害他的感情。



* * *



insert　［ɪnˈsɜːt］

vt. 插入〈同 input〉

例 He inserted the key into the lock to open the door. 他把钥匙插进锁里来打开门。

Lesson 15




音频



预备测验



找出与句子中划线单词意义最相近的词。

1. The teacher's encouraging words inspire the depressed boy to study hard.

(A) make

(B) draw

(C) encourage

2. The year 1962 saw the launching of a major satellite.

(A) sending off

(B) completion

(C) dry run

3. The opossum has good hearing and a keen sense of smell.

(A) sharp

(B) interested

(C) enthusiastic

4. Ralph Earle was one of the first artists to paint landscapes in the United States.

(A) lawns

(B) barns

(C) sceneries

5. The architectural designs of I. M. Pei integrate the structure and its environment.

(A) emphasize

(B) determine

(C) unify





第一部分

inspire　［ɪnˈspaɪə(r)］

vt. 鼓舞；给…以灵感〈同 encourage；inspirit 〉

例 The coach inspired his players to win the game. 教练鼓舞队员赢得比赛。

联 inspiring adj. 使人振奋的，鼓舞的；inspiration n. 灵感



* * *



install　［ɪnˈstɔːl］

vt. 安装，设置〈同 set up〉

例 The plumber is coming tomorrow to install the new washing machine. 管道工明天会来安装新洗衣机。

联 installation n. 安装；就职；installment n. 分期付款



* * *



instinct　［ˈɪnstɪŋkt］

n. 本能，直觉〈同 intuition〉

例 The dog's instinct is to chase the cat. 狗的本能是追逐猫。

记 in（在…里面）+ stin（站，立）+ ct→站在里面的东西→本能

联 instinctive adj. 天生的，本能的



* * *



instrument　［ˈɪnstrʊmənt］



n. 仪器；工具；乐器〈同 tool〉

例 The flute and the piano are both musical instruments. 长笛和钢琴都是乐器。

联 instrumentalist n. 器乐家，器乐演奏者



* * *



insult　［ɪnˈsʌlt］

vt. 侮辱，凌辱〈同 offend〉

例 After he drank of all my wine, he began to insult all of my friends. 他把我的酒都喝光了之后，就开始辱骂我所有的朋友。

联 insulting adj. 侮辱的



* * *



integrate　［ˈɪntɪgreɪt］

vt. 使成为整体，使一体化〈同 unify, synthesize〉

例 One of the reasons for the opera's popularity is that it integrates oriental culture and western culture successfully. 那部歌剧大受欢迎的原因之一，是剧中成功地融合了东西方文化。

联 disintegrate v.（使）分解，(使）碎裂；integrated adj. 完整的；综合的；integration n. 综合；integrity n. 正直，诚实



* * *



intense　［ɪnˈtens］

adj. 强烈的，剧烈的；紧张的

例 She felt intense pain when she broke her leg. 腿摔断的时候，她感到一阵剧痛。

记 in（不）+ tense（伸展）→拉到了不能再拉的地方→强烈的；紧张的

联 intensify v. 加强，强化；intensity n. 强烈，强度；intensive adj. 加强的；密集的，集中的



* * *



interfere　［ˌɪntəˈfɪə(r)］

vi. 妨碍；干涉〈同 hinder; disrupt〉

例 She never had children because they would have interfered with her dancing career. 她从未要过孩子，因为孩子会妨碍她的舞蹈事业。

联 interference n. 冲突；干涉



* * *



interior　［ɪnˈtɪərɪə(r)］

n./adj. 内部（的）〈同 inside, internal〉

例 Although the outside of the car was painted black, the interior was red. 虽然车的外部被刷成了黑色，但里面却是红色的。

记 inter（内部）+ior→内部的



* * *



intermediate　［ˌɪntəˈmiːdɪət］

adj. 中间的；中级的〈同 middle〉

例 After I complete the introductory course, I will go on to the intermediate level. 完成基础入门课程之后，我会继续学习中级课程。

记 inter（在中间）+medi（中间）+ate→中间的

联 intermediary adj. 媒介的；中间的



自我检测


从第一部分中选出最适当的词填入空格内。

6. Quasars are starlike objects emitting extremely ______ radio waves and visible radiation.

7. We only have very small and very large sizes in stock. We've sold all the ______ sizes.

8. I got angry when John ______ me before many people.

9. The company will design, supply and ______ your new kitchen.

10. A ruler is an ______ used for measuring things.

11. Birds migrate because of their ______.





第二部分

interpret　［ɪnˈtɜːprɪt］

v. 解释，说明〈同 explain〉

例 Many people are interpreting the minister's statement as meaning that she intends to resign. 许多人把部长的声明解释成她打算辞职。

联 interpretation n. 解释



* * *



interval　［ˈɪntəvəl］

n. 间隔时间〈同 pause〉

例 Katy went to the bathroom during the five-minute interval between the second and third acts of the play. 在这部戏第二场和第三场之间的五分钟间隔期间，凯蒂去了一趟洗手间。



* * *



intimate　［ˈɪntɪmət］

adj. ① 亲密的〈同 close〉

例 The lovers became very intimate and decided to get married. 那对情侣变得非常亲密，并决定结婚。

② 深刻的〈同 profound〉

例 Professor Green has the most intimate understanding of physics than any other professor at our university. 格林教授对物理学有最深刻的了解，远远超过了我们大学的其他教授。

联 intimacy n. 亲密，熟悉



* * *



invade　［ɪnˈveɪd］

v. 侵略，侵犯〈同 aggress〉

例 Famous people often find their privacy is invaded by the press. 名人经常会发现自己的隐私被媒体侵犯了。

联 invasion n. 入侵；invader n. 侵略者



* * *



investigate　［ɪnˈvestɪɡeɪt］

vt. 调查，研究〈同 explore, research〉

例 Police are investigating allegations of corruption and bribery involving senior executives in the company. 警方正在调查关于这家公司的高管贪污受贿的指控。

联 investigation n. 调查



* * *



involve　［ɪnˈvɒlv］

vt. 包括；潜心于，使陷于〈同 include〉

例 She involved herself in many activities to meet new friends. 她参加了很多活动来认识新朋友。

联 involvement n. 连累；包含



* * *



isolate　［ˈaɪsəleɪt］



vt. 使隔离，使孤立〈同 seclude〉

例 John isolated himself and spoke to no one. 约翰把自己彻底隔离，不与任何人说话。

联 isolated adj. 与世隔绝的，偏僻的；孤独的；isolation n. 隔离；孤立



* * *



issue　［ˈɪʃuː; ˈɪsjuː］

n. ① 问题〈同 subject〉

例 Whether or not to abolish slavery constituted a big issue for the U.S. centuries ago. 几个世纪之前，是否废除奴隶制是美国面临的一个重大问题。

②（报刊的）期

例 There's an article on motorbikes in the latest issue. 在最新一期中有一篇关于摩托车的文章。

v. 发行〈同 release〉

例 The film company issued a film starring Tom Hanks. 这家电影公司发行了一部由汤姆•汉克斯主演的电影。



* * *



item　［ˈaɪtəm］

n.（可分类或列举的）项目，条款；（新闻等的）一条，一则

例 There were several interesting items in today's paper. 今天的报纸上有几条有趣的新闻。

联 itemization n. 详细分类



* * *



jail　［ʤeɪl］

n. 监狱〈同 prison〉

例 Johnny said that the food they serve in jail tastes terrible. 约翰尼说，监狱里的食物很难吃。



自我检测


从第二部分中选出最适当的词填入空格内。

12. This village was ______ by the heavy rain.

13. The Board meets once a month to deal with the big ______ in the company.

14. It's difficult to ______ these statistics without knowing how they were obtained.

15. Janet and Mary are ______ friends；they usually help each other.

16. The government began to ______ the bribery scandal.

17. Would you please ______ that again? I do not understand it fully.





第三部分

jealous　［ˈʤeləs］

adj. ① 妒忌的

例 Tom is jealous of anyone who talks to his girlfriend. 汤姆妒忌任何与他的女朋友说话的人。

② 羡慕的〈同 envious〉

例 She is jealous of her sister's good grades. 她羡慕自己的妹妹成绩那么好。

记 jeal（=zeal 热心）+ous→热心想要别人有的→妒忌的

联 jealousy n. 妒忌；羡慕



* * *



journal　［ˈʤɜːnəl］



n. ① 期刊；杂志〈同 magazine〉

例 She works for a trade journal for the car industry. 她为一家汽车行业的贸易期刊工作。

② 日记，日志〈同 diary〉

例 He kept a journal for over 50 years, in which he recorded his daily activities and observations about the city where he lived. 他坚持写日记超过50年了，他在日记中记录了自己的日常活动，以及对自己所居住的城市的观察。

联 journalist n. 新闻记者；journalistic adj. 新闻事业的，新闻工作的；journalism n. 新闻业；报章杂志



* * *



jungle　［ˈʤʌŋɡəl］

n. 丛林〈同 thicket〉

例 They found a profusion of trees, vines, and tropical flowers growing in the jungle. 他们发现丛林里长着大量的树木、葡萄藤和热带花卉。



* * *



jury　［ˈʤʊəri］

n. 陪审团

例 The jury could not reach agreement on the criminal's verdict. 对于罪犯的裁决，陪审团无法达成一致。



* * *



justify　［ˈʤʌstɪfɑɪ］

vt. 证明…是正当的或有理的；为…辩护〈同 vindicate〉

例 We'll have to justify the additional expenditure to the Board. 我们必须向董事会提供额外开支的理由。

联 justification n. 正当的理由；辩护



* * *



keen　［kiːn］

adj. ① 锋利的〈同 sharp〉

例 The keen edge of the razor blade was made of special steel. 剃须刀锋利的刀刃是用特殊钢材制成的。

②（感觉、观察、理解等）敏锐的〈同 acute〉

例 You must have a keen eye to be able to read those numbers at this distance! 你的眼睛肯定非常敏锐，不然怎么能看清那么远的数字！



* * *



knot　［nɒt］

n.（绳等的）结；（树的）节

例 Tie a knot in the rope to mark where you stopped. 在绳子上打一个结，标记你停留过的地方。

联 knotty adj. 多节的；难解决的



* * *



lag　［læg］

vi. 落后〈同 delay〉

例 Don't let your son lag behind in the class. 不要让你儿子在班级中落后。



* * *



landscape　［ˈlændskeɪp］

n. 风景，山水；风景画〈同 scenery〉

例 Anne sat on a hill and gazed at the landscape around her. 安妮坐在山上，凝视着周围的风景。



* * *



lane　［leɪn］

n.（乡间）小路；狭窄的通道；航线

例 It is very dangerous to drive fast along narrow country lanes. 在狭窄的乡村小路上快速行驶是非常危险的。



自我检测


从第三部分中选出最适当的词填入空格内。

18. The bride and groom walked down a ______ formed by two lines of wedding guests.

19. The child ______ behind because he was tired.

20. The fine quality of the cloth ______ its high price.

21. Anna feels ______ every time another woman looks at her boyfriend.

22. ______ are hot and humid regions with many kinds of plants and wild animals.

23. Seeing from the church tower, the two hills with the valley formed a beautiful ______.





第四部分

lasting　［ˈlɑːstɪŋ］

adj. 持久的；永恒的；耐用的〈同 forever; enduring〉

例 Kennedy left a lasting impression on the people who heard his inaugural address. 肯尼迪给那些听过他就职演说的人们留下了不可磨灭的印象。



* * *



launch　［lɔːntʃ］



vt. 发动〈同 begin〉

例 When he was stopped, the old man launched a verbal attack at the policeman. 那个老人被拦住以后，便开始对警察破口大骂。

n./v. 发射，(使）升空〈同 send off〉

例 The satellite was launched into orbit. 卫星被发射到运行轨道。



* * *



laundry　［ˈlɔːndri］

n. 洗衣店；待洗的衣服〈同 washing〉

例 I placed the clean laundry on the table and started folding it. 我把干净衣服放到桌子上，然后开始叠衣服。



* * *



layer　［ˈleɪə(r)］

n. 层，层次；阶层〈同 tier〉

例 There was a thin layer of oil on the surface of the water. 在水面上有薄薄的一层油。



* * *



layout　［ˈleɪaʊt］

n. 布局；设计〈同 design〉

例 This map shows the layout of the camp. 这张地图展示了营地的布局。



* * *



leap　［liːp］

n./vi. 跳跃〈同 jump〉

例 The dog leapt over the fence. 那条狗跳过了栅栏。



* * *



lease　［liːs］

n. 租约〈同 rent〉

例 I signed a lease to rent a truck for a week. 我签了一份租约，租一辆卡车一星期。

vt. 出租，租借〈同 rent〉

例 We have leased an apartment for one year. 我们出租了一套公寓，租期为一年。

记 分割记忆：l+ease（安心）→有了租约才安心→租约



* * *



legal　［ˈliːɡəl］

adj. 法律的；法定的，合法的〈同 judicial〉

例 It's legal to turn right at a red light in most states. 在大多数州，红灯时向右转是合法的。

记 leg（法律）+ al→法律的

联 legality n. 合法；legalize v. 合法化



* * *



legislation　［ˌleʤɪsˈleɪʃən］

n. ① 立法〈同 lawmaking〉

例 Congress has the power of legislation. 国会拥有立法权。

② 法规〈同 laws〉

例 The government mandates that the states are to comply with federal legislation. 政府规定，各州应遵守联邦法律。

联 legislature n. 立法机关；legislate vt. 立法



* * *



liable　［ˈlaɪəbəl］

adj. ① 有责任的，有义务的〈同 responsible〉

例 The Postal Service is not liable for damage to a parcel. 邮政部门对包裹的损坏不承担责任。

② 易…的，有…倾向的〈同 likely〉

例 That glass is liable to break. 那种玻璃很容易打碎。

联 liability n. 责任，义务；倾向

Lesson 16




音频



预备测验



找出与句子中划线单词意义最相近的词。

1. The adult polar bear is almost totally a marine animal.

(A) plant eating

(B) fur covered

(C) sea dwelling

2. A lock is a mechanism that is generally opened with a key.

(A) drawer

(B) box

(C) device

3. The blue whale can live for half a year without eating; it is maintained by its blubber（鲸脂）.

(A) restrained

(B) sustained

(C) weighed

4. The merit of a sales tax is that it decreases government reliance on income taxes.

(A) virtue

(B) surplus

(C) outcome

5. Proteins are composed of more than twenty amino acids that are liberated during digestion.

(A) congregate

(B) multiplied

(C) freed





第一部分

liberal　［ˈlɪbərəl］

adj. ①（思想）开放的，坚持（主张）变革的，自由主义的〈同 open-minded〉

例 The conservative newspaper denounced the liberal article. 保守派的报纸公开抨击自由派的文章。

② 慷慨的，不拘泥的〈同 generous〉

例 A miser is not liberal with money. 一个吝啬鬼在钱的方面不会慷慨。

记 liber（自由）+ al→自由主义的

联 liberally adv. 随意地，不受限制地；liberality n. 慷慨；开明



* * *



liberate　［ˈlɪbəreɪt］

vt. 释放，使自由〈同 free〉

例 I liberated the rabbit from its cage. 我把兔子从笼子里放了出来。

联 liberty n. 自由



* * *



license　［ˈlaɪsəns］



n. 许可（证），执照〈同 permission〉

例 I went downtown to renew my driver's license. 我去市中心更换新的驾驶执照。

vt. 许可，特许〈同 approbate〉

例 The city licensed me to open a restaurant. 市里批准我开一家餐馆。



* * *



lick　［lɪk］

v. 舔（某人/某物）

例 The cat licked the milk. 猫舔食牛奶。



* * *



likewise　［ˈlaɪkwaɪz］

adv. 同样地，也〈同 similarly〉

例 It's eight p.m. I must go home now, and you likewise. 已经晚上八点了。我必须回家了，你也是。



* * *



limb　［lɪm］

n. 肢，翼；树枝〈同 arm; leg〉

例 The driver lost a limb in the car accident. 那名司机在车祸中失去了一条胳膊。



* * *



liquid　［ˈlɪkwɪd］

n. 液体，流体〈同 fluid〉

例 Mercury is a liquid at room temperature. 水银在室温下以液体形式存在。

adj. 液体的

例 I washed my hands with liquid soap. 我用液体香皂洗手。

联 liquor n. 酒；液体



* * *



loan　［ləʊn］

n./v.（借出的）贷款，借出〈同 lend〉

例 Her friend loaned her the money. 她朋友借给她钱。



* * *



lodge　［lɒʤ］

n.（山林）小屋；旅馆

例 We stayed in the lodge because there was a blizzard outside. 我们待在旅馆里，因为外面有暴风雪。

vi. 寄存；临时住宿

例 We lodged in motels on our trip. 我们在旅途中临时住在一家汽车旅馆里。

联 lodging n. 寄宿；住房（常指出租的房间）



* * *



logical　［ˈlɒʤɪkəl］

adj. 合乎逻辑的；合理的〈同 coherent〉

例 An upset stomach is a logical result of overeating. 胃不舒服是暴饮暴食的必然结果。

联 logic n. 逻辑，逻辑学

第二部分

loop　［luːp］

vt. 把…圈成环；缠绕〈同 circle〉

例 To join two ends of a rope, you just loop it. 要把绳子两头连起来，你只需要把它围成环状就可以了。

n. 圈，环

例 The road makes a wide loop around the lake. 这条路沿湖绕了一圈。



* * *



loyal　［ˈlɔɪəl］

adj. 忠诚的，忠心的〈同 faithful〉

例 My parents have always been loyal to each other. 我父母一直忠于彼此。

联 loyalty n. 忠诚，忠心



* * *



luxury　［ˈlʌkʃəri］

n. 奢侈，豪华〈同 extravagance〉

例 The movie star was accustomed to luxury. 电影明星习惯了奢侈的生活。

联 luxurious adj. 奢侈的，豪华的



* * *



magnetic　［mæɡˈnetɪk］



adj. ① 磁的，有磁性的

例 The pieces of iron were stuck together by magnetic force. 这几块铁片被磁力粘在一起。

② 有吸引力的〈同 attractive〉

例 He is the most magnetic male dancer in the Royal Ballet. 他是皇家芭蕾舞团最有吸引力的男舞者。

联 magnet n. 磁铁；magnetism n. 磁，磁力；magnetize vt. 使磁化；吸引



* * *



magnificent　［mæɡˈnɪfɪsənt］

adj. 壮观的，华丽的；高尚的〈同 gorgeous〉

例 The singer's magnificent performance deserved enthusiastic applause. 那位歌手华丽的表演应得到观众热情的掌声。

记 magn（大）+ ificent→大得壮观→壮观的，华丽的

联 magnificence n. 华丽，富丽堂皇



* * *



maintain　［meɪnˈteɪn］

v. 维持，保持；继续〈同 keep〉

例 If you maintain an automobile properly, it will last longer. 如果你对汽车进行适当的保养，它就能用更长的时间。



* * *



maintenance　［ˈmeɪntənəns］

n. ① 维修，保养〈同 preservation〉

例 Proper car maintenance includes checking the oil regularly. 适当的汽车保养包括定期检查润滑油。

② 维持，继续〈同 continuance〉

例 The United Nations Security Council is in charge of the maintenance of international peace and security. 联合国安全理事会负责维护国际和平和安全。



* * *



manual　［ˈmænjʊəl］

n. 手册〈同 guide book〉

例 The car manual is on the back seat. 汽车使用说明书在后座上。

adj. 人工的，手动的〈同 hand-operated〉

例 Bob seems to lack manual skills. 鲍勃似乎缺乏动手能力。

联 manually adv. 用手地；手工地



* * *



manufacture　［ˌmænjʊˈfæktʃə(r)］

n./v. 制造〈同 produce〉

例 This factory manufactures furniture. 这家工厂生产家具。

联 manufacturer n. 厂商



* * *



margin　［ˈmɑːʤɪn］

n. ① 边缘〈同 edge〉

例 Miss Bao always writes her corrections in the margins of her students' papers. 鲍老师总是在学生试卷的空白处写上她做的修改。

②（时间、花费上保留的）余地〈同 room〉

例 We allow a margin of 15 minutes in catching a train. 我们只剩15分钟来赶火车。

联 marginal adj. 记在页边的；边缘的

第三部分

marine　［məˈriːn］

adj. 海的；航海的；海产的〈同 sea-dwelling; maritime〉

例 Whales and dolphins are marine mammals. 鲸和海豚都是海洋哺乳动物。

记 mar（海）+ine→海的

联 mariner n. 水手



* * *



marvelous　［ˈmɑːvələs］

adj. 不可思议的；了不起的〈同 wonderful〉

例 The weather was marvelous for an afternoon walk in the park. 天气非常适合下午去公园散步。



* * *



massive　［ˈmæsɪv］

adj. 大而重的，庞大的；可观的〈同 enormous, colossal〉

例 If the drought continues, deaths will occur on a massive scale. 如果干旱继续，将会发生大规模死亡。

记 mass（体积）+ive→体积大的→巨大的



* * *



match　［mætʃ］

n. 相配的人（或物)

例 We talked about their love and hopes, and we all agreed that it was a good match. 我们谈论了他们的爱与希望，大家都认为他们俩很相配。

v.（使）匹配〈同 go well together〉

例 I've been unable to match this coat with any of my dresses. 我一直没法把这件外套与我的其他裙子进行搭配。

联 matching adj.（尤指颜色或外表）相配的，一致的；matchless adj. 无敌的；无比的



* * *



mate　［meɪt］



v.（使）结伴，（使）成配偶〈同 breed〉

例 The zoo bought a new male gorilla to mate with the female one. 动物园新买了一只雄性大猩猩，与雌性大猩猩配成一对。

n. 配偶〈同 spouse〉

例 A male goose has only one mate until he dies. 公鹅一生只有一个伴侣。

联 mateless adj. 无配偶的，无伴的



* * *



mature　［məˈtjʊə（r); (US)məˈtʊər］

adj.（智力或体力）成熟的

例 Young girls are often more mature than young boys. 小女孩通常比小男孩更成熟。

记 mat（成熟）+ure→成熟的

联 maturity n. 成熟；immature adj. 不成熟的，未完全发展的；premature adj. 早熟的



* * *



maximum　［ˈmæksɪməm］

n./adj. 最大量（的），最大限度（的)〈同 greatest〉

例 The maximum amount of time I can give you is 2 weeks. 我最多能给你两周时间。



* * *



mean　［miːn］

adj. ① 卑鄙的；吝啬的〈同 not generous〉

例 She's very mean and never shares her sweets. 她非常小气，从不跟其他人分享她的糖果。

② 平均的〈同 average〉

例 Six is the mean number between three and nine. 六是三和九的平均数。



* * *



mechanism　［ˈmekənɪzəm］

n. 机械（装置）；机理; 运作机制〈同 device〉

例 An automobile engine is a complicated mechanism. 汽车引擎是一种非常复杂的机械装置。

记 mechan（机械）+ism→机械（装置）

联 mechanics n. 机械学，力学；mechanize v. 机械化；mechanical adj. 机械的



* * *



media　［ˈmiːdɪə］

n. 媒体

例 The media are interested in focusing on controversial matters. 媒体有兴趣关注争议性事件。
