* * *



memorial　［məˈmɔːrɪəl］

n. 纪念物〈同 monument〉

例 Mary has a rose garden as a memorial to her dead child. 玛丽有一座玫瑰花园，作为对她死去孩子的纪念。

adj. 用以纪念的

例 Hundreds of friends and former students came to Professor Conner's memorial activities. 数百位好友和从前的学生都来参加康纳教授的纪念活动。

联 memorialize v. 纪念



* * *



merchant　［ˈmɜːtʃənt］

n. 商人

例 They worked illegally as arms merchants. 他们从事非法倒卖军火的生意。

联 mercantile adj. 商业的，贸易的；merchandise n. 商品，货物



* * *



mercury　［ˈmɜːkjʊri］

n. ① 水银

例 Mercury is an element, and its symbol is Hg. 汞是一种元素，它的符号是Hg。

② [M-] 水星

例 Mercury revolves around the sun once every 88 days. 水星每88天围绕太阳转一圈。

记 Mercury n.【罗马神话】墨丘利（众神的信使）



* * *



merit　［ˈmerɪt］

n. 优点，价值〈同 virtue〉

例 This film is entertaining but has little artistic merit. 这部电影非常有趣，但没多少艺术价值。



* * *



mess　［mes］



n. 混乱，脏乱

例 He left his office in a mess when he worked. 他工作的时候，把办公室弄得一团糟。

联 messy adj. 肮脏的，凌乱的



* * *



metric　［ˈmetrɪk］

adj. 米制的，公制的

例 A yard is about 1 meter in the metric system. 一码大约相当于公制的一米。



* * *



minimum　［ˈmɪnɪməm］

adj. 最小的，最低的〈同 smallest〉

例 The minimum age for leaving school is 16. 离校的最小年龄是16岁。

n. 最小值

例 You ought to eat a minimum of 1,000 calories a day. 你每天摄入的热量至少要达到1,000卡路里。

联 minimize v. 减到最低程度



* * *



minority　［maɪˈnɒrəti; (US)maɪˈnɔːrəti］

n. 少数；少数民族

例 Only a minority of his wages was spent on feeding his family. 他的工资只有一小部分用来养家糊口。



* * *



minus　［ˈmaɪnəs］

adj. 负的

例 Minus six plus minus two equals minus eight. 负6加负2等于负8。

prep. 减去

例 Fifteen minus four equals eleven. 15减4等于11。

Lesson 17




音频



预备测验



找出与句子中划线单词意义最相近的词。

1. The history of the United States’ flag is embroidered with myth and tradition.

(A) custom

(B) respect

(C) legend

2. Travel between time zones may result in obvious disturbances in normal sleep patterns and body rhythms.

(A) temporary

(B) evident

(C) troublesome

3. A result of nuclear explosion, fallout（辐射微尘）is the descent of minute particles of radioactive material through the atmosphere.

(A) charged

(B) heavy

(C) tiny

4. The pulse is most easily monitored where an artery（动脉）is closest to the surface of the skin.

(A) observed

(B) infected

(C) revived

5. Because it is so small and so close to the sun, the planet Mercury has been extremely difficult to observe.

(A) watch

(B) identify

(C) contact





第一部分

minute　［maɪˈnjuːt］

adj. ① 极小的，极少的〈同 tiny〉

例 The baby mice were minute when they were born. 老鼠幼崽在刚出生时非常小。

② 详尽的，准确的

例 Please report this event in minute detail. 请详细报道此事件。

记 minu（小）+te→极小的

联 minutia n. 细节，琐事



* * *



miracle　［ˈmɪrəkəl］

n. 奇迹，奇事〈同 marvel〉

例 It's a miracle of nature that life can grow on plants that look dead all winter. 那些在整个冬天看起来像是死掉的植物竟然能恢复生机，真是大自然的奇迹。

联 miraculous adj. 奇迹的，不可思议的



* * *



mirror　［ˈmɪrə(r)］

vt. 反映，映出〈同 reflect〉

例 The strength of the economy is mirrored in improved living standards. 经济的力量反映在生活水平的提高上。



* * *



miserable　［ˈmɪzərəbəl］

adj. 痛苦的，悲惨的，可怜的〈同 unhappy〉

例 She's been so miserable since her dog died. 自从她的狗死了之后，她便一直非常痛苦。



* * *



missile　［ˈmɪsaɪl］



n. 导弹，发射物

例 There are enough atomic missiles to destroy the whole world several times. 原子弹的数量已经足以将整个世界毁灭许多次。



* * *



mission　［ˈmɪʃən］

n. 使命；任务〈同 task〉

例 Their mission was to find a way to the top of the mountain. 他们的任务是找到一条通往山顶的路。



* * *



mist　［mɪst］

n. 薄雾；喷雾

例 The gardener sprayed the plants with mist. 园艺师给植物洒喷雾。



* * *



mobile　［ˈməʊbaɪl］

adj. ① 可移动的〈同 moveable〉

例 The mobile blood bank operated by the Red Cross visited our neighborhood today. 由红十字会管理的移动血库今天来到了我们社区。

② 易变的

例 Her face is so mobile—one minute she seems to be laughing, the next crying! 她的面部表情真丰富——前一分钟看起来还在笑，后一分钟就变成哭了！

联 mobility n. 流动性；灵活性；immobile adj. 稳定的



* * *



mode　［məʊd］

n. 方式，模式〈同 manner〉

例 Our mode of doing business is to treat the customer like royalty. 我们做生意的方式是把客户当作王室成员一样对待。



* * *



moderate

[ˈmɒdərət] adj. 温和的；适度的，有节制的〈同 temperate〉

例 Unlike moderate antislavery advocates, abolitionists demanded an immediate end to slavery. 与温和的反对奴隶制的主张不同，废奴主义者要求立即废除奴隶制。

[ˈmɒdəreɪt] vt. 使缓和，使稳定〈同 appease〉

例 Cool breezes will moderate the high temperatures of the last two days. 凉风将使过去两天的高温有所缓解。

记 moder（=mod 风度）+ate→做事有风度→适度的

联 immoderate adj. 无节制的；moderation n. 适度



自我检测


从第一部分中选出最适当的词填入空格内。

6. I wore only a light jacket because the temperature was ______.

7. He's such a ______ old man—I've never seen him smile.

8. The glass vase fell on the floor and broke into the ______ pieces.

9. At 90 years old my grandmother was still completely ______.

10. Given the extent of her injuries, it is almost a ______ that she is still alive.

11. Her ______ in life is to teach people in poor countries.





第二部分

modest　［ˈmɒdɪst］

adj. 谦虚的；适度的〈同 humble; moderate〉

例 Bernie won many awards as a translator but he is always modest when he speaks about it. 作为一名翻译，伯尼获得过许多奖项，但他在谈论这些荣誉的时候却始终非常谦虚。

记 mod（方式，风度）+est→做事有风度→谦虚的；适度的

联 immodest adj. 不谦虚的



* * *



modify　［ˈmɒdɪfaɪ］

vt. 修改，变更〈同 alter〉

例 I modified my travel plans by staying an extra night in Rome. 我修改了我的旅行计划，决定在罗马多住一晚。

记 mod（=mode 方式）+ ify→改变方式→修改

联 modification n. 修改，修饰；modifiable adj. 可更改的；modifier n. 改造者；修饰语



* * *



moisture　［ˈmɔɪstʃə］

n. 潮湿，湿气；湿度〈同 wetness〉

例 I could feel the moisture in the air on the muggy day. 在闷热的桑拿天里，我能感觉到空气中的潮湿。

联 moisten vt. 弄湿，使湿润；moist adj. 潮湿的，多雨的



* * *



molecule　［ˈmɒlɪkjuːl］

n. 分子

例 One molecule of water equals two atoms of hydrogen and one atom of oxygen. 一个水分子等于两个氢原子和一个氧原子。

联 molecular adj. 分子的



* * *



monitor　［ˈmɒnɪtə(r)］

vt. 监控；探测〈同 watch; locate〉

例 The doctor monitored the patient's heartbeat every minute. 医生监控患者每分钟的心跳。



* * *



mosquito　［məˈskiːtəʊ］

n. 蚊子

例 I became sick after I was bitten by a mosquito. 我被一只蚊子叮了之后就病了。



* * *



motivate　［ˈməʊtɪveɪt］

vt. 激发，刺激〈同 prompt〉

例 The energetic teacher motivates her students by praising them for good work. 那位精力充沛的老师通过对学生的良好表现进行表扬来激励他们。

记 motiv（动机）+ate→有动机→激发

联 motivation n. 动机；刺激



* * *



mount　［maʊnt］

v. ① 增长〈同 increase〉

例 Rent mounts month by month. 租金每月都在上涨。

② 爬上；使骑上马〈同 get on〉

例 He mounted a horse and rode off in a cloud of dust. 他骑上马，在飞扬的尘土中疾驰而去。



* * *



multiply　［ˈmʌltɪplaɪ］

v. ① 繁殖，增加〈同 proliferate, increase〉

例 The world population is multiplying fast. 世界人口在迅速增加。

② 乘

例 Two multiplied by four is eight. 2乘以4等于8。



* * *



mushroom　［ˈmʌʃrʊm］



n. 蘑菇

例 Thousands of mushrooms covered the dark forest floor. 成千上万的蘑菇覆盖着森林里不见阳光的地表。

v. 迅速生长

例 Since the government began offering easy loans, small businesses have mushroomed. 由于政府开始提供宽松的贷款，因此小企业如雨后春笋般迅速增加。



自我检测


从第二部分中选出最适当的词填入空格内。

12. I ______ the stairs too quickly and had to rest at the top.

13. We will ______ the plans according to your suggestions.

14. The ______ painter avoided the press at the gallery opening.

15. The leader is now frustrated since the scandals continue to ______.

16. You can manage and ______ the server from this interface.

17. The bamboo will ______ after the spring rain.





第三部分

mutual　［ˈmjuːtjʊəl］

adj. 相互的；共有的〈同 interactive〉

例 Although Bob and his father do not agree on the issues, they have a mutual respect for each other's opinions. 虽然鲍勃和他父亲在这几个问题上没有达成一致，但他们都相互尊重彼此的意见。

联 mutually adv. 互相地



* * *



myth　［mɪθ］

n. 神话，神话故事〈同 legend〉

例 When I was a child, my grandmother told me the myths that she had heard from her grandmother. 当我还是个孩子的时候，奶奶把她从她奶奶那里听到的神话故事讲给我听。

联 mythical adj. 神话的，虚构的；mythology n. [总称]神话



* * *



naked　［ˈneɪkɪd］

adj. 裸体的，无遮盖的〈同 nude〉

例 Due to the refraction of light rays, it is impossible for the naked eye to determine the exact location of a star close to the horizon. 由于光线会发生折射，因此用肉眼无法确定一颗接近地平线的星星的确切位置。



* * *



negative　［ˈneɡətɪv］

adj. ① 否定的；负的〈同 adverse〉

例 We got a negative answer to our request. 我们的请求被拒绝了。

② 消极的〈同 pessimistic〉

例 If you're so negative, you'll never get the job. 如果你总是这么消极，你就永远找不到工作。

记 neg（否认，否定）+ ative→否定的

联 negate v. 否定，打消



* * *



neglect　［nɪˈɡlekt］

n./vt. 疏忽；忘记〈同 disregard; ignore〉

例 He works so hard that he neglects his family. 他工作太卖力了，把家人都忽视了。

联 negligent adj. 疏忽的，粗心大意的；negligible adj. 可忽略的，无关紧要的



* * *



negotiate　［nɪˈɡəʊʃɪeɪt］

v. 谈判，交涉；议定〈同 discuss〉

例 The two parties are negotiating the contract. 双方正在就合同进行磋商。

联 negotiation n. 商议，谈判



* * *



neutral　［ˈnjuːtrəl］

adj. 中性的；中立的〈同 impartial〉

例 A neutral political viewpoint is neither conservative nor liberal. 中立的政治观点既不属于保守派，也不属于自由派。

记 neutr（中间）+al→中立的

联 neutralize v. 使中立化；使无效；neutron n. 【核物理学】中子



* * *



nevertheless　［ˌnevəðəˈles］

adv. 仍然，不过〈同 even so, still〉

例 I don't want to come; nevertheless I shall because I feel I have to. 我不想来；但我还是会来，因为我感觉我不得不来。



* * *



nightmare　［ˈnaɪtmɛə(r)］

n. 噩梦〈同 frightening dream〉

例 The girl had a nightmare about jumping off a burning train. 那个女孩做了一个噩梦，梦见自己从一辆着火的列车上跳了下来。

记 组合词：night（夜晚）+mare（恶魔）→夜晚梦见恶魔→噩梦



* * *



normally　［ˈnɔːməli］

adv. 正常地，通常地〈同 commonly, typically〉

例 It is normally quite hot at this time of the year in Beijing. 北京每年的这个时候通常都很热。

联 normalize v. 规格化；normalization n. 正常化，标准化



自我检测


从第三部分中选出最适当的词填入空格内。

18. An electric current can consist of charges that are positive, ______, or both.

19. She was quite sick; ______, she attended all of her classes.

20. They had ______ respect for one another.

21. Try to act ______; otherwise they'll know something is wrong.

22. I've got the job but we're still ______ my salary and hours of work.

23. He is very clever to remain ______ in a dispute between two managers.





第四部分

novelty　［ˈnɒvəlti］

n. 新颖；新奇的事物〈同 newness〉

例 You will soon get used to the novelty of your surroundings. 你很快就能习惯周围环境带来的新奇感。

记 novel（新的）+ty→新颖



* * *



nuisance　［ˈnjuːsəns; (US)ˈnuːsəns］

n. 讨厌的人或东西，麻烦事〈同 bother〉

例 It's a nuisance to have to work tonight but I did promise to finish it. 今天晚上得工作，真是令人讨厌，但我确实保证过要完成这些工作。



* * *



numerous　［ˈnjuːmərəs; (US)ˈnuːmərəs］

adj. 众多的，很多的〈同 many〉

例 We've had numerous complaints about the quality of the food. 我们收到过很多关于食品质量的投诉。

记 numer（数字）+ ous→数字多的→众多的



* * *



object

[ˈɒbʤɪkt] n. 物体，目标〈同 objective〉

例 Japan and South Korea were the objects of the world's attention during the 2002 World Cup. 2002年的世界杯期间，日本和韩国成为了举世瞩目的焦点。

[əbˈʤekt] vi. 反对，拒绝；不喜欢（to）〈同 oppose〉

例 He objected to being treated like a child. 他不喜欢别人把他当成小孩子一样对待。

联 objection n. 反对；objectionable adj. 引起反对的，讨厌的



* * *



objective　［əbˈʤektɪv］

n. 目标〈同 goal〉

例 The objective of the Sky Lab Mission was to study a person's ability to live and work for extended periods in the weightless conditions of space. “天空实验室计划”的目的是，研究一个人在太空中的失重状态下长时间生活和工作的能力。

adj. 客观的〈同 impartial〉

例 Science is usually concerned only with objective facts that can be proved or disproved. 科学通常只关注能被证明或反驳的客观事实。

记 object（物体，客观）+ ive→客观的



* * *



observe　［əbˈzɜːv］

v. ① 观察，观测〈同 notice〉

例 Human beings like to observe the behavior of monkeys. 人类喜欢观察猴子的行为。

② 遵守〈同 obey〉

例 You must observe the speed limit and the rules of the game. 你必须遵守速度限制和游戏规则。

派 observation n. 观察，观测；observer n. 观测者



* * *



obstacle　［ˈɒbstəkəl］

n. 障碍〈同 obstruction〉

例 Your age is an obstacle to getting the job. 你的年龄是获得这份工作的障碍。



* * *



obtain　［əbˈteɪn］

vt. 得到〈同 acquire, get〉

例 He has obtained great fame because of his intelligent work. 他凭借自己才华横溢的作品而名声大噪。

联 obtainable adj. 可得到的



* * *



obvious　［ˈɒbvɪəs］

adj. 明显的，显而易见的〈同 apparent〉

例 It is obvious that they need our help. 很明显，他们需要我们的帮助。



* * *



occasion　［əˈkeɪʒən］



n. ① 场合，时机

例 During those rare occasions when the weather is good, we eat outside. 在难得的天气晴好的情况下，我们会去外面吃饭。

② 重大活动，盛会〈同 a special event〉

例 Let's make our wedding an occasion to remember. 让我们把婚礼变成一场永生难忘的盛会。

联 occasional adj. 偶然的；临时的

Lesson 18




音频



预备测验



找出与句子中划线单词意义最相近的词。

1. Sally is famous in business circles for her outstanding talents and hard work.

(A) exhaustive

(B) charitable

(C) remarkable

2. Numerous parallels exist between Janet's life and her mother's.

(A) studies

(B) problems

(C) similarities

3. Within a given year, a maximum of seven eclipses can occur, either four solar and three lunar, or five solar and two lunar.

(A) be studied

(B) be compared

(C) happen

4. Satellites that orbit the globe transmit detailed pictures of cloud cover.

(A) photograph

(B) circle

(C) decorate

5. As a United States' delegate to the United Nations and as an ambassador overseas, Eleanor Roosevelt influenced human rights legislation.

(A) occasionally

(B) abroad

(C) besides





第一部分

occupy　［ˈɒkjʊpaɪ］

vt. ① 居住〈同 inhabit〉

例 Generally, dormitories are occupied by students. 一般而言，学生宿舍由学生居住。

② 占据（人心、注意力等）；使忙碌；（军事)占领〈同 busy oneself in, take up〉

例 The war began when Iraq tried to occupy Kuwait. 伊拉克试图占领科威特，战争由此爆发。

联 occupant n. 占有者，居住者



* * *



occur　［əˈkɜː(r)］

vi. ① 发生，出现〈同 happen〉

例 Quarrels occur in every family. 每个家庭都会发生争吵。

② 想到（to）

例 The idea of selling the farm has never occurred to me before. 我以前从未有过卖农场的想法。

联 occurrence n. 事件；发生



* * *



odd　［ɒd］

adj. 奇异的，古怪的〈同 bizarre〉

例 It is odd to find a person who speaks many languages. 竟然能找到一个会说许多种语言的人，真是奇怪。

联 oddly adv. 奇特地，古怪地；odds n. 可能性，几率；胜算



* * *



offend　［əˈfend］

v. 触怒，冒犯；违反〈同 annoy〉

例 Her little boy's lack of good manners offended her. 她的小儿子没礼貌的行为让她很生气。

联 offense n. 进攻；offensive adj. 讨厌的，无礼的



* * *



offer　［ˈɒfə(r); (US)ˈɔːfər］

n. 出价；提议

例 They made me an offer I couldn't refuse. 他们给我出的价，我无法拒绝。

vt. 提供〈同 provide〉

例 We offered to help him but he said he didn't need it. 我们主动提出帮助他，但他说自己不需要帮助。



* * *



omit　［əˈmɪt］

vt. 省略，省去；忽略〈同 leave out；bypass〉

例 You may omit questions nine and ten because they do not apply to students. 你可以忽略问题九与问题十，因为这两个问题不适合学生回答。

联 omission n. 省略；删节



* * *



opportunity　［ˌɒpəˈtjuːnəti; (US)ˌɒpəˈtuːnəti］

n. 机会，时机〈同 chance〉

例 Winning the contest gave me the opportunity to quit my job. 赢得这场比赛，让我有机会辞掉工作。



* * *



opposed　［əˈpəʊzd］

adj. 反对的〈同 contrary〉

例 We're going to the seaside this year as opposed to the mountains. 我们今年要去海边，而不是去爬山。

联 opposing adj. 相反的，对立的；opposition n. 反对，敌对



* * *



optical　［ˈɒptɪkəl］

adj. 视觉的；光学的

例 I was given an optical examination to determine my range of vision. 我接受了视力检查，来确定我的视野。

联 optician n. 眼镜商；光学仪器制造商；optometrist n. 验光师



* * *



optimistic　［ˌɒptɪˈmɪstɪk］

adj. 乐观的〈同 hopeful〉

例 She is optimistic about her chances of winning a gold medal. 她乐观地相信自己有赢得金牌的机会。

联 optimism n. 乐观主义，乐观



自我检测


从第一部分中选出最适当的词填入空格内。

6. Several murders ______ during the last act of the play.

7. I'm ______ that we can finish the job on time.

8. The publisher ______ the third chapter of the book by mistake.

9. I was ______ by Bob's lack of sympathy.

10. I ______ my afternoons with reading.

11. She ______ me $20 for my old bicycle.





第二部分

optional　［ˈɒpʃənəl］

adj. 可自由选择的〈同 not compulsory〉

例 At the end of every chapter in our science text, there is a group of optional questions, intended for students who wish to go more deeply into the subject. 在我们的科学教科书每一章的结尾，都有一些可自由选择回答的问题。这些问题针对的是愿意进一步深入了解这门课的学生。



* * *



orbit　［ˈɔːbɪt］



n. 轨道〈同 circle〉

例 Our planet is in orbit around the sun. 地球环绕太阳运行。

vt. 绕…轨道而行〈同 encircle〉

例 The earth orbits the sun every 365 days. 地球每365天环绕太阳一周。

联 orbital adj. 轨道的



* * *



orchestra　［ˈɔːkɪstrə］

n. 管弦乐队〈同 band〉

例 Orchestras play symphonies and the music for operas and dance. 管弦乐队演奏交响乐和歌剧与舞蹈中的音乐。



* * *



organism　［ˈɔːgənɪzəm］

n. 生物体，有机体；微生物〈同 living being〉

例 The sea is full of organisms used as food by fish. 大海里充满了生物，鱼类以此为食。

联 microorganism n. 微生物



* * *



origin　［ˈɒrɪʤɪn］

n. 起源，由来；出身，血统

例 AIDS has its origin in Africa. 艾滋病起源于非洲。



* * *



original　［əˈrɪʤənəl］

adj. ① 最初的，原始的〈同 first〉

例 This is the original map before the forest was cut down. 这是森林被砍伐之前的原始地图。

② 有创意的〈同 novel〉

例 The students had to write an original short story for class. 学生们得为班级写一部原创短篇小说。

联 originality n. 创意，新奇；originally adv. 本来；最初；originate v. 开始，起源；发明



* * *



otherwise　［ˈʌðəwaɪz］

adv./conj. 另外，否则〈同 under different conditions〉

例 Come early; otherwise you may not get a seat. 早点来，否则你可能找不到座位。



* * *



outcome　［ˈaʊtkʌm］

n. 后果，成果〈同 result〉

例 The newspaper reported the outcome of the Board meeting. 报纸报道了董事会会议的成果。



* * *



outlet　［ˈaʊtlet］

n.（河流、烟等）出口〈同 opening〉

例 A chimney is an outlet for smoke from a fireplace. 烟囱是壁炉向外排烟的出口。

记 out（出）+let（让）→让…排出→出口



* * *



outline　［ˈaʊtlaɪn］

n. 大纲，概要；轮廓

例 I'll describe the plot of the play in an outline. 我会以大纲的形式介绍戏剧的情节。

v. 画…的轮廓

例 The police outlined the shape of the murder victim on the street with chalk. 警方用粉笔在街道上画出谋杀案受害者的轮廓。



自我检测


从第二部分中选出最适当的词填入空格内。

12. Please send the ______ certificate and not a photocopy.

13. They are sold through many ______.

14. She drew an ______ of the new house.

15. The ______ of this river is a spring（泉）up in the mountains.

16. Thousands of tiny ______ live in and on the human body.

17. Stop it; ______ I'll tell your dad.





第三部分

outlook　［ˈaʊtlʊk］

n. ① 观点，见解〈同 viewpoint〉

例 Talking to Sue is depressing because she has a very negative outlook. 跟休说话真压抑，因为她的观点非常消极。

② 前景〈同 prospect〉

例 What's the outlook for our sales to America next year? 我们明年在美国的销售前景如何？



* * *



output　［ˈaʊtpʊt］

n. 输出，产品；生产量〈同 production〉

例 This coal has a high output of heat. 这种煤产热量高。



* * *



outset　［ˈaʊtset］

n. 开始，开端〈同 beginning〉

例 I knew from the outset that we would win. 我从一开始就知道我们会赢。



* * *



outstanding　［aʊtˈstændɪŋ］



adj. 突出的，显著的〈同 prominent〉

例 The prize was awarded for an outstanding contribution to broadcasting. 该奖项颁发给了那些对广播事业有突出贡献的人。



* * *



overall　［ˌəʊvərˈɔːl］

adj. 全部的，全面的〈同 general〉

例 The overall charges for the parts and labor are itemized in your statement. 配件和人工的总费用记录在你的报表当中。



* * *



overlook　［ˌəʊvəˈlʊk］

vt. 忽略，没注意到〈同 ignore〉

例 When planning your holiday, make sure not to overlook travel insurance. 在规划假期时，一定不能忽略旅行保险。



* * *



overseas　［ˌəʊvəˈsiːz］

adv./adj.（在）海外的，（在）国外的〈同 abroad〉

例 Anne traveled overseas from New York to London. 安妮从纽约出发，出国去伦敦旅行。



* * *



overtake　［ˌəʊvəˈteɪk］

vt. 赶上，追上〈同 pass〉

例 Our sales have overtaken our most important competitor in Japan. 我们的销量已经赶上了我们在日本的最大的竞争对手。



* * *



owe　［əʊ］

v. ① 亏欠，负债

例 John owes his sister a lot of money. 约翰欠他姐姐一大笔钱。

② 由于（owing to）〈同 due to〉

例 The trip has been postponed owing to the bad weather. 由于糟糕的天气，行程被推迟了。



* * *



ownership　［ˈəʊnəʃɪp］

n. 所有权；物主身份

例 The ownership of the farm was disputed in court. 这个农场的所有权在法庭上产生了争议。



自我检测


从第三部分中选出最适当的词填入空格内。

18. I made an ______ phone call to my friend in Paris.

19. I ______ Bill a dinner because he paid for my dinner last night.

20. She has an optimistic ______ about life, so everyone likes her.

21. Scientists must not ______ any aspect of an experimental procedure.

22. The boss recorded the workers' ______ in the computer.

23. Sara Mayo Hospital in New Orleans was so named in recognition of Dr. Mayo's ______ humanitarianism.





第四部分

pace　［peɪs］

n.（一）步，速度〈同 step〉

例 There were perhaps ten paces between me and the bear. 我与熊之间大概有十步的距离。

vi. 踱步，缓慢地走

例 We paced off the distance and found it to be 72 paces. 我们步测了一下距离，发现有72步。



* * *



palm　［pɑːm］



n. ① 棕榈树

例 Most palms have tall trunks, no branches, and many large leaves at the top. 大多数棕榈树都有高高的树干，没有树枝，在树顶则有许多大叶子。

② 手掌

例 I applauded so hard that my palms hurt. 我鼓掌太用力了，拍得手心都痛。



* * *



panel　［ˈpænəl］

n. ① 镶板〈同 board〉

例 The kitchen floor was built with wooden panels. 厨房地面铺的是木地板。

② 专门小组

例 A panel of experts gave its opinion on ways to solve the traffic problems. 关于解决交通问题的方法，一个专家组给出了建议。

vt.（用木头、玻璃镶板等）覆盖

例 The dining room was paneled in oak. 餐厅的墙壁都镶有橡木板。

记 pan本身就有“平板”之义，加上“el”还是板；需特别注意其“专门小组”一义。



* * *



parallel　［ˈpærəlel］

vt. 与…平行；匹敌〈同 be equal to; compare〉

例 Nobody can parallel him in this ability. 没有人能在这项能力上与他匹敌。

n. 类似，相似

例 Her background is a parallel of mine. 她的背景与我非常相似。

记 par（旁边）+allel（另一个)→总在另一个的旁边→与…平行

联 unparalleled adj. 无比的，空前的；parallelogram n. 【数】平行四边形



* * *



parliament　［ˈpɑːləmənt］

n. 国会，议会

例 In Britain, Parliament consists of the House of Commons, the House of Lords and the king or queen. 在英国，议会由下院、上院和国王或女王组成。

联 parliamentary adj. 议会（制）的



* * *



partial　［ˈpɑːʃəl］

adj. 部分的〈同 incomplete〉

例 I am making only a partial payment at the present time and will pay off the balance in installments. 目前我只支付一部分，剩下的部分将分期支付。

记 part（部分）+ial→部分的

联 impartial adj. 公平的，不偏不倚的；partiality n. 偏爱



* * *



participate　［pɑːˈtɪsɪpeɪt］

vi. 参与，参加

例 The teacher participated in the children's games. 老师加入了孩子们的游戏。

联 participant n. 参与者，参赛者



* * *



particle　［ˈpɑːtɪkəl］

n. 颗粒，微粒〈同 grain〉

例 The curtain was so dirty that when the wind blew, it filled the air with dust particles. 窗帘太脏了，风一吹，便弄得空气里满是灰尘颗粒。



* * *



particular　［pəˈtɪkjʊlə(r)］

adj. ① 值得注意的，特别的

例 Lisa wrote the letter with particular attention to her choice of words. 莉萨在写这封信时，特别注意自己的措辞。

② 特有的，特定的〈同 specific〉

例 “Was there a particular size of dress you wanted?” the clerk asked me. “这里有没有您想要的特定尺寸的裙子？”店员问我。

记 part（部分）+icular（有…的）→有自己特点的部分→特别的

联 particularize v. 详细说明，列举；particularity n. 特性



* * *



passion　［ˈpæʃən］

n. 激情，热情；酷爱〈同 ardor〉

例 Janet has a passion for seafood. 珍妮特非常爱吃海鲜。

联 passionate adj. 充满热情的，热烈的

Lesson 19




音频



预备测验



找出与句子中划线单词意义最相近的词。

1. The climate and soil as far north as the Arctic Circle permit farmers to raise livestock and grow barley（大麦）, potatoes and other crops.

(A) help

(B) allow

(C) require

2. It was not poverty, but rather a concern for simplicity that kept Puritan churches unadorned.

(A) theology

(B) hunger for power

(C) lack of money

3. Amateur archaeologists start out by learning how to plot records of their finds in a given area.

(A) arrange

(B) chart

(C) keep

4. In the United State's education system, intermediate schools are the transitional phase between the primary and high school.

(A) stage

(B) notion

(C) pattern

5. The twinkling of the stars is caused by warm and cool patches of air drifting through the earth's atmosphere.

(A) shades

(B) gases

(C) expanses





第一部分

passive　［ˈpæsɪv］

adj. 被动的；消极的〈同 compliant〉

例 It has been suggested that people who watch television incessantly may become overly passive. 有证据显示，不断看电视的人会变得过于被动。

记 pass（感情）+ive→被感情所左右→被动的

联 passivity n. 被动性



* * *



paste　［peɪst］

v. 粘贴

例 It took me several hours to paste all the wallpaper onto the wall. 我花了好几个小时才把所有壁纸贴在墙上。



* * *



patch　［pætʃ］

n. 片，块；补丁〈同 expanse〉

例 The gardener planted a patch of roses. 园艺师种了一小片玫瑰。



* * *



pattern　［ˈpætən］



n. 式样，图案〈同 design〉

例 The bright pattern of the monarch butterfly distracts its predators. 黑脉金斑蝶身上闪亮的图案会分散捕食者的注意力。



* * *



peace　［piːs］

n. 和平，和睦

例 We enjoy the peace of the country. 我们很享受乡村的宁静。

联 peaceful adj. 和平的，安宁的



* * *



peculiar　［pɪˈkjuːlɪə(r)］

adj. ①（人、地点、时间等）特有的，专有的〈同 special〉

例 I was longing to get home—a desire peculiar to all people who travel for quite a long time. 我盼望着回家——这是所有在外漂泊已久的人特有的一种渴望。

② 奇怪的，异常的〈同 odd, unusual〉

例 This peculiar behavior puzzles everyone who knows him. 他奇怪的行为让所有认识他的人迷惑不解。

记 pec（来自pecus，意为“牛”，牛是私有财产，所以是特有的)+uliar→特有的，专有的

联 peculiarity n. 特性；怪癖



* * *



penetrate　［ˈpenətreɪt］

vt. 穿透；渗透〈同 go through〉

例 The bullet penetrated the victim's chest and lodged itself just to the right of his heart. 子弹穿透了受害者的胸部，正好停在他心脏的右边。

联 penetrating adj. 敏锐的，尖锐的；penetration n. 穿透，渗透



* * *



perceive　［pəˈsiːv］

vt. 感知；察觉，发觉；理解，认识〈同 sense; detect; know〉

例 The eyes perceive color and the ears perceive sound. 眼睛可以识别颜色，耳朵可以感知声音。

记 per（全部）+ceiv（拿住)+e→全部拿住→理解，认识

联 perceivable adj. 可感知的



* * *



performance　［pəˈfɔːməns］

n. 履行；表演，演奏〈同 enactment; show〉

例 They gave a superb performance of Arthur Miller's play The Crucible. 他们精彩地演绎了亚瑟·米勒的戏剧《萨勒姆的女巫》。



* * *



periodically　［ˌpɪərɪˈɒdɪkəli］

adv. 周期性地；定时性地〈同 intermittently; routinely〉

例 Some materials periodically demonstrate unusual behavior when frozen. 个别材料在冷冻时会周期性地呈现出异常反应。



自我检测


从第一部分中选出最适当的词填入空格内。

6. A clock without any hands looks rather ______.

7. Did you ______ the colors of that bird?

8. I sewed a ______ over the hole in my pants.

9. If you watch TV for a long time, the part of the brain that processes complex information shows lowered activity and you become more and more ______.

10. The strong wind ______ into the hall and everyone felt very cold.

11. Bob's new shirt has a ______ of large, colored spots.





第二部分

permanent　［ˈpɜːmənənt］

adj. 长久的，永久的〈同 everlasting〉

例 After he moved to the United States, he decided it would be permanent and he would not return to his hometown. 他搬到美国之后，便决定永远住在那里，再也不回他的家乡了。

记 per（贯穿，自始至终）+ man（停留）+ ent→永久停留→长久的

联 permanence n. 永久，持久



* * *



permit

[ˈpɜːmɪt] n. 通行证，许可证〈同 license〉

例 Mary's permit allows her to fish in the river. 玛丽有许可证，她可以在河里钓鱼。

[pəˈmɪt] v. 许可，准许

例 I will go on Monday, if the weather permits. 如果天气允许，我周一就去。

联 permissive adj. 忍让的，宽容的；permission n. 许可，允许



* * *



persist　［pəˈsɪst］

vi. 坚持；持续〈同 continue〉

例 He persisted in denying that he was at the scene of the crime although a number of people saw him there. 虽然有许多人看到他在犯罪现场，但他坚持否认。

联 persistence n. 坚持；persistent adj. 持续的



* * *



personal　［ˈpɜːsənəl］

adj. ① 私人的，个人的〈同 individual, private〉

例 I bought a computer for my own personal use. 我买了一台电脑给自己用。

② 亲自的〈同 by oneself〉

例 The actress made a personal visit to a seriously ill fan of hers. 那位女演员亲自拜访了她的一位患重病的粉丝。



* * *



perspective　［pəˈspektɪv］

n.（判断事物的）角度，方法，观点〈同 viewpoint〉

例 Perhaps in the long-term perspective of history, some events that seem very important now will prove minor. 从长期的历史角度来看，某些现在看起来很重要的事可能会变得微不足道。



* * *



persuade　［pəˈsweɪd］

v. 说服，劝说，（使）相信〈同 convince〉

例 I knew I should study, but he persuaded me to go to the movie. 我知道我应该学习，但他说服我去看电影。

联 persuasive adj. 有说服力的；persuasion n. 说服；说服力



* * *



pessimistic　［ˌpesɪˈmɪstɪk］

adj. 悲观的，厌世的

例 I was pessimistic about passing the test because I hadn't studied. 我对通过考试持悲观态度，因为我根本没学习。



* * *



phase　［feɪz］

n. 阶段，状态〈同 stage〉

例 The three phases of matter are solid, liquid and gas. 物质的三种状态分别是固态、液态和气态。



* * *



physical　［ˈfɪzɪkəl］



adj. 身体的；物质的

例 There's an element of danger in any sport in which there is a lot of physical contact. 任何有大量身体接触的运动项目都有危险。

联 physician n. 内科医生



* * *



pillar　［ˈpɪlə(r)］

n. 柱，柱子〈同 column〉

例 Sometimes a pillar stands alone as a monument. 有时候，一根单独立着的柱子就是一座纪念碑。



自我检测

13. At present his voice is changing; that is a ______ all boys go through.

17. We ______ her that she was wrong.





第三部分

pillow　［ˈpɪləʊ］

n. 枕头

例 My neck hurts because I slept without a pillow last night. 我脖子痛，因为我昨晚睡觉没枕枕头。



* * *



pilot　［ˈpaɪlət］



n. 飞行员；领航员

例 The pilot steered the plane through thick clouds. 飞行员操控着飞机，穿过厚厚的云层。

v. 引导〈同 guide〉

例 The manager piloted us through the big factory. 经理带领我们参观这个大工厂。



* * *



pinch　［pɪntʃ］

vt. 掐，夹痛〈同 clutch〉

例 As she was getting out of the car, she accidentally pinched her finger in the door. 她在下车的时候，不小心被车门夹了手指。



* * *



pit　［pɪt］

n. 坑，地坑；煤矿〈同 cavity; mine〉

例 My dog dug a shallow pit in the back yard. 我的狗在后院挖了一个很浅的坑。

vt. 使对抗，使相斗〈同 confront〉

例 The winners of the semifinals will be pitted against each other. 半决赛的获胜者将展开巅峰对决。



* * *



plate　［pleɪt］

n. 盘子；版图，大片平面〈同 dish; covering〉

例 Our food is served on plates. 我们的食物是用盘子盛的。

联 platelike adj. 层状的



* * *



platform　［ˈplætfɔːm］

n.（车站）月台；平台；讲坛〈同 stage〉

例 The guards prevented the fans from climbing onto the platform where the famous singer was performing. 保安人员阻止粉丝爬上那名著名歌手表演的舞台。

记 plat（看作flat，平的）+ form（外形)→平台



* * *



plot　［plɒt］

n.（小说的）情节，结构〈同 scenario〉

例 The TV show's plot was so silly that I refused to finish watching it. 这个电视节目的情节太傻了，我不愿意继续把它看完了。

v. ① 绘图〈同 chart〉

例 The pilot plotted the plane's course. 飞行员绘制出飞机的航线。

② 密谋〈同 make plans〉

例 The rebels plotted against the government. 反叛者密谋与政府对抗。



* * *



plug　［plʌɡ］

n. 塞子；插头；插销

例 I put the plug in the drain to keep the water from running out of the bathtub. 我用塞子堵上排水口，这样水就不会从浴缸里流走了。



* * *



plunge　［plʌnʤ］

v.（使）跳进；（使）投入，（使）陷入〈同 dive〉

例 The swimmer plunged into the pool. 那个游泳的人跳入了水池。



* * *



policy　［ˈpɒləsi］

n. ① 政策

例 I can't issue a refund without a receipt. It's the store's policy. 没有收据，我无法安排退款。这是商店的规定。

② 保险单

例 My fire insurance policy states that I shall receive $40,000 if my house burns down. 我的火灾保险单上说，如果我的房子被烧毁了，我将获得40,000美元的补偿。



自我检测


从第三部分中选出最适当的词填入空格内。

18. Anne put some corn on my ______ next to my potatoes.

19. Their lavish spending ______ them into a debt trap.

20. She was ______ against her friend in the last round of the tennis match.

21. The nurse ______ the patient's temperature on a chart over several days.

22. Foreign investors must know well about Chinese ______ before they make their investment decisions.

23. Janet likes to use a soft ______ while sleeping.





第四部分

polish　［ˈpɒlɪʃ］

vt. 擦亮〈同 shine〉

例 Ellen always polished her boyfriend's shoes in order to please him. 埃伦为了取悦她的男朋友，经常给他擦鞋。

n. 光泽；上光剂〈同 shine; glaze〉

例 The polish of the furniture reflected our faces like a mirror. 家具的光泽像镜子般照出了我们的面孔。

联 polished adj. 擦亮的



* * *



pool　［puːl］

v. 联合经营；共享

例 The only one way for us to overcome the difficulty is to pool our resources. 我们克服困难的唯一途径就是资源共享。



* * *



portable　［ˈpɔːtəbəl］

adj. 便携的，手提式的；轻便的〈同 mobile〉

例 With the growing popularity of back-packing and hiking, all kinds of portable camping equipment is being sold. 随着背包旅行和徒步旅行的日益流行，各种便携式露营设备开始上市。

记 port（拿）+ able→可以手拿的→轻便的



* * *



portrait　［ˈpɔːtrɪt; ˈpɔːtrət］



n. 肖像，画像；描写

例 The queen posed for a portrait painted by a famous artist. 女王摆出一个姿势，让一名著名艺术家为她绘制肖像。

联 portraitist n. 肖像画家；portraiture n. 肖像画法；肖像



* * *



positive　［ˈpɒzətɪv］

adj. ①【电】阳极的

例 An electric current can consist of charges that are positive, negative, or both. 电流中可能包含正电荷、负电荷，或两种电荷同时存在。

② 肯定的；积极的 〈同 definite〉

例 Nodding one's head is a positive response. 点头是表示肯定的回答。

记 posit（肯定）+ ive→肯定的



* * *



possess　［pəˈzes］

vt. 占有，拥有 〈同 have〉

例 That businessman possesses more than five companies. 那个商人拥有超过五家公司。

联 possession n. 拥有，占有；财产



* * *



postpone　［pəˈspəʊn］

vt. 推迟，使延期〈同 put off, delay〉

例 The meeting was postponed till next week. 会议被推迟到下周。



* * *



potential　［pəˈtenʃəl］

adj. 可能的；潜在的〈同 possible〉

例 Destroying nuclear weapons reduces a potential threat to human survival. 销毁核武器可以减少人类生存所面临的潜在威胁。

记 potent（能够，有能力）+ ial→可能的

联 potentially adv. 潜在地；potentiality n. 潜能，潜力



* * *



pour　［pɔː(r)］

v. 灌注，倾泻

例 I poured the milk out of the bottle. 我把牛奶从瓶子里倒出来。



* * *



poverty　［ˈpɒvəti］

n. 贫困〈同 destitution〉

例 There were very few jobs in the town, and many families lived in poverty. 这个城市没有太多的工作机会，许多家庭生活贫困。

Lesson 20




音频



预备测验



找出与句子中划线单词意义最相近的词。

1. Presently, there are more than three thousand colleges and universities in the United States.

(A) Allegedly

(B) Evidently

(C) Currently

2. When carbon is added to iron in the proper proportions, the result is steel.

(A) containers

(B) sequences

(C) amounts

3. One of the new conservation projects undertaken by the state of Oklahoma involves flood prevention.

(A) topics

(B) programs

(C) concerns

4. After years of research, Charles Drew devised a procedure for preserving plasma.

(A) transporting

(B) saving

(C) reusing

5. Annie Oakley became famous as one of the world's most precise sharpshooters（神枪手）.

(A) formidable

(B) logical

(C) accurate





第一部分

precaution　［prɪˈkɔːʃən］

n. 预防措施，警惕〈同 prevention〉

例 It may rain tonight so take an umbrella as a precaution. 今天晚上可能会下雨，因此预防起见，还是带一把伞吧。

记 pre（预先）+ caut（谨慎）+ ion→预先十分谨慎地做好准备→预防措施

联 precautious adj. 戒备的，警惕的



* * *



precede　［prɪˈsiːd］

vt. 在…之前，早于〈同 come before〉

例 Last year's heavy rainfall preceded this year's good harvest. 去年的大雨决定了今年的好收成。

联 preceding adj. 在前的



* * *



precious　［ˈpreʃəs］



adj. 宝贵的，珍贵的〈同 valuable〉

例 Diamonds, rubies, and emeralds are precious stones. 钻石、红宝石和祖母绿都是宝石。



* * *



precise　［prɪˈsaɪs］

adj. 精确的，准确的

例 The directions they gave were so precise that we found our way easily. 他们给出的方向指示非常准确，我们很容易就找到了路。

联 precision n. 精确，精密度



* * *



predict　［prɪˈdɪkt］

vt. 预言，预告〈同 foretell〉

例 Although the weatherman had predicted snow, it was a beautiful weekend. 虽然天气预报说有雪，但周末却是好天气。

联 prediction n. 预言，预报；predictive adj. 预言性的，成为前兆的；predictable adj. 可预见的



* * *



preface　［ˈprefəs］

n. 序言；开端

例 The lecturer stated her main idea in the preface of her speech. 演讲人在开场白中陈述了自己的主要观点。

记 pre（前面）+ face（脸面)→放在前面的→序言；开端

联 prefatory adj. 序言的



* * *



prejudice　［ˈpreʤʊdɪs］

n. 偏见〈同 bias〉

例 The new immigrants faced much prejudice. 新移民面临许多歧视。

联 prejudicial adj. 引起偏见的



* * *



preliminary　［prɪˈlɪmɪnəri; (US)prɪˈlɪmɪneri］

adj. 预备的，初步的〈同 initial〉

例 The professor expects a preliminary draft of the paper two weeks before the final due date. 教授希望在最终截止日期的两周前收到论文的初稿。

记 pre（预先）+ limin（门槛）+ ary→入门以前→初步的



* * *



prescribe　［prɪˈskraɪb］

vt. ① 指示，规定〈同 dictate〉

例 The company president prescribed a new business plan for his employees. 公司总裁为员工制定了一个新的业务方案。

② 开药方

例 The doctor prescribed penicillin. 医生开了青霉素。

联 prescribed adj. 规定的；prescription n. 药方，处方



* * *



presently　［ˈprezəntli］

adv. 现在，当前〈同 at the present time〉

例 Anne is presently busy and cannot come to the telephone. 安妮目前很忙，没法来接电话。



自我检测


从第一部分中选出最适当的词填入空格内。

6. The Weather Service ______ rain for tomorrow.

7. Locking doors is a ______ against thieves.

8. This golden ring is my most ______ possession.

9. The doctor ______ a new medicine for John's heart problem.

10. The band ______ the floats（彩车）in the parade.

11. The ______ age of the dead man was inestimable, because the corpse had thoroughly decomposed.





第二部分

preserve　［prɪˈzɜːv］

vt. 保存，保护〈同 retain; save〉

例 Max eats only good things hoping to preserve his health. 马克斯只吃好东西，希望保持健康。

联 preservation n. 保存，贮藏；保护



* * *



press　［pres］



vt. 压，压榨〈同 squeeze out〉

例 Press all the juice from the oranges. 压出橘子里的所有果汁。

联 pressing adj. 紧迫的



* * *



prevail　［prɪˈveɪl］

vi. 流行，盛行；居主导地位〈同 dominate〉

例 Making resolutions on New Year's Day is a custom that still prevails. 在新年当天许下心愿是一种至今仍非常流行的习俗。

联 prevalent adj. 普遍的；流行的



* * *



previous　［ˈpriːvɪəs］

adj. 在前的，早先的

例 Training is provided, so no previous experience is required for the job. 这份工作将提供培训，因此不需要之前有任何经验。

联 previously adv. 先前



* * *



primary　［ˈpraɪməri］

adj. 第一位的，主要的〈同 principal, prime〉

例 A balanced diet is primary to good health. 均衡饮食对身体健康最重要。

联 primarily adv. 根本上



* * *



prime　［praɪm］

adj. 主要的；最初的；最重要的〈同 principal〉

例 Prime wisdom is derived from experience. 最重要的智慧来源于经验。

n. 鼎盛时期〈同 peak〉

例 He is in the prime of his career at forty. 他四十岁时职业发展达到了顶峰。



* * *



primitive　［ˈprɪmətɪv］

adj. 上古的，原始的〈同 rudimentary〉

例 Anthropologists agree that our primitive ancestors who inhabited the tropics probably had natural protection against the sun. 人类学家同意，居住在热带的人类祖先可能有对抗太阳的天然防护能力。

记 prim（最早的）+ itive→原始的



* * *



principal　［ˈprɪnsəpəl］

n. 负责人；首长；校长

例 Ms. Chen is the principal of our school. 陈女士是我们学校的校长。

adj. 主要的，首要的〈同 main〉

例 The moon, being much nearer to the earth than the sun, is the principal cause of the tides. 月亮比太阳距离地球更近，是引发潮汐的主要原因。



* * *



principle　［ˈprɪnsəpəl］

n. 原则，原理〈同 law〉

例 I make it a principle to save some money each week. 我把每周存一些钱作为自己的一条原则。



* * *



prior　［ˈpraɪə(r)］

adj. 优先的，在前的

例 They had to refuse the dinner invitation because of a prior engagement. 他们不得不拒绝晚餐邀请，因为他们之前已经另有约会。

adj. 在…之前的（to）〈同 before〉

例 He had shown no signs of being in pain prior to suffering a heart attack and collapsing. 他在突发心脏病和体力不支之前，没有表现出任何痛苦的迹象。



自我检测

第三部分

privilege　［ˈprɪvəlɪʤ］

vt. 给予…特权，特免

例 I cannot privilege you to see your exam paper. 我不能给你查看试卷的特权。



* * *



procedure　［prəˈsiːʤə(r)］

n. 程序，手续〈同 course〉

例 You can't just do it however you like—you must follow the procedure. 你不能随着自己的性子做事——你必须遵守流程。



* * *



proceed　［prəˈsiːd］

vi. 进行，继续下去〈同 continue〉

例 The tour group proceeded to the next site after a thirty-minute lunch break. 旅行团午餐时休息了30分钟后，继续前往下一个景点。

联 proceeds n. 收益；proceeding n. 行动；进行



* * *



professional　［prəˈfeʃənəl］



adj. 专业的，职业的

例 A lawyer or a doctor is a professional person. 律师或医生都是专业人士。

n. 专业人员〈同 specialist〉

例 It's the sort of ad that is intended to appeal to teachers, lawyers, doctors and other professionals. 这就是那类用来吸引教师、律师、医生和其他专业人员的广告。



* * *



profit　［ˈprɒfɪt］

n. 利润，益处

例 The profits in this business are not large. 这家公司的利润不高。

vi. 得益；利用〈同 benefit〉

例 The football team profited from many hours of practice. 几个小时的练习让这支足球队获益匪浅。



* * *



prohibit　［prəˈhɪbɪt; (US)prəʊˈhɪbɪt］

vt. 禁止〈同 ban, taboo〉

例 I prohibit you to call me late at night. 夜深了，你不许给我打电话。

联 prohibitive adj. 禁止的，抑制的；prohibitively adv. 令人望而生畏地；（价格）极高地；Prohibition n. 〈美〉禁酒时期



* * *



project

[ˈprɒʤekt] n. 设计，规划；项目〈同 program, plan〉

例 He was employed by the company to work on the King's Cross Housing project. 公司聘用他负责国王十字区住宅项目。

[prəˈʤekt] vt. 投射，射出〈同 cast〉

例 The images are projected onto the screen. 图像被投影在屏幕上。

联 projector n. 放映机；projection n. 发射；projectionist n. 〈美〉电影放映员，幻灯片放映员



* * *



prominent　［ˈprɒmɪnənt］

adj. 杰出的，突出的〈同 distinguished〉

例 Their talent for locating oil deposits made them prominent geologists in the corporation. 定位油田的才能使他们成为公司里杰出的地质学家。

联 prominence n. 显著，突出



* * *



promise　［ˈprɒmɪs］

n./vt. 允诺，答应

例 You can count on her to keep her promise. 你可以相信她，她一定会信守诺言。

联 promising adj. 有希望的，有前途的



* * *



promote　［prəˈməʊt］

vt. 晋级，使升级；促进〈同 elevate; advance〉

例 Many nations promote tourism to lure foreign currency. 许多国家通过推动旅游业来吸引外汇。

联 promoter n. 促进者；promotion n. 促进，提升



自我检测


从第三部分中选出最适当的词填入空格内。

18. It would look more ______ if the letter was typed rather than hand-written.

19. There is a complicated ______ for setting up the printer.

20. The tree ______ a shadow on the window.

21. Pupils who pass the test will be ______ to the next grade.

22. Rainy weather and fog ______ flying.

23. After a year of arguments, preparations for the festival are now ______ smoothly.





第四部分

prompt　［prɒmpt］

vt. 鼓动，促进〈同 motivate〉

例 She prompted me to call my relatives. 她鼓励我给亲人打电话。

adj. 迅速的；按时的〈同 instant; punctual〉

例 When David came late, the boss warned that he must be prompt. 戴维上班迟到了，于是老板警告他必须准时上班。

联 promptly adv. 迅速地，立刻地



* * *



proof　［pruːf］

n. 证据〈同 evidence〉

例 Keep your receipt as proof of purchase. 保留好你的收据，作为购物的凭证。



* * *



property　［ˈprɒpəti］

n. ① 财产，所有物〈同 asset〉

例 He owns some extremely valuable properties. 他拥有一些价值极高的财产。

② 性质，特性〈同 attribute〉

例 One of the properties of copper is that it conducts heat and electricity very well. 铜的属性之一是，它具有很好的导热和导电性。



* * *



proportion　［prəˈpɔːʃən］

n. 比例，比率〈同 percentage〉

例 A great proportion of Janet's MBA classmates will work on Wall Street. 珍妮特读MBA的同班同学，将来大部分都会在华尔街工作。

联 proportionate adj. 成比例的；disproportionate adj. 不成比例的



* * *



propose　［prəˈpəʊz］

vt. 提出，提议〈同 advance〉

例 The governor is going to propose new taxes. 州长将提议增加新税种。

联 proposal n. 提案；建议



* * *



prospect　［prəˈspekt; (US)ˈprɒspekt］

n. 前景，期望〈同 hope〉

例 With not much prospect of settling the dispute, the talks were halted. 由于解决争端无望，谈话陷入停顿。

vt. 勘探，采矿〈同 explore〉

例 He spends the summers prospecting in the mountains. 他每年夏天都在山中勘探。

记 pro（向前，在前）+ spect（看)→向前看→前景

联 prospecting n. 探矿；prospector n. 探勘者，采矿者；prospective adj. 预期的，未来的



* * *



prosperity　［prɒˈsperəti］

n. 兴旺，繁荣〈同 fortune〉

例 The war was followed by a long period of peace and prosperity. 战争过后，是很长一段时期的和平与繁荣。

记 pro（很多）+ sper（希望）+ ity→有很多希望→兴旺，繁荣

联 prosperous adj. 繁荣的



* * *



protest　［ˈprəʊtest］



n./v. 抗议〈同 objection; complain against〉

例 Conservation groups have united in protest against the planned new road. 保护组织联合起来，反对新公路的规划。



* * *



provided　［prəˈvaɪdɪd］

conj. 倘若〈同 on the condition that〉

例 I will go provided my friends can also go. 我会去的，但前提是我的朋友们也能去。



* * *



provision　［prəˈvɪʒən］

n. ① 供应；供应品〈同 supply〉

例 The hunter bought provisions for the winter. 猎人采购过冬用品。

② 规定，条款〈同 stipulation〉

例 A provision of the lease is that the rent must be paid promptly. 租约的一条条款规定，租金必须按时支付。



自我检测

Lesson 21




音频



预备测验



找出与句子中划线单词意义最相近的词。

1. About a quarter of the workers in the United States are employed in factories.

(A) third

(B) fourth

(C) tenth

2. Feminism as a theme emerged rather late in the history of literature.

(A) regrettably

(B) undeniably

(C) fairly

3. The octopus（章鱼）has three hearts that pump blood through its body.

(A) draw

(B) filter

(C) dilute

4. The papaya is a tropical fruit usually eaten raw.

(A) unpeeled

(B) uncooked

(C) unsweetened

5. Hafnium, a rare element, is used in the manufacture of light bulbs.

(A) an explosive

(B) an uncommon

(C) a physical





第一部分

psychology　［saɪˈkɒləʤi］

n. 心理学；心理

例 Mental illness is only one part of psychology. 精神疾病只是心理学的一部分。

联 psychological adj. 心理（上）的；psychologist n. 心理学者



* * *



pump　［ˈpʌmp］

n. 泵

例 As the handle is pushed down, the pump moves upward pulling water up through the valve. 推下手柄后，水泵上升，通过阀门将水抽上来。

vt.（用泵）抽（水），抽吸〈同 draw〉

例 She pumped water from the barrel. 她从桶里抽水。



* * *



punctual　［ˈpʌŋktjʊəl］

adj. 按时的，准时的〈同 prompt〉

例 She is punctual to the minute. 她非常准时。

记 punct（点）+ ual→按点到的→按时的，准时的

联 punctuality n. 守时



* * *



purchase　［ˈpɜːtʃəs］

n./vt. 买，购买〈同 buy〉

例 To be eligible for the lower fare, you must purchase your tickets 21 days in advance. 要想有资格获得更低的票价，你必须提前21天买票。



* * *



purple　［ˈpɜːpəl］

n./adj. 紫色（的）

例 The early morning sun cast deep purple shadows. 清晨初升的太阳投射出深紫色的阴影。



* * *



pursue　［pəˈsjuː; (US)pəˈsuː］



v. ① 追赶，追捕〈同 chase〉

例 The thief was pursued by the policeman. 小偷后面有警察在追赶。

② 追求，不断努力以取得〈同 go on with〉

例 Janet pursued her studies even after her marriage. 珍妮特即使在结婚之后也坚持继续深造。

记 pur（向前）+ sue（求)→追求；追赶

联 pursuer n. 追捕者



* * *



puzzle　［ˈpʌzəl］

n. 难题；谜〈同 enigma〉

例 How to get all my things into one trunk is a puzzle. 如何把我所有的东西全放进一个行李箱里，这是一个难题。

联 puzzling adj. 令人迷惑的



* * *



qualified　［ˈkwɒlɪfaɪd］

adj. 合格的〈同 competent〉

例 A qualified airplane pilot must have good eyesight and hold a license to fly. 一位合格的飞机驾驶员必须有良好的视力，并持有飞行执照。

联 qualification n. 资格，条件



* * *



quality　［ˈkwɒləti］

n. 质量；品质，性质〈同 characteristic〉

例 Look for quality rather than quantity. 要注重质量，而不是数量。



* * *



quarter　［ˈkwɔːtə(r)］

n. 四分之一〈同 fourth〉

例 A quarter of a century is 25 years. 一个世纪的四分之一是25年。

联 quarterly adv. 每季地；一年四次地

第二部分

quit　［kwɪt］

vt. 离开，放弃；辞职〈同 stop doing; resign〉

例 Would you quit your job if you inherited lots of money? 如果你继承了一大笔钱，你会辞掉工作吗？



* * *



quote　［kwəʊt］

v. ① 引用，引证〈同 cite〉

例 Our teacher often quotes Shakespeare in class. 我们的老师经常在讲课时引用莎士比亚的作品。

② 报（价）

例 The architect has quoted ￡3,000,000 to build a mansion. 这位建筑师建一栋大厦的报价是300万英镑。



* * *



race　［reɪs］



n. ① 种族〈同 ethnic group〉

例 Discrimination on grounds of race should not be allowed. 基于种族方面的歧视应该被禁止。

② 比赛，竞赛〈同 contest〉

例 The Oxford and Cambridge boat race takes place on the River Thames every year. 牛津与剑桥的划船比赛每年都在泰晤士河上举行。



* * *



rack　［ræk］

n. 搁物架〈同 shelf〉

例 Racks of clothing at the store were emptied during the Christmas sale. 在圣诞节大减价期间，这家商店里一货架一货架的衣服都被抢购一空。

vt. 使痛苦〈同 cause pain〉

例 As soon as he returned from the playing field, his whole body was racked with pain. 他刚从赛场回来，整个身体就开始感到疼痛。



* * *



radioactive　［ˌreɪdɪəʊˈæktɪv］

adj. 放射性的；有辐射能的

例 Radium, uranium, and thorium are radioactive metallic elements. 镭、铀和钍都属于放射性金属元素。



* * *



radius　［ˈreɪdɪəs］

n. 半径；范围

例 The explosion was heard within a radius of four miles. 在四英里的范围内都能听到这个爆炸声。



* * *



rail　［reɪl］

n. 轨道；铁路

例 Rail passengers are complaining about the recent increase in rail fares. 铁路乘客在抱怨最近铁路票价上涨的事。

v. 责备；抱怨〈同 complain〉

例 He railed against the injustices of the system. 他抱怨体制的不公。

联 railroad n. 铁路；rail-motor adj. 铁路公路联运的；railbus n. 有轨（公共）汽车；railcar n. 铁路车；有轨车



* * *



raise　［reɪz］

vt. ① 举起；增长〈同 lift up〉

例 Children in school raise their hands to answer a question. 在学校里，孩子们举手回答问题。

② 饲养；养育〈同 bring up〉

例 She was raised by her aunt in London. 她是由姑姑在伦敦养大的。

③ 筹集（资金)〈同 collect〉

例 I raised a loan for my sister's wedding. 我为姐姐的婚礼借了一笔钱。



* * *



range　［reɪnʤ］

n. 行列；范围〈同 limit〉

例 The temperature range was between eight and twelve degrees. 温度范围在8度至12度之间。



* * *



rare　［rɛə(r)］

adj. 稀有的〈同 scarce〉

例 Many gardeners have become interested in the propagation of rare seeds, in order to keep old strains from disappearing. 为了避免古老植物品种的消失，许多园艺师开始对稀有种子的繁殖感兴趣。

联 rarefy vt. 使稀少，使稀薄；vi. 变得稀少；rarely adv. 很少地，罕有地

第三部分

rather　［ˈrɑːðə; (US)ˈræðər］

adv. ① 宁愿，宁可〈同 more readily〉

例 I would rather go today than tomorrow. 我更愿意今天去而不是明天去。

② 有点，相当〈同 somewhat〉

例 The dress was rather more expensive than I was expecting it would be, so I didn't buy it. 那条裙子的价格比我预期的高多了，所以我没买。



* * *



ratio　［ˈreɪʃɪəʊ］

n. 比，比率

例 The ratio of 10 to 3 is written as 10:3. 10比3，写出来就是10:3。



* * *



rational　［ˈræʃənəl］

adj. 理性的；合理的〈同 logical〉

例 It isn't rational to walk barefoot in the snow. 光着脚在雪中走是不理性的。

记 ration（理性）+ al→理性的；合理的

联 rationale n. 基本原理；rationality n. 合理性；rationalize v.（使）合理化



* * *



raw　［rɔː］

adj. 生的，未加工的〈同 uncooked〉

例 Raw milk has not been pasteurized. 生鲜牛奶没有经过巴氏灭菌。



* * *



react　［riːˈækt］



v.（使）起反应，（使）起作用〈同 take effect〉

例 Many people react badly to penicillin. 许多人注射青霉素会有不良反应。

联 reaction n. 反应；反作用



* * *



realm　［relm］

n. 王国；领域〈同 kingdom〉

例 Lu Xun is well-known worldwide in the realm of literature. 鲁迅在文学界全球知名。



* * *



rear　［rɪə(r)］

vt. 培养，饲养〈同 raise〉

例 The mother swallow reared her children until they could fly on their own. 燕子妈妈会一直抚养孩子，直到它们能够独立飞行。

n. 后面〈同 back〉

例 The rear of the bus is the most uncomfortable part. 公交车后排座位是最不舒服的地方。



* * *



reasonable　［ˈriːzənəbəl］

adj. 合理的；讲道理的，通情达理的〈同 sensible〉

例 If you tell him what happened I'm sure he'll understand—he's a reasonable man. 如果你告诉他发生了什么，我敢肯定他会理解的——他是个通情达理的人。



* * *



rebel

[ˈrebəl] n. 反叛者；叛徒

例 The prime minister left the capital after learning that the rebels were planning an imminent attack. 首相在得知反叛者正在预谋发动的袭击即将来临之后，便离开了首都。

[rɪˈbel] vi. 谋反，造反〈同 revolt〉

例 The people rebelled when bread prices tripled again. 当面包价格再次涨至三倍时，人们便开始造反。

联 rebellion n. 谋反，叛乱；rebellious adj. 造反的，反叛的



* * *



recall　［rɪˈkɔːl］

vt. 回忆起；记得〈同 remember〉

例 The victim was asked to recall what happened to him the day he was robbed. 受害者被要求回忆自己被抢当天都发生了什么。

第四部分

receipt　［rɪˈsiːt］

n. ① 收据

例 I need all your receipts so that I can verify the bill for the work. 我需要你的所有收据，这样我就可以核对公费账单了。

② 收到

例 On receipt of the news he went home. 一收到这个消息，他就回家了。

记 来自receive（v. 收到）

联 receptive adj. 善于接受的，能接纳的；recipient n. 接受者



* * *



reception　［rɪˈsepʃən］



n. ① 接待；招待会；欢迎会

例 Our school gave a reception for our new principal. 我们学校为新任校长举办了一场欢迎会。

② 接收

例 The reception was poor because we were so far from the transmitter. 信号接收不良，因为我们离发射机太远了。

联 receptionist n. 接待员



* * *



recommend　［ˌrekəˈmend］

vt. ① 推荐〈同 suggest〉

例 The waiter recommended that we eat the lobster. 服务员建议我们吃龙虾。

② 劝告〈同 advise〉

例 The doctor recommended that the patient stay in bed. 医生建议患者卧床休息。

联 recommendation n. 推荐；介绍（信）



* * *



refer　［rɪˈfɜː(r)］

v. ① 提交（to）〈同 hand over〉

例 Let's refer the dispute to the manager. 我们把争议提交给经理吧。

② 查阅，参考（to）

例 A person refers to a dictionary to find the meaning of words. 人们通过查词典来获知单词的意思。

联 reference n. 参考



* * *



refined　［rɪˈfaɪnd］

adj. ① 优雅的〈同 elegant〉

例 A photographer encouraged her to become a model because of her slim figure and refined features. 一位摄影师鼓励她成为一名模特，因为她身材苗条，气质优雅。

② 精制的〈同 purified〉

例 To obtain pure lead, the lead ore is mined, then smelted, and finally refined. 为了获得纯铅，需要对铅矿进行开采，接着是冶炼，并在最后进行精炼。

记 来自refine（vt. 提纯，精炼）；re（再）+ fin（完成）+ ed→做完后还反复做→精制的

联 refinement n.（言谈、举止等的）文雅，精巧；refinery n. 精炼厂



* * *



reflection　［rɪˈflekʃən］

n. 反映〈同 expression〉

例 Your tone of voice is a reflection of your attitude. 你的语调反映了你的态度。

记 re（反）+ flect（弯曲）+ ion→弯曲反射回来→反映



* * *



refresh　［rɪˈfreʃ］

v.（使）精神振作，（使）精力恢复；更新〈同 renew〉

例 His bath refreshed him. 他洗完澡后精神焕发。

联 refreshing adj. 提神的；使人清爽的



* * *



regarding　［rɪˈɡɑːdɪŋ］

prep. 关于〈同 concerning〉

例 The company is being questioned regarding its employment policy. 公司因其雇佣政策而受到质疑。



* * *



register　［ˈreʤɪstə(r)］

n./v. 登记〈同 record〉

例 Citizens must register before they can vote. 公民在投票之前必须进行登记。



* * *



regulate　［ˈreɡjʊleɪt］

vt. ① 管制，控制〈同 direct〉

例 The government regulates the coining of money. 铸币由政府管控。

② 调节；校准〈同 adjust〉

例 My watch is losing time; I have to have it regulated. 我的表走得慢了；我得校准一下。

联 regulation n. 规则；规章

Exercise 2　从第二栏中选出第一栏各词的同义词。





COLUMN Ⅰ COLUMN Ⅱ

Lesson 22




音频



预备测验



找出与句子中划线单词意义最相近的词。

1. Alaska is a state with rich natural resources but its climate and isolation have kept it undeveloped.

(A) belongings

(B) effects

(C) materials

2. Histamine（组胺）is one of the chemicals released by certain body cells when tissues are injured.

(A) destroyed

(B) given off

(C) inhibited

3. Hundreds of years ago, cloves（丁香）were used to remedy headaches.

(A) disrupt

(B) diagnose

(C) cure

4. Over thirty cities around the world boast more than five million residents.

(A) jobs

(B) dwellings

(C) inhabitants

5. Underground storage reservoirs are important in the conservation of natural gas.

(A) laboratories

(B) receptacles

(C) reactors





第一部分

reinforce　［ˌriːɪnˈfɔːs］

vt. 加强〈同 strengthen〉

例 The mayor reinforces the police department by hiring more cops. 市长聘用了更多的警察，来加强警察局的力量。

记 re（再次）+ in（加强）+ force（力量)→再次加强力量→加强

联 reinforcement n. 增援；加强，加固



* * *



reject　［rɪˈʤekt］

vt. 拒绝，抵制〈同 turn down, deny〉

例 He tried to join the army but was rejected because of his poor health. 他想参军，但由于健康状况较差而被拒绝了。

联 rejection n. 拒绝



* * *



relate　［rɪˈleɪt］

vt. ① 叙述，讲〈同 tell〉

例 Although they did not agree with the plan, they did not relate their opposition to it. 虽然他们不同意这个计划，但也没有表示反对。

② 使联系，发生关系（with)

例 Some education advisers have related the drop in the standard of students' performance with the increase in the size of classes. 有些教育顾问将学生成绩水平的下降与班级规模的扩大联系起来。

联 relationship n. 关系，关联；relative n. 亲戚



* * *



relax　［rɪˈlæks］



v.（使）松弛，放松〈同 free〉

例 The massage relaxed her. 按摩让她放松了下来。

联 relaxed adj. 不拘束的；悠闲的；relaxation n. 松弛，缓和



* * *



release　［rɪˈliːs］

n./v. 释放〈同 give off; freedom〉

例 The end of the war brought the release of the prisoners. 战争结束后，囚犯们获得释放。



* * *



relevant　［ˈreləvənt］

adj. 有关的，切题的〈同 pertinent, related〉

例 His nationality isn't relevant to whether he's a good lawyer. 他的国籍与他是否是一位好律师无关。

记 re（重新）+ lev（提出）+ ant→把有关问题重新提出来探讨→有关的

联 relevance n. 相关；irrelevant adj. 不相关的，不切题的



* * *



reliable　［rɪˈlaɪəbəl］

adj. 可靠的，可信赖的〈同 dependable〉

例 I am happy to recommend her for this position because I have always found her to be an efficient and reliable employee. 我很高兴推荐她担任这个职务，因为我始终认为她是一位高效和可靠的员工。

记 来自rely（vi. 依赖)

联 reliability n. 可靠性；unreliable adj. 不可靠的；reliant adj. 依靠的；依靠自己的；reliance n. 依赖；依靠的人（或物）



* * *



relief　［rɪˈliːf］

n.（痛苦等的）减轻；（债务等的）免除

例 His relief from pain came as the medicine began to work. 随着药物逐渐发挥作用，他的疼痛也得到了缓解。



* * *



relieve　［rɪˈliːv］

vt. 减轻〈同 assuage〉

例 The medicine relieved her itch. 这种药物为她减轻了瘙痒。

联 relieved adj. 放心的；免除的



* * *



reluctant　［rɪˈlʌktənt］

adj. 不情愿的，勉强的〈同 unwilling〉

例 She was reluctant to accept the job offer because she was not sure that she could find a baby-sitter. 她并不愿意接受这个工作邀请，因为她不确定自己能否找到一位保姆。



自我检测


从第一部分中选出最适当的词填入空格内。

6. All the evidence ______ to this trial must be given to the court.

7. The subway is the most ______ way of getting to the airport during rush hour.

8. The pockets on my jeans are ______ with double stitching.

9. Take a vacation and ______.

10. I am ______ to go out in very cold weather.

11.s I applied for a job as a mechanic in a local garage, but I was ______.





第二部分

rely　［rɪˈlaɪ］

v. 依赖，依靠；信任（on/upon）

例 The success of this project relies on everyone making an effort. 这个项目的成功依靠的是每个人的努力。



* * *



remark　［rɪˈmɑːk］

n. 评论；注释〈同 comment〉

例 Her remarks on the employment question led to a heated discussion. 她对就业问题的评论引发了热烈的讨论。

v. 评论；谈及〈同 mention〉

例 “I think it's going to rain,” she looked out of the window and remarked. “我感觉要下雨了，”她看着窗外说道。



* * *



remarkable　［rɪˈmɑːkəbəl］

adj. 显著的，值得注意的〈同 outstanding〉

例 The invention of the radio was a remarkable achievement. 收音机的发明是一项非凡的成就。



* * *



remedy　［ˈremədi］

n. 药物〈同 drug〉

例 I know a good remedy for toothache. 我知道一种治牙疼的良药。

vt. 治疗；补救〈同 cure; fix〉

例 These mistakes can't be remedied. 这些错误无法补救。

联 remediable adj. 可挽回的；可治疗的；remedial adj. 治疗的，补救的



* * *



remind　［rɪˈmaɪnd］

vt. 提醒，使记起

例 Satire tends to remind people that what they see, read and hear is partially true. 讽刺文学旨在提醒人们，他们所看、所读和所听的内容只有部分是真实的。

联 reminder n. 提醒的人（或物等)；暗示



* * *



remote　［rɪˈməʊt］

adj. 遥远的，偏僻的〈同 isolated〉

例 The remote island was so small that no one lived there. 那个偏远的岛太小了，上面没有人居住。



* * *



remove　［rɪˈmuːv］



vt. ① 移动；搬开〈同 take away〉

例 The men came to remove the rubbish from the house. 几个男人弄走了房子里的垃圾。

② 除去；开除

例 The mayor removed the chief of police for failing to do his duty. 市长因警察局长工作失职而将他撤职。



* * *



render　［ˈrendə(r)］

vt. 给予，提供〈同 provide〉

例 Jeff's law firm renders service to foreign clients only. 杰夫的律师事务所只为国外客户提供服务。

联 rendering n. 表现，描写



* * *



rent　［rent］

n. 租金，租费

例 The rent for Janet's apartment is $700 per month. 珍妮特的公寓每月租金为700美元。

v. 租，出租〈同 lease〉

例 We rented a holiday resort at the seaside. 我们在海边租了一个度假村。

联 rentable adj. 可出租的；rental n. 租金额；租赁，出租



* * *



repetition　［ˌrepəˈtɪʃən］

n. 重复〈同 repeat〉

例 These statements are just repetitions of what was said last year. 这些报告只是在重复去年说过的话。



自我检测


从第二部分中选出最适当的词填入空格内。

13. This apartment ______ for $300 a month.

第三部分

replace　［rɪˈpleɪs］

vt. 取代，替换〈同 change for〉

例 I will replace the cup I broke in the restaurant. 我得把我在餐厅打破的杯子换掉。

联 replacement n. 交换；代替者



* * *



reply　［rɪˈplaɪ］

n. 答复〈同 answer〉

例 We advertised the job but received very few replies. 我们登了招聘广告，但收到的回复非常少。

vi. 答复；回击

例 The enemy replied to the attack with heavy gunfire. 敌人用猛烈的炮火进行还击。



* * *



represent　［ˌreprɪˈzent］

vt. 代表；描绘，表现〈同 stand for; depict〉

例 The 50 stars on the flag of the United States represent the 50 states. 美国国旗上的50颗星星代表50个州。

联 representation n. 表示，表现



* * *



representative　［ˌreprɪˈzentətɪv］

n. 代表〈同 delegate〉

例 The tiger is a representative of the cat family. 老虎是猫科动物的代表。

adj. 典型的，有代表性的〈同 typical〉

例 Are your opinions representative of all the workers here? 你能代表这里所有工人的意见吗？



* * *



request　［rɪˈkwest］

n./vt. 请求，要求

例 She requested a loan from the bank. 她向银行申请了贷款。



* * *



require　［rɪˈkwaɪə(r)］

vt. 需要，要求〈同 request〉

例 The university requires that all students live on campus. 大学要求所有学生住校。

联 requirement n. 需求，要求



* * *



rescue　［ˈreskjuː］



n./vt. 援救，救援〈同 salvage; save〉

例 The firefighter rescued six people from the burning building. 消防员从那栋失火的建筑中救出了六个人。



* * *



resemble　［rɪˈzembəl］

vt. 像，类似〈同 take after〉

例 Kathy resembles her mother more than her sister does. 凯茜比她姐姐更像她妈妈。

联 resemblance n. 相似，酷似



* * *



reserve　［rɪˈzɜːv］

vt. 储备；保留，预定〈同 keep〉

例 These seats are reserved for the elderly and women with babies. 这些座位是留给老年人和带小孩的妇女的。

联 reservation n. 保留；（旅馆房间等的）预定，预约



* * *



reservoir　［ˈrezəvwɑː(r)］

n. 水库，蓄水池〈同 receptacle〉

例 The big storms in August refilled the reservoirs. 八月份的暴风雨再次把水库蓄满了。

第四部分

resident　［ˈrezɪdənt］

n. 居民〈同 inhabitant〉

例 The state college offered lower tuition to the residents of the state. 这所州立学院向本州居民收取较低的学费。

联 residence n. 居住；住处



* * *



resign　［rɪˈzaɪn］

v. 辞职〈同 quit〉

例 He resigned from this company in order to take a more challenging job. 他从这家公司辞职，目的是想找一份更具有挑战性的工作。

记 re + sign（签字)→再次签字→辞职

联 resignation n. 辞职；辞职书



* * *



resist　［rɪˈzɪst］

v. ① 抵抗〈同 act against〉

例 The soldiers resisted the enemy's attack for two days. 士兵们抵御敌人的进攻已有两天时间。

② 不受影响；抗，耐〈同 withstand〉

例 A healthy body resists disease. 健康的身体能抵御疾病。

联 resistant adj. 抵抗的，有抵抗力的；resistance n. 反抗；抵抗力，阻力



* * *



resolve　［rɪˈzɒlv］

vt. ① 决定〈同 determine〉

例 She resolved that she would never speak to him again. 她决定再也不跟他说话了。

② 解决〈同 settle〉

例 The letter resolved our doubts. 这封信消除了我们的怀疑。



* * *



resort　［rɪˈzɔːt］

v. ① 求助于（to）〈同 turn for help〉

例 The parents resorted to punishment to make the child obey. 那对父母通过惩罚的方式让孩子听话。

② 常去（to）〈同 often go〉

例 Many people resort to the beaches in hot weather. 许多人在炎热的天气里去海边避暑。



* * *



resource　［rɪˈsɔːs; (US)ˈrɪːsɔːrs］

n. 资源，财力；办法，智谋〈同 materials; abilities〉

例 Climbing a tree is a cat's resource when chased by a dog. 在被狗追逐的时候，猫的对策是爬树。

联 resourceful adj. 资源丰富的；足智多谋的；resourcefulness n. 足智多谋



* * *



respective　［rɪˈspektɪv］

adj. 分别的，各自的〈同 individual〉

例 The applicants received respective interviews. 申请人分别接受了面试。

记 re（重复）+ spect（看）+ ive→一个一个看→分别的

联 respectively adv. 分别地，各个地



* * *



respond　［rɪˈspɒnd］

vi. 回答，反应（to）〈同 react to〉

例 Please respond to this offer by Friday. 请在周五之前对邀请作出答复。

联 response n. 回答，反应



* * *



responsible　［rɪˈspɒnsəbəl］

adj. ① 有责任的〈同 accountable〉

例 Your foolishness is responsible for the failure of your project. 你的愚蠢是项目失败的原因。

② 负责的；可依赖的〈同 trustworthy〉

例 Choose a responsible person to take care of the money. 挑选一个负责任的人来保管这些钱。

记 re（回）+ spons（许诺）+ ible→对许诺有回应→负责的

联 responsibility n. 责任，职责；irresponsible adj. 不负责任的，不可靠的



* * *



restless　［ˈrestləs］



adj. 焦躁不安的；不静止的〈同 uneasy〉

例 The dog seemed restless as if it sensed some danger. 狗似乎有些焦躁不安，它好像察觉到了什么危险。

Lesson 23




音频



预备测验



找出与句子中划线单词意义最相近的词。

1. After a long lunch hour, business resumes as usual.

(A) responds

(B) delays

(C) continues

2. During the Civil War, steamboating（汽船，轮船）on the lower Mississippi River was ruined.

(A) delayed

(B) taxed

(C) destroyed

3. Rival traditions of acting have coexisted in Western theaters since antiquity.

(A) Competitive

(B) Rudimentary

(C) Myriad

4. Although air travel has some risks, statistically it is much safer than any other means of mass transportation.

(A) downturns

(B) opponents

(C) dangers

5. Amphibians（两栖动物）have moist, scaleless skin that may be either soft and smooth or rough and gritty.

(A) slick

(B) coarse

(C) flabby





第一部分

restore　［rɪˈstɔː(r)］

vt. 使恢复；整修，修复〈同 reinstate; renovate〉

例 The patient was soon restored to health. 那位病人很快就恢复健康了。

联 restoration n. 恢复；翻新



* * *



restrain　［rɪˈstreɪn］

vt. 克制，抑制〈同 inhibit〉

例 I was so angry that I could hardly restrain myself. 我太生气了，几乎无法控制自己。

记 re（重新）+strain（拉紧)→重新拉紧→克制

联 unrestrained adj. 无限制的；restraint n. 克制；抑制



* * *



resume



[ˈrezjumeɪ] n. 摘要，概略；〈美〉履历〈同 summary〉

例 Applicants for this job are required to submit a resume of their education and job experience. 申请这份工作的求职者需要提交一份简历，其中应包括教育背景与工作经历。

[rɪˈzjuːm] v. 继续；重新开始〈同 continue〉

例 They will resume their quarrel after the interferer leaves. 等劝和的人走了之后，他们又会继续争吵。



* * *



retain　［rɪˈteɪn］

vt. 保持，保留〈同 keep〉

例 In the United States, most married women do not retain their maiden names. 在美国，大多数已婚女性不再保留她们婚前的姓氏。



* * *



retire　［rɪˈtaɪə(r)］

vi. 退休，引退

例 Our teachers retire at 65. 我们的老师在65岁退休。

联 retirement n. 退休



* * *



retreat　［rɪˈtriːt］

n./vi. 撤退，退却〈同 receding; withdraw〉

例 After a hard struggle, they were finally forced to retreat. 经过艰苦的战斗，他们最终被迫撤退。



* * *



reveal　［rɪˈviːl］

vt. 展现；揭露〈同 expose〉

例 Their smuggling was discovered and revealed to the public. 他们的走私行为被发现并公之于众了。

联 revelation n. 显示，揭露



* * *



reverse　［rɪˈvɜːs］

vt. 颠倒，翻转；推翻〈同 overturn〉

例 The Supreme Court can reverse the decision of any lower court. 最高法院可以推翻任何下级法院的判决。

n. 背面〈同 back〉

例 His name is on the reverse of the medal. 他的名字在奖牌的背面。

联 reversible adj. 可逆的



* * *



review　［rɪˈvjuː］

vt. ① 回顾；复习〈同 study again〉

例 Review today's lesson for tomorrow's exercises. 复习今天的课，为明天的练习作准备。

② 评论〈同 comment〉

例 I only go to see films that are reviewed favorably. 我只去看获得好评的电影。



* * *



revise　［rɪˈvaɪz］

vt. 修改，修订〈同 amend〉

例 Following their professor's suggestions, the student revised his paper carefully. 那个学生根据教授的建议仔细修改了论文。

联 revision n. 修订，校订



自我检测


从第一部分中选出最适当的词填入空格内。

6. The enemy ______ before the advance of our soldiers.

7. Now that you have a job and I don't, our situations are ______.

8. The medicine ______ Anne's health.

9. She has ______ her essay to make it read better.

10. She took a break from her work to make herself some coffee and then ______ a few minutes later.

11. Before the examinations we have a ______ of the term's work.





第二部分

revolt　［rɪˈvəʊlt］

n./v. 反抗，起义；反叛〈同 resist〉

例 The people revolted against the dictator. 人们反抗独裁者的统治。



* * *



reward　［rɪˈwɔːd］

n. 报酬，奖金〈同 prize〉

例 She got a percentage of the profits in reward for having thought of the original idea. 她获得了一定比例的收益，作为对她提出的最初构想的报酬。

vt. 酬劳，奖赏

例 He was rewarded for his years of service to the company with a grand farewell party. 公司举办了盛大的欢送会，奖励他多年来为公司所作的贡献。



* * *



rhythm　［ˈrɪðəm］

n. 节奏，韵律〈同 beat〉

例 The rhythm of the rain hitting the roof put him to sleep. 他在雨点落在屋顶上发出的有节奏的声响中睡着了。

联 rhythmic adj.（=rhythmical）有节奏的，有韵律的



* * *



ribbon　［ˈrɪbən］

n. 缎带；带状物，带子

例 The flag was torn to ribbons by the severe windstorm. 旗子被猛烈的暴风撕成了碎条。



* * *



ridge　［rɪʤ］



n. 脊；山脊

例 A bald eagle stood on the ridge of the tall office building. 高耸的办公大楼的屋脊上站着一只秃鹰。



* * *



ridiculous　［rɪˈdɪkjʊləs］

adj. 荒唐的，可笑的〈同 ludicrous〉

例 It is ridiculous to become angry about such an insignificant matter. 为这样一件无关紧要的事情生气，真是可笑。

记 rid（笑）+ ic + ulous（多…的）→多笑的→可笑的

联 ridicule v. 嘲笑



* * *



rigid　［ˈrɪʤɪd］

adj. ① 坚硬的，不易变曲的〈同 stiff〉

例 My wet socks froze and became rigid. 我的湿袜子结冰了，变得非常坚硬。

② 严格的〈同 strict〉

例 The teacher was very rigid in his ideas about class attendance. 这位老师在课堂出勤率的问题上非常严格。

联 rigidly adv. 坚硬地；严格地



* * *



ripe　［raɪp］

adj. ① 熟的，成熟的

例 The farmer harvested the ripe grain. 农民收获了成熟的谷物。

② 时机成熟的〈同 full-blown〉

例 The time is ripe to invest in new technology. 投资新技术的时机已经成熟。

联 ripen v.（使）成熟



* * *



risk　［rɪsk］

n. 危险 vt. 冒…的危险〈同 danger; endanger〉

例 Fire-fighters risk their lives many a time. 消防员许多次都冒着生命危险。

联 risky adj. 危险的



* * *



rival　［ˈraɪvəl］

vt. 比得上，与…相匹敌

例 Thomas Jefferson's achievements as an architect rival his contributions as a politician. 托马斯·杰斐逊作为一名建筑师所取得的成就，与作为一名政治家所作的贡献不相上下。

adj. 竞争的〈同 competitive〉

例 The rival supermarkets both cut their prices to attract customers. 两家相互竞争的超市均通过降价来吸引顾客。

n. 竞争者；匹敌者〈同 competitor〉

例 The two managers were rivals for the same position. 两位经理是争夺同一个职位的竞争者。

联 rivalry n. 竞争；敌对状态

13. It's ______ to expect a two-year-old kid to be able to read.

14. When studying for exams, I kept to a ______ schedule.

15. If you drive carefully, there is no ______ of being fined.

16. Betty's academic background will ______ any successful business-woman's after she gets an MBA degree.

17. Many girls like to beautify themselves by wearing ______ in their hair.





第三部分

roar　［rɔː(r)］

v. 吼，轰鸣〈同 bellow〉

例 The wind roared at the windows. 狂风在窗外咆哮。



* * *



roast　［rəʊst］

vt. 烤，烘〈同 bake〉

例 Chocolate is prepared by a complex process of cleaning, blending, and roasting cocoa beans, which must be ground and mixed with sugar. 巧克力的制作是一个非常复杂的过程，其中包括清洗、混合和烘焙可可豆，而且可可豆必须经过研磨，并与糖混合。



* * *



role　［rəʊl］

n. 角色；任务〈同 part; function〉

例 She played the leading role in the school play. 她在校园剧里饰演主角。



* * *



roll　［rəʊl］

v. 滚动〈同 turn〉

例 The ball rolled away. 球滚走了。

n.（一）卷，卷形物

例 The huge dog had rolls of fat along its neck. 那只大狗的脖子上有一圈圈的肥肉。

联 rock and roll 摇滚乐



* * *



romantic　［rəˈmæntɪk］



adj. 传奇式的；浪漫的

例 The old couple reminisced about the days of their courtship, when they were young and romantic. 这对老夫妇回忆起他们恋爱的日子，那时候的他们既年轻又浪漫。

联 romanticism n. 浪漫精神，浪漫主义



* * *



rotate　［rəʊˈteɪt; (US)ˈrəʊteɪt］

v. ① 轮流〈同 alternate〉

例 The officials will rotate as chairman. 官员们将轮流担任主席。

②（使）旋转〈同 revolve〉

例 Wheels rotate as the wagon is proceeding. 四轮马车向前驶去，车轮不断转动。

联 rotation n. 旋转



* * *



rotten　［ˈrɒtən］

adj. 腐烂的，恶臭的〈同 decayed〉

例 Rotten eggs smell just terrible. 臭鸡蛋闻起来太糟糕了。



* * *



rough　［rʌf］

adj. 粗糙的；不平的〈同 coarse〉

例 My feet ached when I walked on the rough road. 在崎岖不平的路上走时我的脚会疼。

联 roughly adv. 粗略地



* * *



rouse　［raʊz］

v. ① 唤醒〈同 wake up〉

例 I was roused by the ring of the telephone. 我被电话铃声吵醒了。

② 激起〈同 stir up〉

例 She was roused to anger by the insult. 她被那种侮辱激怒了。



* * *



routine　［ruːˈtiːn］

n. 常规，惯例〈同 convention〉

例 Getting up and going to bed are part of everyone's daily routine. 起床和睡觉是每个人日常生活中的两个部分。

adj. 常规的，日常的〈同 regular〉

例 The workers did their routine tasks in silence. 工人们安静地做着自己的日常工作。

联 routinely adv. 例行公事地；经常地

第四部分

royal　［ˈrɔɪəl］

adj. 王室的，皇家的

例 The brave knight was honored with an invitation to the royal castle. 那位勇敢的骑士很荣幸地获得了进入皇家城堡的邀请函。

联 royalty n. 皇室；王权；版权



* * *



rub　［rʌb］

v. 擦，摩擦

例 Rub your hands to warm them. 搓一搓，让手暖和起来。

联 rubber n. 橡皮，橡胶



* * *



ruin　［ˈruːɪn］

v. 破坏，毁灭〈同 destroy〉

例 There was a flash flood, and the dam was ruined. 洪水爆发，冲毁了大坝。

联 ruins n. 废墟，遗迹



* * *



rumor　［ˈruːmə(r)］

n. 流言，谣言，传闻

例 The rumor spread that a new school would be built here. 有传言说这里将建一所新学校。



* * *



rural　［ˈrʊərəl］

adj. 农村的，乡下的，田园的〈同 country〉

例 Tired of the big city, the writer moved to a quiet rural town. 那位作家厌倦了大城市的生活，于是搬到了一个宁静的乡村小镇上去。



* * *



sack　［sæk］



n.（一）袋；麻袋〈同 bag〉

例 Clutched in the guard's hands was a sack full of rubbish. 保安手里抓着的是一个装满垃圾的麻袋。

联 haversack n. 背包，干粮袋



* * *



sacrifice　［ˈsækrɪfaɪs］

n./v. 牺牲，献身

例 He sacrificed his life trying to save the children from the burning house. 为了从着火的房子里救出孩子们，他牺牲了自己的生命。



* * *



saddle　［ˈsædəl］

n. 鞍子，马鞍

例 Anne put the saddle on the horse's back and rode away. 安妮把马鞍放在马背上，然后骑上马走了。



* * *



sail　［seɪl］

n. 帆；篷

例 Sails were traditionally made of canvas, but now they are usually made of synthetic material. 传统的船帆是用帆布制成的，但现在则通常用合成材料制成。

v. 航行〈同 travel〉

例 As the ship sailed by, everyone on deck waved. 当船驶过的时候，甲板上的所有人都挥手致意。

联 sailboat n. 帆船；sailor n. 海员，水手



* * *



sample　［ˈsɑːmpəl; (US)ˈsæmpəl］

n. 范例，样品〈同 example〉

例 There was a free sample of shampoo attached to the front of the magazine. 杂志封面上附有一份免费的洗发水小样。

Lesson 24




音频



预备测验



找出与句子中划线单词意义最相近的词。

1. Migrating wild geese scan the ground for possible danger before they land.

(A) survey

(B) strip

(C) smell

2. What is the scope of your undertaking？

(A) respect

(B) purpose

(C) extent

3. A blizzard is a severe snowstorm.

(A) light

(B) pleasant

(C) harsh

4. Wheat flour was scarce during the war.

(A) complex

(B) strong

(C) rare

5. I can jog a few miles, but the Boston Marathon is certainly beyond my scope.

(A) view

(B) opportunity

(C) range





第一部分

sandwich　［ˈsænwɪʤ; ˈsænwɪtʃ］



n. 夹心面包，三明治

例 Mary ate a jelly sandwich for lunch. 玛丽午餐吃了一个果冻三明治。

vt. 夹入中间

例 He was sandwiched between two large boxes on the seat. 他被夹在座位上的两个大箱子中间。



* * *



sausage　［ˈsɒsɪʤ; (US)ˈsɔːsɪʤ］

n. 香肠，腊肠

例 David fried some sausages for dinner. 戴维煎了一些香肠做晚餐。



* * *



scale　［skeɪl］

vt. 攀登〈同 climb〉

例 Monica scaled the ladder and painted her house. 莫妮卡爬上梯子，粉刷了她的房子。

n. 等级；刻度；规模〈同 level; scope〉

例 A large-scale price deduction will be made around the Christmas season. 圣诞节期间将进行大规模减价。



* * *



scan　［skæn］

vt. 扫描；细看，审视〈同 survey〉

例 John scanned the reading assignment briefly before class. 约翰在上课之前大体浏览了一遍阅读作业。

联 scanner n. 扫描器



* * *



scarce　［skɛəs］

adj. 缺乏的，稀有的，罕见的〈同 rare〉

例 Chromium is a comparatively scarce element, occurring in nature only in compounds. 铬是一种相对稀有的元素，在自然状态下只会出现在化合物中。

记 注意不要和scare（惊恐）相混

联 scarcely adv. 几乎不，简直没有；scarcity n. 缺乏，不足



* * *



scare　［skɛə(r)］

v. 惊吓，（使）受惊〈同 frighten〉

例 Courageous people can't be scared easily. 勇敢的人们不会轻易被吓倒。



* * *



scatter　［ˈskætə(r)］

v. 分散，扩散〈同 spread〉

例 If you scatter salt on the sidewalk, it will melt the ice. 如果你在人行道上撒些盐，就能融化冰。



* * *



scenery　［ˈsiːnəri］

n. 风景，景色〈同 landscape〉

例 She enjoys mountain scenery very much. 她非常喜欢山上的风景。

联 scenic adj. 景色优美的



* * *



schedule　［ˈʃedjuːl; (US)ˈskeʤʊl］

n. 时间表；计划表〈同 timetable〉

例 On the airline schedule, I saw that there was a flight to Osaka at seven o'clock. 在航班时刻表上，我看到有一班7点钟飞往大阪的飞机。

vt. 预定，安排〈同 arrange〉

例 Flight 220 is scheduled to arrive at 10:30 p.m. 220航班预计抵达时间为晚上10:30。

联 reschedule v. 重新计划，重订…的时间表



* * *



scheme　［skiːm］

n. ① 方案〈同 design〉

例 There's a new scheme in our town for recycling plastic bottles. 我们城市有一个回收塑料瓶的新方案。

② 阴谋〈同 plot〉

例 They have a scheme to bring the jewels into the country without paying duty. 他们有一个阴谋，想不交税，偷偷把珠宝带进这个国家。



自我检测


从第一部分中选出最适当的词填入空格内。

6. You should ______ every word in the contract before you sign it.

7. The pay ______ for this job ranges from $18,000 to $30,000 a year.

8. He has a ______ for extracting salt from seawater.

9. The ______ includes a moonlit garden.

10. The crowd ______ when it began to rain heavily.

11. A train timetable is a ______ of the coming and going of trains.





第二部分

scholar　［ˈskɒlə(r)］

n. 学者

例 The professor was a famous scholar. 那名教授是一位非常著名的学者。

联 scholarly adj. 学者气质的；scholarship n. 奖学金



* * *



scissors　［ˈsɪzəz］



n. 剪刀

例 These scissors are rather blunt—I'll have to get them sharpened. 这把剪刀非常钝——我得把它们磨得锋利一些。



* * *



scope　［skəʊp］

n. 范围，界限〈同 range, extent〉

例 This objective is beyond the scope of our project. 这个目标超出了我们项目的范围。

联 microscope n. 显微镜；telescope n. 望远镜



* * *



score　［skɔː(r)］

n. ① 分数，得分

例 He had a nearly perfect score on the history exam. 他历史考试几乎满分。

② 乐谱〈同 musical compositions〉

例 How can someone be a conductor if he can't read the score? 如果一个人看不懂乐谱，怎么可能成为一名指挥家？

v. 记分

例 She scored five points for our team. 她为我们队得了五分。



* * *



scout　［skaʊt］

n. 侦察；侦察员；侦察机〈同 spy〉

例 The scout spied on the village during the night. 侦察机夜间在那个村庄上空侦查。

vt. 侦察；搜索〈同 probe〉

例 The policemen scouted the whole city for the robber. 保安人员全城搜索抢劫犯。



* * *



scrape　［skreɪp］

vt. 刮掉，擦掉〈同 rub against〉

例 He drove too close to the wall and scraped his car. 他开车时离墙太近，结果把车刮坏了。



* * *



scratch　［skrætʃ］

v. 搔，抓，擦〈同 scrape〉

例 The cat scratched the piano leg with its claw. 猫用爪子抓钢琴腿。

n. 划痕

例 There are scratches on my arm where my cat clawed me. 我胳膊上有些抓痕，那是我的猫用爪子抓的。



* * *



screw　［skruː］

n. 螺旋，螺丝

例 He loosens a screw with a screwdriver. 他用螺丝刀松开了一个螺丝。

v. 旋紧，拧紧

例 Screw the lid on the jar. 拧紧罐子上的盖子。

联 screwdriver n. 螺丝刀



* * *



seal　［siːl］

n. 印章，图章

例 The seal of the United States is stamped on important government papers. 美国国徽会被印在重要的政府文件上。

v. 盖章于；密封〈同 mark〉

例 The treaty was signed and sealed by both governments. 该协议由双方政府签字和盖章。



* * *



secondary　［ˈsekəndri; (US)ˈsekənderi］

adj. ① 中级的

例 The proposed reforms include making secondary education compulsory up to the age of 18. 计划进行的改革包括：将中等教育纳入义务教育范围直到学生18岁。

② 次要的，伴随的〈同 subordinate〉

例 Reading fast is secondary to reading well. 读得快比不上读得好。



自我检测


从第二部分中选出最适当的词填入空格内。

12. Go and ______ for firewood for the picnic.

13. He ______ the envelope and put a stamp on it.

14. The cat ______ my hand.

15. I'm afraid that problem is beyond the ______ of my lecture.

16. Currently in that country, funding has not been equally divided between the primary and ______ schools.

17. The child fell and ______ his elbow.





第三部分

secure　［sɪˈkjʊə(r)］

vt. ① 使安全，保卫〈同 anchor〉

例 We secured all of the doors of the lab before leaving. 在离开之前，我们把实验室的所有门都关好了。

② 获得〈同 obtain〉

例 Secure your tickets early. 早点把票弄到手。

adj. 安全的；确定无疑的〈同 safe〉

例 We know in advance that our victory is secure. 我们提前就知道我们必胜无疑。

联 security n. 安全



* * *



semester　［sɪˈmestə(r)］

n. 学期〈同 term〉

例 Many students arrange internships or work-study placements during the second semester. 许多学生在第二学期安排实习或申请勤工俭学。



* * *



senate　［ˈsenət］

n. [S-] 议会；参议院，上院

例 The law has no chance of being passed by the Senate. 这部法律毫无机会被议会通过。

联 senator n. 参议员



* * *



senior　［ˈsiːnɪə(r)］



adj. 年长的；资格较老的；地位较高的〈同 older〉

例 Some senior members of the staff have worked here for more man 20 years. 有些资深的员工已经在这里工作了20多年了。



* * *



sensible　［ˈsensəbəl］

① 明智的，合理的〈同 rational〉

例 His sensible decision greatly promoted our enterprise. 他明智的决定极大地促进了我们公司的发展。

② 可感觉到的，明显的〈同 perceivable〉

例 A sensible trend is that people are using computers more. 一个非常明显的趋势是，人们越来越多地使用计算机。

记 sens（感觉）+ible→可感觉到的

联 sensibility n. 敏感性；感性



* * *



sensitive　［ˈsensətɪv］

① 灵敏的〈同 delicate〉

例 Dogs are more sensitive to odors than people are. 狗比人对气味更敏感。

② 敏感的，易受影响的〈同 susceptible〉

例 Bob is too sensitive about what people think about him. 鲍勃过于在意人们对他的看法。

记 sens（感觉）+itive→敏感的

联 sensitively adv. 神经过敏地；sensitivity n. 敏感；hypersensitive adj. 非常敏感的；photosensitive adj.【物】感光性的



* * *



sequence　［ˈsiːkwəns］

n. 序列；顺序〈同 progression; order〉

例 Arrange the names in alphabetical sequence. 按字母顺序排列姓名。



* * *



series　［ˈsɪəriːz］

n. 连续；系列〈同 group〉

例 A series of rainy days spoiled their vacation. 连续的雨天让他们的假期泡汤了。



* * *



serious　［ˈsɪərɪəs］

adj. ① 严肃的，认真的〈同 solemn〉

例 Are you joking or are you serious？你是开玩笑呢，还是认真的？

② 严重的〈同 severe in effect〉

例 It's a serious illness—you can die of it. 这是一种严重的疾病——你可能会因此而丧生。

联 seriously adv. 认真地；庄重地



* * *



session　［ˈseʃən］

n. ① 会议〈同 formal meeting〉

例 The UN Security Council held an emergency session to discuss the crisis. 联合国安理会召开了紧急会议来讨论此次危机。

② 一段时间；一次〈同 a period of time〉

例 There'll be a question-and-answer session at the end of this morning's lecture. 今天上午的演讲结束后，将有一个问答环节。

第四部分

setting　［ˈsetɪŋ］

n. 环境；背景〈同 background〉

例 The villa has a beautiful setting overlooking the sea. 这栋别墅环境优美，可以眺望大海。



* * *



severe　［sɪˈvɪə(r)］

adj. ① 严厉的；严峻的〈同 harsh〉

例 The judge gave the criminal a severe sentence. 法官对罪犯作出了重刑判决。

② 剧烈的〈同 violent〉

例 The weather service issued a severe storm warning for most of Michigan. 气象部门向密歇根州的大部分地区发布了强风暴警告。

联 severity n. 严肃，严重



* * *



shallow　［ˈʃæləʊ］

adj. 浅的〈同 superficial〉

例 The stream was quite shallow so we were able to walk across it. 小溪很浅，所以我们可以步行穿过去。



* * *



shave　［ʃeɪv］

v. 剃；刮脸〈同 cut hair off〉

例 The actor shaved his head in order to portray a bald man. 为了饰演一位秃顶的人，那位演员剃光了头发。



* * *



shear　［ʃɪə(r)］

v. 剪，修剪，剪切〈同 cut〉

例 The farmer taught her how to shear sheep. 农民教她如何剪羊毛。



* * *



shed　［ʃed］

vt. ① 脱落，蜕〈同 fall off〉

例 Deciduous trees shed all or nearly all of their leaves each year. 每年，落叶阔木的所有叶子或者几乎所有叶子都会掉光。

② 流出；散发〈同 give out〉

例 She shed a few tears at her daughter's wedding. 她在女儿的婚礼上流下了眼泪。



* * *



sheet　［ʃiːt］

n. ①（一）片，（一）张，薄片〈同 piece, layer〉



例 The application form has several sheets of paper. 申请表有几页纸。

② 被单，被褥

例 One of the things I like about staying in hotels is that they put clean sheets on the bed every day. 关于住酒店，我比较喜欢的一件事就是他们每天都会换干净的床单。



* * *



shell　［ʃel］

n. 壳〈同 husk〉

例 Oysters, turtles, and beetles all have shells. 牡蛎、乌龟和甲虫都有壳。

联 eggshell n. 蛋壳；shellfish n. 贝类水生动物



* * *



shelter　［ˈʃeltə(r)］

n. 掩蔽处；庇护所〈同 asylum〉

例 Everyone looked for shelter from the blazing sun. 每个人都在寻找阴凉儿以躲避炎炎烈日。

vt. 掩蔽〈同 protect〉

例 The mother bird sheltered her chicks from the cold. 鸟妈妈保护幼鸟不受寒冷的侵袭。

联 sheltered adj. 遮蔽的



* * *



shield　［ʃiːld］

v. 庇护，保护〈同 protect〉

例 Politicians often shield criminals for their self-interest. 政客们经常出于自身利益包庇罪犯。

n. 盾；保护物

例 The shield protects your eyes from damage. 这个护眼罩可以保护你的眼睛不受伤害。

记 要牢记shield的原始意义是“盾”，其他意义都由此引申而来

联 windshield n. 挡风玻璃
