Lesson 25




音频



预备测验



找出与句子中划线单词意义最相近的词。

1. The gar（雀鳝）is a fish with a long, slender body and scales as hard as flint.

(A) flat

(B) straight

(C) slim

2. It is believed that pigs are smarter than dogs.

(A) stronger

(B) cuter

(C) more intelligent

3. Their sole fault was a failure to recognize all the factors involved.

(A) only

(B) usual

(C) maximum

4. The poet shifted his main interest from poetry to history during his career.

(A) transformed

(B) refined

(C) changed

5. If wool is submerged in hot water, it tends to shrink.

(A) smell

(B) contract

(C) fade





第一部分

shift　［ʃɪft］

v. 移动，改变位置或方向〈同 change〉

例 When the wind shifted from south to north, it began to get cold. 当南风变成北风时，天气就开始变冷了。

n. ① 轮班〈同 turn〉

例 She is on the night shift this week. 她这周上夜班。

② 转移；改变〈同 move; change〉

例 The shift in the wind was helpful to the sailors. 风向的变化对水手们很有帮助。

联 shifting adj. 变动的；运动的；shifty adj. 诡诈的，不老实的



* * *



shock　［ʃɒk］

n. 震动，震惊；打击〈同 tremble〉

例 Her mother's death was a great shock. It was so unexpected. 母亲的离世对她是个沉重的打击。一切来得太突然了。

vt. 震惊，激怒〈同 stun〉

例 The news of Anne's accident shocked me. 安妮出车祸的消息让我震惊。

联 shocking adj. 骇人听闻的；shocked adj. 震惊的，震撼的



* * *



shower　［ˈʃaʊə(r)］



n. 阵雨；淋浴

例 Mary turned off the shower and dried herself with a towel. 玛丽关上淋浴，用毛巾把身上擦干。



* * *



shrink　［ʃrɪŋk］

vi. 收缩，缩小〈同 contract〉

例 Because my shirt had shrunk, I gave it to my younger cousin. 我的衬衣缩水了，所以我把它送给了我堂弟。

联 shrinkage n. 收缩



* * *



sideways　［ˈsaɪdweɪz］

adv. 向一旁，向侧面

例 If you would move sideways to the left, I can get everyone in the picture. 如果你往左边移一下，我就能把所有人拍到画面里。



* * *



sigh　［saɪ］

vi. 叹息，叹气

例 James sighed when Ann told him that she would not go to the dance with him. 当安拒绝跟他参加舞会时，詹姆斯叹了一口气。

n. 叹息声

例 The student let out a sigh of relief when he finished the examination. 那个学生考完试之后，松了一口气。



* * *



sightseeing　［ˈsaɪtsiːɪŋ］

n. 观光

例 He went on a sightseeing trip to Rome. 他去罗马观光旅游。



* * *



sign　［saɪn］

n. 标志；符号〈同 indication〉

例 Ancient people viewed comets as signs of evil. 古代人将彗星视为灾难的标志。

v. 签署；签名〈同 write the name〉

例 He signed at the end of the letter. 他在信的结尾署上自己的名字。



* * *



signal　［ˈsɪɡnəl］

n. 信号〈同 sign〉

例 A red light is a signal of danger. 红灯是危险的信号。



* * *



signature　［ˈsɪɡnətʃə(r)］

n. 签名，署名

例 The doctor's signature was difficult to read. 医生写的字很难认。



自我检测


从第一部分中选出最适当的词填入空格内。

6. Earthquakes are caused by ______ layers of earth along faults.

7. My wool sweater ______ when it was washed.

8. The changing color of the leaves on the trees is a ______ that it will soon be autumn.

9. Her death was a great ______ to her family.

10. “￡” is the ______ for the British pound.

11. It's popular in China for people to go to Thailand for ______ trips.





第二部分

significant　［sɪɡˈnɪfɪkənt］

adj. 有意义的；重要的，重大的〈同 noteworthy〉

例 Proper exercise plays a significant role in the rehabilitation of patients with various back ailments. 对于各种背部疾病的患者来说，适当的锻炼对于康复有着至关重要的作用。

记 sign（记号，信号）+ific（带来）+ant→带有信号的→有意义的

联 significantly adv. 意味深长地；值得注目地；significance n. 意义，含义；重要性；insignificant adj. 无关紧要的，可忽略的



* * *



similar　［ˈsɪmələ(r)］

adj. 相似的，类似的〈同 comparable〉

例 I bought some new shoes which are very similar to a pair I had had before. 我买了几双新鞋，与我之前的一双鞋非常类似。



* * *



simplify　［ˈsɪmplɪfaɪ］

vt. 单一化，简单化〈同 make easier〉

例 The college simplified its complex entry requirements. 学院简化了复杂的入学要求。

联 simplicity n. 简易



* * *



sincere　［sɪnˈsɪə(r)］

adj. 诚挚的，真诚的〈同 honest〉

例 He offered a sincere apology for his behavior. 他为自己的行为表达了诚挚的歉意。



* * *



single　［ˈsɪŋɡəl］

adj. 单一的；单身的〈同 only one〉

例 The sisters share one room with two single beds in it. 俩姐妹共用一个放着两张单人床的房间。



* * *



singular　［ˈsɪŋɡjʊlə(r)］

adj. ① 单数的

例 The singular form of “children” is “child”. “children”的单数形式是“child”。

② 显著的，非凡的〈同 unique〉

例 John developed a singular manner for dealing with angry people tactfully. 约翰想出来一种巧妙应对生气的人的奇妙方法。



* * *



sink　［sɪŋk］



v. 沉下，（使）下沉〈同 go down〉

例 The storm sank two fishing boats. 暴风雨造成两艘渔船沉没。

n. 水槽，水池

例 David's dirty dishes piled up in the kitchen sink. 戴维的脏盘子都堆在厨房的水槽里。



* * *



site　［saɪt］

n. 地点，地方〈同 place〉

例 The ambulance rushed to the accident site. 急救车迅速赶往事故现场。



* * *



sketch　［sketʃ］

n. 草图；素描〈同 outline〉

例 My mother made a pencil sketch of my brother reading a book. 我妈妈画了一幅弟弟读书的铅笔素描。

v. 打草稿；素描〈同 draw, delineate〉

例 He sketched out a plan for his inferiors to execute. 他草拟了一个方案，交给下属去执行。

联 sketchy adj. 粗略的



* * *



skim　［skɪm］

v. ① 撇去

例 We made a contest to see who could skim a flat stone over the water the farthest. 我们进行打水漂比赛，看谁的扁平石头在水面上飞的距离最远。

② 略读；掠过

例 I've only skimmed over his letter. I haven't read it carefully yet. 我只是粗略地浏览了一下他的信。我还没有仔细读。



自我检测

14. ______ the cream carefully from the milk.

15. July 4, 1776, is a ______ date for Americans.

16. The ship ______ in deep water in a storm.

17. Paul's appearance is ______ to his brother's.





第三部分

slam　［slæm］

v. ① 砰地关上

例 She slammed the window down. 她“砰”的一声把窗户关上了。

② 猛烈撞击〈同 hit〉

例 That car slammed into a truck. 那辆小汽车猛地撞在一辆卡车上。



* * *



slender　［ˈslendə(r)］

adj. 苗条的；纤细的〈同 slim〉

例 Silkworms digested mulberry leaves and then formed slender threads. 蚕消化桑树叶后吐出蚕丝。

记 注意不要和slander（诽谤）相混

联 slenderize vt. 使苗条



* * *



slice　［slaɪs］

n. 薄片〈同 piece〉

例 Would you like another slice of ham? 你还想再来一片火腿吗？

vt. 切成薄片，切下〈同 cut〉

例 Could you slice me a very thin piece of cake? 你能给我切一片薄薄的蛋糕吗？



* * *



slide　［slaɪd］



v.（使）滑动，（使）滑行〈同 slip〉

例 The drawers slide in and out. 抽屉推进拉出。

n. 幻灯片

例 Slides are put in a projector and shown on a screen. 幻灯片被放在投影仪里，显示在屏幕上。

联 landslide n.【地】山崩



* * *



slight　［slaɪt］

adj. 轻微的；微小的，微不足道的〈同 subtle; tiny〉

例 Since an owl's ears are widely separated, there is usually a slight difference in the time it takes for a sound to reach each ear. 由于猫头鹰的耳朵分开的距离很大，因此一个声音传入它两个耳朵的时间通常存在细微的差异。

记 s+litht（轻微的，不重要的)→微小的

联 slightly adv. 轻微地



* * *



slip　［slɪp］

n. 滑倒；事故

例 John's slip on the floor resulted in a broken leg. 约翰在地板上滑倒了，结果摔断了腿。

v. 滑动；滑倒〈同 slide〉

例 The knife slipped and he cut his finger. 刀子滑了一下，他割伤了自己的手指。

联 slipper n. 拖鞋；slippery adj. 滑的，滑溜的



* * *



slit　［slɪt］

vt. 切开，撕裂〈同 cut〉

例 She slit the envelope open with a knife. 她用刀子割开了信封。



* * *



slope　［sləʊp］

n. 斜坡，斜面〈同 slant〉

例 The floor of the theater has a slope of four feet from the back to the front. 剧院的地面从后往前有一个四英尺的斜坡。

联 sloping adj. 倾斜的，有坡度的



* * *



smart　［smɑːt］

adj. 巧妙的，聪明的〈同 clever〉

例 If you are a smart man, women will like you, even if you are not good-looking. 如果你是个聪明的男人，女人就会喜欢你，即便你长得不帅。



* * *



smooth　［smuːð］

adj. ① 光滑的；平静的〈同 flat〉

例 Her skin was as smooth as silk. 她的肌肤如丝般光滑。

② 顺利的，无问题的〈同 easy〉

例 The bill has all-party support which will ensure it has a smooth passage through Parliament. 这部法案获得了各党派的支持，可以保证它能顺利被议会批准。

联 smoothly adv. 平稳地；顺利地；smoothen vt. 使平滑



自我检测


从第三部分中选出最适当的词填入空格内。

18. The teacher always tells his students that if they want to be ______ they have to listen to him.

19. Mary put a ______ of ham on her sandwich.

20. I ______ the envelope and took out the letter.

21. The car driven by a drunken driver ______ into a tree.

22. This cream will help to keep your skin ______.

23. A pencil is a ______ piece of wood.





第四部分

soak　［səʊk］

v. 浸，泡；浸透〈同 immerge〉

例 Soak the clothes all night before you wash them. 在洗衣服之前，先把它们泡一晚上。



* * *



so-called　［ˌsəʊˈkɔːld］

adj. 所谓的；号称的

例 It was one of his so-called friends who supplied him with the drugs that killed him. 正是由于他的一位所谓的朋友为他提供毒品，才最终致使他丧命。



* * *



soil　［sɔɪl］

n. 土壤，土地

例 The rainstorm washed a lot of soil into the river. 暴雨把大量泥土冲到了河里。



* * *



solar　［ˈsəʊlə(r)］



adj. 太阳的〈同 of the sun〉

例 A solar battery traps sunlight and converts it into electrical energy. 太阳能电池捕捉阳光，并将阳光转换成电能。



* * *



sole　［səʊl］

adj. 单独的，唯一的〈同 only〉

例 His sole purpose for playing cards is to relax. 他打牌的唯一目的是让自己放松。

n. 鞋底〈同 bottom〉

例 Janet wears shoes with rubber soles. 珍妮特穿着橡胶底的鞋子。

联 solely adv. 独自地，单独地



* * *



solemn　［ˈsɒləm］

adj. 严肃的；庄严的，隆重的〈同 serious; sober〉

例 This is a far from solemn book—it is a rich mix of pleasure and information, and is full of surprises. 这完全不是一本严肃的书——里面混杂了各种有趣的事和信息，充满了惊喜。



* * *



soluble　［ˈsɒljʊbəl］

adj. 可溶的，可溶解的〈同 dissolvable〉

例 Salt is soluble in water. 盐可溶于水。

记 solu（溶化）+ble→可溶的

联 insoluble adj. 不能溶解的；solution n. 解决办法



* * *



somewhat　［ˈsʌmwɒt］

adv. 稍微，有点〈同 a bit〉

例 He is a nice boy though somewhat slow. 他是个好男孩，虽然有些迟钝。



* * *



sophisticated　［səˈfɪstɪkeɪtɪd］

adj.（物）复杂的；（人）久经世故的〈同 intricate; experienced〉

例 The diplomat spoke in a sophisticated manner. 外交官说话的方式非常老练。

记 sophist（诡辩者）+icated→久经世故的

联 unsophisticated adj. 不懂世故的，单纯的；sophistication n. 老练；精密；复杂



* * *



sore　［sɔː(r)］

adj. 疼痛的，痛心的〈同 painful〉

例 The suffering of her friend made her heart sore. 她朋友的不幸遭遇让她很心痛。

Lesson 26




音频



预备测验



找出与句子中划线单词意义最相近的词。

1. Coal formation occurs in clearly defined stages.

(A) districts

(B) layers

(C) phases

2. The trumpet（喇叭）was part of the opera orchestra long before it became a standard orchestral instrument.

(A) major

(B) tuneful

(C) normal

3. Soot（烟灰）sticks to anything it touches.

(A) points to

(B) blackens

(C) clings to

4. The osprey（鱼鹰）flies above the water and when it spots a fish it swoops down to catch it.

(A) drops

(B) sees

(C) wants

5. Please help me split the wood.

(A) cut

(B) emulate

(C) haggle





第一部分

sort　［sɔːt］

n. 种类，类别〈同 type〉

例 I like this sort of candy best. 我最喜欢这种糖果。

vt. 分类；挑选〈同 assort〉

例 The clerk sorted the invoices by their dates. 记账员按日期对发票进行分类。



* * *



sound　［saʊnd］



n. 声音

例 Sound travels through air in waves about 1,115 feet（340 meters）per second. 声音以声波形式在空气中传播，速度约为每秒1,115英尺（340米)。

adj. 健全的，健康的；牢固的〈同 in good condition〉

例 His body is very sound considering his age. 就他的年龄而言，他的身体非常健康。



* * *



source　［sɔːs］

n. 源头，来源〈同 beginning〉

例 The newspaper gets news from many sources. 报纸从许多来源获得新闻。



* * *



sow　［saʊ］

v. 播种〈同 plant〉

例 The farmer sowed the field with wheat. 农民在田里播种小麦。



* * *



span　［spæn］

n. 跨度；一段时间〈同 distance; duration〉

例 The span of the bridge is three miles. 这座桥的跨度有三英里。

vt. 跨越〈同 step over〉

例 The old man's life spanned 90 years. 这个老人活了90岁。

联 wingspan n.【空】翼展



* * *



spare　［spɛə(r)］

adj. 多余的，备用的〈同 extra〉

例 Have you got a spare pen? I've left all mine at home. 你有没有多余的钢笔？我把我的全都落在家里了。

v. 节约，节省〈同 save〉

例 The company appears to have spared no expense in designing and building the new shoe store. 公司为了设计和建造新鞋店似乎不惜成本。

联 sparing adj. 节俭的；保守的



* * *



spark　［spɑːk］

n. 火花，火星〈同 flash〉

例 The burning wood threw off sparks. 燃烧的木头溅出火星。

v. 发动，激起〈同 bring about〉

例 The murder sparked off panic among the residents. 这件凶杀案在居民当中引起了恐慌。



* * *



specialize　［ˈspeʃəlaɪz］

v. 专攻；使适应特殊情况；专门从事

例 She's hired a lawyer who specializes in divorce cases. 她雇用了一位擅长离婚案的律师。

联 specialist n. 专家



* * *



specific　［spəˈsɪfɪk］

adj. 具体的，特指的〈同 particular〉

例 Feathers are a feature specific to birds. 羽毛是鸟类专有的特征。

联 specifically adv. 特定地，明确地



* * *



specimen　［ˈspesɪmən］

n. 标本，样品〈同 model, sample〉

例 As a geologist, she collects specimens of all kinds of rocks and minerals. 作为一名地质学家，她收集各种岩石和矿物的样本。

记 spec（看）+imen→给人看的东西→样品

8. Usually, mines are the chief ______ of diamonds.

第二部分

sphere　［sfɪə(r)］

n. 球体；范围；环境〈同 ball〉

例 We usually represent the earth as a sphere in pictures. 我们在图画里经常把地球描绘成球形。

联 spherical adj. 球的，球状的；hemisphere n. 半球；magnetosphere n. 磁气圈；lithosphere n.【地】岩石圈；photosphere n. 光球；hydrosphere n. 水圈；ionosphere n. 电离层；biosphere n. 生命层，生物圈



* * *



spill　［spɪl］

v.（使）溢出，（使）溅出〈同 pour〉

例 The waitress spilled coffee on the customer. 女服务生把咖啡洒在了顾客身上。



* * *



spin　［spɪn］



v. 旋转〈同 rotate〉

例 The top spins round. 陀螺旋转。



* * *



spiritual　［ˈspɪrɪtʃʊəl］

adj. 精神上的

例 After years of living abroad, I feel that China is my true spiritual home. 经过多年的海外生活，我发现中国才是我真正的精神家园。



* * *



splendid　［ˈsplendɪd］

adj. 壮丽的；辉煌的；极好的〈同 brilliant〉

例 The coronation of a new king or queen is a splendid affair, with much elaborate and brilliant ceremony. 新国王或女王的加冕仪式是一件非常精彩的盛事，有许多精心准备的华丽仪式。

联 splendor n. 壮丽；辉煌



* * *



split　［splɪt］

v. 劈开，（使）裂开；分开〈同 cut; divide〉

例 The teacher split the children into three groups. 老师把孩子们分成了三个组。



* * *



spoil　［spɔɪl］

v. ① 损坏；腐烂〈同 go bad〉

例 When milk spoils, it smells very bad. 牛奶一旦变质，会非常难闻。

② 宠坏，溺爱〈同 pamper〉

例 Mary spoiled her children with expensive toys. 玛丽用昂贵的玩具把孩子宠坏了。

联 spoilage n.（食物等）变质；损坏；unspoiled adj. 未损坏的



* * *



sponsor　［ˈspɒnsə(r)］

n. 赞助者

例 All the major theatres now have sponsors, especially for high-cost productions. 现在所有大型剧院都有赞助商，尤其是高成本的作品。

vt. 赞助；资助〈同 support〉

例 The team is sponsored by JVC, so the players wear the letters “JVC” on their shirts. 这个团队得到了JVC公司的赞助，所以演员们都穿着印有JVC字母的衬衫。



* * *



spot　［spɒt］

n. 地点，场所〈同 site〉

例 This looks like a nice spot for a picnic. 这里看起来是个不错的野餐地点。

v. 发觉，发现〈同 detect〉

例 The policeman spotted that I hadn't got my seat belt on and signaled me to stop. 警察发现我没有系安全带，用动作示意我停车。

联 spotless adj. 没有污点的



* * *



spray　［spreɪ］

n. 喷雾，飞沫

例 Can you feel the spray from the waterfall? 你能感觉到瀑布的水雾吗？

vt. 向…喷射，喷〈同 sprinkle〉

例 John sprayed insect poison on the plants. 约翰往植物上喷洒杀虫剂。

第三部分

spring　［sprɪŋ］

n. 泉；弹簧

例 This bottled water comes from a spring in Wisconsin. 这瓶纯净水是来自威斯康星州的泉水。

vi. 跳，跃起〈同 jump〉

例 The waiting tiger sprang at its prey. 等待时机的老虎猛地扑向猎物。

联 springwater n. 泉水



* * *



spur　［spɜː(r)］

n. 踢马刺

例 Dave drove his spurs into the sides of his horse to make it go faster. 戴夫用踢马刺刺马的两侧，让它跑得更快点。

vt. 刺激，鞭策〈同 stimulate〉

例 James is content with his success, but his wife keeps spurring him onto something “higher” or “better”. 詹姆斯满足于自己的成功，而他的妻子却不断激励他要追求“更高”或“更好”。

记 spur的原意是踢马刺，用于刺马或驱马前进



* * *



squeeze　［skwiːz］

vt. 榨；挤进，塞进〈同 extract〉

例 Anne squeezed the orange to make orange juice. 安妮用力挤橘子，来制作橘子汁。



* * *



stable　［ˈsteɪbəl］

adj. 稳定的；相对固定的〈同 fixed〉

例 Don't lean on my desk! It's not stable. 别靠在我的桌子上！这个桌子不稳。

记 sta（站，立）+（a）ble→能站住的→稳定的

联 unstable adj. 不牢固的，不稳定的；stability n. 稳定性；stabilize v. 使稳固；使稳定



* * *



stack　［stæk］

vt. 堆积〈同 pile〉

例 She stacked the dishes in the sink because she did not have time to wash them. 她把盘子都堆在水槽里，因为她没时间洗。

n. 堆

例 He buried himself in a stack of materials, searching for the data needed in support of his arguments. 他埋头在一堆资料里，寻找能支持他的论据的数据资料。



* * *



staff　［stɑːf］

n. 全体职员；工作人员〈同 personnel〉

例 An airport's staff are all the people who work at the airport. 机场的工作人员是指所有在机场工作的人。



* * *



stage　［steɪʤ］



n. ① 舞台

例 The opera singer will return to the London stage this summer. 这位歌剧演唱家将在今年夏天重返伦敦舞台。

② 阶段，时期〈同 period〉

例 Tadpoles are frogs in an early stage of development. 蝌蚪是处于成长初期的青蛙。



* * *



stain　［steɪn］

n. 污点，瑕疵〈同 blemish〉

例 Her one grade C was a stain on her good school report. 她有一门课得了C，这成了她良好学习成绩单上的一个污点。

联 stained adj. 污染的，玷污的；stainless adj. 纯洁的，无瑕疵的



* * *



stake　［steɪk］

n. 赌注

例 He loved gambling and each time he lost he would double his stakes. 他沉迷于赌博，每次输钱后，都会再下双倍的赌注。



* * *



stale　［steɪl］

adj. ① 不新鲜的；走了味的

例 Restaurants with few customers invariably serve stale food since they seldom replenish their stock. 顾客寥寥无几的餐厅总是提供一些不新鲜的食物，因为他们很少补充库存。

② 无趣味的，乏味的

例 They have been working together for over five years and they have both become a little stale. 他们在一起合作超过五年了，两人都感觉有些乏味了。

记 s+tale（故事）→把故事讲死（s）了→无趣味的

第四部分

standard　［ˈstændəd］

n./adj. 标准（的）〈同 criteria; normal〉

例 The employees who didn't meet the company standards were fired. 没达到公司标准的员工被解雇了。

联 standardized adj. 标准化的



* * *



starve　［stɑːv］

vi. 挨饿〈同 hunger〉

例 A lot of people starved to death during the famine. 许多人在饥荒时期饿死了。

联 starvation n. 饥饿；饿死



* * *



statue　［ˈstætjuː］

n. 雕像〈同 effigy〉

例 There's a statue of the company's founder in the main lobby. 在大厅里有一座公司创始人的雕像。



* * *



status　［ˈsteɪtəs］

n. 状况；身份，地位〈同 identity〉

例 The success of her book has given her unexpected celebrity status. 她的书大获成功，这使她突然成了名人。



* * *



steady　［ˈstedi］

adj. ① 稳的，牢固的〈同 stable〉

例 His parents were relieved when he got a steady job. 他找到一份稳定的工作后，他的父母如释重负。

② 持续的〈同 consistent〉

例 Senior executives said they needed to show steady improvements of the company's financial condition to reassure the public. 高管人员称，他们需要证明公司财务状况有持续的改善，以打消公众的疑虑。

记 stead（=stand 站）+y→能站牢的→稳的，牢固的



* * *



steak　［steɪk］

n.（供煎、烤等的）肉；牛排

例 I ate a steak at the restaurant. 我在餐厅吃了块牛排。



* * *



steep　［stiːp］

adj. 险峻的，陡峭的〈同 sharp〉

例 It's a steep climb to the top of the mountain, but the view is worth it. 虽然登上山顶的路很陡，但迷人的风景绝对值得上去一看。



* * *



steer　［stɪə(r)］

v. 驾驶，掌舵〈同 drive〉

例 Our garage door isn't very wide and it's quite difficult to steer the car through it. 我们车库的门不宽，要把汽车开进这道门相当困难。

联 steering n. 操纵，掌舵



* * *



stem　［stem］

n.（植物的）茎〈同 stalk〉

例 I grabbed the weeds by their stems and pulled them from the ground. 我抓着野草的茎部，把它们从地里拔了出来。

vi. 来源于；由…造成（from）〈同 arise from〉

例 Hate sometimes stems from envy. 仇恨有时是由嫉妒造成的。



* * *



stick　［stɪk］

n. 棍，棒；手杖〈同 rod〉

例 The children collected sticks and twigs for the fire. 孩子们收集木棍和细枝来生火。

v. ① 粘住，粘贴〈同 cement〉

例 These labels do not stick very well. 这些标签粘得不牢。

② 坚持（to)〈同 cling to〉

例 We have decided to stick to our previous plan. 我们决定坚持之前的计划。

联 sticky adj. 黏的，黏性的

Lesson 27




音频



预备测验



找出与句子中划线单词意义最相近的词。

1. America's first successful strike took place in Philadelphia in 1786.

(A) peace march

(B) prison riot

(C) work stoppage

2. People buy insurance in order to substitute a small, certain, tolerable loss for a large, uncertain, catastrophic one.

(A) provide

(B) return

(C) exchange

3. Hemp, a harsh, stiff fiber, comes from a plant that grows in both hot and mild climates.

(A) sticky

(B) rigid

(C) dense

4. The Rocky Mountains stretch all the way from Mexico to the Arctic.

(A) unite

(B) spread

(C) extend

5. The industrial chemical acetone（丙酮）is used to dissolve many kinds of substances.

(A) stains

(B) residues

(C) materials





第一部分

stiff　［stɪf］

adj. ① 硬的，僵直的〈同 rigid〉

例 The sturdy box was made of stiff cardboard. 那个结实的盒子是用硬纸板做的。

②（态度、举止）拘谨的，呆板的〈同 restrained〉

例 John is shy and seems stiff, but if you get to know him, he is a lot of fun. 约翰很腼腆，看起来有点呆板，但你跟他熟悉之后就会发现他非常有趣。

联 stiffen vt. 使硬，使僵硬



* * *



stimulate　［ˈstɪmjʊleɪt］

vt. 刺激，激励，激发〈同 encourage, motivate〉

例 The government plans to cut taxes in order to stimulate the economy. 政府计划实施减税，以刺激经济。

联 stimulation n. 激励，鼓舞；刺激；stimuli n.（stimulus的复数）刺激



* * *



sting　［stɪŋ］

v. 刺；刺痛〈同 puncture〉

例 She wore gloves when she was gardening to prevent the nettles from stinging her. 她种植花木的时候会戴着手套，以避免被荨麻刺伤。



* * *



stock　［stɒk］

n. ① 库存〈同 storage〉

例 It is now halfway through winter and food stocks are already low. 冬天才过去一半，食物库存量就已经很少了。

② 股票，股份

例 She buys and sells stocks and shares. 她买卖股票和股份。

adj. 普通的〈同 usual〉

例

“Nobody is perfect” is Janet's husband's stock expression for whenever he makes a mistake. “人无完人”是珍妮特的丈夫每次犯错时都会说的话。



* * *



stoop　［stuːp］



v. 弯腰，屈背〈同 bend down〉

例 Bob stooped so he wouldn't bump his head on the low eaves. 鲍勃俯下身，这样才不会被低矮的屋檐撞到头。



* * *



strain　［streɪn］

n. ① 紧张；压力〈同 tension〉

例 The strain of meeting a daily deadline made the columnist very anxious. 每天都会遇到最后期限的压力，这让专栏作家非常紧张。

② 血统；物种〈同 breed〉

例 Scientists have discovered a new strain of virus which may be responsible for the disease. 科学家们发现了一种新的病毒，它可能是造成这种病的罪魁祸首。

vt. 过滤〈同 filter〉

例 Janet strained the particles from the chemical solution. 珍妮特从化学溶液中滤除微粒。



* * *



strap　［stræp］

n. 带，皮带〈同 belt〉

例 Could you help me fasten the strap around my suitcase? 你能帮我系上手提箱上的皮带吗？



* * *



strategy　［ˈstrætəʤi］

n. 策略，战略〈同 policy〉

例 The company will spend $6 million on the development of new products and sales strategies. 公司将投入600万美元，用于开发新产品和制定销售策略。

联 strategic adj. 战略的，战略上的



* * *



strengthen　［ˈstreŋθən］

vt. 加强，巩固〈同 reinforce〉

例 The new constitution will further strengthen the powers of the president. 新章程将进一步加强总裁的权力。



* * *



stress　［stres］

n. 重压，压力〈同 tension〉

例 Many heavy trucks put a lot of stress on the old bridge. 许多辆重型卡车给这座古老的大桥带来了许多压力。

vt. 着重，强调；重读〈同 emphasize〉

例 She has repeatedly stressed that the laboratory's safety standards are the best in the country. 她不断强调，实验室的安全标准在全国是最高的。

从第一部分中选出最适当的词填入空格内。

6. The local shop has a ______ of postcards before Christmas.

7. The history teacher ______ dates too much and didn't teach the children about the causes of events.

8. Their marketing ______ for the product involves obtaining as much free publicity as possible.

9. My neck was ______ from driving all day long.

10. Many of Edith Wharton's best stories were completed under great personal ______.

11. The professor tried to ______ interest in archaeology by taking his students on expeditions.





第二部分

stretch　［stretʃ］

v. 伸展，伸长〈同 extend〉

例 Anne stretched her arms wide and yawned. 安妮伸了伸胳膊，然后打了个哈欠。



* * *



strike　［straɪk］

n. 罢工〈同 walk off the job〉

例 The union settled the strike when the management offered a fair contract. 在管理层提出签订一份公平的契约后，工会才平息了罢工。

v. 撞击；作用于〈同 hit〉

例 The ball struck me in the back. 球打在了我的后背上。

联 striking adj. 显著的，惊人的



* * *



string　［strɪŋ］



n. 细绳，带子

例 The parcel had been damaged in the mail and was held together with string. 包裹在邮寄的过程中已经损坏了，用绳子捆在了一起。

联 strings n. 弦乐器



* * *



strip　［strɪp］

vt. 剥夺；剥掉〈同 deprive〉

例 The vice president was stripped of her authority when the president found out she was a spy. 副总裁被剥夺了职权，因为总裁发现她是一个间谍。

n. 条，带〈同 ribbon〉

例 I used a strip of tape to stick the note to the wall. 我用一条胶带把便条粘在了墙上。



* * *



stripe　［straɪp］

n. 斑纹，条纹〈同 band〉

例 The city worker painted yellow stripes down the middle of the road. 市政工人在马路中间刷上黄色条纹。

联 striped adj. 呈斑纹的，条纹的



* * *



stroke　［strəʊk］

n. 一击〈同 blow〉

例 With one stroke of his ax, the woodchopper cut the pine tree down. 伐木工人一斧头就把松树砍倒了。



* * *



stuff　［stʌf］

n. 材料；东西〈同 things; belongings〉

例 We'll have to carry all our camping stuff when we walk, so only pack essentials. 我们去散步的时候不必带着所有露营装备，所以只带一些必需品就行了。

联 foodstuff n. 食料，食品；stuffed toy bear 填充玩具熊



* * *



style　［staɪl］

n. 风格；时尚；文体〈同 way〉

例 It's difficult to distinguish between the two artists by style since their works are so similar. 从风格上很难区分这两位艺术家，因为他们的作品太相似了。

联 stylized adj. 风格化的；程式化的；stylish adj. 时髦的，流行的



* * *



subject　［ˈsʌbʤekt］

n. ① 题目，主题〈同 topic〉

例 I tried to explain the situation, but he just changed the subject. 我试图解释一下情况，但他却转移了话题。

② 科目，学科〈同 discipline〉

例 My favorite subjects at school were history and geography. 我上学时最喜欢的科目是历史和地理。

adj. 受…影响的；以…为条件的（to)〈同 depending on〉

例 Moving all the books should not take long, subject to there being enough helpers. 搬走所有的书应该用不了多长时间，因为给我们帮忙的人足够多。

联 subjective adj. 主观的；个人的



* * *



submarine　［ˌsʌbməˈriːn; ˈsʌbməriːn］

n. 潜水艇，潜艇

例 Submarines can fire missiles at targets on land. 潜艇可以向陆上目标发射导弹。

adj. 水下的，海底的〈同 underwater〉

例 There are lots of submarine telephone cables under the sea. 海洋中有许多海底电话电缆。

第三部分

submerge　［səbˈmɜːʤ］

v.（使）沉没，淹没〈同 sink〉

例 The coastal city was submerged by the flood. 那个海滨城市被洪水淹没了。

记 sub（下面）+ merge（合并；吞没)→吞没下去→淹没



* * *



submit　［səbˈmɪt］

v. ① 服从〈同 defer〉

例 Employees who refuse to submit to the authority of the boss are usually dismissed. 拒绝服从上司管理的员工通常会被开除。

② 提交，递交〈同 hand in, present〉

例 Applicants for the job are asked to submit their resumes. 这个职位的申请者被要求提交简历。

联 submission n. 屈服；呈交；submissive adj. 顺从的



* * *



subsequent　［ˈsʌbsɪkwənt］

adj. 随后的，后来的〈同 following〉

例 The story will be continued in subsequent issues of the magazine. 这则故事将在随后几期杂志中连载。

记 sub（后面）+ sequ（跟随）+ ent→随后的，后来的

联 subsequently adv. 随后；subsequence n. 结果；随后



* * *



substance　［ˈsʌbstəns］

n. 物质；实质〈同 matter; essence〉

例 Celery contains a valuable chemical substance that helps lower blood pressure. 芹菜中包含一种珍贵的化学物质，有助于降低血压。



* * *



substantial　［səbˈstænʃəl］

adj. 相当的，可观的〈同 large, significant〉

例 The politician won the election by a substantial number of votes. 那位政治家以相当多的票数赢得选举。

联 substantially adv. 相当多地，大大地



* * *



substitute　［ˈsʌbstɪtjuːt; (US)ˈsʌbstɪtuːt］

vt. 代替〈同 replace〉

例 You can substitute vinegar for lemon juice in this recipe, but it does not taste quite as good. 你可以用醋代替这份菜谱中的柠檬汁，但味道尝起来略差一些。

n. 代替者，代替品〈同 replacement〉

例 Vitamin should not be used as a substitute for a healthy diet. 维生素不应该成为健康饮食的代替品。

联 substitution n. 代替；取代作用



* * *



subtraction　［səbˈtrækʃən］



n. 减少；减法〈同 reduction〉

例 The subtraction of a number from a smaller number yields a negative number. 用一个较小的数字减去一个较大的数字会得到负数。

联 subtractive adj. 减去的；负的



* * *



succession　［səkˈseʃən］

n. 系列，连续

例 Manchester scored three goals in quick succession. 曼彻斯特队接连进了三个球。

联 successor n. 继承者；后续的事物；successive adj. 连续的，依次的



* * *



suck　［sʌk］

v. 吸，吮，吸取〈同 absorb〉

例 She was sitting on the grass sucking lemonade through a straw. 她坐在草地上，用吸管喝着柠檬水。



* * *



sufficient　［səˈfɪʃənt］

adj. 足够的，充足的〈同 adequate〉

例 The banks have built up sufficient reserves to cope with the crisis. 为了应对危机，银行已经积累了充足的准备金。

记 来自suffice（v. 足够）；suf（下面）+ fice（做）+ ient→做出来了→足够的

联 sufficiently adv. 十分地，充分地；insufficient adj. 不足的，不够的

第四部分

suitable　［ˈsuːtəbəl; ˈsjuːtəbəl］

adj. 适当的；相配的〈同 appropriate〉

例 My mother doesn't like me wearing short skirts to church because she doesn't think they're suitable. 我妈妈不喜欢我穿短裙去教堂，因为她认为短裙在这样的场合不合适。



* * *



summary　［ˈsʌməri］

n. 摘要，概要〈同 abstract〉

例 The author submitted a summary along with the complete manuscript. 作者提交了完整的原稿以及一份摘要。

联 summarize v. 概述，总结



* * *



sunset　［ˈsʌnset］

n. 日落〈同 sundown〉

例 The fishermen set out at sunset for a night's fishing. 渔民们在日落时出发，进行夜间捕鱼。



* * *



superficial　［ˌsuːpəˈfɪʃəl; ˌsjuːpəˈfɪʃəl］

adj. 肤浅的，表面（上）的〈同 shallow〉

例 His kindness was all superficial. Janet exposed him for what he really was. 他的仁慈都是表面现象。珍妮特揭露了他的真实面目。

记 super（超过）+ fic（做）+ ial→在上面做→表面（上)的

联 superficially adv. 表面上地



* * *



superior　［suːˈpɪərɪə(r); sjuːˈpɪərɪə(r)］

adj. 较高的，上级的；较好的；优秀的

例 We chose her for the job because she was the superior candidate. 我们选择她来从事这份工作，是因为她是候选人中最出色的一位。

记 super（超级）+ ior→比其他的更好的→较好的

联 superiority n. 优越



* * *



supplement　［ˈsʌplɪmənt］

n./vt. 增补，补充〈同 add, complement〉

例 Mary took a second job to supplement her income. 为了增加收入，玛丽找了第二份工作。

联 supplementary adj. 补充的；supplementation n. 增补，补充；supplemental adj. 补足的，追加的



* * *



supreme　［suːˈpriːm; sjuːˈpriːm］

adj.（权力、级别或地位）至高的；最重要的〈同 highest〉

例 The former emperor of China was the supreme ruler of the country. 中国从前的皇帝都是国家的最高统治者。

记 参考 superior（超越的）

联 supremely adv. 无上地，崇高地；supremacy n. 至高无上的权力；supremacist n. 至上主义者；Supreme Court 最高法院



* * *



surface　［ˈsɜːfɪs］

n. 表面，外表；水面

例 A thin film of oil was floating on the surface of the sea. 海面上漂着薄薄的一层油。



* * *



surgery　［ˈsɜːʤəri］



n. 外科；手术

例 The patient underwent eight hours of surgery on his heart. 患者经历了八个小时的心脏手术。

联 surgeon n. 外科医生



* * *



surrender　［səˈrendə(r)］

v. ① 投降〈同 yield〉

例 They would rather die than surrender. 他们宁死不降。

② 交出；放弃〈同 give up〉

例 The drunken driver surrendered his license. 那位酒驾司机被吊销了驾照。

Exercise 1　从第二栏中选出第一栏各词的反义词。

30. ______ subsequent A. frustrate

31. ______ superior B. profound

32. ______ stimulate C. inferior

33. ______ superficial D. prior

35. ______ supreme F. inappropriate


Exercise 2　找出与句子中划线单词意义最相近的词。

Lesson 28




音频



预备测验



找出与句子中划线单词意义最相近的词。

1. Limestone（石灰石）that can be highly polished is termed marble.

(A) substituted for

(B) known as

(C) similar to

2. The grey squirrels in most city parks have become so tame that they will beg for food.

(A) starved

(B) acclimatized

(C) domesticated

3. The Aleutian goose mates for life, but only the female tends the eggs.

(A) lays

(B) cares for

(C) looks at

4. The Klondike Gold Rush of 1896 is still celebrated today in the Yukon territory near Alaska.

(A) region

(B) land

(C) tract

5. Tranquilizers（镇静剂）are often used in the treatment of tension.

(A) stress

(B) headaches

(C) broken bones





第一部分

survey　［ˈsɜːveɪ; səˈveɪ］

n./v. 调查〈同 poll〉

例 The government agency conducted a survey about public health. 政府机构进行了一项关于公众健康的调查。



* * *



survive　［səˈvaɪv］

vi.（人）幸免于难，活下来；（物）耐久〈同 outlive; endure〉

例 The baby was born with a heart problem and only survived for a few hours. 那个孩子出生的时候心脏有问题，只存活了几个小时。

联 survival n. 生存，幸存；survivor n. 生还者；残存物；survivability n. 存活率，生命力



* * *



suspect

[ˈsʌspekt] adj. 令人怀疑的，不可信的〈同 doubtful〉

例 Janet's testimony was suspect and drew the attention of the lawyer. 珍妮特的证词很可疑，引起了律师的注意。

[səˈspekt] vt. 怀疑，猜想〈同 doubt〉

例 No one knows who killed her, but the police suspect her husband. 没有人知道是谁杀了她，不过警方怀疑是她的丈夫。



* * *



suspend　［səˈspend］



vt. ① 吊，悬挂〈同 hang〉

例 When a magnet is freely suspended it becomes a compass. 把一块磁铁随意地悬挂起来，它就会变成一个指南针。

② 延缓；中止〈同 postpone, delay〉

例 The ferry service has been suspended because of bad weather. 由于天气恶劣，摆渡服务中止了。

联 suspender n. 吊裤带；suspense n. 悬念；悬而未决的事情；suspension n. 吊，悬浮；暂停，延迟



* * *



suspicion　［səˈspɪʃən］

n. 怀疑〈同 mistrust〉

例 There is a growing suspicion that the men who were jailed for the bombing were in fact innocent. 越来越多的人怀疑，因爆炸案被捕的那些人实际上是无辜的。

联 suspicious adj. 可疑的



* * *



sustain　［səˈsteɪn］

vt. 维持；支撑〈同 maintain〉

例 The trees could not sustain the attack of the locusts. 树木无法承受蝗虫的袭击。

联 sustained adj. 持续不变的；sustenance n. 食物；生计



* * *



swallow　［ˈswɒləʊ］

v. 吞下，咽下

例 Anne swallowed two vitamins with a glass of water. 安妮用一杯水喝下了两片维生素。

n. 燕子

例 Janet awoke at sunrise with the song of the swallows. 黎明时分，伴随着燕子的歌声，珍妮特从睡梦中醒来。



* * *



sway　［sweɪ］

vi. 摇摆，摇动〈同 swing〉

例 The trees were swaying in the wind. 树木在风中摇摆。

vt. 使转变，说服〈同 persuade〉

例 Herb's speech failed to sway his colleagues into supporting the plan. 赫布的演讲未能说服他的同事们支持这个计划。



* * *



swear　［swɛə(r)］

v. 发誓〈同 vow〉

例 I swear I don't know anything about what happened. 我发誓，我对所发生的事一无所知。



* * *



sweep　［swiːp］

v. ① 清扫，打扫〈同 clean〉

例 I sweep the floor with a broom. 我用扫帚扫地。

② 席卷，扫过〈同 remove〉

例 The army swept over the border, eliminating all resistance. 军队对边境展开猛烈攻击，消灭了所有抵抗力量。

联 sweeping adj. 彻底的，广泛的



自我检测


从第一部分中选出最适当的词填入空格内。

6. What he did has confirmed all my worst ______ about him.

7. Bill ______ and dusted（拂去灰尘）after making a mess.

8. Both sides in the conflict have agreed temporarily to ______ hostilities.

9. The trees were ______ in the wind.

10. China will conduct a ______ about the population.

11. A person should first think how to ______ in society, and then how to make life better.





第二部分

swell　［swel］

vt. 肿胀，膨胀〈同 bulge〉

例 The insect bite made her finger swell. 蚊虫的叮咬让她的手指肿胀起来。

联 swelling n. 肿胀



* * *



swift　［swɪft］

adj. 迅速的，敏捷的〈同 quick〉

例 The swift current carried the raft downstream. 急流带着救生艇顺流而下。

联 swiftness n. 迅速，敏捷；swiftly adv. 很快地；即刻



* * *



swing　［swɪŋ］



v. 摇摆，摆动〈同 sway〉

例 She swung her tennis racket to hit the ball. 她挥动网球拍击球。

联 upswing n./v. 高涨；向上摆动



* * *



symbol　［ˈsɪmbəl］

n. 符号，记号；象征〈同 sign, signal〉

例 The statue outside the court building is considered a symbol of justice. 法院大楼外的雕像被视为正义的象征。

联 symbolism n. 象征主义；符号论；symbolic adj. 象征的，符号的；symbolize v. 象征



* * *



sympathy　［ˈsɪmpəθi］

n. 同情，同情心〈同 compassion〉

例 He appreciated her expression of sympathy. 他非常感谢她表达的同情。

联 sympathize v. 同情，体谅；sympathetic adj. 有同情心的；合意的，赞成的



* * *



synthetic　［sɪnˈθetɪk］

adj. 合成的，人造的〈同 artificial〉

例 During the twentieth century, many synthetic products began to replace natural ones. 在20世纪，许多合成产品开始代替天然产品。

联 synthesize v. 综合，合成



* * *



systematic　［ˌsɪstəˈmætɪk］

adj. 系统的，体系的〈同 ordered, methodical〉

例 Systematic changes in foreign policy have been proposed. 人们提出对外交政策进行系统性改变。



* * *



talent　［ˈtælənt］

n. 才能；天才〈同 skill; gift〉

例 She is a young dancer of great talent. 她是一位很有天赋的年轻舞者。

联 talented adj. 有才能的



* * *



tame　［teɪm］

vt. 驯养，驯服〈同 domesticate〉

例 It is quite difficult to tame wild animals. 驯服野生动物很难。

adj.（指动物）驯服的，温顺的〈同 domesticated, meek〉

例 The monkeys born at the zoo are tame. 在动物园出生的猴子非常温顺。

记 发音像北京话“忒没”→忒没脾气了→驯服的

联 untamed adj. 未驯服的；tameless adj. 无法驯服的



* * *



tap　［tæp］

vt. 开发，利用〈同 utilize〉

例 Western cities in China have expanded their water supplies by tapping even more remote sources. 中国西部城市通过开发更偏远地区的水源来增加供水量。

联 untapped adj. 未使用的



自我检测


从第二部分中选出最适当的词填入空格内。

12. The country has many rich resources that have not been ______.

13. The bee stung her finger and made it ______.

14. Before the advent of ______ fibers, people had to rely entirely on natural products for making fabrics.

15. African elephants are larger, fiercer, and more difficult to ______ than Asian elephants.

16. The strange ______ found in Egyptian tombs have intrigued historians for centuries.

17. His ______ talents were wasted in his boring job.





第三部分

target　［ˈtɑːɡɪt］

n. 目标，对象〈同 object〉

例 The target of the attack was a train station in the center of the city. 袭击的目标是市中心的一个火车站。



* * *



technician　［tekˈnɪʃən］



n. 技术员，技师

例 The technicians tested the elevator after it was installed. 电梯安装完后，技术人员对它进行了检验。



* * *



technique　［tekˈniːk］

n. 技术，技巧，方法〈同 skill, method〉

例 We have developed a new technique for detecting errors in the manufacturing process. 我们开发了一种新技术，用于检测生产过程中的失误。



* * *



tedious　［ˈtiːdɪəs］

adj. 单调乏味的，沉闷的〈同 tiresome〉

例 The tedious lecture bored most of the audience. 沉闷乏味的演讲让大多数听众感到厌烦。

记 ted（厌倦）+ious→让人厌倦的→单调乏味的

联 tedium n. 乏味



* * *



temper　［ˈtempə(r)］

n. 脾气，性情〈同 mood, disposition〉

例 My boss was in a good temper all day today. 我的老板今天一整天心情都很好。

vi. 缓和，调节〈同 modulate〉

例 Anne's harsh words were tempered with a kind smile. 安妮的话语严厉，脸上却带着和蔼的微笑，缓和了气氛。



* * *



temporary　［ˈtemprəri］

adj. 短暂的，暂时的〈同 impermanent〉

例 The temporary worker was soon replaced by a permanent employee. 临时工很快就被永久雇员所代替。

记 tempor（时间）+ary→短时间的→短暂的

联 temporarily adv. 暂时地，临时地



* * *



tempt　［tempt］

vt. 诱惑；吸引〈同 entice〉

例 The chocolate cake tempts the little girl. 巧克力蛋糕吸引着那个小女孩。

联 tempting adj. 诱惑人的；temptation n. 诱惑；诱惑物



* * *



tend　［tend］

v. ① 倾向于

例 It tends to snow a lot in the polar regions. 极地地区往往会下很多雪。

② 照顾，护理〈同 look after〉

例 The nurse gently tended the patient's cuts and bruises. 护士温柔地护理患者的伤口和瘀伤。

联 tendency n. 趋向；癖好



* * *



tender　［ˈtendə(r)］

adj. 嫩的，柔软的；体贴的〈同 gentle〉

例 The tender lobster meat is worth the effort of cracking the hard shell. 柔软的龙虾肉值得费力剥开硬壳。

记 tend（注意，关心)+er→关心的→体贴的

联 tenderness n. 亲切，温柔



* * *



tension　［ˈtenʃən］

n. 紧张（状态)，压力〈同 stress〉

例 You could feel the tension in the room as we waited for our exam results. 我们在等待考试结果的时候，能感受到教室里的紧张气氛。

第四部分

term　［tɜːm］

n. ① 学期

例 Janet has finished her first term at business school. 珍妮特结束了她在商学院的第一个学期。

② 术语〈同 expression〉

例 The term used to describe the Treasury Minister in Great Britain is “the Chancellor”. 曾经用来称呼英国财政部长的术语是“财政大臣”。



* * *



terminal　［ˈtɜːmɪnəl］

n. ① 总站，终点站

例 The bus took the passengers directly to the terminal. 公交车直接将乘客送到了终点站。

②（电脑）终端，接线端

例 I waited in the computer lab for the next available terminal. 我在计算机实验室等着下一个可以使用的终端机。



* * *



territory　［ˈterətəri; (US)ˈterɪtɔːri］

n. 领土，地域〈同 region〉

例 Children's books are a new territory for the publisher. 儿童书籍是出版商关注的一个新领域。

联 territorial adj. 领土的；区域的



* * *



terror　［ˈterə(r)］

n. 恐怖；恐怖的缘由

例 Janet awoke from her nightmare with a feeling of terror. 珍妮特从噩梦中醒来，心里感到一阵恐惧。

联 terrorism n. 恐怖主义；terrorist n. 恐怖分子；terrorize v. 使恐惧；恐吓



* * *



theoretical　［ˌθɪəˈretɪkəl］

adj. 理论上的〈同 academic〉

例 A theoretical possibility is something which could, but is unlikely to, happen according to the known facts. 理论上的可行性是指某件事情能够发生，但根据已知事实不可能发生。

联 theoretically adv. 理论上



* * *



thereby　［ˈðɛəˌbaɪ］

adv. 因此，从而〈同 thus, accordingly〉

例 Diets that are high in saturated fat and cholesterol tend to clog up our arteries, thereby reducing the blood flow to our hearts and brains. 饱和脂肪和胆固醇含量过高的食物，易造成动脉堵塞，进而减少心脏和大脑的供血量。



* * *



thirsty　［ˈθɜːsti］

adj. 口渴的

例 I felt hot and thirsty after hours of walking. 走了几个小时之后，我感觉又热又渴。

联 thirst n. 渴，口渴



* * *



thorough　［ˈθʌrə; (US)ˈθɜːrəʊ］

adj. 完全的，彻底的〈同 complete〉

例 The maid did such a thorough job of cleaning our kitchen that it looked new. 女仆对我们的厨房进行了非常彻底的打扫，厨房看起来就跟新的一样。

联 thoroughly adv. 彻底地



* * *



thoughtful　［ˈθɔːtfʊl］

adj. ① 体贴的，考虑周到的〈同 considerate〉

例 It was thoughtful of you to make all the necessary arrangements for me. 你为我做了所有必要的安排，真是太周到了。

② 有思想性的〈同 pensive〉

例 Andrew Wyeth is famous for his realistic and thoughtful paintings of people and places. 安德鲁•怀斯以其极富思想性的写实主义肖像画和风景画而著名。



* * *



threaten　［ˈθretən］



v. ① 威胁〈同 intimidate〉

例 The man threatened revenge on the police. 这个男人威胁要报复警察。

② 预示…的凶兆；临近，迫近〈同 menace〉

例 When heavy rains threatened, we canceled our picnic. 马上就要下暴雨了，我们取消了野餐。

Lesson 29




音频



预备测验



找出与句子中划线单词意义最相近的词。

1. When a tremendous spark leaps from one part of a thundercloud（雷雨云）to another, it appears as sheet lightning.

(A) bright

(B) disconnected

(C) huge

2. Nineteenth century scholars tried to trace the origins of modern gauges to the ancient Hebrews（希伯来人）.

(A) limit

(B) connect

(C) convert

3. Apple trees need moisture in order to thrive.

(A) yield

(B) flourish

(C) pollinate

4. Oaks are strong, long-lived trees with tough wood.

(A) hard

(B) rough

(C) dark

5. In the Mesozoic period, the upward thrust of great rock masses created the Rocky Mountains and the Alps.

(A) collision

(B) angle

(C) push





第一部分

thrive　［θraɪv］

vi. 繁荣，兴旺；茁壮成长〈同 flourish〉

例 Most plants thrive in sunlight. 大多数植物在阳光下会茁壮成长。

联 thriving adj. 繁荣的；thrive on 在…中旺盛生长



* * *



throat　［θrəʊt］

n. 咽喉，喉咙

例 I drank hot tea because my throat was sore. 我喝了热茶，因为我的嗓子疼。



* * *



throughout　［θruːˈaʊt］

prep. 遍及，贯穿〈同 during〉

例 Someone in the audience was talking throughout the entire movie. 在整部电影放映的过程中，观众里一直有人在说话。



* * *



thrust　［θrʌst］

n. 推力，冲〈同 push〉

例 With a powerful thrust of his foot, the policeman broke open the door. 警察的脚一用力，便把门踹开了。

vt. 冲；插入，用力刺

例 He is strong enough to thrust himself through the locked door. 他非常强壮，可以撞开上锁的门。



* * *



thumb　［θʌm］



n. 拇指

例 The thumb is the short, thick finger of the hand. It can be moved against one of the other four fingers to grasp things. 拇指是手上又短又粗的那个手指。它可以移向其他四个手指里的一个来抓东西。



* * *



thunder　［ˈθʌndə(r)］

n. 雷；雷声

例 The thunder woke me up about midnight when it started to rain. 大约半夜的时候，我被雷声惊醒，这时外面开始下雨。



* * *



tide　［taɪd］

n. 潮汐；潮流〈同 current〉

例 As the tide came in, it destroyed the sandcastle I had built. 潮水涌上来，冲毁了我刚刚堆起的沙堡。

联 tidal adj. 潮汐的；定时涨落的



* * *



tidy　［ˈtaɪdi］

adj. 整洁的，整齐的〈同 neat〉

例 My son is very tidy and never goes out without making his bed. 我儿子非常爱整洁，不整理好床铺绝对不出去。

联 其他表示“整洁的”的词：neat, clean



* * *



tie　［taɪ］

v. 系，扎〈同 fasten〉

例 She tied the ribbon tightly in a knot. 她把丝带紧紧地系成一个结。

联 tie up 阻碍



* * *



tip　［tɪp］

n. ① 顶，尖端〈同 nib〉

例 If I stand on the tips of my toes, I can just reach the top of the cupboard. 如果踮起脚尖，我刚好能够到橱柜的顶部。

② 小费

例 I gave my barber a large tip. 我给了理发师一大笔小费。

联 fingertip n. 指尖；tiptoe n. 脚尖 v. 用脚尖走



自我检测


从第一部分中选出最适当的词填入空格内。

6. I'll ______ the flowers into a bunch for you.

7. There's ______ in the air. I wouldn't be surprised if we had a storm.

8. Industries can't ______ without modern sophisticated technology.

9. He cut the ______ of his finger when he was chopping an onion.

10. Owners of large estates generally keep their property ______ with the help of grounds keepers.

11. People usually pay a 10 percent to 15 percent ______ based on the bill in American restaurants.





第二部分

tissue　［ˈtɪʃuː; ˈtɪsjuː］

n.【生】组织

例 The tissues of the body constitute organs. 人体组织构成了器官。

联 tissular adj. 组织的



* * *



toast　［təʊst］



n. 烤面包（片），吐司面包

例 I've ordered buttered toast and coffee. 我点了黄油土司和咖啡。

v. 烤

例 I like my bread lightly toasted. 我喜欢把面包稍微烤一下。



* * *



toe　［təʊ］

n. 趾，脚趾，足尖

例 My toes are cramped in these narrow shoes. 这双鞋太瘦了，我的脚趾被挤得很痛。

联 toed adj. 有趾的



* * *



tolerant　［ˈtɒlərənt］

adj. 容忍的；宽容的〈同 permissive〉

例 He is not tolerant of other people's opinions; he thinks that he is always right. 他不能容忍其他人的意见；他认为自己永远是正确的。

记 toler（承受，容忍）+ant→容忍的

联 tolerance n. 忍受，宽容；toleration n. 容忍；intolerable adj. 无法忍受的；intolerant adj. 不能包容的



* * *



torture　［ˈtɔːtʃə(r)］

n. 酷刑 vt. 拷打

例 About half of the prisoners died from torture or starvation. 约有一半的囚犯死于酷刑或饥饿。

记 tort（扭）+ ure→扭打，折磨→酷刑



* * *



tough　［tʌf］

adj. ① 坚硬的；坚强的〈同 hard; strong〉

例 These plants are not tough enough to survive outside in the winter. 这些植物不够顽强，在冬季根本无法在室外存活。

② 困难的〈同 difficult〉

例 This math problem is really tough！这道数学题真难！

③ 坚韧的；严格的，严格执行纪律的〈同 rigid〉

例 You have to be tough to be successful in politics. 你得坚忍不拔，才能在政治上取得成功。



* * *



trace　［treɪs］

n. 痕迹〈同 trail〉

例 The cunning fox leaves no trace for the hunters. 狡猾的狐狸没有给猎人留下任何踪迹。

vt. 跟踪；追溯〈同 follow; connect〉

例 The trapper who traced the fox for five consecutive weeks finally captured it. 连续五个星期跟踪狐狸的捕猎者终于抓住了它。



* * *



track　［træk］

n. 轨迹，路；足迹〈同 path〉

例 John didn't wipe his shoes clean, so he left tracks on the rug. 约翰没有把鞋擦干净，所以他在地毯上留下了足迹。

v. 循路而行，追踪〈同 trace〉

例 The policeman tracked the robbers to their lair. 警察跟踪劫匪，找到了他们的老巢。



* * *



tradition　［trəˈdɪʃən］

n. 传统，惯例〈同 convention〉

例 There's a tradition in our office that when it's somebody's birthday, we buy a cake to share. 我们办公室有一个传统，每当有人过生日时，我们都会买一个蛋糕，所有人一起分享。

联 traditional adj. 传统的，惯例的



* * *



traffic　［ˈtræfɪk］

n. 交通

例 Every morning, I try to avoid the rush-hour traffic. 每天早上，我都会尽量避开交通高峰时段。

第三部分

tragedy　［ˈtræʤədi］

n.（戏剧）悲剧；悲惨之事〈同 disaster〉

例 Hamlet and Othello are two Shakespearean tragedies. 《哈姆雷特》与《奥赛罗》是莎士比亚的两部悲剧。

联 tragic adj. 悲惨的，悲剧的



* * *



transfer　［trænsˈfɜː(r)］

v. 转移，转学〈同 shift, distract〉

例 Police are investigating how ￡20 million was illegally transferred out of the Trust's bank account. 警方正在调查2,000万英镑是如何被非法转出托拉斯的银行账户的。



* * *



transform　［trænsˈfɔːm］

vt.（使）变形，改观〈同 change〉

例 Do you really think that you can transform your appearance by wearing your hair differently? 你真的认为，你换个发型就能改变自己的外貌？

记 trans（改变）+ form（形状）→（使）变形

联 transformation n. 转变；变形；transformer n.【电】变压器



* * *



transit　［ˈtrænsɪt］

n. 运输；运输设备〈同 transportation〉

例 Britain imports over 100,000 birds each year, but 20,000 die in transit. 英国每年进口10多万只鸟，但其中有2万只死于运输途中。

联 transistor n.【电子】晶体管；transitional adj. 过渡的



* * *



transmit　［trænzˈmɪt］

v. 传送，传播〈同 forward〉

例 The radio station plans to transmit its broadcasts from a satellite. 广播电台决定通过卫星传输其广播节目。

记 trans（横过）+ mit（送)→送过去→传送

联 transmitter n. 传送者；发送器；transmission n. 播送，传送；neurotransmitter n. 【生化】神经传递素



* * *



transparent　［trænsˈpærənt］

adj. 透明的

例 Quartz may be transparent, translucent, or opaque, and it may be colorless or colored. 石英可能是透明的、半透明的或不透明的，可能是无色的，也可能有颜色。

记 trans（穿过）+ par（平等，一样）+ ent→穿过去看形状一样→透明的



* * *



transport　［trænsˈpɔːt］



v. 运输〈同 carry〉

例 Flying is not always the fastest way to transport passengers to their destination. 飞行并不总是将乘客送达目的地的最快方式。

联 transportation n. 运输，运送



* * *



trap　［træp］

n. 圈套，陷阱〈同 snare〉

例 The hunter set traps to catch rabbits. 猎人设置陷阱来捕捉兔子。

v. 捕捉，困住；陷害〈同 catch〉

例 Scientists have devised methods to trap vapor in bottles so they can study its makeup. 科学家用各种方法将蒸汽收集到瓶子里，以便研究它的成分。

联 trapper n. 设阱捕兽者，猎人



* * *



treatment　［ˈtriːtmənt］

n. ① 待遇，对待〈同 handling〉

例 Peter gets special treatment because he knows the boss. 彼得得到了特殊待遇，因为他认识老板。

② 治疗〈同 care〉

例 Heat treatment certainly helped my knee. 热疗法确实对我的膝盖很有帮助。



* * *



treaty　［ˈtriːti］

n. 条约，谈判〈同 agreement〉

例 The small country broke the treaty four days after signing it. 那个小国在签署条约四天后就违反了条约。

第四部分

tremble　［ˈtrembəl］

n./v. 战栗，颤抖

例 Her bottom lip trembled and tears welled up in her eyes. 她的下嘴唇颤抖着，眼泪夺眶而出。



* * *



tremendous　［trɪˈmendəs］

adj. 巨大的，惊人的〈同 huge, enormous〉

例 The tremendous earthquake in Tangshan made thousands of people homeless. 唐山大地震使成千上万人无家可归。

记 trem（颤抖）+end+ous→让人发抖的→惊人的

联 tremendously adv. 非常地；巨大地



* * *



trend　［trend］

n. 倾向，趋势〈同 tendency〉

例 Although some people work until they are sixty-five, the trend is to retire after thirty years of service. 虽然有些人一直工作到65岁，但大趋势是工作30年后便退休。



* * *



trial　［treɪl］

n. ① 实验〈同 experiment〉

例 Over a very large number of trials, the probability of an event occurring is equal to the probability that it will not occur. 经过大量测试，一个事件发生的概率与其不发生的概率是相等的。

② 审讯

例 The scandal put the President on trial. 丑闻使总统面临审讯。



* * *



trick　［trɪk］

n. 诡计；恶作剧

例 Somebody played a trick on me by hiding my shoes. 有人把我的鞋子藏了起来捉弄我。



* * *



trim　［trɪm］

vt. 修剪，整饰〈同 clip〉

例 The barber trimmed my hair. 理发师给我理发。



* * *



triumph　［ˈtraɪəmf］

n. 胜利〈同 victory〉

例 His career was characterized by one triumph after another. 他做事的特点就是接二连三的胜利。

vi. 获得胜利，成功〈同 win〉

例 The lucky patient triumphed over cancer. 那名幸运的患者战胜了癌症。

联 triumphant adj. 胜利的



* * *



tropical　［ˈtrɒpɪkəl］

adj. 热带的

例 Most bananas are grown on tropical plantations. 大部分香蕉都被种在热带种植园里。



* * *



troublesome　［ˈtrʌbəlsəm］

adj. 讨厌的，麻烦的〈同 annoying〉

例 Her hip has been troublesome for quite a while, and she'll probably need surgery on it. 她的臀部让她烦恼了很久，她可能需要给它做个手术。

联 troubling adj. 令人不安的，令人忧虑的



* * *



twist　［twɪst］



v. 扭弯，扭曲，缠绕〈同 bend〉

例 The visitor twisted his neck to look at the photograph on the wall behind him. 参观者扭过头看他身后墙上的照片。

Lesson 30




音频



预备测验



找出与句子中划线单词意义最相近的词。

1. The representative was asked to verify his earlier statement.

(A) confirm

(B) withdraw

(C) repeat

2. In his novels, Upton Sinclair showed his unique genius for recreating social history.

(A) proven

(B) understandable

(C) peerless

3. Many city dwellers are turning vacant lots into thriving gardens.

(A) costly

(B) empty

(C) small

4. The molecular and structural arrangements of the components in a composite material can vary greatly.

(A) interact

(B) disintegrate

(C) differ

5. The rise and fall of our work efficiency coincides with temperature variations in our body.

(A) changes

(B) differences

(C) alterations





第一部分

typical　［ˈtɪpɪkəl］

adj. 典型的；有代表性的〈同 classic; representative〉

例 This sort of hot and spicy food is very typical of the food in the south of the country. 这种辛辣食品是这个国家南方的典型食品。

记 typ（看作type，类型）+ical→经典的类型→典型的

联 atypical adj. 非典型的；typically adv. 有特色地



* * *



ugly　［ˈʌɡli］

adj. 丑陋的，难看的

例 She's got one of those really ugly dogs with a squashed face. 她有一只那种非常丑陋的狗，狗脸看上去像是被压扁了。



* * *



ultimate　［ˈʌltɪmət］

adj. 最后的，最终的〈同 final〉

例 The ultimate results were not really foreseeable, but we prepared for them as best we could. 最终结果是不可预测的，但我们已经尽可能为此做好了准备。

记 ultim（最远，落后）+ate→最后的

联 ultimately adv. 最后，最终；ultimatum n. 最后通牒



* * *



unconscious　［ʌnˈkɒnʃəs］

adj. 不省人事的；无意识的〈同 senseless〉

例 The doctor tried to revive the unconscious crash victim. 医生努力让那名失去意识的车祸受害者苏醒过来。

记 un（不）+conscious（清醒的）→不省人事的

联 unconsciously adv. 无意中，不知不觉



* * *



undergo　［ˌʌndəˈɡəʊ］

v. 经历，遭受〈同 experience〉

例 Mary told me of the ordeal she underwent during the robbery. 玛丽跟我讲了她在抢劫发生期间所经受的折磨。

记 under（底下）+go（走)→从底下走→遭受



* * *



underline　［ˌʌndəˈlaɪn］

vt. ① 在…下面划线

例 Students prefer to underline important points, and it seemed to be just as useful as note-taking. 学生们喜欢划出要点，这似乎与记笔记一样有用。

② 强调〈同 emphasize〉

例 To underline their disgust, the crowd started throwing bottles at the stage. 为了强调他们的厌恶，人们开始向舞台扔瓶子。



* * *



undertake　［ˌʌndəˈteɪk］

v. 从事，承担〈同 take on, embark on〉

例 The overall task looks forbidding, but the stakes are too high not to undertake it. 从表面上看，整个任务让人望而生畏，但不接受这个任务的风险太大了。

联 undertaking n. 事业，企业



* * *



undoubtedly　［ˌʌnˈdaʊtɪdli］

adv. 毋庸置疑地，确凿地〈同 unquestionably〉

例 The soybean is undoubtedly the king of beans, and is rapidly becoming the most widely utilized bean in the world. 毫无疑问，大豆是豆中之王，并且迅速成为全球使用最广泛的豆类。



* * *



uneasy　［ʌnˈiːzi］

adj. 不安的，忧虑的；不舒服的〈同 worried; upset〉

例 We ate an uneasy supper, saying little, just listening. 我们的晚饭吃得很不舒服，很少说话，只是在听而已。

记 un（不）+easy（舒适的，安心的）→不舒服的

联 unease n. 焦虑，不安



* * *



uniform　［ˈjuːnɪfɔːm］



n. 制服

例 His uniform was covered with medals of valor and rank. 他的制服上挂满了代表勇气和军衔的勋章。

adj. 统一的；始终如一的〈同 unified; consistent〉

例 Traffic laws are similar from one state to the next, but they aren't uniform; each state has its own variations. 各州的交通法基本类似，但并不统一；每个州都有各自的变化。

联 uniformity n. 同样，一致；uniformly adv. 一律地，均一地



自我检测


从第一部分中选出最适当的词填入空格内。

6. She put the figures up on the board to ______ the seriousness of the situation.

7. Her discovery may help to explain how stars form and thus answer some of our questions about the ______ fate of the universe.

8. The strange man on the bus made Bill ______.

9. In 1992, the life expectancy of a ______ American woman was 72.

10. They ______ terrible hardships.

11. The children found it hard to keep their school ______ clean.





第二部分

unique　［jʊˈniːk］

adj. 独一无二的；独特的〈同 peerless; particular〉

例 The letter was written in Anne's unique style. 这封信是按安妮独特的风格写的。

联 uniqueness n. 独特，独一无二



* * *



universal　［ˌjuːnɪˈvɜːsəl］

adj. 普遍的；共同的〈同 comprehensive; all-inclusive〉

例 The desire to be loved is universal. 对被爱的渴望是普遍存在的。

联 universe n. 宇宙；universally adv. 普遍地，到处



* * *



upset　［ʌpˈset］



v. 颠覆，推翻；扰乱〈同 overturn; disturb〉

例 Any mechanical problems would upset our plans of driving across the desert. 任何机械问题都会扰乱我们驾车穿越沙漠的计划。

adj. 心烦意乱的〈同 worried〉

例 Mary was upset because we were going to be late. 玛丽很心烦，因为我们要迟到了。



* * *



urban　［ˈɜːbən］

adj. 城市的〈同 metropolitan〉

例 Urban problems often stretch beyond city limits into suburbs. 都市问题通常会从市区扩展到郊区。

联 urbanism n. 都市生活，都市化；urbanite n. 都市人；suburbanite n. 郊区居民



* * *



urge　［ɜːʤ］

v. 催促；力劝，恳求〈同 entreat〉

例 The teacher urged us to work harder to achieve high scores. 老师督促我们更加努力地学习，以取得好成绩。



* * *



urgent　［ˈɜːʤənt］

adj. 紧急的，迫切的〈同 pressing〉

例 Janet's boss gave her some urgent work that needed to be finished in one hour. 珍妮特的老板给她分配了一些紧急任务，必须在一个小时内完成。

记 来自urge（v. 驱策，催促）+ent→催促着做的→紧急的

联 urgently adv. 迫切地，急切地；urgency n. 紧急情况



* * *



utility　［juːˈtɪləti］

n. ① 运用；效用〈同 function, usefulness〉

例 The utility of the rescue equipment still has to be assessed in a real emergency. 这种救生设备的功用还有待在真正的紧急情况中评定。

② 公用事业公司；公用事业设备

例 The cost of utilities in this building is included in my monthly rent. 这栋大楼的公用事业费用包含在我每月的租金当中。

联 utilitarian adj. 功利的，实利的；utilitarianism n. 功利主义



* * *



utilize　［ˈjuːtəlaɪz］

v. 利用〈同 harness, take advantage of〉

例 Efficient workers utilize time wisely. 有效率的员工会非常明智地利用时间。

记 util（用）+ize→利用

联 utilization n. 利用



* * *



utter　［ˈʌtə(r)］

v. 说出；发表〈同 speak; express〉

例 Not a word was uttered during the thrilling movie. 在看这部惊悚电影的时候，没有人说话。

adj. 全然的，完全的〈同 complete〉

例 There was utter silence in the classroom. 教室里异常安静。

联 utterance n. 说话；说话的方式；utterly adv. 完全地，绝对地



* * *



vacant　［ˈveɪkənt］

adj. 空的，未被占用的〈同 empty〉

例 The neighborhood boys like to play baseball on that vacant lot. 附近的男孩子们喜欢在那片空地上打棒球。

联 vacancy n. 空白，空缺

12. It still ______ Mark when he thinks about the accident.

13. I'd recognize your handwriting anywhere; it's ______.

14. John ______ the knife blade as a screwdriver.

15. Amy parked her car in the ______ lot.

16. The magazine had a special report about ______ crime.

17. She ______ a sigh of relief after the final examination.





第三部分

vacation　［veɪˈkeɪʃən］

n. 度假，休假

例 The director is not here. He's gone on vacation. 主任不在这里。他去度假了。

联 vacate vt. 腾出，空出



* * *



vague　［veɪɡ］

adj. 模糊的；含糊的〈同 imprecise, obscure〉

例 The confusing movie had a rather vague ending. 这部令人迷惑的电影有一个非常含糊的结尾。

联 vagueness n. 暧昧，含糊



* * *



vain　［veɪn］



adj. ① 徒然的〈同 useless〉

例 He made a vain attempt to reach the drowning woman. 他尝试接近那名溺水的女士，结果徒劳无功。

② 自负的；爱虚荣的〈同 conceited〉

例 The vain man spent a lot of money on the latest fashions. 那个虚荣的人花了许多钱来购买最新款的时装。



* * *



valid　［ˈvælɪd］

adj. 有效的；有根据的，正确的〈同 sound〉

例 This coupon is valid until the end of the month. 这张优惠券的有效期至月底。

记 val（强大；值得）+id→值得做的→有效的

联 validity n. 有效性，合法性；validate vt. 使生效，确认，证实；invalid adj. 无效的



* * *



valuable　［ˈvæljʊəbəl］

adj. 贵重的；颇有价值的〈同 expensive〉

例 Anne wore a valuable diamond ring to the party. 安妮戴着一枚贵重的钻石戒指去参加聚会。

联 valuables n. 贵重物品



* * *



vanish　［ˈvænɪʃ］

vi. 消失；灭绝〈同 disappear; die out〉

例 Dinosaurs vanished from the earth at the end of the Mesozoic Era. 中生代末期，恐龙从地球上消失了。



* * *



variable　［ˈvɛərɪəbəl］

n.【数】变数，变量〈同 factor〉

例 The variables of the laboratories doing the testing mean that the results cannot be relied on. 实验室做实验时的变量表明，实验结果并不可靠。

adj. 可变的，易变的〈同 changeable〉

例 He soon learned that the moods of a young girl—happy one moment, miserable the next—can be as variable as the winds. 他很快就知道了，少女的情绪就像风一样易变，时而高兴，时而悲伤。

记 vari（变化）+able→变化多的→可变的

联 variability n. 可变性；invariable adj. 不变的



* * *



variation　［ˌvɛərɪˈeɪʃən］

n. 变异；变种〈同 change, deviation〉

例 Nectarines are a variation of peaches. 油桃是桃子的变种。



* * *



various　［ˈvɛərɪəs］

adj. 各种的〈同 diverse〉

例 The company, which has been exploring various means of expansion, has decided to open 10 more restaurants. 这家一直在研究各种扩张方式的公司，已经决定再开10家餐厅。

联 variety n. 变化，多样性



* * *



vary　［ˈvɛəri］

v. 呈现不同；改变，变化〈同 differ〉

例 Bill varied his writing style because he thought it was boring. 比尔改变了写作风格，因为他认为之前的风格太无聊了。

联 variation n. 变化；variance n. 差异，不一致

第四部分

vast　［vɑːst; (US)væst］

adj. 巨大的，大量的；范围广的〈同 large; extensive〉

例 The movie star got a vast amount of fan mail every week. 那个电影明星每周都会收到大量的粉丝来信。

联 vastness n. 巨大



* * *



vehicle　［ˈviːɪkəl; (US)ˈviːhɪkəl］

n. ① 交通工具，车辆〈同 automobile〉

例 Twenty vehicles were involved in the crash on the highway. 公路上的这场车祸涉及20辆汽车。

② 媒介物，传达手段〈同 medium〉

例 Language is a vehicle of great thoughts. 语言是伟大思想的媒介。



* * *



velocity　［vəˈlɒsəti］

n. 速度；速率〈同 speed〉

例 At the current velocity, the plane will land in London in one hour. 按照当前的速度，飞机将在一小时后抵达伦敦。

联 velocimeter n. 速度计



* * *



venture　［ˈventʃə(r)］

n. 冒险（事业），投机活动〈同 adventure〉

例 Alice's venture into the stock market wasn't very successful. 艾丽斯冒险投资股市的结果并不怎么成功。

记 vent（发泄）+ure→发泄精力的事→冒险（事业)

联 venturesome adj. 好冒险的；（行为）冒险的；venturous adj. 好冒险的，大胆的



* * *



verify　［ˈverɪfaɪ］

vt. 证明，证实〈同 confirm〉

例 Your signature here will verify that you understand the terms of the agreement. 你在这里的签名将证明，你理解了本协议的条款。

记 ver（真实）+ify→证明是真实的→证实

联 verifiable adj. 能证实的



* * *



version　［ˈvɜːʃən; (US)ˈvərʒən］

n. ① 译本，译文〈同 edition〉

例 The class read the English versions of famous Russian poems. 全班阅读了俄罗斯著名诗歌的英译本。

② 一种描述〈同 description〉

例 Bob gave his version of the accident in a statement to the police. 鲍勃在向警方提供的口供中，给出了他对事故的描述。



* * *



vertical　［ˈvɜːtɪkəl］

adj. 垂直的，竖直的〈同 upright〉

例 The carpenter made sure the wall was vertical. 木匠确保墙是垂直的。

记 来自vertex（n. 顶点)→从顶点向下→垂直的



* * *



vessel　［ˈvesəl］



n. ① 船〈同 craft〉

例 The captain ordered the crew to board the vessel. 船长命令船员们登船。

② 脉管〈同 duct〉

例 A heart attack is caused by a blockage in the blood vessels that supply the blood to the heart muscle. 心脏病是由向心肌供血的血管堵塞引起的。

③ 容器〈同 container〉

例 Soup was served from a large, silver vessel. 汤被盛在一个巨大的银色器皿里端了上来。



* * *



veteran　［ˈvetərən］

n. 老兵；老手

例 He's a 20-year veteran of the New York Police Department. 他是在纽约警察局工作了20年的老手。



* * *



via　［ˈvaɪə］

prep. 经，通过，经由〈同 by way of〉

例 The flight goes via Frankfurt. 这趟航班途经法兰克福。

Lesson 31




音频



预备测验



找出与句子中划线单词意义最相近的词。

1. An understanding of the quantum theory（量子论）is vital in the study of solid state physics.

(A) alive

(B) essential

(C) acquired

2. He was a young sailor on his first sea voyage.

(A) lover

(B) journey

(C) view

3. Many farms in the southern United States yield hay and tobacco.

(A) store

(B) fertilize

(C) produce

4. The spear is one of the oldest weapons known to man.

(A) instruments

(B) tools

(C) arms

5. The western region of the United States has widespread mineral deposits.

(A) precious

(B) beneficial

(C) extensive





第一部分

vibrate　［vaɪˈbreɪt; (US)ˈvaɪbreɪt］

v. 颤动，震动 〈同 tremble〉

例 When a train comes in on the tracks below, the ground of the railroad station vibrates. 当有火车从地下的轨道经过时，整个火车站的地面都在震动。

联 vibration n. 震动，颤动；vibrant adj. 活泼的；生机勃勃的



* * *



vice　［vaɪs］

n. 恶习，恶行〈同 wickedness〉

例 Smoking is one of Mr. Bao's vices. 吸烟是鲍先生的恶习之一。



* * *



victim　［ˈvɪktɪm］

n. 牺牲品，受害者

例 Food is being sent to the victims of the disaster. 食物被派发到灾民手中。

联 victimize v. 牺牲



* * *



victory　［ˈvɪktəri］



n. 胜利，战胜

例 The citizens celebrated the army's victories. 市民们庆祝军队的胜利。

联 victorious adj. 获胜的，胜利的；victor n. 胜利者；获胜者



* * *



vigorous　［ˈvɪɡərəs］

adj. 健壮的，精力旺盛的；强有力的〈同 robust; strong〉

例 There has been vigorous opposition to the proposals for a new road. 修建新公路的提议遭到强烈的反对。



* * *



violent　［ˈvaɪələnt］

adj. ① 暴力引起的；暴力的〈同 turbulent〉

例 A violent crime is committed in the United States about every 22 seconds. 美国大约每22秒钟就会发生一起暴力犯罪。

② 激烈的，强烈的〈同 strong〉

例 The violent winds tore down many tall trees. 强风吹倒了许多大树。

记 viol（冒犯）+ ent→用暴力冒犯别人→暴力的

联 violence n. 暴力



* * *



virtually　［ˈvɜːtjʊəli］

adv. 事实上，实质上；几乎〈同 almost completely〉

例 It used to be virtually impossible to find vegetarian restaurants outside the major cities, but it's much easier now. 以前要在大城市以外的地方找到素食餐厅几乎是不可能的，但现在却容易了许多。



* * *



visible　［ˈvɪzəbəl］

adj. 看得见的，明显的〈同 able to be seen〉

例 Employees must wear their badges so they are visible. 员工必须佩戴徽章，以使他们易于辨认。

联 visibility n. 可见度



* * *



vision　［ˈvɪʒən］

n. 视觉〈同 sight〉

例 Surgery restored the blind woman's vision. 手术恢复了那位盲人女子的视力。



* * *



visual　［ˈvɪʒjʊəl］

adj. 视觉的

例 Special glasses corrected David's visual problem. 特殊的眼镜矫正了戴维的视力。



自我检测


从第一部分中选出最适当的词填入空格内。

6. The outline of the mountains was clearly ______.

7. Cutting the bush back in the autumn will help promote ______ growth in the spring.

8. If I drive my car too fast, the engine will start to ______.

9. The flood ______ were given emergency funds.

10. David tried to quit the ______ of smoking cigarettes.

11. Historically, ______ every major city once had a stock market, but now the major markets are located in New York, Chicago and San Francisco.





第二部分

vital　［ˈvaɪtəl］

adj. 极重要的；与生命有关的；充满活力的〈同 essential〉

例 We learned in our biology class that all living things, no matter how large or small, carry on the same vital functions. 我们在生物课上学到过，所有生物，不论大小，均有同样的生命机能。

联 vitalism n. 活力论，生机说；vitalist n. 活力论者；vitality n. 活力，生命力



* * *



vivid　［ˈvɪvɪd］

adj. ①（光线、色彩）鲜艳的；强烈的〈同 bright〉

例 David's tie was a vivid green. 戴维的领带是鲜艳的绿色。

② 生动的，逼真的〈同 graphic, lively〉

例 The author's vivid description aided my visualization of the story's setting. 作者鲜明生动的描述，帮助我更形象地了解了故事的背景。

记 viv（生命）+ id→生动的

联 vivify vt. 使生动；vivisection n. 活体解剖



* * *



volume　［ˈvɒljuːm］

n. 体积，容积；量〈同 capacity; amount〉

例 The volume of information that a computer diskette can hold is astounding. 计算机磁盘可存储的信息量是惊人的。

联 voluminous adj. 长篇的；大量的



* * *



voluntary　［ˈvɒləntəri; (US)ˈvɒlənteri］

adj. 自愿的；志愿的〈同 willing〉

例 The charity relied solely on voluntary support. 慈善团体完全依靠自愿支持。

记 volunt（意志，意愿）+ ary→自愿的

联 involuntary adj. 自然而然的，无意的；volunteer n. 自愿者



* * *



vote　［vəʊt］



n./vt. 投票〈同 cast one's ballot〉

例 In India everyone eighteen or over gets the right to vote in political elections. 在印度，凡年满18岁者，均有权在政治选举中投票。

联 voter n. 投票者，选举人



* * *



voyage　［ˈvɔɪɪʤ］

n. 航行；旅行，航程〈同 journey〉

例 The voyage to America used to take many months. 以前，去往美国的航程需要花数月时间。

联 voyager n. 航海者



* * *



wage　［weɪʤ］

n. 工资〈同 payment〉

例 Susan gets paid a good wage for her work. 苏珊的工资很高。

v. 发动〈同 carry on〉

例 Pakistan waged a war with India in 1965. 1965年，巴基斯坦发动了对印度的战争。



* * *



wander　［ˈwɒndə(r)］

vi. 徘徊，漫步〈同 roam〉

例 Early man used to wander from one place to another in search of food and shelter. 早期人类经常四处漂泊，寻找食物和住所。



* * *



wax　［wæks］

n. 蜂蜡；蜡状物

例 She watched the wax as it dripped down the side of the candle. 她看着蜡从蜡烛的一侧往下滴。

v. 上蜡于〈同 polish〉

例 I waxed the floor so I'm afraid it's a bit slippery. 我给地板打了蜡，所以恐怕地板有点滑。

联 waxy adj. 苍白的；光滑的



* * *



weapon　［ˈwepən］

n. 武器〈同 arms〉

例 No weapons are permitted in school. 校园内禁止携带任何武器。



自我检测


从第二部分中选出最适当的词填入空格内。

12. The Titanic sank on its maiden ______.

13. Which of these bottles do you think has the greater______?

14. The victims of injustice ______ a battle with the government.

15. The mother ______ on the streets looking for her child.

16. Dale cast her ______ for the youngest candidate.

17. Money is ______ to the success of the program.





第三部分

weed　［wiːd］

n. 杂草

例 The farmer killed the weeds with poison. 农民用农药除去了杂草。

联 locoweed n.【植】疯草（牲畜食后会患上疯草病)；seaweed n. 海草，海藻；weed killer 除草剂



* * *



weep　［wiːp］

vi. 哭泣〈同 cry〉

例 The movie Titanic was so sad that many people wept when they saw it. 电影《泰坦尼克号》太悲伤了，许多人边看边哭。



* * *



weld　［weld］

vt. ① 焊接

例 The cell door was sheet metal welded onto a frame of iron. 牢房的门是把金属板焊在铁框架上制成的。

② 结合〈同 combine〉

例 He is a born leader, who welded a collection of gifted individualists into a real team. 他是个天生的领袖。他吸引了一批有才华的人，组成了一个真正的团队。



* * *



welfare　［ˈwelfeə(r)］

n. 福利〈同 well-being〉

例 These organizations have fought very hard for the rights and welfare of immigrants. 这些组织为了移民的权利和福利进行了艰苦的斗争。



* * *



whip　［wɪp; (US)hwɪp］



n. 鞭子

例 The cowboy bought a long, slender whip at the leather shop. 牛仔在皮革店里买了一条细长的鞭子。

v. 鞭打，抽打〈同 strike〉

例 The rider whipped the horse to make it go faster. 骑手用鞭子抽打马匹，让它跑得更快。



* * *



whisper　［ˈwɪspə(r)］

v. 低声说；耳语

例 You should whisper when you're in the library. 在图书馆的时候，你应该小声说话。

n. 低语

例 The librarian spoke in a whisper. 图书管理员小声地说话。



* * *



whittle　［ˈwɪtəl; (US)ˈhwɪtəl］

v. 削；削减〈同 cut〉

例 Susan whittled a stick with a knife to pass the time. 苏珊用刀子削着一根木棍，以此来打发时间。



* * *



wicked　［ˈwɪkɪd］

adj. 坏的，邪恶的〈同 evil〉

例 The wicked owner treated the employees badly. 那个邪恶的老板对员工态度非常恶劣。



* * *



widespread　［ˈwaɪdspred］

adj. 分布广的，普遍的〈同 extensive〉

例 The earthquake caused widespread damage. 地震造成了大范围的破坏。



* * *



wisdom　［ˈwɪzdəm］

n. 智慧〈同 intelligence〉

例 It is often said that wisdom is the product of experience. 人们经常说，智慧是经验的产物。



自我检测


从第三部分中选出最适当的词填入空格内。

18. The working environment should have adequate facilities and arrangements for employees' ______.

19. During the depression, the management ______ away at the number of jobs in the company.

20. One certainly hopes to gain a little ______ as one grows older.

21. The criminals were ______ as a punishment.

22. Many chemicals can be used to stop ______ growing, but most of them have side effects.

23. The hostages' families ______ tears of joy upon their release.





第四部分

withdraw　［wɪðˈdrɔː］

v. ① 撤退〈同 retreat〉

例 There's been a lot of debate about whether the UN should withdraw its troops from the country. 关于联合国是否应该从这个国家撤军的问题，仍存在许多争议。

② 收回，撤销〈同 revoke〉

例 Once in court, he withdrew the statement he'd made to the police. 一到法庭上，他却收回了向警方所做的供述。

联 withdrawal n. 收回；撤退，退回



* * *



withstand　［wɪðˈstænd］

vt. 承受，抵住〈同 tolerate, resist〉

例 The training that astronauts receive teaches them how to withstand the hazards of space exploration. 宇航员所接受的培训，让他们学会了如何抵御太空探测的危险。

联 with（相反）+ stand（站）→反着站→承受，抵住



* * *



witness　［ˈwɪtnəs］

vt. 目击；为…作证〈同 observe〉

例 The lady witnessed the murder. 那位女士目击了凶杀案。

n. 证人

例 John and Anne served as witnesses to the signing of the contract. 约翰和安妮担任了签署合同的见证人。

联 eyewitness n. 目击者，见证人



* * *



wonder　［ˈwʌndə(r)］

n. 奇迹；惊奇

例 Mount Everest is one of the natural wonders of the world. 珠穆朗玛峰是世界上的自然奇观之一。

vt. 对…感到惊奇，想知道〈同 be curious about〉

例 I wondered how he could finish so much work during a short period. 我想知道，他是如何在这么短时间内完成这么多工作的。

联 wonderful adj. 令人惊奇的，奇妙的，极好的



* * *



worship　［ˈwɜːʃɪp］

n./v. 崇拜，膜拜〈同 adore〉

例 He was the hero worshipped by the younger children. 他是孩子们崇拜的英雄。

v. 敬神

例 Tom worships at the temple every Sunday morning. 汤姆每周日上午都去寺庙拜神。



* * *



worthwhile　［ˌwɜːθˈwaɪl］

adj. 值得的，值得花时间、金钱或精力的〈同 rewarding〉

例 It may someday be worthwhile to try to recover uranium from seawater, but at present this process is prohibitively expensive. 或许有一天值得尝试从海水中回收铀，但目前这种工艺的成本还是太过高昂。

记 worth（价值）+ while→有价值的→值得的



* * *



wrap　［ræp］

vt. 裹，包，捆〈同 enclose〉

例 He wrapped his handkerchief round his bleeding finger. 他用手绢把流血的手指包了起来。

联 wrap up 胜利完成；包起来



* * *



wreck　［rek］

n. 失事；失事的残骸〈同 destruction〉

例 The divers found a wreck on the seabed. 潜水员在海床上发现了一艘沉船的残骸。

vt. 失事〈同 sink, destroy〉

例 The ship was wrecked when it hit the rocks in a storm. 船在暴风雨中撞上了岩石，结果失事了。

联 shipwreck n. 船只失事，海难



* * *



yawn　［jɔːn］



n. 哈欠 vi. 打哈欠

例 He yawned and fell asleep. 他打了个哈欠，然后睡着了。



* * *



yield　［jiːld］

v. ① 生产；产生〈同 produce; bear〉

例 The cow won't yield much milk. 奶牛不怎么产奶了。

② 放弃；投降〈同 surrender〉

例 The child pleaded, but the parents wouldn't yield. 孩子不断恳求，但家长就是不让步。

n. 产量；收益〈同 output〉

例 An experienced farmer can estimate the annual yield of his acres with surprising accuracy. 一个有经验的农民可以估算出自己农田的年产量，而且准确度高得惊人。

联 yield to 屈服于



自我检测

24. The police are appealing to anyone who may have ______ the accident.

25. After the accident, he ______ into himself and refused to talk to either his family or friends.

26. The police carefully pulled the injured man out of the ______.

27. The terrorists ______ themselves to the police.

28. Anne ______ the present in colorful paper.

29. According to a recent poll, 80% of Americans pray regularly and over 40% ______ on a weekly basis.

31. ______ voluntary B. defeat

33. ______ wisdom D. compulsory

34. ______ vigorous E. folly

35. ______ vivid F. resist

36. ______ vice G. feeble


Exercise 2　找出与句子中划线单词意义最相近的词。


37. Older citizens in the United States vote more regularly than younger ones, particularly when local and state issues are being considered.

(A) cast their ballots

（B）run for office

（C）criticize the government

38. Because it symbolized strength, the oak（橡树，橡木）was traditionally worshiped and had numerous mythological associations.

(A) bought

(B) transported

(C) adored

39. The best country songs are those that express an emotion that is likely to make a listener weep.

(A) smile

(B) think

(C) cry

40. Because of its vivid yellow, black and orange coloring, the emperor penguin stands out（显眼的）against the usually bleak landscape of its habitat.

(A) odd

(B) pale

(C) bright

41. The Californian redwoods, the tallest trees in the world, are known for their ability to withstand fire, insects and disease.

(A) receive

(B) resist

(C) attack

42. Under the Housing Act of 1977, British local authorities must in certain circumstances provide housing for homeless families as part of the government welfare program.

(A) benefit

(B) calmness

(C) grace

44. ______ victim B. ruin

45. ______ weld C. seeing

46. ______ vital D. shear

47. ______ violent E. crucial

48. ______ vibrate F. unforced

49. ______ whittle G. integrate

50. ______ wreck H. powerful

51. ______ voluntary I. practically

52. ______ virtually J. sufferer

57. The political influence of the developed countries of the world is ______.

58. She ______ when Paul left.

62. Telescopes and microscopes are ______ aids.

前言

本丛书专为哪些人编写？

◎ 准备参加TOEFL、IELTS、GRE、GMAT等考试，但英语水平或词汇量不足，难以直接复习备考，需要实实在在、循序渐进提高词汇量及英文水平的人——本丛书词汇从“Vocabulary Basic”开始，难度逐级提高，直到“Vocabulary 23000”。

◎ 准备参加大学英语四级考试的人——“Vocabulary Basic”包括了《大学英语教学大纲》规定的英语四级应掌握的全部核心词汇。

◎ 准备参加大学英语六级考试的人——“Vocabulary Basic”+“Vocabulary 6000”，包括了《大学英语教学大纲》规定的英语六级应掌握的全部核心词汇。

◎ 准备参加TOEFL、研究生入学等考试的人——“Vocabulary Basic”+ “Vocabulary 6000”+“Vocabulary 12000”，包含了TOEFL、研究生入学考试应掌握的全部核心词汇。

◎ 以上所有类型的读者均可首先学习或最后总结学习“Vocabulary 23000”。该书采用“词根词缀”记忆法，为读者构建词汇学习之框架，同时结合“近形”和“同根”记忆法，帮助读者轻松、快速地扩大词汇量。

本丛书有何特点？

◎ 以“课”为单元，每课包括4个部分或3～5个Group，各部分虽只有10个左右的主词，但由其衍生出来的同义、反义、形近、同根、同类词等的量非常之大。这样既可方便读者安排学习进度（每天1~2课），又能够保证其3个月内词汇量迅速达到20000以上。

◎ 每个单词均附有国际音标、词性说明、中文释义、英文例句及译文。

◎ 列出各单词的同义词，帮助读者迅速扩大词汇量。配合联想记忆法，举一反三，事半功倍。

◎ 根据词义精心设计了助记插图，既便于读者更好地理解单词，又为学习增加了趣味性。

◎ 前三册每一部分后均附有习题，以加深读者对所学单词的印象；全四册每一课后均有综合复习，便于读者自我检测对所学单词的了解程度，并增强活用单词的能力。

◎ 附赠MP3录音，可在网络上免费下载，其中包含书中的所有主词和英文例句。录音由英音外教朗读，发音纯正地道，配合学习，效果更佳。

词汇量的增加不可一蹴而就，但是若能采用系统的方法，还是可以缩短扩大词汇量所需的时间。为此，我们特别为全国广大的英语学习者编写了这套词汇丛书。从最基本的“Vocabulary Basic”到足以应付留学考试之需的“Vocabulary 23000”，读者只要按部就班、循序渐进地学习本丛书，必可在最短的时间内取得最大的成效。无论您目前是在校求学或已步入社会，都会发现本系列书籍即是您苦寻已久、增强英文实力的最佳利器。学校老师更可采用本系列书籍作为辅助教材，以弥补平时上课内容之不足。

编　者



Lesson 1





音频



预备测验

找出与句子中划线单词意义最相近的词。

1. During the Second World War, all important resources in the United States were allocated by the federal government.

(A) distributed

(B) commanded

(C) nationalized

2. Chicago's O'Hare International Airport accommodates forty-four million passengers per year.

(A) amazes

(B) lures

(C) carries

3. One of California's most acute problems is inadequate water supply.

(A) unusual

(B) critical

(C) persistent

4. Most traditional folk songs are of anonymous origin.

(A) insignificant

(B) inconspicuous

(C) unknown

5. The fear of smallpox, which terrorized the eighteenth century, has no analogy today.

(A) occurrence

(B) remnants

(C) parallel



第一部分

abide［ə'baɪd］

vi. 遵守（by）〈同 follow, comply with〉

例　Players have to abide by the referee's decision. 参赛者必须遵守裁判的判定。

vt. 忍受〈同 endure, put up with〉

例　Many people can't abide the smell of cheap cigars. 许多人没法忍受廉价雪茄的气味。

联　abiding adj. 持久的





abnormal［æb'nɔ:məl］

adj. 反常的，异常的；变态的〈同 anomalous, unnatural〉

例　The warm December weather in Beijing is abnormal. 在北京，12月份还这么暖和是不正常的。

记　ab（不）+ norm（标准）+ al → 不标准的 → 异常的

联　normal adj. 正常的，正规的，标准的；supernormal adj. 非凡的，异乎寻常的；subnormal adj. 低于正常的，弱智的

abolish［ə'bɒlɪʃ］

vt. 废除，取消〈同 eliminate〉

例　Slavery was abolished in the United States after the Civil War. 美国在南北战争以后废除了奴隶制。

联　abolition n. 废除，革除；abolitionist n. 废奴主义者

abrupt［ə'brʌpt］

adj. ① 突然的，意外的〈同 sudden〉

例　There is a road with many abrupt turns. 那儿有一条路有很多急转弯。

② 唐突的；无礼的

例　Abrupt responses often cause hurt feelings. 无礼的回答通常会伤害别人的感情。

absurd［əb'zɜ:d］

adj. 荒谬的，可笑的〈同 foolish, ridiculous〉

例　It is absurd to wear a coat at the swimming pool. 在游泳池边穿着外套很可笑。

记　ab + surd（笨）→ 笨的 → 可笑的

联　absurdity n. 荒谬，谬论

accent［'æksənt］

n. ① 口音

例　My father was born in Germany and still speaks English with a German accent. 我的父亲出生在德国，他在说英语的时候仍带着德国口音。

② 重音〈同 emphasis〉

例　In the word“wonderful”, the accent is on the first syllable. 单词wonderful的重音在第一个音节上。

联　accentuate vt. 重读；强调

accessory［ək'sesəri］

n. 附件，零件〈同 accompaniment〉

例　Her new car has many accessories, including air conditioning. 她的新车有许多配套设施，包括空调。

accommodate［ə'kɒmədeɪt］

vt. ① 容纳，为…提供空间；供应（膳宿）〈同 contain, supply〉

例　That hotel can accommodate up to one hundred guests. 那家旅馆总共可以容纳100个客人。

② 使适应；调节〈同 suit, adjust〉

例　I will accommodate my scheme to yours. 我会调整我的计划以适应你的计划。

记　ac（朝向）+ commodate（使合适，方便）→ 使适应；调节

联　accommodation n. 住处，膳宿；accommodating adj. 乐于助人的，随和的；commodity n. 商品；commodious adj. 宽敞的

activate［'æktɪveɪt］

vt. 刺激，使活动〈同 mobilize〉

例　The hungry and tired child was activated when he saw the bread. 这个又饿又累的孩子一看见面包马上变得精神起来。

联　activation n.【化】活化作用；active adj. 积极的，活跃的；activity n. 活跃，行动，行为

acute［ə'kju:t］

adj. ① 灵敏的，敏锐的〈同 keen〉

例　Acute hearing helps most animals sense the approach of thunderstorms long before people do. 大多数动物都有着灵敏的听觉，它们比人类感知雷雨到来的时间要早很多。

② 剧烈的；严重的；紧要关头的〈同 intense, critical〉

例　With the acceleration of industrial growth came acute urban crowding and accompanying social stress. 随着工业化的加速发展，城市里出现了严重拥挤和随之而来的社会压力。

记　acu（尖）+ te → 尖锐的 → 敏锐的

联　acuity n. 尖锐，敏锐；acumen n. 敏锐，聪明；cute adj. 可爱的

自我检测　从第一部分中选出最适当的词填入空格内。

6. The boy's parents were worried about his ______ behavior that never had happened before.

7. The long drought caused an ______ shortage of water in the city.

8. The idea that the number 13 brings bad luck is ______.

9. Dialing 110 ______ your community's emergency response program.

10. Both teams will ______ the umpire's（裁判员）decision.

11. I made an ______ turn to avoid another car.



第二部分

adhere［əd'hɪə(r)］

vi. ① 黏附，粘牢〈同 stick〉

例　Mud adheres to your shoes. 你的鞋粘上泥了。

② 追随，坚持；遵守（to）〈同 follow〉

例　In China, many people adhere to Confucius' teaching. 在中国，有很多人遵循孔子的教育理念。

联　adhesive adj. 有黏性的；adherent adj. 黏着的 n. 信徒，追随者；adhesion n. 黏附，支持；cohere vi. 粘连，结合；inhere vi. 与生俱来





adjacent［ə'ʤeɪsənt］

adj. 毗连的，邻近的〈同 neighboring〉

例　The house adjacent to ours has been sold, so we have a new neighbor. 我们隔壁的房子已经卖出去了，于是我们有了新的邻居。

记　ad + jacent（躺）→ 躺在附近 → 邻近的

adjust［ə'ʤʌst］

vt. 调整；使适应〈同 regulate, adapt〉

例　It took Janet more than half a year to adjust to the new business after she changed her job. 珍妮特跳槽以后，花了多半年的时间来适应这份新工作。

联　adjustment n. 调整

administer［əd'mɪnɪstə(r)］

vt. 管理〈同 govern〉

例　The British administered Hong Kong until 1997. 英国对香港的管辖持续到1997年。

联　administration n. 管理，经营；administrative adj. 管理的，行政的；administrator n. 管理人，行政官

adolescent［ˌædə'lesənt］

adj. 青春期的；成长中的

例　In his adolescent years, the successful businessman claimed, he had undergone many hardships. 这位成功的商人说，他在青少年时期受过很多的磨难。

记　adol（成年）+ escent（开始…的）→ 开始成年的 → 青春期的

联　adolescence n. 青春期

advent［'ædvent］

n.（尤指不寻常的人或事的）出现，到来〈同 coming into being〉

例　The advent of e-mail changed communication. 电子邮件的出现改变了通信方式。

记　ad + vent（到来）→ 出现，到来

联　adventure n. 冒险；adventitious adj. 偶然的；prevent vt. 防止，预防；circumvent vt. 包围；intervention n. 干涉

adverse［æd'vɜ:s］

adj. 负面的，不利的；相反的〈同 unfavorable, opposite〉

例　The adverse effects from most of the medication were minimal. 大多数药物的副作用很小。

联　adversary n. 敌人，对手；adversity n. 不幸，灾难

advocate

［'ædvəkət］ n. 提倡者，主张者，拥护者〈同 proponent〉

例　The International Fund for Animal Welfare was a strong advocate of the campaign to save dolphins from death. 国际爱护动物基金会是拯救海豚运动的坚决拥护者。

［'ædvəkeɪt］ vt. 拥护，主张〈同 support〉

例　Some people advocated limiting the number of cars on the main road. 有些人倡议限制主路上的汽车数量。

aesthetic［i:s'θetɪk］

adj. 美学的，审美的〈同 artistic〉

例　The new building has little aesthetic value, but can accommodate a lot of people. 这座新楼没有多少美学价值，不过可以容纳很多人。

联　anesthetic n. 麻醉剂

affiliate［ə'fɪlɪeɪt］

vt. 使隶属；接纳…为成员〈同 associate, incorporate〉

例　The hospital is affiliated with a local university. 这家医院是当地一所大学的附属医院。

记　af + fili（儿子）+ ate → 使成为儿子 → 使隶属

联　affiliation n. 联系，从属关系；afflict vt. 使痛苦；affinity n. 密切关系；吸引力
