12. Some people ______ stricter laws against drunk drivers.

13. The Secretary of Defense ______ a department of the government.

14. That TV station is ______ with a national network.

15. My house is ______ to hers, so we are neighbors.

16. ______ criticism discouraged me.

17. This chair may be ______ but it's not very comfortable.



第三部分

affirm［ə'fɜ:m］

vt. ① 断言；坚称〈同 assert〉

例　She affirmed before the policeman that he was the one who stole her purse. 她在警察面前坚称他就是偷她钱包的那个人。

② 证实，确认；批准〈同 approve〉

例　The post office affirmed that the letter was delivered. 邮局证实信已寄出。

联　affirmative adj. 表示同意的，肯定的；infirm adj. 体弱的，意志薄弱的；infirmary n. 医务室

afflict［ə'flɪkt］

vt. 折磨；使苦恼〈同 plague〉

例　The villagers in several mountainous areas are afflicted by poverty in the nation. 在这个国家，一些山区的村民深受穷困之苦。

记　af + flict（打击）→ 一再受到打击 → 折磨

联　afflicting adj. 痛苦的；affliction n. 苦难；conflict n./vi. 斗争，冲突

agenda［ə'ʤendə］

n. 日程，议程〈同 schedule〉

例　My agenda is quite full for the whole week, so I can't make an appointment with you. 这个星期我的日程已经排得很满了，所以我没有时间跟你会面了。

aggravate［'ægrəveɪt］

vt. 使恶化，使加重〈同 worsen〉

例　Mary aggravated her injuries by refusing treatment. 由于玛丽拒绝接受治疗，她的伤情加重了。

记　ag + grav（重）+ ate → 加重

联　aggravating adj. 恼人的，讨厌的；aggravation n. 加重，恶化；grave n. 墓穴，坟墓；gravitate vi. 受引力作用，下沉；gravity n. 庄重，地球引力

agitation［ˌæʤɪ'teɪʃən］

n. 焦虑，不安；煽动〈同 anxiety〉

例　Because of her agitation over losing her job, she could not sleep. 由于失业让她很焦虑，她都睡不着觉了。

agony［'ægəni］

n. 苦恼；极大的痛苦〈同 anguish〉

例　Listening to my neighbor practice the piano is an agony. 听我的邻居练习钢琴是一件很痛苦的事。

记　agon（挣扎）+y → 拼命挣扎 → 极大的痛苦

联　agonize vt. 使极度痛苦，折磨





agreeable［ə'gri:əbəl］

adj. ①（指计划等）使人愉快的，合意的〈同 pleasing, acceptable〉

例　The plan was agreeable to everyone but Mary. 除了玛丽，所有人都对这个计划满意。

② 和蔼可亲的，容易相处的〈同 affable〉

例　Mr. Bao is an agreeable man with a kind smile. 包先生是一个面带微笑、十分随和的人。

记　agree（赞同）+ able → 表示同意的 → 合意的

联　agreement n. 协议，一致；disagree vi. 不一致，争执；disagreeable adj. 不友善的，令人厌恶的

alien［'eɪlɪən］

adj. 相异的，陌生的〈同 strange〉

例　When I first went to New York, it all felt very alien to me. 当我第一次去纽约的时候，那里的一切对我来说都很陌生。

联　alienate vt. 使疏远，离间；salient adj. 显著的，突出的

allege［ə'leʤ］

vt.（尤指无根据地）宣称；断言〈同 assert〉

例　Although he has no proof, this man alleges that the janitor stole his watch. 尽管没有证据，这个男人还是断言是看门人偷了他的表。

联　allegedly adv. 据说；allegation n. 主张，断言

alleviate［ə'li:vɪeɪt］

vt. 减轻（痛苦等），缓和〈同 reduce, lighten〉

例　To alleviate symptoms, you should drink plenty of water and stay in bed. 为缓解症状，你需要多喝水，卧床休息。

记　al + lev（轻）+ iate → 减轻

联　alleviation n. 缓和；levity n. 轻率，轻浮；levitate v.（使）飘浮在空中

23. This medicine will ______ your sore throat.



第四部分

allocate［'æləkeɪt］

vt. 分配，分派，拨出〈同 allot〉

例　The federal government allocated millions of dollars for cancer research. 联邦政府拨出几百万美元用于癌症研究。

联　allocation n. 分配，安置；locate v. 定位，定居

alternate

［ɔ:l'tɜ:nət］ adj. ① 交替的，轮流的〈同 intermittent〉

例　Private cars are banned from the city on alternate days. 私家车每隔一天就被禁止入城。

② 替代的〈同 alternative〉

例　If that business does not make what we want, we can always find an alternate one that does. 如果那项业务达不到我们想要的水平，我们随时都可以选择其他的业务来替代。

［'ɔ:ltɜ:neɪt］ vi. 轮流，交替〈同 rotate〉

例　Her cheerfulness alternated with despair. 她的欢乐和绝望交替而来。

联　alternative adj. 两者（或两者以上）择一的，另外的 n. 可选事物，另一种选择；alternation n. 交替，轮流

ambiguous［æm'bɪgjʊəs］

adj. 歧义的，含糊的〈同 unclear, equivocal〉

例　His ambiguous statements could have been understood in more than one way. 他含糊不清的陈述可能让人有不止一种理解方式。

记　ambi（双，两个）+ gu（= go 走）+ ous → 有两种意义的 → 歧义的，含糊的

联　ambiguity n. 歧义，含糊

ambitious［æm'bɪʃəs］

adj. 有雄心的，渴望成功的；有野心的〈同 aspiring〉

例　She has some ambitious expansion plans for her business. 她的事业拓展计划野心勃勃。

记　ambi（多于一的）+ tious → 志向多的 → 有雄心的

联　ambition n. 雄心，野心

amend［ə'mend］

vt. 修正，改正〈同 revise〉

例　Rather than amend the club's constitution again, let us discard it and start afresh. 与其再次修改俱乐部的章程，我们还不如把它废弃，制定新的章程。

记　a + mend（补，修）→ 修订

联　amends n. 赔偿，赔礼；amendment n. 改正，修正；mend vt. 修改，修理；amenable adj. 应服从的，有责任的；amenity n.（地方、气候等的）宜人，礼仪；mendacious adj. 虚假的，说谎的

ample［'æmpəl］

adj. 富足的，充足的〈同 abundant〉

例　She received ample compensation for her injuries from this accident. 她在这起交通事故中所受到的伤害获得了足够的赔偿。

联　trample v. 践踏，毁坏

amplify［'æmplɪfaɪ］

vt. 放大；扩大；增强〈同 enlarge, strengthen〉

例　They needed the radio signal to be amplified in order to receive it properly. 他们需要增强广播信号以便更好地接收。

联　amplification n. 扩大





analogy［ə'næləʤi］

n. 类比，类推；类似物〈同 comparison, parallel〉

例　He drew an analogy between the brain and a computer. 他打了个比方，把人脑比作电脑。

联　analogous adj. 类似的

analytical［ˌænə'lɪtɪkəl］

adj. 分析的，解析的

例　He has a very analytical mind and always gets the highest score in his geometry course. 他的分析能力很强，总是在几何学课程中得最高分。

联　analyze vt. 分析，分解；analysis n. 分析，分解

anonymous［ə'nɒnɪməs］

adj. 匿名的〈同 unknown〉

例　Sometimes, the newspaper publishes anonymous articles in the political opinion section. 有时候，报纸在政治观点版刊登匿名文章。

记　an + onym（名称）+ ous → 无名称的 → 匿名的

联　anonymity n. 无名，匿名；onymous adj. 署名的；synonym n. 同义词

Lesson 2





音频



预备测验

找出与句子中划线单词意义最相近的词。

1. He made an apt remark and everybody agreed with it.

(A) a happy

(B) an appropriate

(C) a fast

2. In early New England, bachelors were required to live with families.

(A) school teachers

(B) college students

(C) unmarried men

3. Nitrogen is the most plentiful gas in the atmosphere.

(A) water

(B) earth

(C) air

4. The term“composition”refers to the way the components of a drawing are arranged by the artist.

(A) took

(B) imagined

(C) put together

5. They hoped to avert a disaster by draining some of the flood waters.

(A) avenge

(B) prevent

(C) endure



第一部分

antarctic［æn'tɑ:ktɪk］

adj.［常作A-］南极的，南极地带的

例　Scientists are keen to track the fortunes of Antarctic plant life over 30 million years. 科学家热衷于追踪3000万年以来南极地区植物的生长情况的宝贵信息。

n.［常作the A-］南极地区

例　The protection of the Antarctic from commercial exploitation is an important goal of environmentalists. 保护南极地区不被商业开发是环保人士重要的工作目标。

appendix［ə'pendɪks］

n. ① 附录；附属品

例　This dictionary has an appendix which lists computer terms. 这本字典有一个列举计算机术语的附录。

②【解】阑尾

例　She had her appendix out last summer. 去年夏天，她做了阑尾切除手术。

applaud［ə'plɔ:d］

v.（向…）鼓掌喝彩，欢呼〈同 clap〉

例　The audience stood up and applauded at the end of the concert. 音乐会结束时，观众们起立鼓掌。

联　applause n. 鼓掌欢迎，欢呼；plausible adj. 似是而非的





application［ˌæplɪ'keɪʃən］

n. ① 申请

例　Application must be made early for the banquet. 宴会的邀请必须早点发出。

② 施用，运用；作用，影响〈同 employment, influence〉

例　Mathematics has applications in science. 数学在科学领域有所应用。

联　apply v. 申请，应用，适用

appraisal［ə'preɪzəl］

n. 评价；估价〈同 assessment〉

例　Fifty thousand dollars would be a fair appraisal of their new house. 给他们的新房估价5万美元是客观公正的。

联　appraise vt. 评价，鉴定；appraiser n. 评价者；apprise vt. 通知，报告

appreciable［ə'pri:ʃɪəbəl］

adj.（数量或变化等）很大的；值得重视的〈同 considerable〉

例　There has been an appreciable drop in the number of the unemployed since the new government came to power. 新政府执政以后，失业人员的数量有了明显下降。

记　ap + preci（赞扬）+ able → 值得赞扬的 → 值得重视的

联　appreciate v. 赏识，感激，涨价；depreciate v. 降低，贬值；perceptible adj. 可感觉到的

apprehension［ˌæprɪ'henʃən］

n. 担心，害怕；理解〈同 worry, understand〉

例　The English test caused me a lot of apprehension because I did not study hard for it. 因为我没有努力学习，英语测试让我感到很恐惧。

联　apprehend v. 逮捕，忧虑，理解；comprehend vt. 理解，包含；reprehend vt. 责备

apt［æpt］

adj. ① 恰当的，贴切的〈同 appropriate〉

例　His apt reply to the question showed that he had understood it very well. 他对这个问题做出的恰当的回答表明他已经理解得很好了。

② 易于…的〈同 likely〉

例　A careless person is apt to make mistakes. 粗心的人容易犯错误。

联　aptly adv. 恰当地，得体地

arc［ɑ:k］

n. 弧；弓形

例　The crowd watched as the ball rose in a high arc and fell behind the boundary line. 观众们看着球划了一条高弧线，然后落在了边界线之外。

联　arch n. 拱门；arcade n. 拱廊

arctic［'ɑ:ktɪk］

adj.［常作A-］北极的，北极区的

例　The Arctic Circle is an imaginary line drawn at approximately 66.5 degrees North. 北极圈是在北纬66.5度附近划的一个假想的圈。

自我检测　从第一部分中选出最适当的词填入空格内。

6. There's an ______ at the end of the book with a list of dates.

7. A. ______ of Five Year Plans reveals that they have failed to decrease unemployment and poverty from the country.

8. The audience ______ her wonderful speech.

9. I filled out an ______ for a job at the supermarket.

10. The roar of the hurricane filled us with ______.

11. The penguin（企鹅）lives in the ______, which is fully covered with snow and ice.



第二部分

arrange［ə'reɪnʤ］

vt. ① 计划，准备〈同 plan, schedule〉

例　I'm trying to arrange my work so that I can have a couple of days off next week. 我尽量安排好工作，好在下周请几天假。

② 整理，摆放〈同 organize, order〉

例　Every morning, Janet arranged the papers on her desk and then began work. 每天早上，珍妮特都要整理好桌上的文件，然后开始工作。

联　arrangement n. 排列，安排

array［ə'reɪ］

n. 展示，陈列；一批，一系列〈同 collection〉

例　The designer displayed an array of new fashions. 设计师展示了一系列新的流行服饰。

articulate

［ɑ:'tɪkjʊleɪt］ vt. 清楚地讲话，清晰地发音〈同 enunciate〉

例　People learning a foreign language often have difficulty in articulating certain sounds. 人们在学习一门外语的时候，经常在发某些音时比较困难。

［ɑ:'tɪkjələt］ adj. 善于言辞的，表达清晰的〈同 clear〉

例　At the age of 93, he was still sharp-witted and articulate. 他93岁了，仍然思维敏捷，表达清晰。

记　articul（接合）+ ate →（语言）连接得好 → 说话清楚的

联　speculate v. 思索，投机；gesticulate v. 用手势示意





ascend［ə'send］

v.（渐渐）上升，升高；攀登〈同 climb〉

例　They slowly ascended the steep mountain. 他们慢慢地爬上了这座陡峭的山。

记　a + scend（爬）→ 爬上 → 攀登

联　ascent n. 攀登，上升；ascendancy n. 优势，支配（或统治）地位；descend v. 下降；condescend vi. 屈尊，俯就；transcend vt. 超越

ascertain［ˌæsə'teɪn］

vt. 查明；确定〈同 confirm〉

例　I ascertained that no one could overhear us before I told Bob the news. 我确定没有人偷听我们讲话，然后才把这个消息告诉鲍勃。

记　as + certain（肯定的）→ 可以肯定的 → 确定

联　certain adj. 确定的，无疑的

ascribe［ə'skraɪb］

vt. 把…归于（to）〈同 attribute〉

例　John ascribed his success to hard work. 约翰把他的成功归功于努力工作。

aspect［'æspekt］

n. ①（问题等的）方面；（事物的）一部分〈同 respect〉

例　The one aspect of the case that puzzled me was why he had committed the crime. 这个案子让我感到困惑的一点是，他为什么要犯罪。

② 观点，角度〈同 perspective, viewpoint〉

例　From the cost aspect, the product is not expensive. 从成本角度来看，这个产品不贵。

assault［ə'sɔ:lt］

n.（武力）袭击；（语言）攻击〈同 attack〉

例　The man was charged with sexual assault. 这个男人被指控性侵犯。

记　as（一再）+ sault（瀑布，急流）→ 一再像瀑布一样冲击 → 袭击

assert［ə'sɜ:t］

vt. 声称，坚持〈同 emphatically state〉

例　The lawyer asserts that his client is not guilty. 律师坚称他的委托人无罪。

记　as + sert（参与）→ 一再参与（讨论）→ 主张

联　assertion n. 主张，断言，声明

assignment［ə'saɪnmənt］

n. ① 任务，作业〈同 task, job〉

例　I have a lot of reading assignments to complete before the end of the term. 我有许多阅读作业要在期末前完成。

② 分配；（财产、权力等）转让〈同 distribution, appointment〉

例　The assignment of the property will take place tomorrow. 产权转让将在明天进行。

自我检测　从第二部分中选出最适当的词填入空格内。

12. John ______ his brother's success to good luck.

13. Despite his team's recent loss, he still ______ that they're the best.

14. The team had an impressive ______ of fine players.

15. She watched the airplane ______ higher and higher.

16. Today's ______ in arithmetic consists of ten exercises.

17. Please ______ the books on the library shelf.



第三部分

assimilate［ə'sɪmɪleɪt］

vt. ① 学习，吸收（知识）〈同 understand〉

例　You'll need to assimilate all Einstein's work before doing this research. 在进行这项研究之前，你需要学习一下爱因斯坦所有的研究成果。

② 吃，吸收（食物或营养）〈同 absorb〉

例　People assimilate nutrients from food. 人们从食物中吸收营养。

记　as + simil（相同）+ ate → 使相同 → 同化

astonish［ə'stɒnɪʃ］

vt. 使惊讶〈同 surprise, shock〉

例　I was astonished by the news of the divorce—they seemed so happy together. 我听到他们离婚的消息时感到很震惊——他们在一起看起来很幸福。

联　astonished adj.（人）惊讶的；astonishing adj.（某事或物）惊人的





astronomy［ə'strɒnəmi］

n. 天文学

例　Astronomy is the scientific study of the universe as a whole and of objects which exist naturally in space, such as the moon, the sun, planets and stars. 天文学是一项针对整个宇宙以及自然存在于宇宙内的天体，如月球、太阳、行星和恒星的科学研究。

联　astronomical adj. 天文学的；astronomer n. 天文学家

atmosphere［'ætməsfɪə(r)］

n. 大气；大气层；（某一地的）空气〈同 air〉

例　The atmospheres of Mars and Earth are very different. 火星和地球的大气层差别很大。

联　atmospheric adj. 大气的；sphere n. 球，球体，范围，领域；hemisphere n. 半球

attendant［ə'tendənt］

n. 侍者，随从；护理人员〈同 aide〉

例　The prince was followed by five or six attendants. 王子的后面跟着五六个随从。

adj. 伴随的〈同 accompanying〉

例　Coughing and sneezing are some of the attendant discomforts of a cold. 咳嗽和打喷嚏都是由感冒引起的不适感。

联　attendance n. 出席，出席人数

augment［ɔ:g'ment］

v. 增加，增大〈同 increase〉

例　The old man sought to augment his wealth by placing it in a bank. 老人想通过把钱存入银行来使自己的财富增值。

记　aug（提高）+ ment → 提高 → 增大

联　augmentative adj. 可增加的；augur v. 占卜，预言；auger n. 螺旋钻

authentic［ɔ:'θentɪk］

adj. 真的，真迹的；可靠的，确实的〈同 genuine, valid〉

例　This discovery is an authentic Goya drawing. 这次发现的这幅画是戈雅的真迹。

记　aut（= auto 自己）+ hent（做）+ ic → 自己做的 → 真的

联　authenticity n. 真实性；authenticate vt. 鉴别，证明…是真的

authorize［'ɔ:θəraɪz］

vt. 授权，批准〈同 empower〉

例　Congress authorized the spending of money for a new post office. 议会授权拨款新建一座邮局大厦。

联　authority n. 权力；authoritative adj. 权威的，有权威的

automaton［ɔ:'tɒmətən］

n. 机器人〈同 robot〉

例　In the future, many human workers may be replaced by automatons. 未来许多人类的工作可能将由机器人来替代完成。

记　auto（自己）+ mat（动）+ on → 自己会动的人 → 机器人

联　automat n. 自动售货（或售票）机；automatic adj. 自动的，机械的；automation n. 自动化

autonomy［ɔ:'tɒnəmi］

n. 自治，自治权〈同 independence〉

例　The thirteen original U.S. colonies won their autonomy after the American Revolution. 在美国独立战争之后，原先的13个殖民地赢得了自治权。

记　auto（自己）+ nomy（统治）→ 自己统治 → 自治

联　autonomous adj. 自治的；autobiography n. 自传；automobile n. 汽车

第四部分

avert［ə'vɜ:t］

vt. 转移；避免；规避〈同 prevent〉

例　The driver averted an accident by a quick turn of the steering wheel. 驾驶员迅速地打方向盘，避免了一起交通事故。

记　a + vert（转）→ 转开 → 避免

联　averse adj. 讨厌的，不情愿的；adverse adj. 不利的，敌对的；aversion n. 厌恶，讨厌的事（或人）；inversion n. 倒转





aviation［ˌeɪvɪ'eɪʃən］

n. 航空；航空学〈同 flying, aeronautics〉

例　Bob likes planes very much. He is interested in aviation. 鲍勃很喜欢飞机。他对航空学感兴趣。

记　avi（鸟，渴望）+ ation → 模仿鸟的飞行 → 航空

联　aviator n. 飞行员；aviary n. 鸟舍；avarice n. 贪心

axis［'æksɪs］

n. 轴；轴心〈同 shaft〉

例　The earth revolves around the axis which joins the North and South Poles. 地球围绕连接北极和南极的轴旋转。

bachelor［'bætʃələ(r)］

n. ①（文或理）学士

例　Janet has a Bachelor of Engineering degree. 珍妮特有工学学士学位。

② 单身汉〈同 unmarried man〉

例　Before the wedding, he held a party with all his bachelor friends. 在举行婚礼之前，他和他所有的单身汉朋友办了一个派对。

badge［bæʤ］

n. 徽章；证章；标志

例　The Red Cross badge is a red cross on a white background. 红十字会的标志是一个在白色背景上的红色十字。

baffle［'bæfl］

vt. 使困惑；阻碍〈同 puzzle, hinder〉

例　The absence of clues baffled the police in the investigation of the murder. 线索的缺乏阻碍了警察调查这起谋杀案。

联　baffling adj. 使人困惑的，阻碍的

baggage［'bægɪʤ］

n. 行李〈同 luggage〉

例　How much baggage can we take on the plane? 我们能带多少行李上飞机？

联　bandage n. 绷带；barrage n. 堰坝，弹幕射击

bald［bɔ:ld］

adj. 秃头的；光秃的〈同 hairless〉

例　At twenty he was already going bald. 他20岁时就开始秃顶了。

联　bald eagle 秃鹰

ballet［'bæleɪ］

n. 芭蕾舞；芭蕾舞乐曲

例　A ballet tells a story through the movements of the dancing and is accompanied by music often written specially for it. 芭蕾舞通过舞蹈动作讲述故事，并且配有通常专门为其创作的音乐。

bandage［'bændɪʤ］

n. 绷带〈同 strip of cloth〉

例　She offered to put a bandage on his arm. 她主动提出为他包扎手臂。

27. A mountaintop（山顶）with no trees or grass is ______.

音频



预备测验

找出与句子中划线单词意义最相近的词。

1. Meteors rarely blaze for longer than a few seconds.

(A) burn brightly

(B) encounter friction

(C) release vibrations

2. It's evident that her handling of them has bruised the peaches.

(A) promulgated

(B) infatuated

(C) damaged

3. Maria Chapman, abolitionist and close associate of William Lloyd Garrison, wrote many brochures condemning slavery.

(A) slogans

(B) short poems

(C) short pamphlets

4. These scissors are blunt and can not cut paper.

(A) weak

(B) broken

(C) dull

5. The formerly barren land has been changed into stretches of rich fields.

(A) dirty

(B) infertile

(C) untouched



第一部分

bankrupt［'bæŋkrʌpt］

adj. 破产的

例　The recession had led to many small businesses going bankrupt. 经济萧条导致许多小公司破产。

vt. 使破产

例　Foolish expenditures will bankrupt the company. 胡乱花钱会导致公司破产。

记　bank（银行）+ rupt（断）→ 从银行断了来源的 → 破产的

联　bankruptcy n. 破产；disrupt vt. 使分裂；eruption n. 爆发；interruption n. 打断

barber［'bɑ:bə(r)］

n. 理发师〈同 haircutter〉

例　It's time you went to the barber's. 你该去理发了。

barely［'beəli］

adv. ① 仅仅〈同 just〉

例　She was barely fifteen when she won her first championship. 她拿到第一个冠军的时候才15岁。

② 几乎不能〈同 hardly, scarcely〉

例　I hurt my foot and can barely walk. 我的脚受伤了，几乎没法走路。

barrel［'bærəl］

n. 桶〈同 vessel〉

例　The price of oil is usually given per barrel. 油价通常按桶计算。





barren［'bærən］

adj. 贫瘠的；荒凉的〈同 infertile, desolate〉

例　The barren soil of the Rocky Mountains provides few nutrients to the grasses growing there. 落基山贫瘠的土壤几乎无法给生长在那里的草提供足够的营养。

记　barr（= bare 光光的）+ en → 一无所有的 → 贫瘠的

联　barrenness n. 荒凉

basement［'beɪsmənt］

n. 地下室〈同 cellar〉

例　The toy department is in the basement of the store. 玩具部设在商场的地下楼层。

batch［bætʃ］

n.（面包等）一炉，一批；（人或物）一批

例　Our second batch of bread was better than the first. 我们第二批的面包要比第一批的好。

beneath［bɪ'ni:θ］

prep./adv. 在…之下〈同 below〉

例　The submarine disappeared beneath the waves. 潜水艇消失在浪涛之下。

betray［bɪ'treɪ］

vt. ① 背叛〈同 be disloyal to〉

例　Mary betrayed Bill by having a love affair. 玛丽背叛了比尔，和别人谈恋爱了。

②（非故意地）暴露，显露〈同 indicate, show〉

例　Although she is nervous on stage, her actions do not betray her feelings. 虽然她在舞台上很紧张，但是并没有在肢体动作中表现出来。

联　tray n. 碟子；astray adj. 迷路的；traitor n. 叛徒

bewilder［bɪ'wɪldə(r)］

vt. 使迷惑，使不知所措〈同 confuse〉

例　The police are bewildered by the mystery of the murder. 这起神秘的凶杀案让警察感到很困惑。

自我检测　从第一部分中选出最适当的词填入空格内。

6. The traitor ______ his country.

7. ______ are usually made of boards held together by hoops（箍）.

8. The company went ______ after a series of bad business decisions.

9. The foreign city ______ him and he did not know where to go.

10. The ______ is the lowest story of a building, partly or wholly below ground.

11. I could not find a job for the whole year and have ______ enough money to live on.



第二部分

bias［'baɪəs］

n. 偏见；偏好〈同 prejudice, preference〉

例　A committee has been established to address the problem of racial and sexual bias within the industry. 已成立了一个委员会以解决行业内的种族和性别歧视问题。

联　biased adj. 有偏见的；unbiased adj. 没有偏见的

bibliography［ˌbɪblɪ'ɒgrəfi］

n.（有关某一专题或某一作者的）书目，参考书目

例　How many books were listed in this bibliography? 这个参考书目里列了多少本书？

记　biblio（圣经，书）+ graphy → 书目

联　bibliographer n. 书志学家，书目提要编著人

biography［baɪ'ɒgrəfi］

n. 传记

例　The reading of a biography gives a knowledge of people and events that cannot always be obtained from history books. 阅读传记能让人获得关于人物和事件的知识，而这些知识通常在历史书上是学不到的。

联　biographer n. 传记作者；autobiography n. 自传

bizarre［bɪ'zɑ:(r)］

adj.（指态度、容貌、款式等）奇异的，古怪的〈同 odd, fantastic〉

例　The frost made bizarre figures on the windowpanes. 霜冻在窗户玻璃上形成了奇异的图案。

blaze［bleɪz］

vi. 燃烧，照耀〈同 burn brightly〉

例　A fire was blazing in the fireplace. 壁炉中的火正在燃烧。

n. 火焰，光辉〈同 flame〉

例　We could see the blaze of the campfire across the beach. 我们在海滩这边能看见那边篝火的火焰。





blazing［'bleɪzɪŋ］

adj. 燃烧的；闪耀的〈同 burning, bright〉

例　I had to leave the blazing heat of the midday sun. 我不得不躲避正午烈日的炙烤。

联　ablaze adj. 着火的，闪耀的

bleak［bli:k］

adj. 荒凉的；凄凉的；寒冷的，阴冷的〈同 desolate, barren〉

例　The rocky peaks of high mountains are bleak. 高山顶上覆盖着岩石，一片荒凉。

记　bleak（参考bleach：漂白，变白）→ 空白的，什么也没有的 → 凄凉的

联　bleach v. 变白，漂白

bless［bles］

vt. 祝福，保佑；赐予，给予

例　My parents were blessed with good health. 我的父母有幸拥有健康的身体。

联　blessing n. 恩赐

blossom［'blɒsəm］

n./vi.（开）花〈同 bloom〉

例　The apple tree is covered in blossoms. 那棵苹果树开满了花。

blunder［'blʌndə(r)］

vt. 跌跌撞撞地走；（犯）大错，做错〈同 stumble〉

例　The exhausted boy blundered through the woods in the dark night. 这个筋疲力尽的男孩在夜晚的森林中跌跌撞撞地行走。

n. 大错〈同 stupid mistake〉

例　Misspelling the title of a book is a silly blunder to make. 把书名拼写错是一个很愚蠢的错误。

记　bl + under → 把bl看作blow（打）→ 犯大错，被打到下面 → 犯大错

联　flounder vi. 困难地往前走，踌躇；plunder v. 抢劫

自我检测　从第二部分中选出最适当的词填入空格内。

12. A ______ is a list of books or articles by a certain author or about a particular subject.

13. The ______ winter wind made us shiver.

14. I ______ through the dark house.

15. A. umpire（裁判员）should have no ______.

16. All the orchards ______ in spring.

17. The priest ______ the temple after its construction.



第三部分

blunt［blʌnt］

adj. ① 直言不讳的〈同 outspoken, candid〉

例　In the army, he was famous for his rough edges and blunt speech. 在军队里，他以不修边幅、说话直率而闻名。

②（刀、铅笔等）钝的，不尖的〈同 dull〉

例　This knife is too blunt to cut vegetables; could you sharpen it? 这把刀太钝了，没法切菜。你能把它磨得锋利一点吗？

记　blu（参考blur：含糊不清）+ nt → 不锋利的 → 钝的

blush［blʌʃ］

vi. 脸红，羞愧〈同 flush〉

例　She always blushes when she is embarrassed. 她在感到尴尬的时候通常会脸红。





boycott［'bɔɪkɒt］

n./vt. 联合抵制；拒绝交往或购买〈同 shun〉

例　The group has threatened to boycott the election because it believes it will not be democratic. 该小组威胁要抵制选举，因他们认为这次选举会不民主。

记　来自人名Boycott，历史上一位英国驻爱尔兰的官员，其因拒绝降低房地租而受到爱尔兰人抵制，最终被迫离开爱尔兰。

brace［breɪs］

vt. 支撑〈同 support〉

例　We braced the roof with four poles. 我们用四根柱子来支撑屋顶。

n. 支柱；【医】矫形支架

例　I had to wear braces for my crooked teeth when I was a teenager. 我在十几岁的时候，必须戴矫形牙套来矫正长歪的牙齿。

记　brace 原指两只手臂，用手支撑 → 支架

联　embrace v. 拥抱；bracelet n. 手镯

bracket［'brækɪt］

n. 托架

例　A bracket is fastened to a wall and used to support something such as a shelf. 支架被固定在墙上，用来支撑架子等物品。

vt. 用托架来固定

例　She bracketed the shelves to make them stronger. 她用托架固定架子，使其更牢固。

brake［breɪk］

n. 刹车闸

例　A brake is anything used to slow or stop the motion of a wheel or vehicle by pressing or by rubbing against the wheel. 刹车闸是通过挤压或摩擦车轮而使车辆减速或者停止的装置。

v.（使）刹车〈同 stop〉

例　The bus braked to avoid hitting the pedestrian. 公交车刹车以避免撞到行人。

breakdown［'breɪkdaʊn］

n. ① 失败；（机械的）故障〈同 failure〉

例　I had a breakdown in the middle of the trip. 在旅途中，我（的车）出故障了。

② 分解；细目，分类〈同 decomposition〉

例　Fungi obtain their supplies either from the breakdown of dead organic matter or from other living organisms. 细菌既可以从死亡生物体的分解中获得养分，也可以从生物活体获得养分。

breathe［bri:ð］

v. 呼吸，呼出〈同 respire〉

例　I like to breathe deeply of the fresh spring air. 我喜欢深吸春天的新鲜空气。

联　breathing n. 呼吸；breath n. 呼吸，气息；breathless adj. 无声息的，喘不过气来的

bribe［braɪb］

n. 贿赂

例　The driver who caused the accident offered the police officer a bribe to let her go. 那起交通事故的肇事司机贿赂警察，好让警察放她走。

vt. 贿赂，向…行贿

例　A gambler bribed one of the boxers to lose the fight. 一个赌徒收买了其中的一个拳击手，让他输掉比赛。

brim［brɪm］

n. 边；边缘〈同 edge〉

例　Please do not fill my cup to the brim because I always put a lot of cream in my coffee. 请别把我的杯子倒满，因为我总会往咖啡里放很多奶油。

联　broad-brimmed adj. 宽边的

自我检测　从第三部分中选出最适当的词填入空格内。

18. The side wall of the old house was ______ with a wooden support to prevent it from collapsing.

19. He sharpened the ______ knife before he started to cook.

20. People were urged to ______ the country's products to force it to change its policies.

21. People in that country usually ______ an official to get things done.

22. The bowl was filled to the ______ with soup.

23. The driver ______ the speeding car and it slid to a stop.



第四部分

brisk［brɪsk］

adj. 活泼的，轻快的〈同 energetic〉

例　Grandmother likes to take a brisk walk every morning to exercise. 祖母喜欢每天早上散会儿步，锻炼锻炼身体。

联　briskness n. 敏捷，活泼

brittle［'brɪtəl］

adj. 易碎的〈同 breakable, fragile〉

例　The pond was covered with a brittle layer of ice. 池塘表面覆盖着一层薄薄的冰。

记　联想记忆：brim（杯边，缘）+ rattle（嘎嘎地响）→ 一击杯边嘎嘎地响 → 易碎的

联　bristle n. 刚毛，猪鬃 v.（使毛发等）竖起，发怒；rattle vi. 喋喋不休，嘎嘎地响

brochure［'brəʊʃə(r); (US)brəʊ'ʃʊər］

n. 小册子〈同 short pamphlet〉

例　The brochure included a price list for cottage rentals. 手册包含小别墅租金价格表。

bronze［brɒnz］

n. 青铜；铜像

例　The church bell is made of bronze. 教堂的钟是由青铜铸成的。

联　Bronze Age 青铜器时代；sun-bronzed adj. 被太阳晒成古铜色的

brood［bru:d］

n. 一窝；（一个家庭的）所有孩子

例　That mother and father have a brood of twelve children. 那对父母养育了12个孩子。

vt. 孵化

例　Hens and other birds brood till the young are hatched. 母鸡和其他鸟类会一直孵自己生的蛋，直到幼雏被孵化出来。

broom［bru:m］

n. 扫帚

例　A broom is a brush with a long handle for sweeping. 扫帚是一种有着长把、用来扫地的、像刷子一样的工具。





bruise［bru:z］

n. 淤伤，擦伤〈同 abrasion〉

例　The bruise on my arm turned black and blue. 我胳膊上的擦伤变得青一块紫一块的。

v. 打伤；撞伤〈同 injure〉

例　Rough handling bruised the apples before they reached the market. 苹果还没送到市场，就被野蛮装卸碰伤了。

brutal［'bru:təl］

adj. 野蛮的，残忍的〈同 cruel〉

例　The brutal coach persisted in asking the team to run all afternoon under the hot sun. 这个残忍的教练坚持让队员们在烈日下跑了一下午。

记　brut（野兽的）+ al → 野兽般的 → 残忍的

联　brutality n. 野蛮，残忍

bud［bʌd］

n. 芽，蓓蕾〈同 shoot〉

例　The trees all round were covered in buds. 周围的树都发芽了。

vi. 发芽〈同 sprout〉

例　Most of the trees and flowers bud in the spring. 大多数的树和花在春天发芽。

联　taste bud 味蕾；buddy n. 密友，伙伴

buffer［'bʌfə(r)］

n. 缓冲器；缓冲者；缓冲物

例　He acted as a buffer between the quarreling children. 他调解了两个孩子的争吵。

音频



预备测验

找出与句子中划线单词意义最相近的词。

1. Some animals, such as rodents, are able to clasp their food with their paws.

(A) bury

(B) hold

(C) eat

2. In what category do Thomas Jefferson and Abraham Lincoln belong?

(A) group

(B) order

(C) party

3. Bladder wrack（墨角藻）, a tough, leathery brown seaweed, clings to rocks tenaciously.

(A) grows under

(B) hides under

(C) sticks to

4. Swifts（雨燕）build nests made of twigs that they cement together with their saliva.

(A) press

(B) push

(C) stick

5. Agricultural experts always caution farmers to irrigate in regions receiving only light rainfall.

(A) tell

(B) teach

(C) warn



第一部分

bulletin［'bʊlətɪn］

n. 公告，报告〈同 announcement〉

例　Sports bulletins and weather bulletins are published in most newspapers. 大部分报纸都刊登体育新闻快报和天气快报。

burden［'bɜ:dn］

n. 担子，货物；负担〈同 load〉

例　The camel collapsed under its heavy burden. 骆驼被身上沉重的货物压垮了。

bureaucracy［bjʊə'rɒkrəsi］

n. 官僚，官僚作风

例　I had to deal with the university's bureaucracy before I could change from one course to another. 要想调课，我必须先和学校的官僚体制打好交道。

联　bureaucrat n. 官僚主义者

butter［'bʌtə(r)］

n. 奶油

例　Bread and butter were served at dinner. 晚餐有面包和黄油。

联　butterfly n.【动】蝴蝶，蝶泳

buzz［bʌz］

n. 嗡嗡声

例　The buzz of the bee around me was annoying. 蜜蜂在我身边嗡嗡地叫，让我很烦。

联　buzzer n.蜂鸣器





bypass［'baɪpɑ:s; (US)'baɪpæs］

vt. 迂回，绕过〈同 avoid〉

例　We were in a hurry so we decided to bypass the shopping mall because we knew there'd be a lot of traffic. 为了赶时间，我们决定绕开那个购物中心，因为我们知道那儿的路会很堵。

by-product［'baɪˌprɒdʌkt］

n. 副产品〈同 derivative〉

例　Buttermilk is a by-product of making butter. 酪乳是制作黄油时产生的副产品。

cabin［'kæbɪn］

n. 小屋；船舱〈同 cottage〉

例　She went to her mountain cabin for the weekend. 她去她的山中小屋过周末。

canvas［'kænvəs］

n. 帆布；画布

例　Most of the soldiers carried canvas bags. 大多数士兵都背着帆布包。

联　canvass v. 征求意见，游说拉票；convalesce vt. 渐渐康复

captive［'kæptɪv］

n. 俘虏〈同 prisoner〉

例　The pirates took many captives during raids along the coast. 海盗在海岸沿线地区进行突袭，抓获了很多俘虏。

联　captivate vt. 迷住，迷惑；captivity n. 囚禁；capture vt. 俘获，捕获

6. The artist painted on a large ______.

7. Kerosene is a ______ of petroleum refining.

8. The weather ______ came over the radio an hour before the storm arrived.

9. The ______ of whispers stopped when the teacher entered the room.

10. The ship's captain asked all passengers to return to the ______.

11. Managing two stores would be a ______ to someone without any management experience.



第二部分

cargo［'kɑ:gəʊ］

n. 货物〈同 shipload, freight〉

例　Cargo is carried on ships, airplanes and trucks. 货物由船只、飞机和卡车装运。

carpenter［'kɑ:pɪntə(r)］

n. 木匠〈同 woodworker〉

例　The carpenter built a beautiful spiral staircase. 木匠建了一座漂亮的旋转式楼梯。

carve［kɑ:v］

vt. ① 把（熟肉）切成片〈同 cut〉

例　The grandmother carves the Thanksgiving Day turkey. 祖母把感恩节火鸡切成片。

② 雕刻〈同 sculpt〉

例　She likes to carve animals out of pieces of wood. 她喜欢用木头块雕刻出动物的形象。

联　carver n. 雕刻匠，雕工





castle［'kɑ:sl; (US)'kæsl］

n. 城堡〈同 citadel〉

例　The knight rode over the drawbridge into the castle. 骑士骑马穿过吊桥，进入了城堡。

casualty［'kæʒʊəlti］

n. 事故；伤亡者〈同 accident〉

例　Tom saw a casualty on the highway and phoned the police. 汤姆在公路上看见了一起事故，然后打电话报警了。

记　casual（随便的）+ ty → 因为随便而造成的事故 → 事故

联　casual adj. 偶然的

catalogue［'kætəlɒg］

n. 目录〈同 directory〉

例　We looked through the store's catalogue to determine what to buy. 我们浏览了一遍商店的商品目录来决定买什么。

category［'kætəgəri］

n. 种类，类目；范畴〈同 classification〉

例　The characters in the story can be divided into two categories: good people and bad people. 故事中的人物可以分为两类：好人和坏人。

联　categorize vt. 分类

cater［'keɪtə(r)］

vi. 满足，迎合（需要）（to）〈同 satisfy〉

例　Nowadays TV caters to many different tastes. 现在的电视节目迎合着许多人不同的品位。

联　caterpillar n. 毛虫

caution［'kɔ:ʃən］

n. 小心，谨慎〈同 care〉

例　Always use caution when crossing streets. 过马路的时候要小心。

vt. 警告〈同 warn〉

例　I cautioned them against playing in the street. 我警告他们不要在马路上玩耍。

联　cautious adj. 谨慎的，小心的

cavity［'kævɪti］

n. 洞；腔〈同 cavern〉

例　The liver lies mainly on the right side of the abdominal cavity. 肝脏大体位于腹腔的右侧。

联　cavil v. 挑剔；cavern n. 大洞穴；cavalry n. 骑兵；cavalier n. 骑士

16. The explosion made a large ______ in the ground.

第三部分

cellar［'selə(r)］

n. 地窖，地下室

例　A cellar is an underground room, usually under a building and often used for storing food or fuel. 地窖是一种地下室，通常位于建筑物的地下部分，用于储藏食物或者燃料。

cement［sɪ'ment］

n. 水泥；接合剂〈同 plaster〉

例　She wrote her name in the wet cement of the new sidewalk. 新修的人行横道水泥还未干，她在上面写下了自己的名字。

v. 接合，胶合；巩固

例　The marriage of our son to their daughter cemented the friendship of our two families. 我们的儿子和他们的女儿的婚姻加深了我们两家人的情谊。

census［'sensəs］

n. 人口调查，人口普查

例　We have a census in China every ten years. 中国每隔十年进行一次人口普查。

联　censure n./v. 责难

cereal［'sɪərɪəl］

n. 谷物；谷类食品〈同 grain〉

例　Oatmeal and cornmeal are cereals. 麦片和玉米粉属于谷类食品。

certainty［'sɜ:tənti］

n. 确定；确实的事情〈同 freedom from doubt, a sure fact〉

例　There are few absolute certainties in life. 生活中很少有绝对确定的事情。

certify［'sɜ:tɪfaɪ］

v. 证明；保证〈同 verify, guarantee〉

例　This diploma certifies that you have completed high school. 这张文凭证明你完成了高中学业。

cherish［'tʃerɪʃ］

v. 抱有（希望等）；珍爱〈同 harbor, treasure〉

例　An athlete always cherishes the hope of winning a gold medal. 运动员都希望自己能拿金牌。

childish［'tʃaɪldɪʃ］

adj. 孩子（气）的；幼稚的〈同 immature〉

例　A childish prank ended in a broken window. 窗玻璃被打碎了，孩子的恶作剧才收场。

chorus［'kɔ:rəs］

n. 合唱团〈同 ensemble〉

例　She was always in the chorus, never a star. 她总是唱合唱，成不了明星。





chronic［'krɒnɪk］

adj. 长期的；慢性的〈同 persistent〉

例　The doctors were finally able to attribute his chronic headaches to the gas in his apartment. 医生最终成功诊断出，他慢性头疼的原因在于其公寓里有煤气泄漏。

记　chron（时间）+ ic → 长时间的 → 慢性的

联　chronicle n. 编年史；chronology n. 年代学；synchronize v.（使）同时发生；chromatic adj. 彩色的

自我检测　从第三部分中选出最适当的词填入空格内。

18. Our school ______ gave a concert at the town hall.

19. I ______ the time I've had with my daughter.

20. A ______ is taken to find out the number of people, their age, sex and many other facts about them.

21. The man's ______ was amusing, for we could all see that he was wrong.

22. The fire inspector ______ the school building as fireproof（防火的）.

23. He has suffered from ______ asthma（哮喘）for ten years.



第四部分

civilization［ˌsɪvɪlaɪ'zeɪʃən］

n. 文明，文化；开化

例　The Babylonian culture was an ancient culture with a high degree of civilization. 巴比伦文化是一种有着高度发达文明的古代文化。

联　civilize vt. 使文明，使开化，教化

clarity［'klærɪti］

n. 清晰，易懂〈同 clearness〉

例　Clarity is an essential requirement for any children's textbook. 清晰易懂是所有儿童教材的一项基本要求。

联　clarify v. 澄清，阐明

clasp［klɑ:sp］

vi. 扣紧，紧握〈同 grip〉

例　I clasped the railing as I climbed the stairs. 我爬楼梯的时候，紧紧地扶着栏杆。

clay［kleɪ］

n. 黏土；泥土

例　Bricks, dishes and vases may be made from clay. 砖、盘子和花瓶都可以用黏土制成。

client［'klaɪənt］

n. 顾客，客户〈同 customer〉

例　The stockbroker has several clients whose accounts he oversees. 这位股票经纪人帮忙管理他的几位客户的账户。

climax［'klaɪˌmæks］

n. 高潮；顶点〈同 summit〉

例　The story's climax came when the two people finally married. 两个人最终步入婚姻的殿堂，这个故事的高潮也随之而来。

cling［klɪŋ］

vi. ① 黏紧，附着（to）〈同 stick〉

例　Wet clothes cling to the body. 衣服湿了，贴在身上。

② 坚持（意见），墨守（习惯）（to）〈同 adhere to〉

例　We have no reason to cling to those old ways. 我们没有理由坚持那些老方法。

联　clingy adj. 粘住的，紧贴的；clinch v. 钉牢，决定

clinic［'klɪnɪk］

n. 诊所〈同 dispensary〉

例　He's being treated at a private clinic. 他在一家私人诊所接受治疗。

联　clinical adj. 临床的

clip［klɪp］

vt. 修剪〈同 trim〉

例　Mary clipped a few roses off the bushes. 玛丽从树丛中剪下了几支玫瑰。





clockwise［'klɒkwaɪz］

adj./adv. 顺时针方向的（地）

例　Turn the key clockwise to unlock the door. 顺时针旋转钥匙来打开房门。

联　counterclockwise adj./adv. 逆时针方向的（地）

自我检测　从第四部分中选出最适当的词填入空格内。

26. A sheep's fleece（羊毛）is ______ off to get wool.

27. A visit to the Grand Canyon was the ______ of our vacation.

28. We got our flu shots（流感疫苗）at the local ______.

29. If this restaurant doesn't improve its service, all its ______ will vanish.

Lesson 5





音频



预备测验

找出与句子中划线单词意义最相近的词。

1. We found the professor's talk on nuclear reactors quite coherent.

(A) confusing

(B) logical

(C) irritating

2. Most cloud formations occur when air masses of different temperatures collide.

(A) touch

(B) smash

(C) bump

3. Georgia was colonized by a group of debtors from British prisons.

(A) discovered

(B) explored

(C) settled

4. Clusters of special cells in the pancreas（胰腺）manufacture insulin.

(A) groups

(B) dozens

(C) batches

5. In mountainous regions, much of the snow that falls is compacted into ice.

(A) broken down

(B) embedded

(C) compressed



第一部分

cluster［'klʌstə(r)］

n. 簇，串，群〈同 group, bunch〉

例　A cluster of strawberries grew in the field. 田野里生长着一簇草莓。

vi. 丛生；聚集〈同 concentrate〉

例　Fans clustered round the pop singer when the concert was over. 演唱会结束后，歌迷们簇拥在这位流行歌手的周围。

记　clust（= clot 凝成块）+ er → 凝成块的东西 → 簇，串，群

联　clutch v. 紧握；bluster v.（风、浪）狂作，（人）咆哮，吓唬；fluster vt. 使紧张，使慌乱

clutch［klʌtʃ］

v. 抓住，攫住〈同 grasp tightly〉

例　I clutched the railing to keep my balance. 我抓住栏杆以保持平衡。

n. 一次产的或孵的蛋

例　In the hollow we could see a clutch of beautiful speckled eggs. 在洞里，我们能看见一窝漂亮的带斑点的蛋。

coherent［kəʊ'hɪərənt］

adj. 连贯的；有条理的〈同 logical, sound〉

例　We had expected his presentation speech to be brilliant and illuminating, but it turned out to be not even coherent. 我们原本期望他的演讲能够精彩绝伦、引人深思，但结果连连贯都谈不上。

记　co + her（粘连）+ ent → 共同粘连 → 连贯的

联　cohere vi. 黏着，连贯；coherence n. 一致；incoherence n. 不连贯，语无伦次；adherent n. 皈依者，门徒；inherent adj. 天赋的，生来的

cohesion［kəʊ'hi:ʒən］

n. 附着（力），凝聚力〈同 unity〉

例　Wet sand has more cohesion than dry sand. 湿沙子比干沙子更容易黏结。

联　cohesive adj. 黏着的

coincide［ˌkəʊɪn'saɪd］

vi.（事情等）同时发生；相符合，巧合〈同 concur, correspond〉

例　Our vacations coincided, so we traveled together. 我们同时放假，于是一起去旅行。

记　co + in（进）+ cide（落下）→ 共同落下 → 同时发生

联　coincident adj. 一致的，巧合的；coincidence n. 一致，巧合；coincidental adj. 一致的，巧合的；incident n. 事件，事变

collaborate［kə'læbəreɪt］

vi.（在文艺、科学等方面）协作，合作〈同 cooperate〉

例　Two writers collaborated in preparing this book. 两位作家合作撰写这本书。

记　col（一起）+ labor（劳动）+ ate → 一起劳动 → 协作，合作

联　collaboration n. 合作；collaborative adj. 合作的，协作的

colleague［'kɒli:g］

n. 同事，同僚〈同 associate, coworker〉

例　Janet is a colleague of Mr. Bao and they cooperate very well. 珍妮特是包先生的同事，他们合作得很愉快。

collection［kə'lekʃən］

n. 收藏，搜集品〈同 assemblage〉

例　The collection of these stamps took ten years. 收集这些邮票花了十年的时间。

联　collective adj. 集体的

collide［kə'laɪd］

vi. 碰撞；冲突〈同 crash, conflict〉

例　The bus collided with a car when it tried to avoid a pedestrian. 这辆公交车在避让行人时，与一辆小轿车相撞。

联　collision n. 碰撞，冲突，抵触





colonize［'kɒlənaɪz］

vt. 建立殖民地，拓殖〈同 settle〉

例　The British first colonized Australia in the 18th century. 18世纪，英国建立了其在澳大利亚的第一个殖民地。

联　colony n. 殖民地；colonist n. 殖民者；colonial adj. 殖民的，殖民地的；colonel n. 陆军上校

6. The two authors ______ in writing a history of the United States.

7. Our library has a large ______ of books.

8. The drunk was staggering and barely ______.

9. Janet's boyfriend sent her a ______ of flowers on her birthday and that made her very happy.

10. My version of the accident doesn't ______ with the other driver's story.

11. The two skiers were not injured when they ______ on the slopes.



第二部分

commander［kə'mɑ:ndə(r)］

n. 司令官，指挥员〈同 chief, leader〉

例　The soldiers stood at attention while their commander inspected them. 司令检阅的时候，士兵们都立正站好。

commemorate［kə'meməreɪt］

vt. 纪念〈同 remember〉

例　A statue has been built to commemorate the 100th anniversary of the poet's birthday. 人们建了一座雕像来纪念这位诗人百年诞辰。

联　commemorative adj. 纪念的





commence［kə'mens］

v. 开始，着手〈同 begin, initiate〉

例　The meeting will commence at noon. 会议将于下午开始。

记　com（共同）+ mence（说，做）→ 一起说或做 → 开始，着手

联　commencement n. 开始，毕业典礼

commend［kə'mend］

vt. 称赞〈同 praise〉

例　The judge commended her on her bravery. 法官赞扬了她的勇敢。

记　com + mend（相信）→ 大家相信 → 称赞

联　recommend v. 推荐，介绍；recommendation n. 推荐，介绍（信）

committed［kə'mɪtɪd］

adj. 忠心耿耿的，效忠的；致力的〈同 dedicated, devoted〉

例　ESL teachers are strongly committed to the goals of English language education worldwide. ESL（非母语英语课程）老师们积极致力于在全球范围推广英语教育。

联　commit vt. 犯（错误），干（坏事）；commitment n. 许诺，委托事项；committee n. 委员会

commodity［kə'mɒdɪti］

n. 商品，日用品〈同 goods〉

例　Groceries are commodities. 杂货属于商品。

commonplace［'kɒmənpleɪs］

adj. 平凡的〈同 ordinary〉

例　The plots of TV plays are often commonplace and nearly everyone is tired of them. 电视剧的情节总是老生常谈，几乎所有人都感到厌烦。

community［kə'mju:nɪti］

n. 社区；社会〈同 society〉

例　The farmer lived in a rural community. 那位农民在农村生活。

commute［kə'mju:t］

vi. 通勤（经常乘汽车或火车往返于两地之间）

例　Most of our students live in the suburbs and commute to school. 我们的大多数学生都住在城郊，每天乘车来上学。

联　commuter n. 通勤者，经常往返者；telecommuter n.（在家里通过使用与工作单位连接的计算机终端来工作的）远程工作者

compact［kəm'pækt］

adj. 紧凑的，紧密的；简洁的〈同 compressed, concise〉

例　What a compact office! How did you fit so much into so little space? 你的办公室真紧凑！你是如何把这么多的东西放进这么小的房间的？

vt. 压缩；使密集〈同 tighten〉

例　Cars had compacted the snow until it was like ice. 雪被汽车碾来碾去，最后都变得像冰一样。

联　compaction n. 压紧

第三部分

companion［kəm'pænɪən］

n. 同伴；同事〈同 associate, partner〉

例　John was Janet's companion at the party and they are really well-matched. 在聚会上，约翰是珍妮特的男伴，他们两人确实很般配。

comparable［'kɒmpərəbəl］

adj. 可比的，比得上的；类似的〈同 equivalent, similar〉

例　The new legislation requires that women get the same pay as men for comparable jobs. 新的立法要求女性在从事和男性类似的工作时，要获得和男性同等的报酬。

记　com（共同）+ par（平等）+ able → 能一起平等的 → 类似的

联　compare v. 比较，对照；comparison n. 比较

comparatively［kəm'pærətɪvli］

adv. 相当地；比较地〈同 rather, relatively〉

例　Generating electricity from coal is a comparatively new development in that country. 在那个国家，依靠煤来发电是一项相对较新的发展。

联　comparative adj. 比较的

compatible［kəm'pætɪbəl］

adj. 可以并存的，相容的，协调的〈同 agreeable〉

例　Fortunately, my roommate and I are quite compatible and we never quarrel with each other. 幸运的是，我和我的室友和睦相处，从来都没有吵过架。

记　com + pat（= path 感情）+ ible → 能有感情的 → 相容的

联　compatibility n. 兼容性；incompatible adj. 不协调的，不相容的，不一致的

compensate［'kɒmpenseɪt］

vt. 补偿，赔偿

例　He plans to follow a study program at home to compensate for his lack of college education. 他打算在家执行一项学习计划来弥补大学教育的缺失。

联　compensation n. 补偿，赔偿；compensatory adj. 补偿性的

compete［kəm'pi:t］

vi. 竞争，比得上〈同 vie, contest〉

例　When the amateur became a pro he had to compete against better men. 业余选手成为专业选手后，必须要和更强大的对手来竞争。

联　competitor n. 竞争者；competition n. 竞争，竞赛；competitive adj. 竞争的；competitiveness n. 竞争能力；competent adj. 有能力的，胜任的；competence n. 能力





compile［kəm'paɪl］

vt. 汇集，编辑〈同 collect, gather〉

例　The scientists compiled a great amount of data to help prove their theory. 科学家收集了大量的数据来帮助证明他们的理论。

记　com + pile（堆）→ 堆积 → 汇集

complaint［kəm'pleɪnt］

n. 抱怨，怨言〈同 grievance, criticism〉

例　The boss had a complaint about Bill's tardiness. 老板对比尔的拖延有所抱怨。

联　complain v. 抱怨，悲叹

complement

［'kɒmplɪment］ vt. 补充，使完善〈同 supplement〉

例　The flower arrangement complements the table decorations. 花的摆放与桌饰互为补充。

［'kɒmpləmənt］ n. 补足物，补充物〈同 addition〉

例　Your choice of wine was a fine complement to the dinner. 你选择的红酒与晚餐相得益彰。

记　com（加强作用）+ ple（装满，填满）+ ment → 补足物，补充

联　complementary adj. 补充的；implement n. 工具 vt. 实施，执行；compliment n./v. 称赞

complication［ˌkɒmplɪ'keɪʃən］

n. 复杂化；（使复杂的）因素〈同 intricacy〉

例　In spite of the complication of the problem, the mathematician solved it quickly. 尽管这个问题很复杂，那位数学家还是很快地解决了。

联　complicate vt. 使复杂；complicated adj. 复杂的，难解的

20. The teacher considers homework a necessary ______ to classroom work.

21. The children mowed our lawn to ______ us for the window they broke while playing ball.

22. A small car is not ______ to a larger one for comfort.

第四部分

compliment［'kɒmplɪment］

n. 恭维，称赞〈同 praise〉

例　She received several compliments on her excellent performance in the play. 她表演得十分精彩，得到了一些称赞。

联　complimentary adj. 称赞的

comply［kəm'plaɪ］

vi. 顺从，遵守（with）〈同 obey, conform to〉

例　My brother was always criticized by my parents because he did not comply with their rules. 我的弟弟不听父母的话，总是被他们批评。

component［kəm'pəʊnənt］

n. 成分，组成部分〈同 constituent, element〉

例　An essay question is one component of the test. 作文题是测试的一部分。

记　com（一起）+ pon（放置）+ ent → 把散的放置在一起 → 成分

联　opponent n. 对手；proponent n. 支持者；exponent n. 说明者

composite［'kɒmpəzɪt］

adj. 合成的，复合的〈同 compound〉

例　She made a composite photograph by putting together parts of several others. 她把其他照片的部分拼凑在一起，合成了一张新的照片。

n. 综合体，合成物〈同 combination〉

例　Brass is a composite of copper and zinc. 黄铜是铜与锌的合金。

记　com + pos（放）+ ite → 放在一起的 → 合成的

composition［ˌkɒmpə'zɪʃən］

n. ① 构成，组成〈同 makeup, constitution〉

例　The design was a highly formal composition of diverse elements. 这个设计是多种元素的高度融合。

② 写作，作文；作曲〈同 writing〉

例　The student wrote a composition for her English writing class. 那个学生应英语写作课的要求写了一篇作文。

联　decomposition n. 分解，腐烂

compulsory［kəm'pʌlsəri］

adj. 必须做的，被强制的〈同 mandatory〉

例　Attending school is compulsory until age sixteen. 16岁前的教育都是义务教育。

conceive［kən'si:v］

vt. 构思；设想〈同 design, consider〉

例　She conceived a plan to expand her company's business. 她想出了一个扩大公司业务的计划。

记　con + ceive（拿）→ 拿住（想法）→ 构想

联　conceivable adj. 想像得出的，可信的；receive v. 接受；perceive v. 发觉





conception［kən'sepʃən］

n. 观念，认识〈同 thought〉

例　We have no real conception of what people suffered during the war, because our country was not involved in it. 我们对于在战争中人们所遭受的苦难没有真切的认识，因为我们国家没有卷入战争。

联　conceptual adj. 概念上的

concert［'kɒnsət; 'kɒnsɜ:t］

n. ① 音乐会

例　The pianist will give a concert at the music hall. 那位钢琴家将在音乐厅举办一场音乐会。

② 一致；共同〈同 harmony, accord〉

例　Two countries acted in concert with each other to stop a war. 两个国家共同行动，制止了一场战争。

联　concerted adj. 商议好的，协定的；concerto n. 协奏曲

concise［kən'saɪs］

adj. 简洁的，简明的〈同 succinct〉

例　In spite of the vast number of details in the United States Constitution, the document is remarkably concise. 尽管美国宪法有许多细节，但是这部宪法还是相当简明的。

记　con + cise（切掉）→ 把（多余的）全部切掉 → 简洁

联　concision n. 简洁；excise vt. 切除，删去；incise vt. 切割，雕刻；precise adj. 精确的

Exercise 2　找出与句子中划线单词意义最相近的词。

37. After 1850, various states in the United States began to pass compulsory school attendance laws.

(A) harsh

(B) diversified

(C) mandatory

38. Cosmologists are more concerned with the origin and evolution of the universe than with the composition of the planets and stars.

(A) interaction

(B) background

(C) makeup

39. The initial appearance of the silver three-cent piece coincided with the first issue of three-cent stamps in 1851.

(A) occurred at the same time as

(B) collided with

(C) was necessitated by

40. Salt has been an important commodity for much of recorded time.

(A) flavoring

(B) preservative

(C) article of trade

41. He is going to compile the data requested by the tax collector.

(A) sprout

(B) evade

(C) gather

42. Beans are comparable to meat as a source of protein.

(A) equivalent

(B) complementary

(C) preferable

43. Citizens who collaborated with the enemy during the war were executed after the war.

(A) resisted

44. James Monroe was by no means regarded as commonplace by his contemporaries.

(A) obey

46. A. early form of softball originated in 1895, when a Minneapolis firefighter decided to provide a simple and inexpensive recreational outlet for his colleagues.

(A) fellow workers

(B) friends and family

(C) university

Lesson 6





音频



预备测验

找出与句子中划线单词意义最相近的词。

1. The research team needs to confer with the director before it begins its final report.

(A) argue

(B) debate

(C) consult

2. Representatives try to act in the interest of their constituents.

(A) campaign contributors

(B) parties

(C) districts' voters

3. Relations between the two countries have never been more cordial.

(A) strained

(B) pleasant

(C) unsympathetic

4. The consensus among the senators was that the bill would not be passed.

(A) controversy

(B) gathering

(C) agreement

5. Mary McCarthy's satires are couched in a prose style that has a classic precision.

(A) expressed

(B) prefaced

(C) fused



第一部分

condensation［ˌkɒnden'seɪʃən］

n. 压缩，浓缩〈同 compression〉

例　This 10-page summary is a condensation of a 100-page report. 这份10页的总结是一份100页报告的浓缩。

联　condense v.（使）浓缩，精简；condenser n. 冷凝器

confer［kən'fɜ:(r)］

v. ① 颁给，赋予（on）〈同 bestow〉

例　The President of Harvard University conferred a doctorate on the distinguished politician. 哈佛大学校长授予这位著名的政治家博士头衔。

② 协商（with）〈同 consult〉

例　One should confer with one's elders before making a big decision. 在做重大决定之前应该和前辈商量一下。

联　conference n. 会议；conferee n. 参加会议者





conference［'kɒnfərəns］

n. 会议；协商会，讨论会〈同 meeting, discussion〉

例　A conference was called to discuss getting a playground for the school. 为了讨论给学校建操场的事情召开了一次会议。

confidential［ˌkɒnfɪ'denʃəl］

adj. 秘密的，机密的〈同 secret〉

例　Only highly trusted employees could read the confidential report. 只有非常可信的雇员才能看这份机密报告。

记　con + fid（相信）+ ent + ial → 被相信才能知道的 → 机密的

联　confide v. 吐露，信托；confident adj. 自信的，有把握的；confidant n. 知心朋友；diffident adj. 自卑的，胆怯的；perfidy n. 不忠实，背叛；affidavit n. 口供书，宣誓书

configuration［kənˌfɪgə'reɪʃən; (US)kənˌfɪgjʊ'reɪʃən］

n. 轮廓，构形〈同 outline〉

例　Geographers study the configuration of the surface of the earth. 地理学家研究地球表面的地形构造。

记　con + figur(e)（形状）+ aion → 全部形状 → 轮廓

联　figure n. 轮廓；figurative adj. 比喻的；figurine n. 小雕像

conform［kən'fɔ:m］

vi. 遵守，顺从；符合（to）〈同 comply with, follow〉

例　Every member must conform to the rules of our club. 每位会员必须遵守我们社团的规章制度。

联　conformity n. 一致，符合；nonconformity n. 不墨守成规，不一致；nonconformist n. 不守成规者

congratulation［kənˌgrætjʊ'leɪʃən］

n. 祝贺，道喜

例　I sent a card of congratulation to the newly married couple. 我给这对新婚夫妇发了一张祝福贺卡。

conscientious［ˌkɒnʃɪ'enʃəs］

adj. 尽责的，一丝不苟的〈同 responsible, reliable〉

例　Conscientious work is careful and exact. 认真尽责的工作意味着细心和准确。

记　con（全部）+ sci（知道）+ ent + ious → 知道、关心多的 → 有责任心的

联　conscious adj. 有意识的，自觉的；conscience n. 良心

consecutive［kən'sekjʊtɪv］

adj. 连续的〈同 successive, sequential〉

例　He was reelected for four consecutive terms. 他又连着当选了四次。

记　con + secu（跟随）+ tive → 一个接一个地跟随 → 连续的

consensus［kən'sensəs］

n. 意见一致〈同 agreement〉

例　The council reached a consensus on the date of the election. 委员会就选举日期达成一致。

记　con + sensus（感觉，认识）→ 共识 → 意见一致

联　sensible adj. 明智的；sensitive adj. 敏感的

自我检测　从第一部分中选出最适当的词填入空格内。

6. I ______ my dentist about getting braces for my teeth.

7. She does not want others to know that she has been married, so she told me in low, ______ tones.

8. Janet was a ______ employee who never left before her work was done.

9. The club members finally reached a ______ about adopting the proposal.

10. I sent her my ______ when she graduated from college.

11. Our teachers have ______ with their students' parents each semester.



第二部分

consent［kən'sent］

n./vi. 同意，赞同〈同 approval, agree〉

例　You need the principal's consent to leave campus. 你得到校长的同意才可以离开学校。

consequent［'kɒnsɪkwənt］

adj. 作为结果的，随之发生的〈同 resulting〉

例　His long illness and consequent absence put him far behind in his work. 他久病请假，使他的工作落后了许多。

联　consequence n. 结果

conserve［kən'sɜ:v］

vt. 保存，保藏〈同 preserve〉

例　An experienced backpacker can give you many suggestions for conserving energy on a long, tough hike. 一位经验丰富的背包客可以在长途跋涉方面给你很多保存体力的建议。

联　conservation n. 保存，保持；conservationist n.（天然资源的）保护理论者

consolidate［kən'sɒlɪdeɪt］

v. ① 巩固〈同 strengthen〉

例　The political party consolidated its power by winning many state elections. 该政党赢得很多州的选票，巩固了势力。

② 合并〈同 combine〉

例　If we consolidate our efforts, we'll get the job done much faster. 如果我们共同努力，就会更早地完成这项工作。

记　con + solid（结实）+ ate → 巩固

联　consolidation n. 巩固，合并；solidity n. 坚固；solidarity n. 团结；consolation n. 安慰

conspicuous［kən'spɪkjʊəs］

adj. 显著的；显眼的，引人注目的〈同 noticeable〉

例　With everyone else dressed in colorful party clothes, my old blue jeans were painfully conspicuous. 其他人都穿了艳丽的礼服，和他们在一起，我旧旧的蓝色牛仔裤特别扎眼。

记　con（大家）+ spic（看）+ uous → 大家都看见的 → 显眼的

联　perspicuous adj. 明白的，明晰的





constituent［kən'stɪtjʊənt］

n. ① 成分，要素〈同 component, ingredient〉

例　Hydrogen and oxygen are the constituents of water. 氢和氧是水的成分。

② 选举者〈同 voter〉

例　As a senator he was excellent—always talking to his constituents and listening to their problems. 这位参议员很优秀，他总是耐心与选民交谈并认真聆听他们的问题。

记　con + stit（= stat 站）+ uent → 站在一起的东西 → 成分

联　constitution n. 宪法，构成；institute vt. 创立 n. 学院；destitute adj. 缺乏的；restitute vt. 归还

constrain［kən'streɪn］

vt. 限制，抑制；约束；关押〈同 restrain〉

例　Bill tried to constrain a cough during the lecture. 上课时比尔尽量忍着不咳嗽。

联　constraint n. 约束，强迫；restrain vt. 抑制

construct［kən'strʌkt］

vt. 建造；创立〈同 build〉

例　Eye witness reports constructed a detailed description of the man. 目击者的报告构成了有关此人相貌的一幅详图。

联　construction n. 建筑，建造

consume［kən'sju:m; (US)kən'su:m］

vt. 消费，消耗；大吃大喝〈同 devour, eat〉

例　At our Thanksgiving dinner, we consumed an entire turkey. 感恩节晚餐我们吃了一整只火鸡。

联　consumer n. 消费者；consumption n. 消耗，消费；costume n. 服装；resume v. 继续；presume v. 假定

contaminate［kən'tæmɪneɪt］

vt. 弄脏，污染；感染〈同 pollute, taint〉

例　The wound was contaminated by bacteria. 伤口受到了细菌感染。

联　contamination n. 玷污，污染；contaminant n. 致污物，污染物；contagious adj. 传染性的

13. The marathon runner ______ her energy for the final mile.

14. Toxic waste from the factory ______ our drinking water.

15. I ______ almost all the money I earned last summer and am broke now.

16. The three banks ______ and formed a single large bank.

17. We ______ the dog with a chain tied to a pole.



第三部分

contemplate［'kɒntempleɪt］

v. 注视；沉思，（对…做）周密考虑〈同 ponder〉

例　Please contemplate my request before answering. 答复之前请认真考虑下我的请求。

记　con + templ（思考，观察）+ ate → 全心思考 → 深思

联　contemplation n. 注视，沉思；temple n. 太阳穴，庙宇

contempt［kən'tempt］

n. 轻视，蔑视〈同 scorn〉

例　I have great contempt for people who hurt others. 我特别鄙视伤害别人的人。

联　contemptible adj. 可轻视的，可鄙的；tempt vt. 诱惑；attempt vt. 尝试，企图

contend［kən'tend］

vi. 斗争，竞争〈同 fight〉

例　Two chimpanzees contended for one banana. 两只黑猩猩为争一根香蕉打了起来。

联　contender n. 竞争者；contention n. 争论，争辩；content adj. 满足的，满意的；pretend v. 假装，装扮；portend vt. 预示；distend v.（使）扩大，（使）扩张





continuity［ˌkɒntɪ'njʊ:ɪti; (US)ˌkɑntə'nu:ɪti］

n.（时间、空间上的）连续性，连贯性〈同 coherence〉

例　The continuity of her talk was broken when the telephone rang. 电话铃声打断了她的讲话。

联　continuous adj. 连续的，持续的

contradict［ˌkɒntrə'dɪkt］

vt. 同…矛盾，同…抵触；提出反对意见〈同 confront〉

例　His mean actions contradicted his fine words. 他的卑劣行径与甜言蜜语互相矛盾。

联　contradiction n. 反驳，矛盾；contradictory adj. 反驳的，对立的；contravene vt. 违反，同…抵触

contrary［'kɒntrəri］

adj. 相反的；对抗的〈同 opposite〉

例　Contrary to the advertisement, this cleanser does not remove tough stains. 与广告宣传的效果不同，这种清洁剂并不能去除顽固污渍。

contrive［kən'traɪv］

v. 设计，发明；策划，图谋〈同 invent, plot〉

例　He contrived an illness to miss a day of school. 他装病请假不去学校。

记　con + tri（反）+ ve（= vene 走）→（和普通人）反着走 → 设计（新东西）

联　contrived adj. 不自然的，勉强的；trivial adj. 琐碎的；contrite adj. 深感懊悔的

controversial［ˌkɒntrə'vɜ:ʃəl］

adj. 引起（或可能引起）争论的〈同 disputable〉

例　The controversial bill was passed by a narrow vote. 在投票中，这项有争议的议案以微小的差异获得通过。

记　contro（反）+ vers（转）+ ial → 反转的 →（可能）引起争论的

联　controvert vt. 反驳，攻击；controversy n. 争论，议论；convert v.（使）转变，（使）…改变信仰；introvert n. 性格内向的人

converge［kən'vɜ:ʤ］

vi. 聚合，集中于一点，会聚〈同 meet, come together〉

例　At first, the two candidates disagreed on every issue, but as the campaign went on, their opinions seemed to converge. 起初，两位候选人在每个议题上意见都不同，但随着竞选的持续，他们的观点似乎越来越趋于一致。

cope［kəʊp］

vi.（善于）应付，（善于）处理〈同 manage successfully〉

例　She was busy but she was still able to cope with the extra work. 她很忙，但仍然可以应付额外的工作。

联　lope v.（使）大步慢跑

自我检测　从第三部分中选出最适当的词填入空格内。

18. After promising to come early, she did the ______ and came late.

19. The first settlers in America had to ______ with harsh winters, sickness and lack of food.

20. A large group ______ on the city hall to listen to the famous politician's lecture.

21. What's the matter with you today? Everything I say you seem to want to ______.

22. I have great ______ for people who are disloyal to their friends.

23. There were too many problems for the newbee to ______ with.



第四部分

cordial［'kɔ:dɪəl; (US)'kɔ:rʤəl］

adj. 热情而真诚的；友好的〈同 hearty, friendly〉

例　He was not very cordial to his girlfriend's former boyfriend. 他对他女朋友的前男友不大友好。

corps［kɔ:(r)］

n. 军团，兵团

例　Janet worked for the Peace Corps for two years in North America. 珍妮特在北美洲的美国和平队工作了两年。

联　corpse n. 尸体；corpus n. 尸体，文集；corpuscle n. 血球

correlate［'kɒrɪleɪt］

vt. 使相互关联；使相互影响〈同 relate〉

例　Increasing cancer rates appear to correlate with rising levels of pollution. 癌症发病率的攀升似乎和环境污染日益严重相关。

联　correlation n. 相互关系，相关（性）

correspondence［ˌkɒrɪ'spɒndəns］

n. ① 通信；信件〈同 message, mail〉

例　Jane saved all of her grandmother's correspondence for years. 简保存了多年来祖母的所有信件。

② 符合，一致〈同 agreement〉

例　Your account of the accident has little correspondence with the story the other driver told. 你对故事的描述与另一位司机的讲述几乎完全不同。

记　cor（共同）+ respond（回答）+ ence → 两人互相回答 → 通信

联　correspond vi. 符合，协调，通信，response n. 反应

corrode［kə'rəʊd］

v.（受）腐蚀，（受）侵蚀〈同 erode〉

例　Acid will corrode certain types of metal. 酸性物质会腐蚀某些金属。

联　corrosion n. 侵蚀，腐蚀状态

corrupt［kə'rʌpt］

v.（使）堕落，（向…）行贿〈同 degrade〉

例　Bad companions may corrupt a person. 品行不端的伙伴可能会毁掉一个人。

adj. 堕落的；不诚实的；贪污受贿的〈同 dishonorable〉

例　The corrupt police officer took bribes. 这个腐败的警官接受了贿赂。

记　cor + rupt（断）→ 全断了的 →（使）堕落

联　corruption n. 腐败；rupture n. 破裂，绝交；abrupt adj. 突然的；disrupt vt. 使分裂，使瓦解；eruption n. 爆发

cosmic［'kɒzmɪk］

adj. 宇宙的

例　Some people believe that what happens in their lives is influenced by cosmic forces. 有些人认为他们生命中所发生的事是受到了宇宙力量的影响。

联　cosmetics n. 化妆品





costly［'kɒstli］

adj. 昂贵的〈同 of great value〉

例　Janet paid a costly salary to hire an American teacher to help her improve her English. 珍妮特高薪聘请了一位美国老师来帮她提高英语水平。

记　cost（费用，代价）+ ly → 费用高的 → 昂贵的

costume［'kɒstju:m; (US)'kɒstu:m］

n. 服装〈同 attire〉

例　The actors in the play had beautiful costumes. 剧中的演员们穿着好看的服装。

couch［kaʊtʃ］

n. 长椅，长沙发〈同 sofa〉

例　A couch refers to a long seat, usually upholstered and having a back and arms. 长沙发都有长长的座位，通常装软垫，并且有靠背和扶手。

vt.（用语言）表达〈同 express〉

例　His thoughts were couched in beautiful language. 他用优美的语言表达了自己的想法。

Lesson 7





音频



预备测验

找出与句子中划线单词意义最相近的词。

1. Many ecologists believe that raising rare animal species in a protected environment will curb the decline of endangered wildlife.

(A) foster

(B) begin

(C) inhibit

2. The epic, which makes great demands on a poet's knowledge and skill, has been deemed the most ambitious of poetic forms.

(A) regarded as

(B) praised as

(C) compared with

3. Embroidery depicting scenic views became popular in the United States toward the end of the eighteenth century.

(A) distorting

(B) commemorating

(C) portraying

4. Human facial expressions differ from those of animals in the degree to which they can be deliberately controlled and modified.

(A) both

(B) noticeably

(C) intentionally

5. In astronomy, a scale of magnitude from one to six denotes the brightness of a star.

(A) signifies

(B) predicts

(C) contrasts



第一部分

counterpart［'kaʊntəpɑ:t］

n. 相似的人或物，配对物〈同 match〉

例　She's my counterpart in our New York office. 她在我们纽约办事处的职位和我的职位相当。

courtesy［'kɜ:təsi］

n. 礼貌，谦恭〈同 civility〉

例　It is a sign of courtesy to give one's seat to another person on a crowded bus. 在拥挤的公共汽车上给人让座是一种有礼貌的表现。

联　courteous adj. 有礼貌的，谦恭的

coward［'kaʊəd］

n. 懦弱的人，胆小的人

例　Mr. Black is a coward; he is easily scared by others' threats. 布莱克先生是个胆小鬼；他很容易被别人的威胁吓到。

联　cowardly adj. 怯懦的；cowardice n. 怯懦，胆小





crew［kru:］

n.（船上、飞机上的）全体工作人员；同事们〈同 team〉

例　The aircraft has a crew of seven. 飞机上有七名机务人员。

联　screw n. 螺丝钉；screwdriver n. 螺丝起子

cripple［'krɪpəl］

vt. 使残废；削弱〈同 handicap, maim〉

例　India has been crippled by foreign debts. 印度由于外债累累而陷入困境。

crisp［krɪsp］

adj. 脆的，易碎的

例　Dry toast and fresh celery are crisp. 干面包和新鲜芹菜都是脆的。

criterion［kraɪ'tɪərɪən］

n.（pl. -ria）（评判的）标准，尺度〈同 standard〉

例　They think that wealth is the only criterion of success. 他们认为财富是判断是否成功的唯一标准。

记　crit（判断，分辨）+ erion → 标准

crown［kraʊn］

n. 王冠；花冠；顶部

例　He won the amateur boxing crown in his latest bout. 他在最近的一场拳击比赛中赢得了非职业选手冠军。

vt. 加冕；褒奖

例　After the death of the old king, the princess was crowned in London. 老国王死后，女王在伦敦加冕。

cruelty［'kru:əlti］

n. 残忍，残酷〈同 brutality〉

例　His former wife accused him of beating, verbal abuse and other cruelties. 他的前妻控告他的殴打、谩骂等残忍行为。

联　cruel adj. 残忍的，残酷的

cue［kju:］

n. 提示，暗示（尤指戏剧等演出中对演员起暗示作用的道白或动作）〈同 hint, suggestion〉

例　The actor entered the stage right on cue. 就在这个时候，男演员走上了舞台。

联　(right) on cue 就在这时候；barbecue n. 吃烧烤肉的野餐

自我检测　从第一部分中选出最适当的词填入空格内。

6. When you visit others, you should take a ______ from the host when it is time to leave.

7. You might get on better with your parents if you showed them some ______.

8. Night is the ______ of day.

9. Pastry and biscuits（饼干）are well-cooked so that they are dry and hard enough to be ______.

10. The loss of our two star players ______ our team.

11. The student was accused of ______ to bears—he poured the vitriol（硫酸）on them!



第二部分

culminate［'kʌlmɪneɪt］

v.（使）达到高潮；（使）以…告终〈同 climax, terminate〉

例　The wedding culminated with a big dance. 婚礼的气氛随着大型舞蹈达到了高潮。

记　culmin（顶点，高峰）+ ate → 达到高潮

cumulative［'kju:mjʊlətɪv］

adj. 累积的，累加的〈同 accumulated〉

例　The cumulative effects of many illnesses made the patient weak. 诸病缠身，病情日益恶化，病人变得很虚弱。

cunning［'kʌnɪŋ］

n./adj. 狡猾（的），有心计（的）〈同 clever, tricky〉

例　The cunning businesswoman sold the house for double its value. 这个精明的女商人以实际价值两倍的价钱卖掉了这座房子。

curb［kɜ:b］

n. 路边

例　Park the car close to the curb. 靠路边停车。

vt. 抑制，约束〈同 restrain〉

例　I went on a diet and curbed my appetite for food and drink. 我节食，并且控制自己的食欲。





curious［'kjʊərɪəs］

adj.（令人）好奇的〈同 inquisitive〉

例　Little kids are usually very curious and ask a lot of questions. 小孩通常都很好奇，问很多问题。

联　curiosity n. 好奇心

curriculum［kə'rɪkjʊləm］

n.（pl. -s; -la）学校的全部课程〈同 courses〉

例　They are trying to widen the college curricula to meet the students' needs. 他们正在试着拓宽大学课程范围，以满足学生们的需求。

联　sanitarium n. 疗养院；chrysanthemum n. 菊花；opium n. 鸦片；bacterium n. 细菌

customary［'kʌstəməri; (US)'kʌstəmeri］

adj. 习惯上的；通常的〈同 habitual, usual〉

例　Ten o'clock is Janet's customary bedtime. 珍妮特通常十点上床睡觉。

记　custom（习惯）+ ary → 习惯上的

联　customer n. 顾客；accustom vt. 使习惯；accustomed adj. 习惯的，通常的

cynical［'sɪnɪkəl］

adj. 愤世嫉俗的〈同 skeptical〉

例　Bob's too cynical to believe in psychic phenomenon, while Janet believes in it completely. 鲍勃不相信存在什么灵异现象，但珍妮特却深信不疑。

记　cyn（狗）+ ic + al → 像狗一样活着的 → 犬儒主义的 → 愤世嫉俗的

联　cynic n. 犬儒主义者，愤世嫉俗者；cynicism n. 愤世嫉俗

damn［dæm］

v. 谴责，指责〈同 condemn〉

例　The critics damned the new book and pointed out a lot of mistakes in it. 评论家们对这本新书提出了指责，并指出了书中的很多处错误。

damp［dæmp］

adj. 潮湿的，有湿气的〈同 humid, moist〉

例　Metals rust most rapidly in damp regions. 金属在潮湿的地方生锈最快。

记　dam（水坝）+ p → 水坝是潮湿的 → 潮湿的

联　dampen vt. 使潮湿；tamp vt. 填塞，夯实

自我检测　从第二部分中选出最适当的词填入空格内。

12. The ______ fox outwitted the dogs and got away.

13. At our school the ______ for Grade 6 includes mathematics, science, social studies, reading and spelling.

14. I ______ my hunger by eating a piece of cheese.

15. Weeks of unsuccessful bargaining for wage increases ______ in a strike.

16. The novel has been unanimously ______ by the critics.

17. Young parents should be very patient to answer the questions their ______ children ask.



第三部分

dazzling［'dæzlɪŋ］

adj. 眼花缭乱的；耀眼的〈同 bright〉

例　The laser system temporarily blinds enemy pilots with rays of dazzling light. 激光系统利用强光让敌机飞行员暂时看不见东西。

联　daze vt. 使茫然，使晕眩；drizzle n. 细雨 vi. 下毛毛雨

deadline［'dedlaɪn］

n. 最终期限〈同 due date〉

例　If I didn't turn in the report by the deadline, I would be fired. 如果我到最后期限还没有把报告交上去，我会被解雇的。

deadly［'dedli］

adj. 致命的〈同 fatal〉

例　This is one of nature's deadliest poisons. 这是自然界最致命的毒药之一。

记　dead（死）+ ly → 致死的

联　deadlock n. 僵局

decimal［'desɪməl］

adj. 十进制的，小数的〈同 of tens〉

例　The metric system is a decimal system. 公制是十进制。

n. 小数

例　The course will help students develop mathematical skills including the use of decimals, fractions, percentages and simple statistics. 这项课程会帮助学生提高数学能力，包括小数、分数、百分比和简单的统计学的应用能力。

记　decim（十分之一）+ al → 小数

联　decimeter n. 分米

decisive［dɪ'saɪsɪv］

adj. 决定性的〈同 determined, conclusive〉

例　The team won by 20 points, which was a decisive victory. 这个队以20分的优势赢得了决定性的胜利。

联　decision n. 决定，决心

dedicate［'dedɪkeɪt］

vt. 把奉献于，致力于〈同 devote〉

例　The book was dedicated to the author's husband. 此书谨献给作者的丈夫。

联　dedicated adj. 专注的，献身的

deem［di:m］

v. 认为，相信〈同 think, believe〉

例　Doctors prescribe the medicines they deem necessary to cure their patients. 医生们给病人开药，这些药是医生认为对治疗有必要的。

联　dean n. 学院院长，系主任

deficiency［dɪ'fɪʃənsi］

n. 缺乏；不足〈同 scarcity〉

例　In Africa, most children live a poor life because of economic deficiency in their families. 在非洲，大多数的儿童因为家庭贫穷过着困苦的生活。

联　deficient adj. 缺乏的，不足的；proficient adj. 精通的，熟练的；sufficient adj. 足够的，充分的；efficient adj. 有效率的

deficit［'defɪsɪt］

n. 赤字〈同 shortfall〉

例　The government tried to avoid a budget deficit and spend strictly according to the plan. 政府为避免财政赤字，根据计划严格控制消费。

联　illicit adj. 违法的；solicit v. 恳求；implicit adj. 含蓄的；explicit adj. 清楚的

defy［dɪ'faɪ］

vt. 公然反抗，蔑视，挑衅〈同 disobey〉

例　The child defied his baby-sitter by refusing to go to bed. 这个小孩不听保姆的话，就是不上床睡觉。

19. The metric system is a ______ system of measurement.

20. A ______ of calcium in your diet can cause soft bones and teeth.

21. He decided to ______ himself to helping the poor.

22. The skater gave a ______ display of his excellent skill and won the first prize.

23. He ______ his parents and stayed out all night.



第四部分

degenerate［dɪ'ʤenəreɪt］

vt.（使）变坏；（使）退化〈同 grow worse〉

例　Her health degenerated because of the disease. 因为这个病，她的身体越来越差。

degrade［dɪ'greɪd］

vt. 使降级，贬低〈同 humiliate, debase〉

例　Janet would not degrade herself by begging for help from the person who insulted her. 珍妮特是不会低头向那些侮辱她的人乞求帮助的。

记　de + grade（等级）→ 使降级

联　degradation n. 退化，降级，降格；retrograde v.（使）后退；upgrade vt.升级；gradient adj. 倾斜的 n. 坡度

deliberate［dɪ'lɪbərət］

adj. ①（尤指坏事）故意的，早有准备的〈同 intentional, planned〉

例　Their excuse was a deliberate lie, but nobody detected it. 他们的理由是个精心编造的谎言，但没人发觉。

② 审慎的，深思熟虑的〈同 careful〉

例　He is very deliberate in everything he says and does, so he rarely hurts others. 他说话办事总是考虑周全，所以他很少伤害到其他人。

记　de + liber（自由）+ ate → 非自由的 → 不是随随便便的 → 审慎的

联　liberate vt. 解放，释放

delight［dɪ'laɪt］

n./v.（使）高兴，（使）愉快〈同 pleasure, cheer〉

例　Winning the award delighted him. 他得了奖，这令他非常高兴。





denial［dɪ'naɪəl］

n. 否定，否认；拒绝〈同 refusal〉

例　Galileo was forced to make a public denial of his belief that the Earth goes around the Sun. 伽利略相信地球是绕着太阳转的，他被迫公开否认了这个观点。

denote［dɪ'nəʊt］

vt. 指示，表示〈同 signify〉

例　His levity at such a serious moment denoted a lack of feeling. 在这么严肃的时刻，他轻浮的举动显示出他的无情。

联　denouement n. 结局；demote vt. 使降级，使降职

denounce［dɪ'naʊns］

vt.（公开）谴责，斥责〈同 censure, condemn〉

例　The reform candidate denounced the corrupt city officers for having betrayed the public's trust. 改革派候选人公开指责腐败的城市官员背叛了民众的信任。

记　de + nounce（报告）→ 坏报告 → 指责

联　announce vt. 宣布；renounce vt. 抛弃，拒绝；pronounce v. 发音，宣告；pronounced adj. 著名的

dentist［'dentɪst］

n. 牙科医生

例　A dentist fills cavities in teeth, cleans, straightens or extracts them, and supplies artificial teeth. 牙医的工作是补牙、洗牙、矫正牙、拔牙，还有装义齿。

联　dental adj. 牙齿的

departure［dɪ'pɑ:tʃə(r)］

n. 出发，离开〈同 leaving〉

例　The airplane's departure for New York was delayed by a blizzard. 飞往纽约的航班因暴风雪推迟起飞时间。

联　partition n. 分开，划分；impart vt. 传授，通知

depict［dɪ'pɪkt］

vt. 描绘，描写，描述〈同 portray, describe〉

例　Her paintings depict the lives of ordinary people in the last century. 她的油画描绘了上个世纪老百姓的生活。

记　de（强调作用）+ pict（画）→ 刻画 → 描述

联　depiction n. 描写；depot n. 仓库

自我检测　从第四部分中选出最适当的词填入空格内。

26. Students gathered in the administration building to ______ the school's discriminatory（歧视性的）practices.

27. Please do not ______ yourself by cheating on a test.

28. It was such a ______ to see you after all these years.

29. Red circles ______ danger zones on this map.

Lesson 8





音频



预备测验

找出与句子中划线单词意义最相近的词。

1. The situation is bound to deteriorate and more and more people will be laid off during the economic depression.

(A) come about

(B) continue

(C) become worse

2. A special dispatch of food and clothing was flown to the refugees this morning.

(A) shipment

(B) punch

(C) jerk

3. Boy's Clubs do not deprive poor children of the opportunity to participate in sports.

(A) deny

(B) retract

(C) improvise

4. Electronic telescopes enable astronomers to discern galaxies ten billion light years away.

(A) classify

(B) detect

(C) measure

5. The two reports have a number of discrepancies although they were written by two people who did the same experiment.

(A) mistakes

(B) maturity

(C) differences



第一部分

deprive［dɪ'praɪv］

vt. 剥夺，使失去〈同 deny, take away〉

例　He was deprived of his sight by the accident. 那次事故使他丧失了视力。

联　deprivation n. 缺乏，剥夺；privation n. 丧失，缺乏；privy adj. 秘密的，私有的；depraved adj. 堕落的，腐化的

descendant［dɪ'sendənt］

n. 子孙，后裔〈同 offspring〉

例　She is a descendant of the 18th-century immigrants. 她是18世纪移民者的后裔。

记　descend（传下）+ ant → 子孙

联　descend v. 下降，遗传；ascend v. 上升；condescend vi. 谦逊，屈尊；transcend vt. 超越，胜过

descent［dɪ'sent］

n. ① 下降〈同 drop〉

例　The gull made a quick descent and plucked a fish from the water. 海鸥突然俯冲，把一条鱼从水里叼了出来。

② 血统，世系〈同 ancestry〉

例　He is of Arabic descent. 他有阿拉伯血统。

designate［'dezɪgneɪt］

vt. 指定，任命〈同 nominate, name〉

例　The teacher has designated me as the group leader. 老师指定我为小组组长。

despise［dɪ'spaɪz］

vt. 轻视；鄙视〈同 disdain〉

例　I've always despised people who say nasty things about others. 我一向看不起那些说别人坏话的人。

dessert［dɪ'zɜ:t］

n. 餐后甜点

例　We had apple pie and coffee for dessert. 我们的餐后甜点有苹果派和咖啡。





destine［'destɪn］

vt. 命中注定；预定〈同 predestine〉

例　Whether as statesman, scientist or philosopher, Benjamin Franklin was destined to gain lasting honor throughout much of the world. 无论是作为政治家、科学家还是哲学家，本杰明·富兰克林注定声名远扬，留芳百世。

记　de（向下）+ stin（站，立）+ e → 在下面站好的 → 命中注定

联　destined adj. 命中注定的；destiny n. 命运，定数；obstinate adj. 顽固的；destination n. 目的地

destruction［dɪ'strʌkʃən］

n. 破坏，毁灭〈同 havoc, demolition〉

例　The war brought death and destruction to the city. 战争给这座城市带来了死亡和毁灭。

destructive［dɪ'strʌktɪv］

adj. 破坏的；毁灭性的〈同 devastating〉

例　The house is being battered by a destructive hurricane. 房子被一场毁灭性的龙卷风损毁。

记　de + struct（结构，建造）+ ive → 反建设性的 → 破坏的

联　destroy vt. 破坏，毁坏；instructive adj. 教导的，有教育意义的；constructive adj. 建设性的

detach［dɪ'tætʃ］

vt. ① 拆开，分开〈同 disconnect〉

例　She had trouble detaching the gum from her shoe. 她弄不掉鞋上的口香糖。

② 派遣，分派〈同 dispatch〉

例　One squad of soldiers was detached to guard the road. 一班士兵被派去防守公路。

记　de + tach（接触）→ 不接触 → 分开

联　detachment n. 拆开，特遣部队；detached adj. 独立的，分开的；attachment n. 附件，依恋

自我检测　从第一部分中选出最适当的词填入空格内。

6. A bulldozer was used in the ______ of the old barn.

7. I ______ a key from the chain and gave it to my daughter to open the door.

8. You are a direct ______ of your parents, grandparents, great-grandparents and earlier ancestors.

9. We were ______ of a good harvest because of the lack of rain.

10. The princess was ______ from birth to be a queen.

11. Parents are very concerned about the ______ effects that violent films may have on children.



第二部分

detail［'di:teɪl; (US)dɪ'teɪl］

n. 细节，详情

例　Her report was complete; it didn't leave out a single detail. 她完成了报告，没有遗漏任何细节。

vt. 详述，细说〈同 itemize〉

例　Our son detailed all the things he had done on his trip to Europe to us. 我们的儿子把他在去欧洲的旅途中所做的事详细地跟我们说明了。

detective［dɪ'tektɪv］

n. 侦探〈同 investigator〉

例　Sherlock Holmes is the best known of all fictional detectives. 夏洛克·福尔摩斯是所有虚构故事中最有名的侦探。

联　detect vt. 察觉，发觉，侦查，探测

deteriorate［dɪ'tɪərɪəreɪt］

v.（使）恶化；（使）质量下降〈同 become worse, decline〉

例　Your health will deteriorate if you work so hard. 如果你这么拼命工作，你的健康将会恶化。





deviate［'di:vɪeɪt］

v.（使）背离，（使）偏离〈同 diverge〉

例　His account of the accident seems to deviate from the facts. 他对事故的陈述似乎偏离了事实。

联　deviation n. 背离；deviant adj. 反常的 n. 不正常的人（或物）

diagnose［'daɪəgˌnəʊs］

vt. 诊断〈同 analyze, identify〉

例　The doctor diagnosed the disease as measles. 医生诊断这种疾病为麻疹。

dictator［dɪk'teɪtə(r)］

n. 独裁者〈同 autocrat〉

例　The dictator seized control of the government and took complete power over the people of the country. 独裁者掌握了政权，剥夺了该国人民的一切权利。

differentiate［ˌdɪfə'renʃɪeɪt］

v. 区分，区别〈同 set apart, discriminate〉

例　Consideration for others differentiates a thoughtful person from a thoughtless person. 能否为别人考虑是体贴的人与不体贴的人之间的区别。

联　undifferentiated adj. 无差别的，无明显特征的

diffuse［dɪ'fju:s］

v. 扩散；散播〈同 spread out〉

例　Schools and libraries diffuse knowledge. 学校和图书馆都传播知识。

adj. 散开的，弥漫的〈同 dispersed〉

例　The technology is diffused and adopted by other countries. 这项技术在其他国家得到传播和使用。

dignity［'dɪgnɪtɪ］

n. 尊严，高贵〈同 nobility〉

例　The king should manifest the dignity matching his status. 国王应该展现出与自己地位相符的尊严。

联　dignify vt. 使有尊严，使高贵；indignity n. 轻视，侮辱；indignant adj. 愤慨的，愤愤不平的

dilemma［daɪ'lemə; dɪ'lemə］

n. 困境，进退两难〈同 predicament〉

例　Janet faced the dilemma of whether to go abroad to study or earn a lot of money in China by taking advantage of her current good opportunity. 珍妮特面临进退两难的境地，她不知道是该出国深造，还是该利用这次机会在中国挣更多的钱。

记　di（两个，双）+ lemma（争论）→ 两种争论 → 进退两难

自我检测　从第二部分中选出最适当的词填入空格内。

12. The Sun ______ the light and heat necessary for life.

13. The abnormal pattern of weather that we have been experiencing in the last few weeks ______ from the norm for this time of year.

14. Two parties are going on tonight, and it's a ______ trying to decide which one to attend.

15. Some color-blind（色盲）people cannot ______ red from green.

16. His condition was ______ as some sort of blood disorder.

17. A judge should maintain the ______ of his or her position by strictly keeping fair.



第三部分

diligent［'dɪlɪʤənt］

adj. 勤勉的，勤奋的〈同 assiduous, industrious〉

例　He's not especially clever, but he's a diligent worker and should do well in the examinations. 他不是特别聪明，但他是一个勤奋的工人，应该会在这次考核中取得好成绩。

记　di（双）+ lig（选出）+ ent → 双倍选出（时间）的 → 勤勉的

联　diligence n. 勤奋；indigent adj. 贫乏的，穷困的

dilute［daɪ'lju:t; (US)daɪ'lu:t］

vt. 稀释，淡化〈同 weaken, attenuate〉

例　She preferred her coffee diluted with milk. 她更喜欢用牛奶稀释咖啡。

diminish［dɪ'mɪnɪʃ］

v.（使）减少，（使）变小〈同 dwindle, reduce〉

例　The excessive heat diminished as the sun went down. 随着太阳下山，余热也慢慢减退。

dine［daɪn］

vi. 就餐〈同 eat〉

例　Let's dine out tonight. 我们今天晚上去外面吃饭吧。

diploma［dɪ'pləʊmə］

n. 文凭，毕业证书〈同 certificate〉

例　Companies hiring today require a high school diploma as a bare minimum. 现在公司招聘要求的最低学历是中学。

联　diplomacy n. 外交；diplomat n. 外交官

directory［dɪ'rektəri］

n. 目录，指南〈同 catalog〉

例　A telephone book is a directory of people who have telephones. 电话本是一本电话持有者的目录。

dirt［dɜ:t］

n. 泥土；污垢

例　She had dirt on her shoes when she came in from the muddy street. 她从泥泞的街道上走进来的时候，鞋子上都是泥。

联　dirty adj. 肮脏的，卑鄙的，下流的

disable［dɪs'eɪbəl］

vt. 使残废；使失去能力〈同 cripple〉

例　Traffic accidents disable thousands of children a year. 交通事故每年造成数以千计的儿童残疾。

记　dis（不，消失）+ able（能够的）→ 使不能 → 使残疾

联　disability n. 无能力，失去能力；enable vt. 使能够





disaster［dɪ'zɑ:stə(r); (US)dɪ'zæstər］

n. 灾难，不幸；彻底的失败〈同 catastrophe, misfortune〉

例　The month-long period of rain was a disaster for the farmer. 持续一个月之久的降雨对农民来说是一场灾难。

联　disastrous adj. 损失惨重的，悲伤的

discern［dɪ'sɜ:n］

vt. 看出；察觉到〈同 detect, perceive〉

例　It was too hard to discern the location of the hidden key. 找到藏起来的钥匙实在是太难了。

记　dis + cern（= sift 筛）→ 筛出来 → 看出

联　discernible adj. 可识别的；discerning adj. 有识别力的，眼光敏锐的；discernment n. 眼光，洞察力；concern n./vt. 关系

自我检测　从第三部分中选出最适当的词填入空格内。

18. I cannot ______ the purpose of her visit because she never contacted me.

19. It's Jan's birthday today, so we're ______ out tonight at a special little restaurant.

20. She gets good grades because she's ______ in her studies.

21. The hurricane's violent winds brought ______ to the coastal town.

22. She ______ her orange juice with water.

23. The sound ______ as we got farther away.



第四部分

disclose［dɪs'kləʊz］

vt. 揭露；透露；露出〈同 reveal〉

例　I can't disclose the source of my information, because I promised not to tell. 我不能公开我的信息来源，因为我答应过不会说出去。

联　disclosure n. 揭发，败露

discourage［dɪs'kʌrɪʤ］

vt. 使气馁；阻碍〈同 depress〉

例　Nothing will discourage him from his determination to take part in the London Marathon. 没有什么能动摇他参加伦敦马拉松赛的决心。

discrepancy［dɪ'skrepənsi］

n. 相差，差异；矛盾〈同 disparity, conflict〉

例　There was a discrepancy in the two witnesses' reports of the accident. 在这两份目击者关于交通事故的报告中有矛盾之处。

discrete［dɪ'skri:t］

adj. 独立的；不连续的，离散的〈同 separate, individual〉

例　These computers operate in a series of discrete steps. 这些计算机以一连串独立的步骤运行。

联　discreet adj. 小心的，谨慎的；discretion n. 判断力

discriminate［dɪ'skrɪmɪneɪt］

v. ① 区别，辨别〈同 distinguish〉

例　The twins' appearance is alike and I cannot discriminate one from another. 这对双胞胎长得很像，我无法分辨出他们谁是谁。

② 歧视，区别对待

例　It is wrong to discriminate against people because of their race, religion, nationality or sex. 因为种族、宗教、国籍或者是性别的原因而去歧视他人是错误的。

联　discrimination n. 辨别，区别，歧视

disguise［dɪs'gaɪz］

n./vt. 伪装，掩盖〈同 camouflage, conceal〉

例　At Halloween I disguised myself as a ghost. 过万圣节时，我把自己伪装成鬼怪。

记　dis（不同）+ guise（姿态，伪装）→ 掩盖

联　guise n. 外表，伪装；dissemble v. 掩饰（真实感情或意图）；disgust n./vt.（使）厌恶，（使）嫌恶





dishonor［dɪs'ɒnə(r)］

n. 不名誉，耻辱〈同 shame〉

例　The robbers brought dishonor to their families. 强盗使他们的家庭蒙受耻辱。

vt. 玷辱，使蒙羞〈同 bring shame to〉

例　She dishonored her family by marrying a thief. 她嫁给了一个小偷，使她的家庭蒙受耻辱。

dismay［dɪs'meɪ］

n./vt.（使）惊慌；（使）沮丧〈同 discourage, consternation〉

例　They were filled with dismay when they saw the rattlesnake. 他们看见响尾蛇之后惊慌失措。

联　dismember vt. 肢解；dismiss v. 解散，开除；dismantle vt. 拆除；dismal adj. 阴沉的，凄凉的

dispatch［dɪ'spætʃ］

vt.（紧急）派遣〈同 send off〉

例　Two loads of woolen cloth were dispatched to the factory on December 12th. 两车呢绒在12月12日被送到了工厂。

n. 派遣；急件；重要消息

例　The correspondent in Paris rushed news dispatches to her newspaper in New York. 在巴黎的通讯员紧急将新闻发送给了她在纽约的报社。

disperse［dɪ'spɜ:s］

vt. 分散，散开〈同 scatter〉

例　The police fired tear gas into the crowd to disperse the protesters. 警察喷射催泪瓦斯驱赶抗议的人群。

联　dispersal n. 疏散，散开；dispense vt. 分发；分配

自我检测　从第四部分中选出最适当的词填入空格内。

24. The law does not allow employers to ______ between men and women who do the same jobs.

25. The thought that she might fail the test ______ her.

26. The crowd ______ when it began raining.

27. The lifting of the curtain ______ a beautiful winter scene.

28. The accountant found a ______ between the receipts and what was recorded in the ledger.

29. The pirates ______ their ship as a trading vessel.
