Lesson 17





音频



预备测验

找出与句子中划线单词意义最相近的词。

1. Most rulers have a sense of majesty.

(A) responsibility

(B) freedom

(C) nobility

2. Probability is the mathematical study of the likelihood of an event's occurrence.

(A) Odds

(B) Fallibility

(C) Desirability

3. That load is so big that a horse cannot bear it.

(A) group

(B) burden

(C) return

4. An electric arc is a luminous current of electricity that leaps from one electrode to another.

(A) ludicrous

(B) glowing

(C) magnetic

5. Professor Baker told me this bottle was labeled poison.

(A) sweated

(B) intruded

(C) identified



第一部分

knit［nɪt］

v. 编织，针织〈同 weave〉

例　Janet likes to knit sweaters in her spare time. 珍妮特有空的时候喜欢织毛衣。

联　knitter n. 编织者；knot n.（绳等的）结 v. 打结；knight n. 骑士，爵士





knob［nɒb］

n. ① 球形把手〈同 handle〉

例　She tried to open the door, but the knob came off in her hand. 她试着去开门，但是球形把手掉在了她的手里。

② 节，瘤〈同 bump〉

例　We can't use this piece of wood because it has too many knobs. 我们没法使用这块木头，因为它的树节太多了。

label［'leɪbl］

n. 标签〈同 tag〉

例　The label on a can will tell you what's in it. 罐头上的标签会告诉你里面有什么。

vt. 贴标签于

例　The bottle is labeled“Poison”. 瓶子上贴着“有毒”的标签。

lame［leɪm］

adj. 跛的〈同 crippled〉

例　She could not run in the race because of her lame leg. 她的腿瘸了，因此无法参加赛跑了。

vt. 使成残废，使跛

例　The child was lamed in the car accident. 小孩的腿因一起交通事故而残废。

latent［'leɪtənt］

adj. 潜伏的，隐藏的〈同 dormant〉

例　Some people believe that telepathy is a latent power of the mind. 有的人认为心灵感应是思维的潜在能力。

联　lately adv. 近来，最近

latitude［'lætɪtju:d; (US)'lætɪtu:d］

n. ① 纬度，范围〈同 scope〉

例　The average annual solar radiation received by the atmosphere varies strongly with latitude. 一年当中大气层吸收的太阳辐射平均量随着纬度的不同而表现出明显的差异。

② 行动或言论的自由（范围）〈同 freedom〉

例　The teacher gave her students a lot of latitude in choosing their science projects. 老师给予学生足够的自由来选择科学课题。

记　lati（阔）+ tude → 纬度

联　longitude n. 经度，经线；latifoliate adj. 阔叶的；lattice n.（做篱笆或爬藤架等的）格子架；aptitude n. 能力；platitude n. 陈词滥调

leaflet［'li:flɪt］

n. 传单

例　They were handing out advertising leaflets outside the supermarket. 他们在超市外散发广告传单。

leak［li:k］

vt. ① 漏；渗〈同 seep〉

例　Water leaks from the cracked glass. 水从破裂的玻璃杯里漏了出来。

② 泄露〈同 divulge, reveal〉

例　The informer leaked the secret to the press. 告密者把这个秘密泄露给了媒体。

联　leaky adj. 漏的；leakage n. 渗漏，泄漏；peak n. 山顶，顶点；beak n. 鸟嘴，喙；streak n. 条纹，纹理；bleak adj. 荒凉的，凄凉的

legend［'leʤənd］

n. 传说；传奇文学〈同 myth, tale〉

例　The stories about King Arthur and his knights of the Round Table are legends. 关于亚瑟王和他的圆桌骑士的故事是传奇故事。

联　legendary adj. 传说中的

legitimate［lɪ'ʤɪtɪmət］

adj. 合法的；正当的，合理的〈同 legal, rightful〉

例　Sickness is a legitimate reason for being absent from school. 因为生病而不去上学是一个合理的理由。

记　legitim（合法）+ ate → 合法的

联　legitimize vt. 使合法，正式批准；illegitimate adj. 违法的，私生的；intimate adj. 亲密的，隐私的

6. My boat ______ and lets water in.

7. The walking stick had a large ______ at the top.

8. She was wearing a sweater ______ from cotton.

9. Parents should not allow their children too much ______.

10. The power of a seed to grow into a plant remains ______ if it is not planted.

11. My leg is ______ from playing football.



第二部分

lessen［'lesən］

v. 减少，变小〈同 decrease, dwindle〉

例　His kind words lessened her sorrow. 他宽容的话语减轻了她的痛苦。

liar［'laɪə(r)］

n. 说谎者

例　He's such a liar that nobody believes him! 他经常说谎，没有人相信他！

librarian［laɪ'breərɪən］

n. 图书馆管理员

例　He was not sure where to look for the information, but the librarian gave him several good leads. 他不确定该去哪儿查找信息，但图书管理员给他提供了几条不错的思路。

联　library n. 图书馆

likelihood［'laɪklɪhʊd］

n. 可能，可能性〈同 probability〉

例　Is there any likelihood of rain today? 今天有可能下雨吗？

limp［lɪmp］

adj. 柔软的，易弯曲的；无生气的〈同 soft〉

例　The flowers need some more water—they've gone limp. 花需要浇水了——它们快枯萎了。

vi. 跛行

例　After falling down the stairs, she limped for several days. 从楼梯上跌下来之后，她好几天都是一瘸一拐的。

联　lamp n. 灯；lump n. 块，肿块；limn vt. 描写，描绘；limb n. 肢；lime n. 石灰；limpid adj. 清澈的





linear［'lɪniə(r)］

adj. 线的，直线的；线性的

例　A pine tree has linear leaves. 松树长着针形叶。

记　来自名词 line（直线）+ ar → 直线的

联　linearity n. 线性，直线性；lineage n. 血统，世系

linger［'lɪŋgə(r)］

vi. 逗留；徘徊〈同 stay, stroll〉

例　I lingered after the exhibition, hoping to meet the guest of honor. 展览会后我没走，希望能见到贵宾。

记　ling（看作 length 长度）+ er → 拉长（时间）→ 逗留

联　ginger n. 姜，活力；malinger vi. 装病以逃避工作

litter［'lɪtə(r)］

v. 乱丢（废弃物）

例　The baby littered the floor with torn papers. 婴儿把撕碎的纸屑丢得满地都是。

n. 垃圾〈同 garbage, refuse〉

例　Children left litter in the park. 孩子们把垃圾留在了公园里。

联　liter n. 公升

lively［'laɪvli］

adj. 活泼的，活跃的；栩栩如生的〈同 energetic, vigorous〉

例　Our patient seems more lively today; he must be feeling better. 我们的病人今天看起来充满活力，他一定感觉好多了。

load［ləʊd］

n. 重担；重任〈同 burden, duty〉

例　Raising two kids can be too heavy a load for some people. 养育两个孩子对有些人来说负担过重了。

vt. 装载，使负担〈同 fill〉

例　The farmers loaded the wagon with hay. 农民把草装到货车上。

联　unload vt. 摆脱…之负担，卸；overload vt. 使超载，超过负荷；shipload n. 船货，一船的装载量；workload n. 工作量

12. What's the ______ of your coming for the weekend?

13. A good night's sleep made us all ______ again.

14. The men ______ the boxes onto the truck.

15. Don't ______! Use the trash can.

16. His apology ______ my anger.

17. The foul odor ______ long after the room was cleaned.



第三部分

locality［ləʊ'kælɪti］

n. 位置，地点〈同 region〉

例　I know few people in the locality of Boston. 在波士顿这个地方我认识的人没几个。

联　local adj. 地方的，当地的；locale n.（事情发生的）场所，地点；locate vt. 查找…的地点，位于；location n. 位置，场所

lofty［'lɒfti; (US)'lɔ:fti］

adj. 高高的〈同 high〉

例　The climber's goal was to reach the lofty pinnacle. 登山者的目标就是到达高高的山顶。

log［lɔ:g］

n. 圆木〈同 wood〉

例　The woodcutter's small house was built of logs. 樵夫的小房子是用木头建成的。

联　log cabin 小木屋；bog n. 沼泽；jog vi. 慢跑

longitude［'lɒŋgɪtju:d; (US)'lɒŋgɪtu:d］

n. 经度，经线

例　The city is at longitude 28° west. 这座城市位于西经28度。

lounge［laʊnʤ］

v. 闲混，闲荡；懒洋洋地打发时间〈同 idle〉

例　The hotel guests lounged by the swimming pool. 酒店的客人在游泳池边打发时间。

n. 起居室

例　The lounge is a good place to meet people. 休息室是见面的好地方。

lubricate［'lu:brɪkeɪt］

vt. 使润滑；加润滑油于

例　A car engine needs to be well lubricated with oil. 有一辆汽车的发动机需要好好地上润滑油。

联　lubricous adj. 光滑的，难以捉摸的；lubricant n. 滑润剂

lumber［'lʌmbə(r)］

n. 木材，木料〈同 board, timber〉

例　The lumber is transported by floating it down the river.（人们把）木头放在水里让它顺流而下来进行运输。

联　plumber n. 水管工人；slumber n./vi. 睡眠；timber n. 木材





luminous［'lu:mɪnəs］

adj. 发光的；明亮的〈同 glowing, fluorescent〉

例　The sun is a luminous body. 太阳是一个发光天体。

联　luminosity n.【物】亮度，发光度

magic［'mæʤɪk］

n. 魔法，魔力；魔术

例　The magic of Shakespeare's poetry has attracted many poets world wide. 莎士比亚诗歌的魔力吸引了世界上的许多诗人。

联　magical adj. 魔术的，不可思议的；magician n. 魔术师，变戏法的人

magnify［'mægnɪfaɪ］

vt. 放大，扩大〈同 intensify, enlarge〉

例　A microscope magnifies bacteria so that they can be seen and studied. 显微镜放大细菌，这样人们就能看见并研究细菌了。

自我检测　从第三部分中选出最适当的词填入空格内。

18. The wall was painted ______ pink.

19. This door keeps sticking—I think the hinges need ______.

20. Although your skin looks smooth, when ______ it is full of bumps and holes.

21. The fairy's ______ changed the brothers into swans（天鹅）.

22. Don't ______ in the street all day; you should study hard for the upcoming exam.

23. Forests are a nation's rich resources, which provide lots of ______.



第四部分

magnitude［'mægnɪtju:d; (US)'mægnɪtu:d］

n. 大小；广度；重要〈同 size, extent, importance〉

例　The war brought problems of very great magnitude to many nations. 战争给许多国家带来了严重的问题。

记　magn（大）+ itude（状态）→ 大的状态 → 巨大，重大 → 大小；重要

majesty［'mæʤɪsti］

n. 雄伟；威严，最高权威〈同 nobility〉

例　The great majesty of the Grand Canyon attracts many visitors world-wide. 壮丽的科罗拉多大峡谷吸引了全世界的游客。

联　majestic adj. 宏伟的，庄严的

mall［mæl; mɔ:l］

n. 大型购物中心〈同 shopping center〉

例　The Mall in Central Park has always been a favorite spot for people on Sunday. 中央公园里的购物中心一直是人们周日最喜欢逛的地方。

maneuver［mə'nu:və(r)］

v.（敏捷地）操纵；（用策略）调动

例　I maneuvered the car through the heavy traffic with ease. 我轻松地把车子驶离交通拥堵地段。

manifest［'mænɪfest］

adj. 明白的，显而易见的〈同 evident〉

例　There was manifest relief among the workers yesterday at the decision not to close the factory. 昨天，不关闭工厂的决定下达之后，工人们明显松了一口气。

vt. 表明，证明〈同 show〉

例　Her love for David was manifested in her smile every time she saw him. 她对戴维的爱从她每次见他时的微笑就可以看出来。

记　mani（手）+ fest（打）→ 用手公开打人 → 显而易见的

联　manifestation n. 表明，显示；infest vt. 骚扰，扰乱

manipulate［mə'nɪpjʊleɪt］

vt. 操作；操纵，利用〈同 maneuver, control〉

例　Because of my injured finger, I could not manipulate the television's controls. 因为我的手指受伤了，我没法按电视遥控器了。

联　manipulative adj. 操纵别人的，老于世故的；manifesto n. 宣言，声明；manual n. 手册，指南 adj. 手工的，体力的





manuscript［'mænjʊskrɪpt］

n. 手稿，原稿〈同 draft〉

例　She has just completed the manuscript for her latest novel. 她刚刚完成了最新小说的手稿。

marsh［mɑ:ʃ］

n. 湿地，沼泽〈同 swamp〉

例　A marsh is a critical component of wildlife habitat. 湿地是野生动物栖息地的重要组成部分。

联　marshy adj. 沼泽的

marshal［'mɑ:ʃəl］

v. 排列；整理，汇集〈同 arrange, collect〉

例　The statistician marshaled his facts before making his presentation. 统计学家先把论据整理好，然后开始做陈述。

n. 元帅，最高指挥官

例　Marshal of the Royal Air Force is the highest rank in the British Air Force. 皇家空军的元帅是英国空军里最高的军衔。

联　martial adj. 军事的，尚武的

masculine［'mæskjʊlɪn］

adj. 男性的；男子气概的〈同 manly〉

例　In some languages, there are masculine pronouns and feminine pronouns. 在有些语言里，有阳性代词和阴性代词之分。

记　mascul（= male 雄性）+ ine → 男性的

联　masculinity n. 男性，雄性；muscle n. 肌肉

自我检测　从第四部分中选出最适当的词填入空格内。

27. Politicians often ______ the public.

28. You are careless! The error was ______ in your essay but you did not find it.

29. A ______ is low land covered at times by water.

Lesson 18





音频



预备测验

找出与句子中划线单词意义最相近的词。

1. Don't mock my taste in music, even if it is old-fashioned.

(A) observe

(B) describe

(C) ridicule

2. In a musical composition, the melody can sometimes be used to tell a story.

(A) beat

(B) piano

(C) tune

3. The two iron mining companies will be merged.

(A) combined

(B) emerged

(C) operated

4. The officer murmured his consent.

(A) stuttered

(B) nodded

(C) mumbled

5. Militant extremists bombed a whaling boat.

(A) Feminine

(B) Fighting

(C) Organized



第一部分

masterpiece［'mɑ:stəpi:s］

n. 杰作，名著〈同 great work〉

例　The novelist's lifelong dream was to write a masterpiece. 这位小说家一生的梦想是创作一部经典作品。

meadow［'medəʊ］

n. 草地，牧场〈同 grassland〉

例　The meadows are covered with wildflowers at this time of year. 每年的这个时候，草地上都长满了野花。

means［mi:nz］

n. 手段，方法〈同 methods〉

例　He used unfair means to get through the examination. 他用不公平的手段通过了考试。

medal［'medəl］

n. 奖章，勋章，纪念章〈同 award〉

例　The swimmer received two bronze medals at the Olympics. 在奥运会上，这位游泳选手获得了两块铜牌。

联　meddle vi. 管闲事





mediate［'mi:dɪeɪt］

v. 斡旋，调停，调解〈同 arbitrate〉

例　He mediated in the family dispute. 他调解家庭纠纷。

记　medi（中间）+ ate → 在中间 → 调停，调解

联　mediator n. 调停者；meditative adj. 沉思的，冥想的；intermediate adj. 中间的，中级的；median n. 中位数，中值

medieval［ˌmedɪ'i:vəl; (US)ˌmi:d'i:vəl］

adj. 中世纪的

例　Castles were a common sight in medieval times. 城堡在中世纪很常见。

记　medi（中间）+ ev（时间）+ al → 中间时间的 → 中世纪的

联　media n. 媒体；medial adj. 中间的，平均的

melody［'melədi］

n. 旋律，曲调〈同 tune〉

例　Ellington was a composer concerned not only with melody, but with harmony, rhythm and instrumentation too. 埃林顿是一个作曲家，他不仅注重曲调，而且注重协调性、旋律和乐器。

memorandum［ˌmemə'rændəm］

n. 备忘录，便笺〈同 memo〉

例　Make a memorandum of the things we'll need for the trip. 把我们旅行需要准备的东西写张条儿吧。

联　memory n. 记忆，记忆力

menace［'menəs］

n. 危险物〈同 danger〉

例　The Third World War would be a menace to world peace. 若有第三次世界大战，那将会威胁世界和平。

vt. 威吓；胁迫〈同 threaten〉

例　The school bully menaced many of the students. 这个学校恶霸威胁过很多学生。

mend［mend］

vt. 修补；改进〈同 repair, improve〉

例　He asked his mother to mend the hole in the pocket of his jeans. 他让母亲为他缝补好牛仔裤口袋上的破洞。

联　amendment n. 改善，改正；recommend vt. 推荐，介绍

自我检测　从第一部分中选出最适当的词填入空格内。

6. I tried to ______ between my two arguing friends.

7. “The Last Supper”is widely regarded as Leonardo da Vinci's ______.

8. Most music has ______, harmony and rhythm.

9. He spent the afternoon ______ the holes in his socks.

10. She won the gold ______ for figure skating（花样滑冰）at the Olympic Games.

11. The torrents（倾盆大雨）of rain were a ______ to the farmer's crops.



第二部分

mental［'mentəl］

adj. 精神的；智力的〈同 cerebral, intellectual〉

例　His mental development is ahead of most other children's in his class. 他的智力发展要比班级里的大多数孩子超前。

记　ment（神智，心）+ al → 智力的

联　mentation n. 精神作用，心理活动；mentality n. 智力，心态；mentor n. 导师，指导者；menial adj. 仆人的

merchandise［'mɜ:tʃəndaɪs; 'mɜ:tʃəndaɪz］

n. 商品〈同 goods〉

例　There was a sale on all merchandise in the store. 这个商店里的所有商品都在大减价。

联　merchant n. 商人

merge［mɜ:ʤ］

v.（使）合并，（使）融合〈同 combine, unite〉

例　The corporation merged two of its divisions. 这个公司合并了两个部门。

联　merger n.（尤指两个或两个以上公司之）合并；submerge v. 淹没；emerge vi. 显现，浮现；emergency n. 紧急情况，突然事件；diverge v.（道路等）分叉，（意见等）分歧；converge v. 聚合，集中于一点

messenger［'mesɪnʤə(r)］

n. 报信者，使者〈同 courier〉

例　In big cities bicycle messengers deliver packages between office buildings. 在大城市，骑自行车的快递员在一座一座的办公大楼之间投递包裹。

联　message n. 消息，讯息

metropolitan［ˌmetrə'pɒlɪtən］

adj. 主要都市的，大城市的〈同 large city〉

例　Vermont has the lowest percentage of metropolitan residents of any state in the United States. 佛蒙特州是美国城市人口比例最低的一个州。

migrate［maɪ'greɪt; (US)'maɪgreɪt］

vi. 移动，迁徒〈同 move from one place to another〉

例　Pioneers from New England migrated to all parts of the United States. 从新英格兰来的开拓者移居到了美国的各个地方。

联　migration n. 定期迁移，迁居；migratory adj. 迁移的，流浪的；migrant n. 候鸟，移居者

militant［'mɪlɪtənt］

adj. 好战的；好暴力的〈同 warlike〉

例　Officials say the attack was orchestrated by a militant group. 官方称这次袭击是由一个激进组织策划的。

联　military adj. 军事的，军用的

mingle［'mɪŋgəl］

v.（使）混合；（使）结合〈同 mix〉

例　Water and oil do not mingle. 油和水不相融。

联　intermingle v. 混合，掺杂；commingle v. 混合

miniature［'mɪnətʃə(r); (US)'mɪnətʃʊər］

n. 缩小的模型，缩图，缩影

例　This model car is a miniature of a real one. 这个汽车模型是真车的缩小版。

adj. 微型的，缩小的〈同 tiny〉

例　Instead of buying a massive dog, Teddy got a miniature poodle. 泰迪买了一只迷你玩具贵宾犬，而没有买真的大贵宾犬。

记　mini（极小的）+ ature → 缩影

联　minibus n. 小型公共汽车





minimize［'mɪnɪmaɪz］

v.（使）最小化，（使）减到最小〈同 diminish〉

例　The businesswoman tried to minimize her losses when the stock market collapsed. 股市崩盘之后，女商人尽量把她的损失降低到最少。

联　minimal adj. 最小的，最少的；minimum n. 最小值，最小化

16. A side road ______ onto the highway up ahead.

17. I like ______ games that test my intelligence.



第三部分

misery［'mɪzəri］

n. 悲惨，不幸〈同 pain〉

例　I was in great misery when I broke my leg. 我的腿断了，十分痛苦。

misfortune［mɪs'fɔ:tʃu:n］

n. 不幸，灾祸〈同 disaster〉

例　It was a misfortune that you lost your money so early in the trip. 旅行才刚开始你就把钱丢了，真不幸。

mislead［mɪs'li:d］

vt. 使误入歧途，误导；欺骗〈同 misguide, deceive〉

例　It is against the law to post an advertisement that misleads the public. 张贴误导公众的广告是违法的。

联　misleading adj. 使人误解的，骗人的

missionary［'mɪʃənəri; (US)'mɪʃəneri］

n. 传教士〈同 preacher〉

例　He spent 20 years in Africa as a missionary. 他在非洲从事了20年的传教工作。

联　mission n. 传教团，代表团，任务，使命





mobilize［'məʊbɪlaɪz］

v. 动员

例　The senator mobilized all her supporters for her reelection campaign. 在连任竞选时，参议员动员了她所有的支持者。

mock［mɒk］

v. 尤指以（模仿性）嘲笑〈同 ridicule〉

例　Don't mock him just because he keeps falling off his bike. 不要仅仅因为他总是从自行车上摔下来就嘲笑他。

联　mockingbird n.【动】仿声鸟（善鸣叫，并能模仿别种鸟的叫声）

monopoly［mə'nɒpəli］

n. 垄断，独占

例　The company once had a monopoly on the telecom industry. 这家公司曾经垄断了电信行业。

记　mono（单一）+ poly（运用）→ 一个人用 → 垄断

联　monopolize vt. 独占，垄断；monotonous adj. 单调的，无变化的；monologue n. 独白，独角戏；monochromic adj. 一色的，单色的；monster n. 怪物，妖怪；monstrous adj. 巨大的，畸形的，怪异的

morality［mɒ'ræləti］

n. 道德〈同 righteousness〉

例　I have to question the morality of forcing poor people to pay for their medical treatment. 强迫穷人为医疗护理埋单，我不得不质疑这种行为的道德性。

联　moral adj. 道德（上）的；精神的；morale n. 士气，民心

mortal［'mɔ:təl］

adj. 必死的；致命的〈同 fatal〉

例　The soldier received a mortal wound in battle. 这名士兵在战场上受了致命伤。

联　mortality n. 死亡率

mortgage［'mɔ:gɪʤ］

n. 抵押贷款

例　If you fail to repay the mortgage, the bank will repossess your house. 如果你无法偿还贷款，银行将收回你的房子。

自我检测　从第三部分中选出最适当的词填入空格内。

18. It's impolite to ______ cripples.

20. Heavy business losses were a ______ blow to him.

21. He is in great ______ because he has no home or friends.

22. The Brown Milk Company has a ______ on milk delivery in this town.

23. They took out a $40,000 ______ to buy the house.



第四部分

mournful［'mɔ:nfʊl］

adj. 悲痛的，悲哀的〈同 sorrowful〉

例　We heard the mournful cry of a wolf. 我们听见了一只狼的哀鸣。

联　mourn v.（为…）哀悼，（为…）忧伤

muddy［'mʌdi］

adj. 多泥的，泥泞的

例　The dog played in the rain and when it came back, it left muddy footprints on the floor. 小狗在雨里玩耍过，当它回到家，地板上留下了带着泥巴的足印。





multiple［'mʌltɪpəl］

adj. 多样的，多重的

例　When selecting your answer from among several in a multiple choice test, always seek the word that is nearest or most appropriate. 在做选择题的时候，要选出那个意思最接近或者最恰当的单词。

记　multi（多，很多）+ ple → 多的 → 多样的，多重的

联　multiply v. 增加，繁殖；multiplicity n. 多样性；multilingual adj. 使用多种语言的

multitude［'mʌltɪtju:d; (US)'mʌltɪtu:d］

n. 大量，多数〈同 a great number〉

例　The book will find a multitude of readers. 那本书将拥有众多的读者。

municipal［mju:'nɪsɪpəl］

adj. 市的，市政的〈同 civic〉

例　Municipal planners deal chiefly with the new layout of communities. 市政设计者主要负责社区新布局。

记　muni（公共的）+ cip（头）+ al → 公共之头的 → 市政的

联　municipality n. 市政当局，自治市；munificent adj. 慷慨的

murmur［'mɜ:mə(r)］

v. 低声说，低语

例　The shy child murmured her thanks. 害羞的小女孩喃喃地道谢。

muscular［'mʌskjʊlə(r)］

adj. 强壮的，肌肉发达的〈同 brawny〉

例　He wished he was more muscular and didn't have such skinny arms. 他希望自己能更结实一点，而不是有这样皮包骨头的臂膀。

联　muscle n. 肌肉，臂力

mute［mju:t］

adj. 哑的；无声的，沉默的〈同 unable to speak, silent〉

例　The little girl stood mute with astonishment. 小女孩惊呆了，默默地站着。

mysterious［mɪ'stɪərɪəs］

adj. 神秘的，不可思议的〈同 unexplainable, enigmatic〉

例　The appearance of UFOs has always been mysterious. UFO是什么样子一直都是个迷。

联　mystery n. 神秘，神秘的事物；myth n. 神话

naive［nɑ:'i:v］

adj. 天真的；幼稚的，容易上当的〈同 unsophisticated, innocent〉

例　Young, naive and trusting as I was, I believed every word he said. 那时的我年轻、幼稚，容易相信人，所以我相信他说的每句话。

自我检测　从第四部分中选出最适当的词填入空格内。

Lesson 19





音频



预备测验

找出与句子中划线单词意义最相近的词

1. The lilac（丁香花）flower has a unique odor.

(A) scent

(B) tint

(C) shape

2. The fire occurred when the old lady was taking a nap.

(A) dozing

(B) tricking

(C) barreling

3. Rollerskating, a sport that has an obscure origin, is popular among children worldwide.

(A) early

(B) unusual

(C) unclear

4. The students will be notified regarding the college entrance examination.

(A) condoned

(B) deformed

(C) informed

5. Soil is the surface layer of the Earth that nourishes and supports the growth of rooted plants.

(A) arranges

(B) shelters

(C) feeds



第一部分

nap［næp］

n.（白天）小睡，打盹〈同 doze〉

例　People usually feel sleepy after lunch. It is beneficial for them to take a nap. 人们通常在午餐后容易犯困。对他们来说打个盹是很有益的。





narrate［nə'reɪt］

v. 讲述〈同 tell〉

例　The speaker presented slides and narrated the story behind them. 演讲者播放幻灯片，讲述它们背后的故事。

联　narrative adj. 叙述性的 n. 叙述；narrator n. 讲述者，叙述者

nasty［'nɑ:sti; (US)'næsti］

adj. ① 令人不愉快的，讨厌的〈同 unpleasant〉

例　The nasty weather ruined our plans for a picnic. 糟糕的天气毁掉了我们去野餐的计划。

② 污秽的；下流的〈同 vile, mean〉

例　Several nasty people threw rocks at the birds on the lake. 几个素质低下的人向湖里的鸟儿扔石头。

联　nastiness n. 污秽

necessitate［nɪ'sesɪteɪt］

vt. 使成为必需，需要〈同 make necessary〉

例　Her broken leg necessitated an operation. 他的腿部骨折了，需要做手术。

联　necessary adj. 必要的，必需的

negligible［'neglɪʤəbəl］

adj. 可忽略的，无关紧要的〈同 insignificant, tiny〉

例　The loss of ten cents is negligible. 十美分的损失微不足道。

联　negligent adj. 疏忽的，粗心大意的

nominal［'nɒmɪnəl］

adj. ① 名义上的，不实的〈同 not real〉

例　The president is the nominal head of our club, but the secretary really runs things. 在我们社团，会长只是名义上的领导，书记才是办事的人。

② 象征性的，微不足道的〈同 trivial〉

例　We paid our friend a nominal rent for the apartment—$5 a month. 我们住这间公寓，象征性地付点房租给朋友——每个月5美元。

记　nomin（名称）+ al → 名义上的

nominate［'nɒmɪneɪt］

vt. 提名；任命〈同 designate〉

例　In ominated Mary for the office of treasurer. 我认命玛丽为办公室财务主管。

联　nomination n. 任命；nominator n. 提名者；nominee n. 被提名者，被任命者

norm［nɔ:m］

n. 准则，规范〈同 convention, standard〉

例　You must adapt to the norms of the school. 你必须适应学校的行为准则。

联　normal adj. 正常的，标准的；normally adv. 通常地；abnormal adj. 反常的，变态的

notable［'nəʊtəbəl］

adj. 著名的；显要的〈同 noteworthy〉

例　She has made notable contributions to the field of biology. 她在生物领域做出了卓越贡献。

n. 名人，要人

例　It was hard to realize that the small, rather ordinary-looking person standing before us was a world-famous notable. 很难意识到这位站在我们面前的个子矮小、长相普通的人是一位世界知名人士。

联　notably adv. 显著地，特别地

notation［nəʊ'teɪʃən］

n. 符号

例　In arithmetic we use Arabic notation（1，2，3，4，etc.）and sometimes Roman notation（Ⅰ，Ⅱ，Ⅲ，Ⅳ，etc.）. 在算术里，我们使用阿拉伯符号（1、2、3、4、等），有时候也使用罗马符号（Ⅰ、Ⅱ、Ⅲ、Ⅳ、等）。

联　notate vt. 以符号表示，把…写成记号（或标志）

自我检测　从第一部分中选出最适当的词填入空格内。

6. An important meeting ______ my being in London on Friday.

7. William Jennings Bryan was ______ three times for President, but he was never elected.

8. Washing dishes is a ______ job.

9. Music has a special system of ______, and so has chemistry.

10. Many ______ came to the reception at the White House.

11. At a ______ price, the settlers got the rest of the land.



第二部分

notify［'nəʊtɪfaɪ］

v. 通知〈同 inform〉

例　Our teacher notified us that there would be a test on Monday. 老师通知我们周一会有测试。

notorious［nəʊ'tɔ:rɪəs］

adj. 臭名昭著的，声名狼藉的〈同 disreputable〉

例　No one wanted to play poker with Tom, because he was a notorious cheater. 没人愿意和汤姆打扑克，因为他是一个臭名昭著的骗子。

记　not（知道，注意）+ orious（多…的）→ 惹人注意的 → 臭名昭著的

联　notoriety n. 臭名，声名狼藉

nourish［'nʌrɪʃ; 'nɜ:rɪʃ］

vt. 养育；滋养〈同 feed, nurture〉

例　After the operation, the doctor plans to nourish the patient with vitamins and good food. 手术之后，医生计划用维生素和有营养的食物为病人补充营养。

联　nourishment n. 食物，营养品；nourishing adj. 有营养的，滋养的

novelty［'nɒvəlti］

n. 新颖，新奇（的事物）〈同 newness〉

例　After the novelty of ice-skating wore off, we did not want to do it any more. 当新鲜感渐渐消失之后，我们再也不想去溜冰了。

记　novel（新的）+ ty → 新颖

联　novel n. 小说 adj. 新奇的；novelist n.（长篇）小说家

numerical［nju:'merɪkəl; (US)nu:'merɪkəl］

adj. 数字的，用数字表示的

例　10 is a numerical quantity. 10是个数量值。

联　numerous adj. 许多的，无数的

nutrition［nju:'trɪʃən; (US)nu:'trɪʃən］

n. 营养；营养学〈同 nourishment〉

例　The right nutrition is important to your health. 合适的营养有利于你的身体健康。

联　nutritional adj. 营养的，滋养的；nutritious adj. 有营养成分的，营养的

oath［əʊθ］

n. 誓言，宣誓〈同 vow〉

例　Every elected official must take an oath of office. 每一个当选的官员都要宣誓就任。

obedient［ə'bi:diənt］

adj. 服从的，顺从的〈同 submissive〉

例　The soldiers were obedient to their commanding officer. 士兵服从指挥官的命令。





obligation［ˌɒblɪ'geɪʃən］

n. 义务，职责〈同 duty, commitment〉

例　Doctors have an obligation to cure the sick. 救治病人是医生的职责。

obscene［əb'si:n］

adj. 淫秽的，猥亵的〈同 indecent〉

例　This movie is limited to adults because there is too much obscene language in it. 这部电影仅限成年人观看，因为里面有太多污言秽语。

联　obscenity n. 淫秽，猥亵

自我检测　从第二部分中选出最适当的词填入空格内。

12. You need some fertilizer to ______ your plants.

13. The witness placed her hand on the Bible and took the ______.

14. We do not yet have any ______ information about casualties.

15. Paying taxes is an ______ which may fall on everybody.

16. A balanced diet provides ______ for your body.

17. The play was banned because of the ______ language it contained.



第三部分

obscure［əb'skjʊə(r)］

vt. 隐藏，使…模糊〈同 conceal, veil〉

例　At times he seemed purposely to obscure his meaning, preferring mystery to clarity. 有时，他似乎有意地遮掩他所要表达的意思，更喜欢神秘一点，不喜欢明晰地表达。

adj. 朦胧的，模糊的，晦涩的〈同 unclear, vague〉

例　The moon is obscure on a cloudy night. 多云的夜晚，月光朦胧。

记　ob（离开）+ scure（跑）→ 跑偏了 → 不好理解了 → 晦涩的

联　obscurity n. 晦涩；secure adj. 安全的





obsolete［'ɒbsəli:t; (US)ˌɑ:bsə'li:t］

adj. 废弃的；过时的〈同 outdated, outmoded〉

例　Wooden warships are obsolete. 木制军舰已经过时了。

记　ob（不）+ solete（使用）→ 不再使用 → 过时的

联　obsolescence n. 废弃，过时

obstruct［əb'strʌkt］

vt. 阻塞（道路、通道等）；妨碍，阻挠〈同 stop, impede〉

例　A car broke down and obstructed the traffic. 一辆汽车抛锚了，阻塞了交通。

记　ob（反）+ struct（建造）→ 反对建造 → 阻挠

联　obstruction n. 阻塞，妨碍；reconstruct v. 重建；superstructure n. 上层建筑；unobstructed adj. 畅通无阻的

odor［'əʊdə(r)］

n. 气味〈同 scent〉

例　She could not remove the unpleasant odor from her kitchen after cooking. 做饭之后，她很难除去厨房里的难闻的味道。

联　odorous adj. 臭的，有气味的；odorless adj. 无臭的，没有气味的

offensive［ə'fensɪv］

adj. 讨厌的，无礼的；攻击性的〈同 disgusting, aggressive〉

例　“Shut up”is an offensive remark.“闭嘴”是攻击性的言辞。

记　of + fens(e)（保护）+ ive → 跟保护相反的 → 攻击性的

联　offend v. 冒犯；defensive adj. 防御性的

offset［'ɒfset; (US)'ɔ:fset］

vt. 弥补；抵消〈同 compensate for, balance〉

例　The government increased the spending allowance to offset the rise in prices. 政府提高消费津贴来弥补物价上涨的影响。

offspring［'ɒfsprɪŋ; (US)'ɔ:fsprɪŋ］

n. 子孙，后代〈同 descendant〉

例　“Parent”refers to any animal or plant that produces offspring.“亲本”指任何能产生后代的动物或植物。

opaque［əʊ'peɪk］

adj. 不透明的；晦涩难懂的〈同 nontransparent, obscure〉

例　Quartz may be transparent, translucent or opaque, and it may be colorless or colored. 石英有可能是透明的、半透明的或者不透明的，也有可能是无色或者有色的。

记　来自 opacus（遮蔽阳光的），opa（不透明）+ que → 不透明的

联　opacity n. 不透明性；opalescent adj. 乳白的；opalescence n. 乳白光；plaque n. 饰板

oppress［ə'pres］

vt. 压迫；压抑〈同 subdue〉

例　A dictator oppresses his people. 独裁者压迫人民。

联　oppression n. 压迫，镇压，压抑；oppressive adj. 压制性的，压迫的

optimum［'ɒptɪməm］

adj. 最适宜的〈同 ideal, best〉

例　If you wait for the optimum moment to act, you may never begin your project. 如果你在等待最合适的时刻启动项目，那你可能永远也不会启动。

第四部分

option［'ɒpʃən］

n. 选项；选择权〈同 alternative, choice〉

例　Pupils in our school have the option of taking Spanish, French or German. 我们学校的学生可以选择上西班牙语课、法语课或者德语课。

联　optional adj. 可选择的，随意的

oral［'ɔ:rəl］

adj. 口头的〈同 spoken〉

例　Had I known this was an oral exam, I would not have brought pen and paper. 要是知道这是口试的话，我就不带笔和纸了。

orderly［'ɔ:dəli］

adj. 有秩序的；整洁的〈同 disciplined, ordered〉

例　The books were aligned on the shelves in an orderly fashion. 书整齐地摆放在书架上。





orientation［ˌɔ:rɪən'teɪʃən］

n. 定向；介绍性指导〈同 direction, adjustment to surroundings〉

例　Freshman orientation provides the incoming students with an opportunity to learn about their new environment and their place in it. 新生指导为新生提供一个机会来了解新的环境以及他们的角色。

记　来自orient（vt. 确定方向）：ori（升起）+ ent → 依（太阳）升起确定方向 → 定向

联　oriental n. 东方人 adj. 东方的

originate［ə'rɪʤɪneɪt］

v. 产生；发起，创办〈同 begin, initiate〉

例　Some bad habits originate in adolescence and continue throughout a person's life. 一些坏习惯在青春期形成，伴随整个人生。

联　originative adj. 有创作力的；originality n. 创意，新奇；original adj. 最初的，原始的

ornament［'ɔ:nəmənt］

n. 装饰，装饰物〈同 decoration〉

例　A lack of ornament made the room appear quite drab. 房屋缺少装饰物，显得很单调。

联　ornamental adj. 装饰性的，装饰的；ornamentation n. 装饰，装饰品

orthodox［'ɔ:θədɒks］

adj. 正统的；传统的〈同 traditional〉

例　She is a cancer sufferer who has rejected orthodox medicine and turned instead to acupuncture and other forms of alternative medicine. 她是一个癌症患者，她拒绝正统医疗，求助于针灸等其他形式的替代疗法。

outbreak［'aʊtbreɪk］

n. 发作；爆发〈同 beginning, eruption〉

例　Doctors are warning us about a possible outbreak of the flu. 医生提醒我们可能会爆发流感。

overflow［ˌəʊvə'fləʊ］

v.（使）泛滥，（使）溢出〈同 spill, flood〉

例　Rivers often overflow in the spring due to heavy rain. 由于春天多雨，河水经常在这个季节泛滥。

overhear［ˌəʊvə'hɪə(r)］

v. 无意中听到，偷听

例　They spoke so loud that I could not help overhearing. 他们说话声音太大了，我无意中听到了他们的谈话内容。

音频



预备测验

找出与句子中划线单词意义最相近的词。

1. The liver performs as a filter for the blood.

(A) serves

(B) poses

(C) masquerades

2. Cahokia, the first city on the American continent, reached its peak of development and power about AD 1100.

(A) summit

(B) tip

(C) height

3. The American dancer Loie Fuller used perfume to create special effects during her performances.

(A) dim lights

(B) strange music

(C) scent

4. There are no overt signs that Janet has been seriously harmed by her experiences.

(A) evident

(B) good

(C) public

5. The refugees were a pathetic sight—starving, frightened and cold.

(A) pitiful

(B) ill

(C) formidable



第一部分

overlap［ˌəʊvə'læp］

vt. 部分重叠，与…交搭，迭盖

例　When you put up wallpaper, should you overlap the edges or put them next to each other? 你贴墙纸的时候，是要把墙纸的边缘搭在一起，还是相互挨着贴？

记　over（在…上）+ lap（大腿）→ 把一条腿放在另一条腿上 → 部分重叠，与…交搭

联　overlay n. 覆盖物

overt［'əʊvɜ:t］

adj. 明显的；公然的〈同 open, public, evident〉

例　Many women at work have to deal with overt sexism. 许多参加工作的妇女不得不面对公然的性别歧视。

联　overtly adv. 公然地，公开地；overtime n. 超时，加班 adv. 加班地；overtire vt. 使过度疲劳；overtax vt. 课税过重

overthrow［ˌəʊvə'θrəʊ］

vt. 打倒，推翻，颠覆〈同 vanquish, overturn〉

例　The protesters tried to overthrow the government. 抗议者试图推翻政府。

overwhelm［ˌəʊvə'welm; (US)ˌəʊvə'hwelm］

vt. ① 战胜；压倒〈同 defeat〉

例　Government troops have overwhelmed the rebels. 政府军镇压了叛乱者。

② 淹没；使沉浸〈同 flood〉

例　The whole village was overwhelmed by the flood. 整个村庄被洪水淹没了。

联　overwhelmingly adv. 压倒性地，不可抵抗地

pacific［pə'sɪfɪk］

adj. 和平的；平静的

例　He did not like to fight, because he was a very pacific person. 他不喜欢打架，因为他是一个性格温和的人。

联　pacify vt. 使平静，安慰，抚慰





painful［'peɪnfʊl］

adj. 疼痛的，使痛苦的

例　The cut was very deep and painful. 伤口很深很疼。

联　pain n. 痛苦，疼痛

pale［peɪl］

adj.（脸色）苍白的；暗淡的〈同 light colored, pallid〉

例　She looks pale and sick. 她看上去面色苍白，病恹恹的。

联　palette n. 调色板；颜料

pamphlet［'pæmflɪt］

n. 小册子〈同 brochure〉

例　The organization's goals are described in the pamphlet. 组织的目标写在小册子里了。

联　pamper vt. 纵容

panic［'pænɪk］

n. 恐慌〈同 alarm, fear〉

例　When the theater caught fire, there was a panic. 电影院着火引起了一场惊恐。

联　pan n. 平底锅；antic adj. 奇特的，滑稽可笑的；Hispanic adj. 西班牙的

parachute［'pærəʃu:t］

n. 降落伞

例　He jumped out of the airplane and opened his parachute. 他从飞机跳了下来，随即打开降落伞。

自我检测　从第一部分中选出最适当的词填入空格内。

6. When you have been ill, your face is sometimes ______.

7. The ______ aim of the proposal is to improve productivity, but the unions are worried that the result of it will be a cut in jobs.

8. They declared the tyrannical regime had been ______ and sued for peace.

9. I read some ______ about cooking.

10. The bad financial news caused a ______ in the stock market.

11. She was ______ with grief and remorse.



第二部分

parade［pə'reɪd］

n. 游行〈同 march, procession〉

例　A parade was held in New York to honor the heroes. 纽约举行了一场游行来纪念这些英雄。

paradise［'pærədaɪs］

n. 天堂〈同 heaven〉

例　The summer camp was a paradise for the children. 夏令营对孩子们来说是天堂。

paradox［'pærədɒks］

n. 似是而非，自相矛盾的话（或人）〈同 inconsistency〉

例　Mr. Cooper is a political paradox; he's a staunch Republican who votes only for Democrats. 库珀先生在政治上是一个矛盾的人，他是一个坚定的共和党人，却只把选票投给民主党。

记　para（旁边）+ dox（观点）→ 不正规的观点 → 自相矛盾的话（或人）

联　orthodox adj. 规范的，合乎传统的；heterodox adj. 非正统的，异端的

paralyze［'pærəlaɪz］

vt. 使瘫痪，使麻痹〈同 benumb〉

例　A serious fall paralyzed Mary and put her in the hospital for a month. 玛丽严重跌伤瘫痪在床，在医院里躺了一个月。

记　para（旁边）+ lyze（分开）→ 使身体的一边分开 → 使瘫痪

联　paralysis n. 瘫痪

parcel［'pɑ:sl］

n. 包裹

例　The parcel was too big to fit in the car. 包裹太大了，没法塞进车里。





partition［pɑ:'tɪʃən］

n. 分割〈同 division〉

例　The partition of the courts resulted in a civil and criminal branch. 法院划分成民事法院和刑事法院。

vt. 隔开，分割〈同 divide〉

例　If we partition the kitchen off, it will make it seem as if we've got two separate rooms. 如果我们把厨房打上隔断，看起来似乎我们就有了两个独立的房间。

passport［'pɑ:spɔ:t］

n. 护照

例　You need to bring your passport when you want to apply for a visa. 如果你想申请签证的话，需要带上你的护照。

pastime［'pɑ:staɪm; (US)'pæstaɪm］

n. 消遣，娱乐〈同 entertainment〉

例　Watching football in Brazil is a traditional family pastime. 在巴西，看足球是传统的家庭休闲方式。

pasture［'pɑ:stʃə(r); (US)'pæstʃə(r)］

n. 牧场，草地〈同 field, meadow〉

例　The rancher grazes 500 cattle in this pasture. 牧场主在这片草地上放牧了500头牛。

联　pastureland n. 牧草地，牧场；pastoral n. 牧歌，田园诗

patent［'peɪtənt; (US)'pætnt］

n. 专利

例　Earlier this year, the company filed a patent on a genetically engineered tomato that remains firm longer than untreated tomatoes. 年初，公司给一种转基因西红柿申请了专利，这种西红柿比非转基因西红柿能存放更长时间。

vt. 取得…的专利权，申请专利〈同 license〉

例　She patented her new invention. 她为她的新发明申请了专利。

第三部分

pathetic［pə'θetɪk］

adj. 可怜的，悲惨的〈同 pitiful〉

例　The hungry homeless cat meowed in a pathetic way. 饥饿的流浪猫哀嚎着。

记　path（感情）+ etic → 引起怜悯的感情的 → 可怜的

联　apathy n. 无感情，冷淡；apathetic adj. 无感情的，冷淡的；sympathetic adj. 同情的

patient［'peɪʃənt］

n. 病人，患者

例　The nurse plotted the patient's temperature on a chart over several days. 护士把病人这几天的体温标在了一个表格中。

adj. 忍耐的，耐心的

例　You have to be patient with him. He only just started working here. 你得对他耐心点儿，他刚来这儿工作。

联　patience n. 耐性，忍耐；impatient adj. 不耐烦的

patriotic［ˌpætrɪ'ɒtɪk; ˌpeɪtrɪ'ɒtɪk］

adj. 爱国的〈同 nationalistic〉

例　It is patriotic to fulfil your responsibilities to your country. 履行对国家的责任是爱国的行为。

联　patriot n. 爱国者

patrol［pə'trəʊl］

v. 巡逻，巡视〈同 guard, watch〉

例　A night-watchman patrols the streets at night. 值夜班的警卫员夜间在街上巡逻。

联　patroller n. 巡警





pause［pɔ:z］

n./v. 暂停，中止，停顿〈同 make a temporary stop〉

例　Janet took advantage of the pause in the teacher's lecture, and finished her homework. 珍妮特利用老师讲课的间歇完成了家庭作业。

pave［peɪv］

vt. 铺设，为…铺路〈同 coat, cover〉

例　The workers paved the road with asphalt. 工人用沥青铺路。

联　pave the way for 为…铺平道路

peak［pi:k］

n. 山顶；最高点，顶端〈同 summit〉

例　The peak of the mountain is covered with snow. 山顶覆盖着雪。

pedal［'pedəl］

n. 踏板

例　The two pedals of a bicycle, pushed down one after the other, make it go. 把自行车的两个踏板交替着往下踩，车就可以前进了。

pedestrian［pɪ'destrɪən; (US)pə'destrɪən］

n. 行人，步行者〈同 walker〉

例　Pedestrians have to watch for automobiles turning corners. 行人在转角处要注意机动车。

adj. 平淡无奇的，缺乏想像力的〈同 dull〉

例　She did not like the author's pedestrian style of writing. 她不喜欢作者缺乏想像力的写作风格。

记　ped（脚）+ estrian → 用脚走的人 → 行人

联　pedal n. 踏板；pedestal n. 基座；biped n. 两足动物；centipede n. 蜈蚣；impede vi. 阻止，妨碍；expedite vt. 加速，促进

peel［pi:l］

v. ① 削（或剥）…的皮

例　Peel a banana for the child. 剥一个香蕉给小孩吃。

② 剥落；脱皮

例　When I was sunburnt, my skin peeled. 我的皮肤被太阳晒伤，脱皮了。

第四部分

peer［pɪə(r)］

vi. 凝视，仔细看〈同 gaze〉

例　She peered at the tag to read the price. 她仔细看标签上的价格。

n. 同辈，同等的人〈同 fellow, companion〉

例　It has been found that left-handed people suffer more stress than their right-handed peers. 人们发现，习惯用左手的人要比习惯用右手的人压力更大。

联　peerless adj. 出类拔萃的，无可匹敌的

penalty［'penəlti］

n. 处罚，罚款；违约金〈同 punishment〉

例　The penalty for speeding is usually a fine. 对超速的处罚通常是罚款。

联　penal adj. 刑罚的，刑法上的；penalize vt. 处罚

pendulum［'pendjʊləm; (US)'penʤʊləm］

n. 钟摆，摇锤

例　The pendulum in the grandfather clock swung back and forth. 落地座钟的钟摆摆来摆去。





peninsula［pə'nɪnsjʊlə; pə'nɪnsələ］

n. 半岛

例　Italy is one of the world's most famous peninsulas. 意大利是世界上最著名的半岛之一。

pension［'penʃən］

n. 养老金，退休金〈同 annuity〉

例　Pensions are often paid because of long service, special merit or injuries received. 通常会由于多年的效力、特殊的功绩或受伤等原因而给当事人发放津贴。

记　pens（挂，引申为挂着钱）+ ion → 养老金

联　pretension n. 借口，自负；distension n. 膨胀，延伸；aspersion n. 诽谤，中伤

perception［pə'sepʃən］

n. 理解；感知，感觉〈同 understanding, sense〉

例　She had a clear perception of the problem, and soon solved it. 她很清楚问题所在，然后很快就解决了。

联　perceptive adj. 感知的，有洞察力的；conception n. 观念，概念；misconception n. 误解

perfect

［'pɜ:fɪkt］adj. 完美的，理想的〈同 flawless, ideal〉

例　The dancer's performance was perfect. 那位舞蹈演员的表现很完美。

［pə'fekt］vt. 使完美；使熟练〈同 refine, improve〉

例　The editor perfected the manuscript with his changes. 手稿经编辑修改之后变得完美了。

联　perfection n. 尽善尽美，完美

perform［pə'fɔ:m］

vt. ① 履行，执行〈同 handle, execute〉

例　He performed his regular duties quickly and quietly. 他总是既快又安静的履行他的职责。

② 表演，演出〈同 serve as, act as〉

例　Horowitz is performing at Carnegie Hall tonight. 霍洛维兹今晚在卡内基音乐厅演出。

联　performance n. 履行，执行，表演，演奏；performer n. 表演者

perfume［'pɜ:fju:m］

n. 香味；香水〈同 scent, fragrance〉

例　She wore an absolutely delicious-smelling perfume. 她身上喷的香水味道很好闻。

periodic［ˌpɪərɪ'ɒdɪk］

adj. 周期的，定期的〈同 repeated, recurrent〉

例　Janet had periodic feelings of anxiety after she was deserted by her boyfriend. 被男朋友抛弃后，珍妮特总是间歇性焦虑。

联　period n. 时期，时代；periodical n. 期刊，杂志 adj. 周期的，定期的

Lesson 21





音频



预备测验

找出与句子中划线单词意义最相近的词。

1. In the 1870's Alexander Graham Bell developed the first practicable telephone.

(A) feasible

(B) functional

(C) available

2. The major portion of writer Benjamin Brawley's work was in social criticism.

(A) goal

(B) subject

(C) part

3. The author's reasons for changing his novel are highly pertinent.

(A) imaginative

(B) unrealistic

(C) relevant

4. Bob ponders his future on graduation day.

(A) thinks deeply

(B) has to steal

(C) pawns

5. We are plagued by a gnawing（使人苦恼的）question.

(A) comforted

(B) placated

(C) bothered



第一部分

perish［'perɪʃ］

vi. 死亡；腐烂〈同 die〉

例　Many animals perished in the forest fire. 许多动物在这场森林大火中死亡。

记　per（消失）+ ish（去）→ 生命消失 → 死亡

联　perishable adj.（食物）易坏的





permeate［'pɜ:mɪeɪt］

vt. 弥漫；渗透，透过〈同 pervade, penetrate〉

例　The odor of frying onions permeated the air. 炸洋葱的气味弥散在空气里。

记　per（全部）+ mea（通过）+ te → 全部通过 → 渗透

联　permeable adj. 可渗透的；permeation n. 渗入

permission［pə'mɪʃən］

n. 许可，允许〈同 consent, approbation〉

例　She asked for permission to leave work early. 她请求早点下班。

联　permissive adj. 许可的，宽容的；permissible adj. 被允许的

perpetual［pə'petjʊəl］

adj. 不间断的，持续的；永久的，永恒的〈同 continual, eternal〉

例　After they stole the money, they lived in perpetual fear of being discovered and arrested. 偷了钱之后，他们一直过着提心吊胆的生活，生怕被发现并被逮捕。

记　per（始终）+ pet（追求）+ ual → 永远追求的 → 永久的

联　perpetuity n. 永恒；perpetuate vt. 使永存，使不朽；perpetrate vt. 犯（罪），做（坏事）

perplex［pə'pleks］

vt. 使迷惑，使困惑；难住〈同 baffle, confuse〉

例　The difficult math problem perplexed the students. 数学难题把学生们难住了。

联　perplexing adj. 使人困惑的，令人费解的；complex adj. 复杂的；duplex adj. 双重的

persistent［pə'sɪstənt］

adj. 坚持的，持久的〈同 tenacious, constant〉

例　His wife's persistent complaining is starting to annoy him. 他妻子没完没了的抱怨开始惹恼他了。

联　persistence n. 坚持不懈，持续

personality［ˌpɜ:sə'nælɪti］

n. 个性，性格；品格〈同 character〉

例　It is in his personality to help others. 乐于助人是他的品格。

联　personal adj. 私人的，个人的，亲自的；personable adj. 漂亮的

persuade［pə'sweɪd］

vt. 说服，劝说〈同 convince〉

例　No one could persuade Tom to stop playing computer games; he is already crazy. 没有人能说服汤姆停止玩电子游戏，他已经着魔了。

联　persuasion n. 说服，说服力；persuasive adj. 善于游说的

pertain［pə'teɪn］

vi. 有关，关于（to）〈同 have to do with〉

例　My question pertains to yesterday's homework. 我的问题是关于昨天的家庭作业的。

pertinent［'pɜ:tɪnənt; (US)'pɜ:tənənt］

adj. 恰当的；相关的，切题的；中肯的〈同 relevant〉

例　In order to win the case, the lawyer must know all the pertinent details. 为了打赢官司，律师必须了解案子的全部相关细节。

记　per（始终）+ tin（拿住）+ ent → 始终拿在手里放不下 → 相关的

联　impertinent adj. 无礼的，粗鲁的，不相干的

自我检测　从第一部分中选出最适当的词填入空格内。

6. This problem is so difficult that it even ______ the teacher.

7. The smell of rotten eggs tends to ______ the kitchen.

8. He knew I should study, but he ______ me to go to the movies.

9. Many a person ______ in the intense earthquake.

10. Keep your remarks ______ and try to stick to the subject at hand.

11. The leader of the group must have a strong ______.



第二部分

pest［pest］

n. 害虫；令人讨厌的人或物〈同 nuisance〉

例　Flies and mosquitoes are pests. 苍蝇和蚊子属于害虫。

联　pesticide n. 杀虫剂

petition［pə'tɪʃən］

n./v. 请愿〈同 request〉

例　We need one hundred more signatures before we take the petition to the governor. 把这份请愿书递交给省长之前，我们还需要100人签名。

联　repetition n. 重复，循环；competition n. 竞争，竞赛

petty［'peti］

adj. 小的，不重要的〈同 trivial〉

例　Don't let petty disturbances upset you. 不要让小困惑烦扰你。

phenomena［fɪ'nɒmɪnə］

n.（pl.）现象〈同 events, appearance〉

例　We kept careful records of the phenomena we noted in the course of these experiments. 我们坚持认真地记录实验过程中所见到的每一个现象。

联　phenomenally adv. 明白地，显著地

physiological［ˌfɪzɪə'lɒʤɪkəl］

adj. 生理学的；生理上的

例　To understand this disease fully, we must examine not only its physiological aspects but also its psychological elements. 为了更好地了解这种疾病，我们不仅要做生理方面的检查，也要做心理方面的检查。

联　physiology n. 生理学

picnic［'pɪknɪk］

n. 野餐

例　Today the weather is really nice; let's go for a picnic. 今天的天气很好，我们去野餐吧。

pierce［pɪəs］

vt. 穿透，戳穿〈同 penetrate〉

例　I pierced the paper with my pencil. 我用铅笔穿透了这张纸。

联　fierce adj. 凶残的；farce n. 闹剧；coerce vt. 强制，强迫





pill［pɪl］

n. 药片

例　He took a pill because he had a headache. 因为头疼，他服下一片药。

plague［pleɪg］

n. 瘟疫，灾祸〈同 epidemic, disease〉

例　The plague has killed millions through the centuries. 几个世纪以来，瘟疫夺去了数百万人的生命。

vt. 折磨，使苦恼；给…造成麻烦（或困难）〈同 afflict, bother〉

例　The construction work was plagued by the heavy rains. 施工因大雨而受阻。

记　plag（击，打）+ ue → 打倒人 → 瘟疫；折磨

plaster［'plɑ:stə(r); (US)'plæstər］

n. 灰泥，石膏

例　The plaster on the walls had cracked as it dried. 墙上的灰泥干裂了。

vt. 抹泥，涂〈同 smear〉

例　Her shoes were plastered with mud. 她的鞋上沾了一层泥。

自我检测　从第二部分中选出最适当的词填入空格内。

12. Sarah got her ears ______ when she was 14, but now she doesn't like earrings.

13. The people on our street signed a ______ asking the city council for a new sidewalk.

14. The entire population of this village was wiped out by a deadly ______.

15. It started raining so we had to stop the ______.

16. The insecticide is supposed to kill all the ______ that attack the maize plants.

17. You should take vitamin ______ every day to stay healthy.



第三部分

plateau［'plætəʊ; (US)plæ'təʊ］

n. 高地，高原〈同 highland, upland〉

例　The new airport will be constructed on a large plateau overlooking the capital. 新的机场将建在一片可以俯瞰整个首都的辽阔高原上。

plausible［'plɔ:zɪbəl］

adj. 好像有道理的，似乎真实的；善于花言巧语的〈同 likely〉

例　He had a plausible reason for being late, but I still did not believe him. 他对于迟到的解释貌似有理，但是我仍然不相信他。

记　plaus（鼓掌）+ ible → 值得鼓掌的 → 好像有道理的

联　plausibility n. 似乎有理；implausible adj. 不像真实的，难以置信的；applause n. 鼓掌欢迎；possible adj. 可能的

plea［pli:］

n. ① 恳求，请求〈同 request〉

例　The employees turned in a plea to their boss for higher pay. 员工恳求老板涨工资。

②（法庭中被告方的）抗辩，辩护〈同 appeal〉

例　Mr. Wilson entered a plea of not guilty. 威尔逊先生提出无罪辩护（不承认有罪）。





plead［pli:d］

v. ① 恳求〈同 beg〉

例　The writer pleaded for an extension on her deadline. 作家请求推迟截止日期。

②（指律师）（为…）申诉，（指律师）（为…）答辩〈同 answer〉

例　He ha d a good lawyer to plead his case. 他有个很好的律师为他的案子辩护。

联　pleat n. 衣服上的褶

pledge［pleʤ］

n. 保证，誓言〈同 promise, oath〉

例　They made a pledge to give money to charity. 他们承诺给慈善机构捐款。

vt. 发誓；保证〈同 vow〉

联　hedge n. 树篱，限制；dredge n. 挖泥船；wedge v. 楔入

poke［pəʊk］

v. 戳，捅〈同 thrust〉

例　She playfully poked her boyfriend in the ribs. 她开玩笑地戳了戳男朋友的肋骨。

联　poker n. 扑克牌

polar［'pəʊlə(r)］

adj. ① 极地（南极或北极）的〈同 of or near the North or South Pole〉

例　It is very cold in the polar regions. 极地非常寒冷。

② 对立的

例　Love and hatred are polar feelings or attitudes. 爱与恨是情感或者态度的两个极端。

联　polarize vt. 使两极分化；polar bear 北极熊

poll［pəʊl］

n. 选举投票；民意测验〈同 survey〉

例　The latest poll shows that ninety percent of the population likes pizza. 最新的民调显示，百分之九十的人喜欢吃比萨饼。

ponder［'pɒndə(r)］

v. 深思，思考〈同 reflect, consider carefully〉

例　Let's ponder the problem and not act hastily. 让我们仔细考虑这个问题，不要匆忙行动。

记　pond（重量）+ er → 掂重量 → 思考

联　ponderous adj. 沉重的，笨重的

porous［'pɔ:rəs］

adj. 可渗透的，多孔的〈同 permeable〉

例　The porous sponge quickly soaked up the water. 多孔海绵很快就吸干了水分。

记　por（孔）+ ous → 多孔的

联　pore n. 毛孔；pole n.（南、北）极，磁极，电极；tadpole n. 蝌蚪

18. The class had a ______ to decide where it would have its picnic.

19. ______ to discovering the facts, the journalist began to dig up new evidence for his readers.

20. Cloth is ______. Aluminum is not.

21. She ______ me in the waist with her elbow.

22. The ancient mountain had long ago eroded down to a ______.

23. Her ______ to keep the house she was living in went unanswered.



第四部分

portion［'pɔ:ʃən］

n. 一部分，部分〈同 part, section〉

例　I am satisfied with a portion of the manuscript, not all. 我对部分手稿很满意，并不是对全部都满意。

联　apportion vt. 分配

portray［pɔ:'treɪ］

vt. 描述；绘制〈同 describe, depict〉

例　The book portrays the actor as a selfish person. 这本书把这位演员描写成一个自私的人。

联　portrayal n. 描画，描写

pose［pəʊz］

vt. 形成，引起〈同 cause〉

例　The rising pollution poses a great health hazard. 日益严重的污染对身体健康造成了巨大的危害。

n. 姿势，姿态〈同 posture〉

例　His interest in books was only a pose to get her attention. 他喜欢书只是装模作样，为了吸引她注意而已。

联　posture n.（身体的）姿势，体态

possession［pə'zeʃən］

n. 拥有，占有；财产〈同 ownership, property〉

例　You are fired now. So you should collect all your possessions and leave now. 你已经被解雇了。请你带上私人物品马上离开。

poster［'pəʊstə(r)］

n. 海报，招贴〈同 placard〉

例　We noticed a poster advertising a circus. 我们注意到了一张马戏团的宣传海报。





postulate［'pɒstjʊleɪt］

vt. 要求；假定〈同 assume〉

例　Scientists do not know why dinosaurs became extinct. But some theories postulate that changes in geography, climate and sea levels were responsible. 科学家还不清楚为什么恐龙会灭绝。但是有些理论假定这与地理因素、气候条件和海平面的变化有关。

记　postul（放）+ ate → 放出观点 → 假定

practicable［'præktɪkəbəl］

adj. 行得通的，可以实行的〈同 feasible〉

例　The board of directors decided that the plan was practicable and agreed to undertake the project. 董事会认定计划是可行的，同意实施这个项目。

practical［'præktɪkəl］

adj. 实际的，实践的；实用的〈同 pragmatic, useful〉

例　He w as a practical man, opposed to theory. 他是一个实干的人，不是理论派。

联　practicality n. 实用性；impractical adj. 不切实际的；practically adv. 实际上，几乎，简直

prayer［'preə(r)］

n. 祈祷，诉求〈同 supplication〉

例　Prayer can be helpful in times of trouble. 在遇到困难的时候，祈祷是有用的。

联　pray v. 祈祷，恳求

preach［pri:tʃ］

v. 布道；鼓吹〈同 advocate〉

例　Our local priest preached a sermon on the need for forgiveness. 我们本地的牧师在布道中说明互相原谅的必要性。

联　preacher n. 传教士

Lesson 22





音频



预备测验

1. Man is prone to error, even though he'd like to think he's infallible.

(A) lying down

(B) averse

(C) disposed

2. The predominant activities in rural societies are those that involve the production of food and raw materials.

(A) principal

(B) predictable

(C) necessary

3. The dental work made a profound change in her appearance.

(A) thorough

(B) provocative

(C) proper

4. In the late 1800's, landscape painting in Canada became increasingly influenced by European prototypes.

(A) subjects

(B) preferences

(C) models

5. According to a belief prevalent in many places, the number“13”means bad luck.

(A) held sacred

(B) broadly accepted

(C) documented



第一部分

precipitate［prɪ'sɪpɪteɪt］

vt. 促成；加速〈同 urge, accelerate〉

例　His failure in stock speculation precipitated his ruin. 证券投机的失败使他一下破了产。

记　pre（提前）+ cipit（落下）+ ate → 提前落下 → 加速

联　precipitous adj. 陡峭的，急躁的；precipitant adj. 仓促的；precipice n. 悬崖

preclude［prɪ'klu:d］

vt. 预先排除，使不可能〈同 prevent〉

例　Retiring members of the Board were precluded from seeking reelection for three years. 董事会的退休成员在三年之内不能重新参加竞选。

记　pre（预先）+ clude（关闭）→ 提前关掉 → 预先排除

联　preclusion n. 排除；preclusive adj. 排除的；precocious adj. 早熟的；prelude n. 前奏，序幕；exclude vt. 把…排除在外；seclude vt. 隔离

predecessor［'pri:dɪsesə(r); (US)'predəsesər］

n. 前辈，前任〈同 forerunner〉

例　George VI was the predecessor of Queen Elizabeth Ⅱ. 伊丽莎白女王二世的前任是乔治六世。

联　antecedent n. 先例；ancestor n. 祖先，祖宗；predate vt. 在日期上早于，居先

predominant［prɪ'dɒmɪnənt］

adj. 支配的，主要的〈同 principal, dominant〉

例　The United States is one of the predominant nations in the world today. 美国是当今世界的主要国家之一。

pregnant［'pregnənt］

adj. 怀孕的

例　She took a leave of absence because she was pregnant. 因为怀孕，她休假了。





premature［ˌpremə'tʃʊə(r); (US)ˌpri:mə'tʊər］

adj. 早熟的，不成熟的；过早的〈同 too soon, too early〉

例　A fire in the gallery caused the premature closing of the exhibition. 由于画廊起火，画展过早结束。

记　pre（…前的）+ mature（成熟的）→ 早熟的

联　premedical adj. 医学预科的；premeditate v. 预谋，预先考虑

premise［'premɪs］

n. 假设，前提〈同 assumption〉

例　If you accept the premise that most children like sugar, you'll understand why sweets are so popular. 如果你接受大多数小孩都喜欢吃糖这个前提，你就会明白为什么糖果这么受欢迎了。

记　pre + mise（协定，协约）→ 之前定好的协约 → 前提

premium［'prɪ:mɪəm］

n. ① 奖金；奖励〈同 prize〉

例　There's a high premium placed on honesty in these times. 当今时代，人们非常重视诚实。

② 保险金

例　I pay premiums on my life insurance four times a year. 我一年要缴纳四次人寿保险费。

preservative［prɪ'zɜ:vətɪv］

n. 防腐剂

例　Morticians use preservatives to keep bodies from decaying. 殡仪业者使用防腐剂避免遗体腐烂。

记　来自 preserve，pre（预先）+ serve（保存）→ 保存

联　preserve vt. 保护，保藏；perverse adj. 倔强的，刚愎自用的；reserve v.（旅馆房间等）预订，预约

preside［prɪ'zaɪd］

vi. 主持；负责〈同 head〉

例　The manager presides over the business of this store. 经理主管这个店铺的业务。

联　president n. 总统，校长

自我检测　从第一部分中选出最适当的词填入空格内。

6. The marathon runner's departure from the race was ______.

7. Salt is a ______ for meat.

8. News of possible devaluation of the pound ______ furious financial trading.

9. Tony will be ______ over the meeting today and will answer some questions.

10. The research project is based on the ______ stated earlier.

11. A rain shower will ______ plans for a picnic.



第二部分

pressure［'preʃə(r)］

n. 压力；压迫〈同 stress, tension〉

例　He began to feel the pressure soon after he took the job. 他接受那份工作以后马上就感觉到了压力。

prestige［pre'sti:ʒ］

n. 威望，声望〈同 fame〉

例　The wealthy man sought to obtain social prestige through contributions to popular charities. 那个富人力求通过为慈善事业做贡献来获得社会威望。

联　prestigious adj. 有名望的，有威信的

presume［prɪ'zju:m; (US)prɪ'zu:m］

vt. 假定，假设，认为〈同 assume〉

例　Don't presume the results till you have all the facts. 不要推测结果，除非你知道了所有的事实真相。

联　presumably adv. 据推测，大概，可能；presumptuous adj. 专横的

pretext［'pri:tekst］

n. 借口，托辞〈同 excuse, pretense〉

例　The United States often meddles in other countries' affairs using human rights as a pretext. 美国经常以人权为借口干涉别国事务。

记　pre（预先）+ text（文字）→ 预先的文章 → 借口

联　context n. 上下文，文章的前后关系

prevalent［'prevələnt］

adj. 普遍的；流行的〈同 common, prevailing〉

例　Colds and flu threaten to be unusually prevalent this winter. 似乎今年冬天得伤风和流感的人会更多。

记　pre（前面）+ val（力量）+ ent → 有走在前面的力量 → 流行的

联　prevalence n. 流行；valiant adj. 勇敢的，英勇的；equivalent adj. 相等的

prey［preɪ］

n. 被掠食者，牺牲者；捕食〈同 victim〉

例　Mice and birds are the prey of cats. 老鼠和鸟是猫的猎物。

vi. 捕食，掠夺〈同 hunt〉

例　Hawks prey on small birds. 鹰捕食小鸟。

联　osprey n. 鱼鹰





prick［prɪk］

v. 刺，戳

例　I got pricked when I tried to pick the rose. 我试着摘玫瑰的时候被刺伤了。

priority［praɪ'ɒrɪti; (US)praɪ'ɔ:rɪti］

n. 优先，优先权〈同 preference〉

例　Being healthy is a top priority to everybody. 身体健康对每个人来说都是最重要的。

privacy［'prɪvəsi］

n. 独处而不受干扰；隐私〈同 seclusion, secrecy〉

例　The new law is designed to protect people's privacy. 新法的目的是保护人们的隐私权。

联　private adj. 私人的，私有的，秘密的

probe［prəʊb］

vi. 调查，查究〈同 detect, find out〉

例　A detective probes into the circumstances of murder. 侦探调查犯罪现场。

记　prob（测试，证明）+ e → 调查

联　lobe n. 耳垂；wardrobe n. 衣橱，全部服装

自我检测　从第二部分中选出最适当的词填入空格内。

12. He needed a ______ to be in the gym during class time.

13. You need to ______ a hole in the bag to let the air out.

14. The law ______ innocence until guilt is proven.

15. Fire engines and ambulances have ______ over other traffic.

16. The bridge collapsed under the ______ of the trucks.

17. After ______ into the scientist's theory, we proved it was correct.



第三部分

process［'prəʊses; (US)'prɑ:ses］

n. 过程〈同 procedure〉

例　He is learning the process for baking bread. 他在学习烘焙面包的工序。

vt. 处理，加工〈同 treat〉

例　These materials are to be processed before they can be used. 这些材料在使用之前要经过加工。

联　procession n.（游行）队伍

proclaim［prə'kleɪm］

vt. 声明，宣告〈同 declare, announce〉

例　The senator proclaimed that he would seek reelection. 参议员宣布他将参加连任竞选。

联　proclamation n. 宣布；clamor n. 喧闹，叫嚷；acclaim n./v. 喝彩，欢呼；declaim v. 演讲，高声朗读；exclaim v. 呼喊，惊叫

productive［prə'dʌktɪv］

adj. 多产的，丰饶的；有成果的〈同 fruitful, having good results〉

例　Efforts t o resolve the dispute were very productive. 解决争议的努力很有成效。

记　来自名词 product（产物，产品）：pro（向前）+ duct（引导，带来）+ ive → 引出东西的 → 有成果的

联　productivity n. 生产力；conductive adj. 传导的；seductive adj. 诱人的；deductive adj. 推论的

profession［prə'feʃən］

n. 职业；专业〈同 vocation〉

例　Now that he has quit his old job he must find a new profession. 既然他已经辞职了，他就必须重新找工作。

proficient［prə'fɪʃənt］

adj. 熟练的，精通的〈同 skilled, expert〉

例　It takes a couple of years of regular driving before you become proficient at it. 你需要花几年的时间经常开车才能使驾驶技术变得熟练。

记　pro（在前）+ fici（做）+ ent → 能在别人前面做的 → 熟练的

联　proficiency n. 熟练，精通；sufficient adj. 足够的；deficient adj. 缺乏的；efficient adj. 有效率的

profile［'prəʊfaɪl］

n. 剖面，侧面；轮廓；概况，传略〈同 outline, contour〉

例　This article depicts a profile of a famous painter. 这篇文章简要介绍了这位有名的画家。

profitable［'prɒfɪtəbəl］

adj. ① 有利润的，赚钱的〈同 lucrative〉

例　Computer programming can be a profitable profession. 电脑程序设计是一个挣钱的职业。

② 有益的〈同 valuable〉

例　His volunteer work in the hospital was a profitable experience. 他在医院所做的志愿工作是一种有益的经验。

profound［prə'faʊnd］

例　We should take the problem of pollution very seriously, because it may have a profound effect on the earth's atmosphere. 我们应该认真对待污染问题，因为它会对地球环境产生深远影响。

联　profoundly adv. 深深地，衷心地

project

［'prɒʤekt］n. 计划，方案〈同 plan〉

例　Less and less money is being put into scientific research projects. 投入到科研项目的资金越来越少。

［prə'ʤekt］vi. 投射；发射（导弹等）〈同 throw〉

例　Motion pictures are projected on the screen. 电影被投射在屏幕上。





prolong［prə'lɒŋ; (US)prəʊ'lɔ:ŋ］

vt. 拖长，延长〈同 extend, lengthen〉

例　She prolonged her visit for another day due to the rain. 由于下雨，她将行程延长了一天。

记　pro（向前）+ long（长）→ 拖长

联　prolongation n. 延长；longevity n. 长命，寿命；elongate v. 拉长，（使）伸长

18. The ______ of rebuilding the city center will take a long time.

19. He is very ______ at what he does, but I don't think he can do much else.

20. The snowstorm ______ their stay for two more days.

21. We spent a ______ afternoon in the library because we read a lot.

22. The ringing bells ______ the coming of the new year.

23. The tree ______ a shadow on the grass.



第四部分

promising［'prɒmɪsɪŋ］

adj. 有前途的，有希望的〈同 encouraging, hopeful〉

例　The young pianist has a great deal of talent and is very promising. 这位年轻的钢琴家很有天分，也很有前途。

联　unpromising adj. 无前途的，没有希望的；compromise n./v. 妥协，折中

prone［prəʊn］

adj. 易于…的；倾向于…的〈同 likely, inclined〉

例　He is a child prone to mischief. 他是一个爱搞恶作剧的小孩。

propagate［'prɒpəgeɪt］

vt. ① 繁殖〈同 raise, reproduce〉

例　Many plants propagate themselves using the wind to carry their seeds. 许多植物通过风来传播自己的种子。

② 散布，传播〈同 spread, disperse〉

例　In a free society it is intrinsic that individuals and groups have the inherent right to propagate ideas and try to win converts. 在自由社会，个人和团体都有权传播教义和争取信徒。

记　pro + pag（砍，切）+ ate → 把树的旁枝剪掉使主干生长 → 繁殖

联　propagator n. 传播者；propaganda n. 宣传

propel［prə'pel］

vt. 推进，促进〈同 push〉

例　The rocket was propelled into space from the launching point. 火箭在发射点发射升空。

记　pro（向前）+ pel（推）→ 推进

联　propeller n. 推进器；compel vt. 强迫，迫使；expel vt. 驱逐，开除；impel vt. 推动，激励；repel vt. 击退，抵制，使厌恶





proper［'prɒpə(r)］

adj. 恰当的，得体的〈同 right, appropriate〉

例　There is a proper technique for using chopsticks. 使用筷子有独特的技巧。

联　property n. 财产，所有物，性质，特性

prophet［'prɒfɪt］

n. 先知；预言者，提倡者〈同 predictor〉

例　The prophet is Mohammed, the man who made Islam known to the world through the Koran. 先知穆罕默德通过《古兰经》使伊斯兰教为世界所知。

联　prophesy v. 预言，预报

proposition［ˌprɒpə'zɪʃən］

n. 提议，主张〈同 offer, suggestion〉

例　The manager presented a proposition to buy several smaller businesses. 经理提议并购几个小公司。

联　propose v. 建议；proposal n. 建议，提议；position n. 位置

prospective［prə'spektɪv］

adj. 预期的〈同 future, expected〉

例　Margaret was not sure whether to marry her prospective husband or not. 玛格丽特不确定是否要嫁给她未来的丈夫。

联　prospect n. 景色，前景，前途

prosper［'prɒspə(r)］

vi. 繁荣，成功

例　Their business began to prosper when they moved to their new location. 他们搬到新址以后，生意变得红火了。

记　pro（前面）+ sper（希望）→ 希望在前 → 繁荣，成功

联　prosperity n. 繁荣；prosperous adj. 繁荣的

prototype［'prəʊtətaɪp］

n. 原型〈同 model, archetype〉

例　She was the prototype for the character in his novel. 她是他这本小说中人物的原型。

记　proto（首先）+ type（形状）→ 首先的形状 → 原型

联　protocol n. 草案，协议；stereotype n.【印】铅版，老套

Lesson 23





音频



预备测验

找出与句子中划线单词意义最相近的词。

1. Many people who are colorblind cannot recognize different hues of red and green.

(A) distinguish

(B) reproduce

(C) coordinate

2. Fear of pirate（海盗）raids caused the Spaniards to fortify their coastline.

(A) invasions

(B) ships

(C) arms

3. Many statistics related to the economy are published quarterly.

(A) every month

(B) every three months

(C) twice a year

4. The attack on Fort Sumter near Charleston provoked a sharp response from the North, which led to the American Civil War.

(A) demanded

(B) elicited

(C) expedited

5. In astronomy the Little Dipper is the figure formed by the seven most radiant stars in the constellation Ursa Minor.

(A) fascinating

(B) brilliant

(C) visible



第一部分

provoke［prə'vəʊk］

vt. 激怒；惹起〈同 irritate, cause〉

例　He provoked her with his endless complaining. 他无休止的抱怨终于激怒了她。

联　provoking adj. 激怒人的，刺激人的；provocative adj. 煽动的；provocation n. 激怒，挑拨，刺激；convoke vt. 召集；evoke vt. 唤起，引起

proximity［prɒk'sɪmɪti］

n. 接近〈同 closeness〉

例　The house is in close proximity to the shops and the station, so its rent is quite high. 房子离商店和车站非常近，所以房租很高。

记　proxim（近处）+ ity → 接近

联　proximate adj. 最接近的，直接的；approximate adj. 大约的；approximation n. 接近，近似；vicinity n. 邻近，接近

publicity［pʌb'lɪsɪti］

n. 公开，宣传〈同 advertisement〉

例　Bad publicity hurts the mayor's chances for reelection. 负面报道影响了市长获得连任的机会。

记　public（公开的）+ ity → 公开，宣传

联　publicize vt. 宣扬，公布；publicly adv. 公然地；publication n. 出版物

purify［'pjʊərɪfaɪ］

vt. 提纯，精练〈同 refine, clean〉

例　Stream water should always be purified before drinking. 溪水在饮用之前要净化。

联　purification n. 纯化，净化；purity n. 纯净，纯度

pursuit［pə'sju:t;(US)pə'su:t］

n. ① 追求；职业〈同 profession〉

例　Fishing is her favorite pursuit; reading is mine. 钓鱼是她最喜欢的消遣，阅读是我最喜欢的。

② 追踪，追捕〈同 chase〉

例　Three people have been killed in high-speed pursuits by the police recently. 最近有三个人在警察的高速追击中死亡。

联　pursue vt. 追赶，追随，追求





qualification［ˌkwɒlɪfɪ'keɪʃən］

n. 资格，条件〈同 prerequisite〉

例　You're wasting your time applying for that job, because you lack the proper qualifications. 你申请这份工作是在浪费时间，因为你没有从业资格。

联　qualify v.（使）具有资格，证明合格

quantify［'kwɒntɪfaɪ］

vt. 量化，确定数量

例　It's difficult to quantify how many people will be affected by the change in the law. 法律修改以后，很难计算出有多少人会受到影响。

联　quantitative adj. 定量的，数量的

quarterly［'kwɔ:təli］

adv. 每季地

例　I pay my insurance premiums quarterly. 我的保险费是季付的。

queer［kwɪə(r)］

adj. 奇怪的，古怪的〈同 strange, unusual〉

例　Her behavior was so queer everyone wondered what was wrong. 她的行为举止很奇怪，每个人都想知道发生了什么事。

quench［kwentʃ］

vt. ① 熄灭〈同 extinguish, put out〉

例　Water quenched the fire. 水浇灭了火。

② 解渴〈同 slake〉

例　It takes more than a soda to quench my thirst on hot days. 在大热天，一瓶碳酸饮料无法让我解渴。

联　blench vi. 退缩；clench v. 紧握；trench n. 壕沟；stench n. 恶臭

自我检测　从第一部分中选出最适当的词填入空格内。

6. You'll never get a good job if you don't have any ______.

7. The best way to generate ______ is to appear on television.

8. They were born in close ______ to each other and they always play together.

9. He is a very good worker. I can't ______ his importance.

10. Don't ______ the dog or it will bite you.

11. The magazine will be published ______, meaning four times a year.



第二部分

quest［kwest］

n. 寻找，探索〈同 search, expedition〉

例　The New York University research team is collaborating with the Department of Health in its quest for a cure for arthritis. 纽约大学的研究团队正和卫生部合作，一起探寻治疗关节炎的方法。

记　question（问题）去掉 ion 成为 quest → 寻找问题的答案 → 寻找

联　questionable adj. 可疑的；unquestionably adv. 无疑地，无可非议的；request n./vt. 请求，要求；bequest n. 遗产，遗赠；sequester vt. 使隐退，使隔绝

questionable［'kwestʃənəbəl］

adj. ① 不确定的〈同 unsure, uncertain〉

例　It's still questionable as to whether or not I'll have the report done on time. 我能否按时完成报告还是一个问题。

② 可疑的，靠不住的〈同 dubious〉

例　I don't trust him. His motives are questionable. 我不相信他。他的动机有问题。

questionnaire［ˌkwestʃə'neə(r)］

n. 调查表，问卷

例　A questionnaire is a written or printed list of questions used to gather information, to obtain a sampling of opinions. 调查问卷是指手写或者打印的问题清单，用于收集信息或一些意见的样本。

queue［kju:］

n. 长队，长列〈同 procession〉

例　If you want tickets you'll have to join the queue at the ticket office. 如果你想买票，那么你必须在售票处排队。

quiver［'kwɪvə(r)］

n./v.（使）颤抖〈同 shake, tremble〉

例　The dog quivered with fear when strangers came to the house. 一看见陌生人往家这边走来，狗就害怕得发抖。

radiant［'reɪdɪənt］

adj.（向四面八方）发光的；容光焕发的；喜形于色的〈同 ablaze, brilliant, delighted〉

例　In autumn, the mountains surrounding Beijing are radiant with shades of red, yellow and orange. 在秋天，北京周围的山笼罩着红色、黄色和橘色。

记　radi（光线，射线）+ ant →（向四面八方）发光的

联　radiate v. 辐射，发光（热）；radiance n. 光辉灿烂，容光焕发；radius n. 半径，范围

radiate［'reɪdɪeɪt］

v. 发光；放射；辐射〈同 spread out, effuse〉

例　The sun radiates light and heat. 太阳释放出光和热。

联　radiation n. 辐射，发光，放热





radical［'rædɪkəl］

adj. 根本的；激进的〈同 thorough or complete, drastic〉

例　The American Revolution was not a radical one, but a gradual evolution. 美国独立战争不是一场激进的、彻底的革命，而是一种渐进的发展演变。

记　radic（根）+ al → 根本的

联　radically adv. 根本上；sporadically adv. 偶发地，零星地；eradicate vt. 根除

rage［reɪʤ］

n. ① 时尚，风靡一时的事物〈同 fashion, vogue〉

例　By the 1930's, jazz music was the rage. 到20世纪30年代，爵士乐风靡一时。

② 大怒，情绪激动〈同 violent anger〉

例　I was frightened because I had never seen him in such a rage before. 我从来都没有看到他这么愤怒过，这让我很害怕。

联　outrage vt. 凌辱，引起…义愤；enrage vt. 激怒；mirage n. 海市蜃楼，幻想；forage n. 草料

raid［reɪd］

n. 袭击〈同 invasion, attack〉

例　Thousands were killed in the air raids on London. 伦敦遭到空袭，数千人死亡。

联　braid vt. 编织

12. The ______ is too long, let's come back later.

13. It was a ______ decision for him to leave home and join the army.

14. A ______ of his mouth showed that he was about to cry.

15. Three persons were arrested in a police drug ______.

16. A greedy man's ______ for gold never ends.

17. A ______ smile lit the face of the young girl when she opened her present.



第三部分

rally［'ræli］

v. 召集，集合；恢复〈同 unite, combine〉

例　We rallied together to save our leader from prison. 我们团结起来，把首领从监狱里救出来。

记　可能来自 ally（联合，联盟），r + ally → 集合

联　dally vi. 慢吞吞地做，浪费时间；tally v.（使）符合，（使）吻合 n. 记分

random［'rændəm］

adj. 任意的，随便的〈同 haphazard〉

例　The police were stopping cars at random and checking their brakes. 警察随机拦下汽车，检查其刹车是否有问题。

ray［reɪ］

n. 光线〈同 beam, light〉

例　A ray of light came in through the hole in the wall. 一缕光从墙洞里穿过。

联　fray vt. 使磨损；foray n. 袭击；tray n. 碟，盘子；array n. 编队，大批；betray vt. 出卖，背叛；spray vt. 喷射，喷溅





readily［'redɪli］

adv. 容易地；欣然地，乐意地〈同 easily, willingly〉

例　These snakes can be readily identified. 这些蛇一眼就能辨别出来。

realistic［ˌrɪə'lɪstɪk］

adj. 现实（主义 ）的〈同 pragmatic〉

例　Set realistic goals and work hard to achieve them. 设定几个现实的目标，再努力去实现它们。

联　realism n. 现实主义；reality n. 真实，事实

realization［ˌrɪəlaɪ'zeɪʃən］

n. 实现；意识〈同 fulfillment, awareness〉

例　He finally bought his own house. That was the realization of his dream. 他终于买了一套属于自己的房子，这让他梦想成真。

reap［ri:p］

vt. 收割，收获；获得〈同 harvest, gain〉

例　Farmers sow in the spring and reap in the fall. 农民在春天播种，秋天收割。

recession［rɪ'seʃən］

n. 萧条时期，（经济）衰退〈同 depression〉

例　Slow growth in the early 1900's, linked with rising unemployment, led many experts to declare a recession. 20世纪头十年，经济增长放缓，加上失业率上升，使许多专家宣布经济进入衰退期。

记　re（反）+ cess（走）+ ion → 反着走的时候 → 萧条时期

联　recessive adj. 隐性遗传的，逆行的；regression n. 衰退

recipe［'resɪpi］

n. 食谱；处方〈同 formula, instructions〉

例　I have a book full of recipes for curry. 我有一本做咖喱饭菜的食谱。

reciprocal［rɪ'sɪprəkəl］

adj. 相应的；相互的〈同 in return, mutual〉

例　She gave me a present, but she expected no reciprocal gift from me. 她给了我一件礼物，但是她不期望我回赠她。

自我检测　从第三部分中选出最适当的词填入空格内。

18. Jobs are scarce during ______.

19. The opinion poll was based on a ______ sample of adults, so I believe the result is quite representative.

20. The ______ says you need four eggs and 250 grams of chocolate.

21. I like ______ paintings that depict nature exactly as it appears.

22. The general ______ his forces to defend the town.

23. He hoped to ______ the profits of his investments in one year.



第四部分

reckless［'reklɪs］

adj. 轻率的，鲁莽的〈同 careless〉

例　Mark had his license suspended for reckless driving. 马克因为野蛮驾驶被吊销驾照。

reckon［'rekən］

vt. 约略地计算；估计，猜想〈同 compute, guess〉

例　John was absent for the first time, so the teacher reckoned he was sick. 约翰第一次缺勤，老师估计他是生病了。

reclaim［rɪ'kleɪm］

vt. 开垦；要求归还，收回

例　The Netherlands has reclaimed large tracts of land from the sea. 荷兰收回了海上的大片领土。

记　re（重新）+ claim（喊）→ 要求归还

联　acclaim n./v.（为…）欢呼；declaim v. 高谈阔论；disclaim v. 放弃，弃权

recognize［'rekəgnaɪz］

vt. ① 识别，辨认〈同 identify〉

例　I'm sure I would recognize you in that disguise. 我确信你伪装成那样我也能认出你。

② 认可，赏识；表彰〈同 honor, reward〉

例　The scientist was recognized by the president for her outstanding achievements. 那位科学家做出了杰出的贡献，受到总统的表彰。

联　recognition n. 赞誉，承认

reconcile［'rekənsaɪl］

vt. 使和解〈同 settle〉

例　Friends managed to reconcile him with his wife after years of estrangement. 他和妻子多年分居，朋友们想方设法让他们重归于好了。

记　re（重新）+ concile（= conciliate 安抚，调和）→ 使和解

联　reconciliatory adj. 和解的，调停的；reconciliation n. 和解；recondite adj. 深奥的，隐藏的，晦涩的；conciliate vt. 安慰，调和；propitiate vt. 劝解，谋求…的好感

recreation［ˌrekrɪ'eɪʃən］

n. 消遣，娱乐〈同 pastime, amusement〉

例　For recreation, I like to go hiking and camping. 在娱乐方面，我喜欢徒步旅行和露营。

记　来自 recreate（娱乐）：re（再）+ creat(e)（创造）+ ion → 再创造能量 → 消遣，娱乐

recruit［rɪ'kru:t］

vt. 征兵，征募；补充〈同 enlist, enroll〉

例　We have to recruit seven more people to start the work. 我们还需要招募七个人来启动这个工作。

记　re（重新）+ cruit（= cres 成长）→ 重新成长 → 补充

联　recruitment n. 征募；recreate v.（使）得到娱乐

rectify［'rektɪfaɪ］

vt. 矫正〈同 correct, amend〉

例　Before you hand in your homework, you should rectify all the mistakes. 交家庭作业之前，你应该好好检查错误。

recur［rɪ'kɜ:(r)］

vi. 重现，再来；复发〈同 reappear〉

例　Memories of my first meeting with her recur on and off. 我第一次和她相遇的回忆不断重现。

联　recurring adj. 往复的，再次发生的





redundant［rɪ'dʌndənt］

adj. 多余的，冗长的〈同 unnecessary〉

例　Bill had already bought paper plates, so our purchase of paper plates was redundant. 比尔已经买了纸板，所以我们再买纸板就多余了。

记　red（= re）+ und（= undulate 波动）+ ant → 反复波动 → 反复出现 → 多余的

联　redundancy n. 冗余；recumbent adj. 斜躺着的，休息着的

26. “What is the time?”“I am not sure, but I ______ about four o'clock.”

27. Walking, gardening and reading are quiet forms of ______.

28. You have to go to the office to ______ the lost money.

29. We should not just ignore ______ drivers; we must take them off the road.

音频



预备测验

找出与句子中划线单词意义最相近的词。

1. Many male birds carry out a variety of courtship rituals.

(A) displays

(B) practices

(C) routines

2. During the 1840's, Dorothea Dix was a leader in the movement for the reform of prison conditions.

(A) unification

(B) creation

(C) betterment

3. Regardless of her illness, she is at work.

(A) Instead of

(B) Irregardless of

(C) Except for

4. When the human body is attacked by an invading organism, its immune system is organized to repel the attacker.

(A) resist

(B) reject

(C) repulse

5. The large red ants can dig as deep as ten feet to establish nests and retrieve soil for their mounds.

(A) store up

(B) throw out

(C) bring back



第一部分

reform［rɪ'fɔ:m］

n./v. 改革，革新〈同 improvement, improve〉

例　Social reforms led to the abolition of slavery. 社会改革使奴隶制被废除。

联　reformer n. 改革家，改革运动者；reformism n. 改革主义

refrain［rɪ'freɪn］

vi. 节制；避免〈同 restrain, avoid〉

例　If you want to be heard, you must refrain from mumbling. 如果你想让别人听见你说什么，就必须口齿清楚。

refreshing［rɪ'freʃɪŋ］

adj. 使人精神振作的；使人耳目一新的〈同 invigorating〉

例　A refreshing breath of fresh air gave me new energy. 呼吸新鲜空气让我精力充沛。

记　来自动词 refresh（使精力恢复，使精神振作）：re（重新）+ fresh（新鲜的）+ ing → 使人精神振作的

联　refreshment n. 精神振作；refreshant n. 提神饮料；freshen v.（使）精神饱满

refugee［ˌrefju:'ʤi:; (US)'refjʊʤi:］

n. 避难者，难民

例　The refugees were forced to leave their home. They had no food and nowhere to stay. 难民被迫离开家园。他们没有食物，也无处可去。

refute［rɪ'fju:t］

vt. 反驳〈同 decline, disprove〉

例　The speaker refuted his opponent's arguments. 演讲者反驳了对手的论点。

记　re（反）+ fute（打）→ 反过来打 → 反驳

联　refutable adj. 可驳倒的；refutal n. 驳斥，反驳；refuse v. 拒绝；futile adj. 无用的；confute vt. 驳斥，驳倒

regardless［rɪ'gɑ:dlɪs］

adj. 不管，不顾，不注意

例　I will attend the concert regardless of what you say. 无论你怎么说，我都会去参加音乐会。

regime［reɪ'ʒi:m］

n. 政权，政体；政治制度〈同 government〉

例　The regime in China is the Communist Party. 中国的执政党是共产党。

联　regimentation n. 系统化，组织化

reign［reɪn］

n./vt. 统治，支配〈同 sovereignty, rule〉

例　The old king has reigned for 30 years. 老国王已经统治了30年。





rejoice［rɪ'ʤɔɪs］

v.（使）欣喜，（使）高兴〈同 exult〉

例　The army rejoiced because of its victory. 军队因为胜利而庆祝。

relay［rɪ'leɪ］

vt. 分程传递；转播

例　The private satellite industry sprang up in the mid-1960's to relay not only television broadcasts but also phone calls and computer data. 私人卫星产业在20世纪60年代中期出现，不仅传送电视节目和手机信号，而且传送电脑数据。

6. The king ______ over his people for forty years.

7. I will keep my promise ______ of what might happen.

8. It was very ______ to take a cold shower on this hot day.

9. The heroes in this story ______ over their defeat of the evil invaders.

10. Some prisons try to ______ the criminal, instead of just punishing them.

11. The executive tried to ______ the statements written about him.



第二部分

relic［'relɪk］

n. 遗迹，纪念物〈同 antique, remains〉

例　This ruined bridge is a relic of the Civil War. 这座毁坏的桥是内战的遗迹。

联　derelict adj. 荒废的，被弃置的

remainder［rɪ'meɪndə(r)］

n. 残余，剩余物〈同 remnant〉

例　Put the remainder of the meal in the refrigerator. 把吃剩的饭菜放进冰箱。

联　remaining n. 剩余，残存

renaissance［rɪ'neɪsəns; (US)'renəsɑ:ns］

n. 复活，文艺复兴〈同 revival, renewal〉

例　The dilapidated downtown experienced a reanissance as the government began to repair the old buildings there. 政府决定开始重修老建筑物，这座破旧的城市正经历一场复兴。

记　re（重新）+ naiss（= nas 出生）+ ance → 复活

联　renascent adj. 新生的；reminiscence n. 回忆

renew［rɪ'nju:］

vt. 使更新，使恢复；重新开始〈同 renovate, restart〉

例　The author renewed the script by rewriting many of the scenes. 作者改写了很多场景，修改了这个脚本。

联　renewal n. 更新，复兴；renewable adj. 可更新的，可恢复的

renovate［'renəveɪt］

vt. 革新；修理，修复〈同 renew〉

例　They claim that they can renovate worn shoes so that they look like new ones. 他们自称可以重修旧鞋，修完之后看上去像新的一样。

联　renovation n. 修复，整修，革新

repay［rɪ'peɪ］

v. 偿还〈同 reimburse, compensate〉

例　Repay your debts promptly to avoid trouble. 立即偿还债务，以免招来麻烦。

repel［rɪ'pel］

vt. 击退，驱逐〈同 repulse, resist〉

例　Anne repelled her attacker by kicking him. 安娜踢那个袭击她的人，击退了他。

记　re（反）+ pel（推）→ 反推 → 击退

联　repellent adj. 击退的，讨人厌的；repeal vt. 撤销，废除；rebel n. 造反者 vi. 造反；compel vt. 强迫；dispel vt. 驱散；expel vt. 排出，开除；impel vt. 驱使；propel vt. 推进

reproach［rɪ'prəʊtʃ］

v. 谴责〈同 reprimand, scold〉

例　She reproached me for being late. 她责备我迟到。

记　re（反）+ proach（靠近）→ 以反对的方式靠近 → 谴责

联　reproachful adj. 责备的；approach n./v. 接近，方法；broach vt. 给…开口，钻孔，开始讨论





reproduce［ˌri:prə'dju:s; (US)ˌri:prə'du:s］

v. 繁殖，再生；复制〈同 multiply, duplicate〉

例　Reproduce three copies of the contract for your records. 复印三份合同放在你的档案里。

联　reproductive adj. 生殖的；reproduction n. 复制品，繁殖

reputation［ˌrepju(:)'teɪʃən］

n. 名誉，名声〈同 repute〉

例　She has a reputation as an honest person. 她享有诚实人的声誉。

15. Most plants ______ by seeds.

16. This store has an excellent ______ for fair dealing.

第三部分

resent［rɪ'zent］

vt. 愤恨，怨恨〈同 begrudge〉

例　Janet resented the way her boyfriend treated her. 珍妮特厌恶她男朋友对待她的方式。

联　resentful adj. 愤恨的，怨恨的；resentment n. 怨恨，愤恨





reside［rɪ'zaɪd］

vi. 居住〈同 dwell, live〉

例　In order to pay a lesser fee at a state university, you must reside in the state for one year. 如果你想要在州立大学少缴点学费，就必须在这个州居住满一年。

联　residence n. 居住，住处；resident n. 居民；residential adj. 住宅的，与居住有关的

resonance［'rezənəns］

n. 回声，反响〈同 reverberation〉

例　The opera singer's voice has very good resonance. 歌剧演员的声音有很好的共鸣效果。

记　re（回）+ son（声音）+ ance → 声音回来 → 回声，反响

联　resonate v. 共鸣，反响；resonant adj.（声音）洪亮的，共鸣的；dissonant adj. 不和谐的；supersonic adj. 超音速的；stereosonic adj. 立体声的

respect［rɪ'spekt］

n. ① 尊敬，敬重〈同 admiration, honor〉

例　The children always showed great respect for their grandparents. 小孩一向对他们的祖父母表现得很尊重。

② 方面〈同 aspect〉

例　The plan is unwise in many respects. 这个计划在许多方面不够明智。

vt. 尊敬，敬重〈同 admire〉

例　I respect you for your honesty. 你为人正直，我敬重你。

联　respectable adj. 可敬的，有名望的，值得尊敬的；respectful adj. 恭敬的，尊敬的；disrespect n. 失礼，无礼

restraint［rɪ'streɪnt］

n. 抑制，克制〈同 control, constraint〉

例　She was very angry, but she spoke with restraint. 她很生气，但是说话还是很克制。

联　restrain vt. 克制，抑制；unrestrained adj. 无限制的

restrict［rɪ'strɪkt］

vt. 限制，约束〈同 inhibit, confine〉

例　The United States has laws that restrict the number and kinds of immigrants allowed to enter its borders. 对于允许进入美国境内的移民的数量和类别，美国有法律来加以限制。

联　restriction n. 限制，约束；restrictive adj. 限制性的；unrestricted adj. 无限制的，自由的

retort［rɪ'tɔ:t; 'ri:tɔ:t］

v. 反驳

例　He retorted upon me, saying I was to blame. 他反驳我，说我该受到责备。

记　re（反）+ tort（扭）→ 反扭 → 反驳

联　distort v. 弄歪（嘴脸等），歪曲（真理、事实等）；extort vt. 敲诈，勒索；contort v. 扭曲，歪曲；resort vt. 求助，诉诸；tortuous adj. 弯曲的，转弯抹角的

retrieve［rɪ'tri:v］

v. 重新找回，取回；找回猎物〈同 regain〉

例　The dog was intelligent and quickly learned to retrieve the duck killed by the hunter. 这只狗很聪明，它很快就学会了捡回被猎人捕杀的鸭子。

记　re（重新）+ trieve（= find 找到）→ 重新找回

联　retrieval n. 取回，挽救；retry vt. 再试；reiterate vt. 重申

retrospect［'retrəspekt］

n. 反顾，回顾〈同 review, reexamination〉

例　In retrospect, I think I would have done better as an artist. 回首往事，我认为我要是当了艺术家，一定要比现在好。

记　retro（向后）+ gress（走）→ 倒退 → 回顾

联　retrospective adj. 回顾的，怀旧的；introspect v. 反省，内省；circumspect adj. 谨慎的，小心的

revenge［rɪ'venʤ］

vt. 替…报仇，复仇〈同 avenge〉

例　He joined the army to revenge his brother who had been killed by the enemy the year before. 他参军为他哥哥报仇，他哥哥一年前被敌人杀害了。

自我检测　从第三部分中选出最适当的词填入空格内。

18. The hollow body of a guitar gives it ______.

19. The earthquake victim ______ the poor emergency care.

20. “It was you who made me spill the water,”she ______.

21. The team will try to ______ its loss in tomorrow's game.

22. Our club membership is ______ to twelve.

23. In ______, I wish I hadn't eaten so much pizza, because now I am so full.



第四部分

revenue［'revənju:; (US)'revənu:］

n.（营业）收入；税收〈同 income〉

例　Our yard sale generated a lot of extra revenue. 我们出售旧货，获得了许多额外的收入。

记　re（回）+ ven（来）+ ue → 回来的东西 →（营业）收入

联　avenue n. 大道

revolutionary［ˌrevə'lu:ʃənəri］

adj. 革命的；彻底改变的〈同 pioneering〉

例　The government is cracking down on revolutionary militia groups. 政府正打击民兵自卫队。

联　revolutionize vt. 彻底改革，在…方面发动革命；revolution n. 革命

revolve［rɪ'vɒlv］

v.（使）旋转〈同 rotate〉

例　The eight planets revolve around the sun. 八大行星围绕太阳旋转。

rigorous［'rɪgərəs］

adj. 严格的〈同 stringent, strict〉

例　Along with the other physical sciences, meteorology has developed in the past three centuries from myth and folklore to rigorous observation, computation, and analysis. 同其他物理科学一起，气象学在过去的三个世纪中，从神话和民间传说发展到严密的观察、计算和分析。

记　来自名词 rigor（严厉）：rig（= rigid 严厉的）+ or + ous → 严厉的

联　rigorousness n. 严厉；rigor n. 严格，严厉；vigorous adj. 精力旺盛的；rigid adj. 僵硬的，严苛的

rim［rɪm］

n. 边缘〈同 edge〉

例　The rim of my coffee cup is chipped. 我的咖啡杯的边缘破了。

联　brim n.（杯的）边，缘；dim adj. 模糊的





rip［rɪp］

vt. 撕，撕裂〈同 tear, rend〉

例　Mary ripped the cloth into strips. 玛丽把布撕成了条。

联　drip n. 水滴 v.（使）滴下；dripstone n. 滴水石，石笋；ripe adj. 熟的，成熟的；ripen v.（使）成熟

ripple［'rɪpəl］

n./v.（起）波纹〈同 wave〉

例　Throw a stone into still water and watch the ripples spread in rings. 把石头扔进平静的水里，观察呈环状散开的波纹。

ritual［'rɪtʃʊəl］

n. 典礼，宗教仪式；例行公事，常规〈同 ceremony, habit〉

例　They go through the ritual of locking all doors and windows before going to bed. 睡觉之前，他们按照惯例把所有的门窗都锁好。

robbery［'rɒbəri］

n. 抢劫

例　The suspects in the robbery were wearing masks. 抢劫案中的疑犯带着面具。

联　robber n. 强盗，盗贼

robust［rəʊ'bʌst］

adj. 强壮的，健康的〈同 strong, healthy〉

例　The candidate for the football team had a robust physique. 申请加入足球队的人有强健的体格。

Lesson 25





音频



预备测验

找出与句子中划线单词意义最相近的词。

1. Television advertising has been under constant scrutiny for the last few years.

(A) counterattack

(B) pressure

(C) examination

2. There is a great selection of books on that topic.

(A) variety

(B) similarity

(C) deficiency

3. The goose quill pen（鹅毛笔）has a great sentimental appeal in this century's highly mechanized culture.

(A) fashion

(B) emotional

(C) monetary

4. The community college is the most rapidly growing segment of higher education in the United States.

(A) core

(B) idea

(C) sector

5. Among all societies legal marriage is usually accompanied by some kind of ceremony that expresses group sanction of the union.

(A) opinion

(B) coercion

(C) approval



第一部分

rot［rɒt］

v.（使）腐烂，（使）腐败〈同 putrefy〉

例　So much rain will make the fruit rot. 过多的雨水将会使水果腐烂。

rupture［'rʌptʃə(r)］

n./v. 破裂，裂开〈同 break, crack〉

例　We must fix the dam before it ruptures. 我们必须在大坝决口前修复它。

记　rupt（断）+ ure → 断裂 → 破裂

联　abrupt adj. 突然的；erupt v. 喷发；corrupt adj. 腐败的；disrupt vt. 使中断；使分裂；rapture n. 全神贯注，兴高采烈 vt. 使狂喜；interrupt v. 打断；bankrupt vt. 使破产；corrupt adj. 腐败的

rust［rʌst］

n. 锈，生锈

例　The iron gate was covered with rust. 铁门锈迹斑斑。

联　rustic adj. 乡村的；乡下风格的；rustproof adj. 不锈的

sacred［'seɪkrɪd］

adj. 神圣的，不可冒犯的〈同 divine〉

例　Mecca is a sacred Islamic city. 麦加是穆斯林的圣城。

记　sacr（神圣）+ ed → 神圣的

联　sacrifice n. 牺牲品；desecrate vt. 亵渎；secular adj. 尘世的，世俗的

safeguard［'seɪfgɑ:d］

vt. 保护，捍卫〈同 protect〉

例　The life vests safeguarded against people drowning in the water. 救生衣能保护人们不溺水。

n. 安全装置，安全措施〈同 protection〉

例　The autopilot device is a safeguard for planes in case something happens to the pilot. 自动驾驶仪能在飞行员发生意外的情况下保护飞机。

saint［seɪnt］

n. 圣人，道德崇高的人〈同 holy person〉

例　Her endless good deeds made her a saint in the eyes of many. 她不停地行善使她成为许多人眼里的圣人。

联　saintly adj. 圣洁的

sanction［'sæŋkʃən］

n. ① 制裁〈同 prohibition, penalty〉

例　The United Nations enforced a sanction against the country that violated international law. 联合国对违反国际法的国家实施制裁。

② 批准，认可〈同 approval〉

例　Unless you have your parents' sanction, you cannot go to the party tonight. 你今天晚上不能去参加派对，除非得到了你父母的同意。

记　sanct（神圣）+ ion → 神圣之物，原指教会的法令，引申为“批准，认可”

联　section n. 片断

saturate［'sætʃəreɪt］

vt. 浸透，使湿透〈同 soak〉

例　Their clothes were saturated by the rain. 他们的衣服被雨水浸透了。

记　satur（饱满）+ ate → 使饱满 → 浸透

联　saturation n. 饱和；saturated adj. 饱和的；sate vt. 使心满意足

savage［'sævɪʤ］

adj. 野蛮的，未开化的；凶猛的，残忍的〈同 barbarian, fierce〉

例　The hunter tried to fend off the tiger's savage attack. 猎人试着避开老虎凶猛的攻击。

saw［sɔ:］

v. 锯，锯开

例　They sawed off the dead branches from the tree. 他们锯掉了树上枯萎的树枝。

n. 锯子〈同 cutter〉

例　The teeth of the saw broke when it hit metal. 锯子碰到金属的时候，锯齿断了。

9. Dead plants ______ and become part of the soil again.
