第二部分

scandal［'skændəl］

n. 丑闻〈同 disgrace〉

例　The president had to resign because of the scandal. 由于丑闻事件，总统不得不下台。

联　scandalous adj. 丢脸的；scan v. 细察；sandal n. 凉鞋，檀香；scandalize vt. 使愤慨

scanty［'skænti］

adj. 缺乏的，不足的〈同 insufficient, sparse〉

例　In the end they came to the conclusion that evidence is scanty. 最后他们得出结论，认为证据不足。

scar［skɑ:(r)］

n. 疤痕，伤痕

例　The cut on his finger from when he was cooking left a scar. 他在做饭的时候切伤了手指，留下了伤疤。

scent［sent］

n. 气味，香味〈同 odor, fragrance〉

例　The scent of the perfume reminded him of his first girlfriend. 香水的气味使他想起了他第一个女朋友。

联　ascent n. 上升，攀登；descent n. 降下，降落，世系，血统；quiescent adj. 静止的；incandescent adj. 遇热发光的，白炽的；fluorescent adj. 荧光的；adolescent n. 青少年

scorn［skɔ:n］

n./vt. 轻蔑，不屑做〈同 belittle〉

例　Her friends scorned at her for wearing such a short dress. 她的朋友嘲笑她穿了一条很短的裙子。

scrap［skræp］

n. 废料，残余物〈同 fragment〉

例　The archaeological records are based on scraps of stone, bone and earthenware. 考古学的记录基于对一些石头、骨头和陶器的碎片的研究。

vt. 废弃，扔弃〈同 throw away〉

例　If the weather doesn't get any better, we may have to scrap our plans for this afternoon's picnic. 如果天气还不好转，我们可能会取消下午野餐的计划。

联　scrub v. 擦洗；scrabble v. 乱写；scramble v. 爬

scrape［skreɪp］

n. 刮，擦；擦痕

例　The doctor said the scrape on his arm would heal in a week. 医生说他胳膊上的擦伤一周后就会痊愈。

vi. 刮掉，擦掉〈同 rub〉

例　He fell off his bike and scraped his arm on the sidewalk. 他从自行车上摔下来，胳膊在人行道上擦伤了。

联　scraping n. 刮削下的碎屑

screen［skri:n］

n. 屏幕

例　He cleaned his computer screen every day to make sure he could see clearly. 他每天擦拭电脑显示屏，以便能清楚地看清上面显示的信息。

vt. 甄别，审查〈同 examine〉

例　All women over 50 will be screened for breast cancer, because this disease is often found in this age group. 所有50岁以上的妇女都要做乳腺癌的筛查，因为这种疾病在这个年龄段高发。





script［skrɪpt］

n. 手稿，手迹；剧本

例　She wrote the script for the popular movie. 是她为这部很受欢迎的电影写的剧本。

scrutiny［'skru:tɪni; (US)'skru:təni］

n. 详细审查〈同 inspection〉

例　The professor's scrutiny of the student's essay was thorough. 教授十分详细地检查学生写的文章。

第三部分

sculpture［'skʌlptʃə(r)］

n. 雕塑；雕刻品〈同 statue〉

例　Sculpture is the art of shaping solid materials. 雕刻是塑造坚硬物体的艺术。

联　sculpt v. 雕刻；sculptor n. 雕刻家；sculptural adj. 雕刻的；雕刻般的





seam［si:m］

n. 接缝，缝合线

例　The shirt was so old that its seams were coming apart. 这件衬衫太破旧了，接缝都裂开了。

联　seamen n. 海员；seabed n. 海底，海床；seamount n. 海底山；seaport n. 海港，港口；seashore n. 海岸，海滨；seaweed n. 海草，海藻

section［'sekʃən］

n. 部分；节〈同 part, segment〉

例　This section of the library has many books about studying English. 图书馆的这个部分有许多关于英语学习的书籍。

联　sectional adj. 部分的，部门的；subsection n. 分部，分段；intersection n. 十字路口，交叉点

seemingly［'si:mɪŋli］

adv. 表面上，似乎〈同 apparently〉

例　The seemingly occasional accident is actually purposely designed. 看上去似乎是偶然的意外事故实际上是蓄意谋划的。

segment［'segmənt］

n. 部分；片段〈同 sector, portion〉

例　A meter is divided into one hundred segments of one centimeter each. 1米可以分成100个1厘米。

记　seg（= sect 部分）+ ment → 部分

联　segmental adj. 部分的，片断的

segregate［'segrɪgeɪt］

vt. 分离，隔离〈同 isolate〉

例　The staff segregated the boys from the girls during gym class. 在上健身课的时候，工作人员把男孩和女孩分开。

记　se（分开）+ greg（团体）+ ate → 和团体分开 → 隔离

联　segregation n. 种族隔离；aggregate n. 合计，总计 v. 聚集，集合；gregarious adj. 爱社交的，群居的；congregate v. 聚集；egregious adj. 异乎寻常的，惊人的

selection［sɪ'lekʃən］

n. 选择，挑选；选集，精选品〈同 choice, collection〉

例　His selection as a candidate was assured. 他将被挑出当候选人，这事已确定无疑。

seminar［'semɪnɑ:(r)］

n. 研究会，讨论会〈同 conference〉

例　The professor gave a one-hour seminar on the laws of physics. 教授给了一个小时来研讨物理定律。

sensation［sen'seɪʃən］

n. 感觉，知觉〈同 feeling〉

例　Sticking my feet into the pool was a cold sensation. 我把脚伸到水池里，感觉很冷。

sentence［'sentəns］

n./vt. 宣判，判决

例　His sentence for the crime was 10 years. 他因这项罪名被判十年监禁。

第四部分

sentimental［ˌsentɪ'mentəl］

adj. 感伤的，感情脆弱的〈同 emotional〉

例　It's a cheap ring but it has great sentimental value for me. 这枚戒指虽然便宜，但对于我而言有巨大的情感价值。

记　来自名词 sentiment（感情）：senti（感觉）+ ment + al → 感觉的 → 感情脆弱的

联　sentiment n. 情感，情绪，多愁善感；sentimentalize v.（使）伤感；sentimentalism n. 感情主义，感情用事；sentient adj. 感觉灵敏的，意识到的

shabby［'ʃæbi］

adj. 破旧的，褴褛的〈同 worn〉

例　When Janet moved into her boyfriend's apartment, she would not let him keep that old shabby couch. 当珍妮特搬到男朋友公寓的时候，她是不会让他还留着那个破旧的沙发的。

记　shab(b)（疥癣；粗糙）+ y → 褴褛的

联　shabbiness n. 破旧；scabby adj. 结痂的；flabby adj.（肌肉）松垮的，意志薄弱的；tatty adj. 破旧的，邋遢的；threadbare adj.（衣服）磨破的，陈腐的

shade［ʃeɪd］

n. ① 荫，阴凉处；阴影〈同 shadow〉

例　The only shade on the treeless street was his own shadow. 在没有树的街上，唯一的阴凉就是他自己的影子。

② 遮光物，帘

例　I lowered all of the window shades so people couldn't see in. 我把所有的窗帘都放了下来，这样人们就看不见里面了。

联　lampshade n. 灯罩





shaft［ʃɑ:ft; (US)ʃæft］

n. 杆状物，轴

例　The soldiers were taught to break the shafts of arrows that had penetrated their flesh. 士兵们受到训练，身体中箭后，要折断箭的杆部。

sharpen［'ʃɑ:pən］

vt. 削尖；使敏锐，使敏捷〈同 make pointed, improve〉

例　The pianist practices a lot to sharpen his playing. 钢琴家通过大量练习使演奏更加熟练。

联　sharply adv. 突然地，猛烈地

shatter［'ʃætə(r)］

v.（使）粉碎，（使）破碎〈同 destroy, break up〉

例　The stone shattered the window. 石头打碎了窗玻璃。

联　shatterproof adj. 防碎的；scatter v.（使）分散；shutter n. 百叶窗，快门；tatter n. 褴褛的衣衫，破旧的布片

sheer［ʃɪə(r)］

adj. ① 陡峭的〈同 steep〉

例　From the top of the wall it was a sheer drop of 100 feet to the water below. 从墙顶到水面有100英尺的垂直落差。

② 纯粹的，绝对的〈同 complete, absolute〉

例　Don't believe him; his words are sheer nonsense. 别相信他，他的话都是一派胡言。

联　jeer v. 嘲笑；steer v. 掌舵，驾驶

shepherd［'ʃepəd］

n. 牧羊人；牧羊犬

例　The shepherd led the sheep back home. 牧羊人赶着羊回家了。

shipment［'ʃɪpmənt］

n. 装运；装载的货物

例　The company sent the shipment of furniture directly to my house. 公司直接装上家具，送到我家。

shot［ʃɒt］

n. ① 照相，相片〈同 photograph〉

例　The photographer took many shots of the actor arriving at the event. 摄影师拍摄了许多演员到达现场的照片。

② 开枪，射击

例　The hunter's shot was too high and the rabbit escaped. 猎人射击位置过高，兔子跑了。

Lesson 26

预备测验

找出与句子中划线单词意义最相近的词。

1. Only sovereign states are able to made treaties.

(A) constitutional

(B) powerful

(C) independent

2. Mary McCarthy's novel The Group helped to solidify her position as America's foremost female author.

(A) describe

(B) assure

(C) characterize

3. Didn't you know that the naughty girl used to skip classes?

(A) attend classes in time

(B) miss classes

(C) cheat in classes

4. Amelia Earhart was the first woman to make a solo flight across the Atlantic.

(A) a noteworthy

(B) a speedy

(C) an unaccompanied

5. Many gymnasts do special exercises to remain slim and fit.

(A) tall

(B) lean

(C) healthy



第一部分

shrewd［ʃru:d］

adj. 精明的〈同 clever, sharp〉

例　The shrewd student received the highest score in the class. 这个聪明的学生得到了全班最高分。

shrug［ʃrʌg］

n./v. 耸肩

例　She did not care what brand toothpaste they bought and shrugged her shoulders. 她不在乎他们买了什么牌子的牙膏，只是耸了耸肩。

shutter［'ʃʌtə(r)］

n. 百叶窗

例　Put the windows down and close the shutters before the storm comes. 暴风雨来临之前把窗户放下来，百叶窗关上。

shuttle［'ʃʌtəl］

n. 往返汽车、列车等（穿梭往返固定线路的运输工具）

例　The student took a shuttle from school to the train station. 学生从学校坐穿梭公交去火车站。

联　space shuttle 航天飞机

signify［'sɪgnɪfaɪ］

vt. 表示，意味〈同 denote, mean〉

例　The poor results from the test trials signify that the shuttle is not ready for launch. 测试的糟糕结果意味着航天器还无法发射。

simultaneous［ˌsɪməl'teɪnɪəs; (US)ˌsaɪməl'teɪnɪəs］

adj. 同时的，同时发生的〈同 concurrent〉

例　The network made a simultaneous broadcast by radio and television. 联播网使得广播和电视可以同时播出同一节目。

记　simult（相同）+ aneous → 时间相同的 → 同时的

联　simultaneity n. 同时性；simulate v. 假装，模仿；simulation n. 假装；stimulate v. 刺激，激励

sin［sɪn］

n. 罪〈同 wrongdoing〉

例　The priest told the children that since they committed sins, they would go to hell. 牧师告诫小孩，如果他们犯下罪孽，就会下地狱。

skeleton［'skelɪtən］

n. 骨架；梗概〈同 framework〉

例　The students studied the skeleton in their biology class. 学生们在生物课上研究骨骼模型。

skeptical［'skeptɪkəl］

adj. 怀疑的；多疑的〈同 suspicious〉

例　I am skeptical of his methods; they do not seem very scientific to me. 我对他的方法持怀疑态度，我认为这些方法不太科学。

记　skept（怀疑）+ ical → 怀疑的

联　skepticism n. 怀疑，怀疑论；skeptic n. 怀疑论者；septic adj. 腐败的，脓毒性的

skip［skɪp］

v. ① 跳〈同 jump, hop〉

例　He skipped from rock to rock. 他从一块岩石上跳到另一块岩石上。

② 逃过；遗漏〈同 escape, omit〉

例　He got into trouble after he skipped class. 他逃课之后遇到麻烦了。

8. The ______ thief avoided getting caught by the police.

9. The space ______ returned to Earth after it traveled around the moon.

10. I ______ the questions I couldn't answer.

11. People who do not believe in God probably do not believe in ______.



第二部分

skyscraper［'skaɪskreɪpə(r)］

n. 摩天大楼〈同 edifice〉

例　Skyscrapers were the tallest buildings in the city. 摩天大楼曾是这个城市最高的建筑。

slack［slæk］

adj. ① 疏忽的〈同 negligent〉

例　The manager criticized them for being slack at their jobs; they omitted many details and incurred a lot of mistakes. 经理批评他们工作马虎；他们遗漏了很多细节，导致发生了许多错误。

② 松弛的，松散的

例　The slack rope needed to be tightened to make it more secure. 需要把松弛的绳索系紧，这样会更安全。

slap［slæp］

n./vt. 拍，拍击；掌击〈同 strike〉

例　She slapped him in the face after he made that impolite comment. 他说了那些无礼的话之后，她扇了他一耳光。

slaughter［'slɔ:tə(r)］

n./v. 屠宰牲畜；大屠杀〈同 massacre〉

例　Thousands of cattle are slaughtered every year to make hamburgers. 为了制作汉堡，每年都要宰杀数以千计的牛。

sleeve［sli:v］

n. 袖子

例　Johnson rolled up his sleeves before he washed the dishes. 约翰逊卷起袖子，开始洗碗。

slim［slɪm］

adj. 纤细的，苗条的〈同 slender〉

例　She went on a diet to become slim. 为了减肥，她开始节食。

记　联想记忆：sli（看作 slight）+ m（看作 me）→ 小小的我 → 苗条的

联　slimy adj. 黏土的，泥泞的；slip v. 滑倒；slit v. 切开，撕裂





slogan［'sləʊgən］

n. 口号，标语

例　Nike's famous slogan is“Just do it”.“Just do it”是耐克公司广为人知的一句广告语。

slot［slɒt］

n. 窄缝，狭槽

例　The postman told the lady to slide her letters into the slot. 邮递员告诉这位女士把信件投入信箱的槽里。

slum［slʌm］

n. 贫民窟

例　Her family could not afford a nice house and so they lived in the slums. 她家买不起像样的房子，只能住在贫民窟里。

联　slumber n./v. 睡眠

smash［smæʃ］

n./v. 打碎，粉碎〈同 crush〉

例　When she gets mad, she likes to smash dishes. 她发疯的时候，喜欢摔盘子。

14. Many long distance runners are very ______.

15. The attack on the defenseless people was a ______.

16. You could see the whole city from the top of the ______.

第三部分

smuggle［'smʌgəl］

vt. 走私

例　The criminal smuggled drugs into the country. 罪犯走私毒品到这个国家。

联　niggle v. 挑剔，吹毛求疵；wiggle v.（使）踌躇，摆动

snack［snæk］

n. 小吃，快餐

例　An apple can be a healthy snack. 苹果是健康的小吃。

snap［snæp］

v. ① 突然断裂〈同 break, crack〉

例　My shoelace snapped when I pulled it too tightly. 我刚一系紧鞋带，它就断了。

② 抢夺；抢购

例　It's really a bargain; you should snap it up. 这件东西价格真便宜，你应该马上买下它。

snatch［snætʃ］

n./v. 攫取，抓住〈同 seize〉

例　T he bird flew down and snatched the worm. 鸟俯冲下来，抓住了虫子。

soar［sɔ:(r)］

vi. ① 高飞，翱翔〈同 fly〉

例　The jet soared above the clouds. 飞机飞到了云层之上。

② 剧增〈同 rise〉

例　After he started studying hard, his grades soared. 他开始努力学习之后，成绩得到了快速提高。





sober［'səʊbə(r)］

adj. ① 清醒的，未喝醉的

例　The sober driver drove his drunk friends home. 清醒的司机开车把喝醉的朋友们送回了家。

② 冷静的，严肃的〈同 serious〉

例　She had a sober look on her face after she heard the bad news. 听到这个坏消息之后，她看上去很冷静。

联　sob v. 哭泣；snob n. 势利小人；somber adj. 阴森的，昏暗的，忧郁的

solidarity［ˌsɒlɪ'dærɪti］

n. 团结，团结一致〈同 unity, accord〉

例　The team won the game because of its strong solidarity. 由于小组团结一致，最终赢得了比赛。

记　solid（固体的）+ arity → 固体状态 → 团结

联　solidity n. 坚固，可靠；solidify v.（使）变得坚固；solidly adv. 坚硬地，稳固地

solidify［sə'lɪdɪfaɪ］

v.（使）凝固；（使）团结，巩固〈同 harden〉

例　It was so cold that the water solidified into ice. 天气太冷了，水都结冰了。

solitary［'sɒlɪtəri; (US)'sɒlɪteri］

adj. 孤独的；独居的〈同 isolated, alone〉

例　The solitary bachelor did not like Valentine's Day. 这个孤独的单身汉不喜欢过情人节。

记　solit（单独）+ ary → 单独一人的 → 孤独的

联　solitude n. 孤独；solicitous adj. 操心的，焦虑的

solo［'səʊləʊ］

n. 独奏曲

例　He always sang solos, never with anyone else. 他总是独唱，从来没有和别人合唱过。

adj. 单独的〈同 unaccompanied, single〉

例　Her solo violin performance was a big hit. 她的小提琴独奏表演很受欢迎。

联　soloist n. 独奏者，独唱者

第四部分

solution［sə'lu:ʃən］

n. ① 解答，解决〈同 answer〉

例　There are many solutions to a problem. 解决问题的办法有许多种。

② 溶液

例　Salt and water form a solution. 盐和水形成溶液。

sovereign［'sɒvrɪn］

n. 君主；统治〈同 monarch, king〉

例　The peasants bowed before their sovereign. 农民向君主鞠躬行礼。

adj. 独立自主的〈同 independent〉

例　The Americans did not want to be ruled by England and fought to become a sovereign country. 美国人不想被英国统治，他们通过斗争建立了独立的国家。

联　sovereignty n. 主权，统治权

spacious［'speɪʃəs］

adj. 广大的，宽敞的〈同 sizable, large〉

例　Working in a spacious room contributes to one's working efficiency. 在宽敞的房间里工作有利于提高工作效率。

span［spæn］

n. 跨度；一段时间〈同 length, range〉

例　Humans measure the span of their lives in decades. 人类以十年为单位来计算生命的长度。

sparkle［'spɑ:kəl］

n./v.（发）火花，（使）闪耀〈同 glitter〉

例　The stars seem to sparkle most on moonless nights. 在没有月亮的夜晚，星星显得尤其闪亮。





spatial［'speɪʃəl］

adj. 空间的

例　Bats emit sound waves to collect spatial information. 蝙蝠发射声波来获取空间的信息。

speciality［ˌspeʃɪ'æləti］

n. ① 招牌性的服务或产品；拳头产品

例　The waiter in the restaurant said their speciality was Peking Duck. 餐厅的服务员介绍北京烤鸭是他们的特色菜。

② 专业，特长〈同 metier〉

例　The scientist's speciality is Greek archaeology. 这位科学家的专长是希腊考古学。

联　specialist n. 专门医师，专家

species［'spi:ʃi:z］

n. 类群，种类〈同 kind, classification〉

例　Pine trees, of which there are almost one hundred species, are found throughout the North Temperate Zone. 松树几乎有上百个品种，遍布整个北温带。

联　subspecies n.【生】亚种

specification［ˌspesɪfɪ'keɪʃən］

n. 规格；详细说明书〈同 instruction, description〉

例　She wrote and sent the architect specifications on how she would like her new house to be built. 她就想要如何建造自己的新房子写了一份详细的说明书，然后把它寄给了建筑师。

specify［'spesɪfaɪ］

vt. 明确说明；具体指定〈同 detail, name〉

例　The chemistry professor specified what chemicals to use in order to avoid any accidents. 为了避免事故发生，化学教授明确说明了要使用的化学品。

联　specified adj. 特定的；specific adj. 具体的，特指的；specifically adv. 特定地，明确地

Lesson 27





音频



预备测验

找出与句子中划线单词意义最相近的词。

1. She stumbled and hurt herself.

(A) cried out

(B) tripped

(C) exaggerated

2. The introduction of standardized parts was a great contribution to the automobile industry.

(A) neutralized

(B) uniform

(C) advanced

3. Harriet Beecher Stowe, in her antislavery novel Uncle Tom's Cabin, aimed to stir the consciences of her readers.

(A) heed

(B) appease

(C) awaken

4. If an object is suspended from any point on the vertical line passing through its center of gravity, the object will remain stationary.

(A) secure

(B) flexible

(C) immobile

5. My aunt is very stubborn.

(A) soft hearted

(B) obdurate

(C) odd



第一部分

spectacle［'spektəkəl］

n. 奇观；展示，景象〈同 demonstration, show〉

例　The fireworks are a very popular spectacle on National Day. 在国庆节，烟火表演非常受欢迎。

spectacular［spek'tækjʊlə(r)］

adj. 引人入胜的，壮观的〈同 sensational, fascinating, grand〉

例　The most spectacular thing that happened in the 20th century was the invention of the computer. 20世纪最引人注目的事件就是电脑的发明。

记　来自名词 spectacle（奇观，壮观）：spect（看）+ ac(le)（东西）+ ular → 看的东西的 → 壮观的

联　spectrum n. 光谱，范围；speculate v. 思索，推测，投机；secular adj. 现世的，世俗的

spectator［spek'teɪtə(r); (US)'spekteɪtər］

n. 参观者，观众〈同 observer, audience〉

例　The spectators watched in sadness as their team lost the championship. 当他们关注的队伍输掉冠军赛的时候，观众的眼里充满了悲伤。

spectrum［'spektrəm］

n. 谱，光谱

例　The visible portion of the spectrum includes red at one end and violet at the other. 光谱的可见部分一端是红色的，另一端是紫色的。

联　spectra n. 光谱

speculate［'spekjʊleɪt］

v. 推测；沉思〈同 hypothesize, guess〉

例　He speculated that there would be a comet passing the Earth this May, but he was wrong. 他推测在五月份会有彗星经过地球，可是他错了。

记　spec（看）+ ul + ate（使…）→ 使仔细看，引起沉思 → 沉思

联　speculation n. 思索，推测，投机

spiral［'spaɪrəl］

adj. 螺旋形的，盘旋的〈同 rotary, curled〉

例　The spring has a spiral shape. 弹簧是螺旋形的。

记　spir(e)（螺旋）+ al → 螺旋形的

联　spiny adj. 多刺的，针状的；spinal adj. 脊髓的；spider n. 蜘蛛





splash［splæʃ］

v. 溅，泼〈同 throw a liquid〉

例　The baby liked to splash water when taking a bath. 这个婴儿在洗澡的时候，喜欢戏水玩耍。

联　splat v. 啪嗒作响；lash n. 鞭子，睫毛 v. 鞭打；splatter v. 泼，溅

spokesman［'spəʊksmən］

n. 发言人；代表者

例　The company spokesman met with the media and answered questions. 公司发言人与媒体见面，回答了他们提出的问题。

sponge［spʌnʤ］

n. 海绵

例　Elizabeth used a sponge to wash her back in the shower. 伊丽莎白在淋浴的时候用海绵擦洗后背。

spontaneous［spɒn'teɪnɪəs］

adj. 自发的，自然产生的〈同 instinctive, natural〉

例　There was spontaneous applause at the end of Mary's speech. 在玛丽演讲结束后，观众自发为她喝彩。

记　spont（自愿）+ aneous → 自发的

联　spontaneity n. 自发性；simultaneous adj. 同时的，同时发生的

自我检测　从第一部分中选出最适当的词填入空格内。

6. Scientists ______ that the rare bone they found was from a dinosaur.

7. The opera singer last night gave a ______ show that brought many people to tears.

8. DNA resembles a ______.

9. She would not answer any questions and told reporters that her lawyer was her ______.

10. Every rainbow has a ______ of colors.

11. After falling into the water, the ______ became larger.



第二部分

spouse［spaʊz; (US)spaʊs］

n. 配偶

例　All the employees will bring their spouses and children to the company's Christmas party. 所有员工将带着配偶和孩子参加公司组织的圣诞派对。

联　espouse v. 支持，拥护；spousal adj. 结婚的；spout n. 喷管 v. 喷出

spy［spaɪ］

n. 间谍，侦探

例　The spy stole the secret documents from the government building. 间谍从政府大楼里偷出了机密文件。

v. 侦察，暗中监视；看见，发现

例　She spied someone breaking into her neighbor's house and called the police. 她发现有人闯入了邻居家，然后报了警。

stabilize［'steɪbɪlaɪz］

vt. 使稳定，使坚固〈同 secure〉

例　In Japan and elsewhere, the trees are planted to stabilize the soil on steep mountain slopes. 在日本以及其他一些地区，人们在陡峭的山坡上种植植物以防止土壤流失。

stainless［'steɪnlɪs］

adj. ① 纯洁的，无瑕疵的

例　After founding four successful businesses, his business reputation was stainless. 成功建立了四个公司之后，他的商业信誉很优良。

② 不生锈的

例　Many pots and pans are made out of stainless steel. 许多厨具由不锈钢制成。

staircase［'steəkeɪs］

n. 楼梯

例　Please use the staircase in case of fire, not the elevators. 一旦遇见火情，请使用楼梯，不要使用电梯。

stall［stɔ:l］

n. 货摊；畜栏，厩

例　He always opened his food stall bright and early and made breakfast for his customers. 他总是一大早就开始营业，为顾客制作早点。

v.（使）停转，（使）停止〈同 stop〉

例　The old car stalled at the stop light. 这辆老旧的汽车在红灯前停了下来。

standardize［'stændədaɪz］

vt. 使符合标准，使标准化〈同 normalize〉

例　The president standardized company policies at all the offices. 总裁要求所有办公室按照公司政策的标准行事。

联　standardized adj. 标准化的

standpoint［'stændpɔɪnt］

n. 立场，观点

例　From his standpoint, Ken found he could not agree with the majority. 从他的立场出发，肯发现他无法同意大多数人的意见。

记　stand（站）+ point（点）→ 站的地方 → 立场

联　standstill n. 停止，停顿

startle［'stɑ:təl］

v. 震惊〈同 surprise, scare〉

例　The thunder startled the baby. 婴儿被雷声吓到了。

static［'stætɪk］

adj. 静态的，呆板的〈同 stationary〉

例　The painting had a picture of a static dog sleeping. 这幅油画画的是一只安静睡觉的小狗。





自我检测　从第二部分中选出最适当的词填入空格内。

12. He saw two men ______ on him from behind a tree.

13. From the ______ of the consumer, better quality at a lower price would be best.

14. She and her ______ have been together for more than ten years.

15. The economy has been anything but ______ this year, with many ups and downs.

16. Computers were ______ for the Internet.

17. One property of ______ steel is that it will not rust.



第三部分

stationary［'steɪʃənəri; (US)'steɪʃəneri］

adj. 固定的，静止的〈同 fixed, motionless〉

例　I think your arm is broken. Try to keep it stationary until we get to the hospital. 我觉得你的胳膊骨折了。在咱们到医院之前，让你的胳膊保持不动。

stationery［'steɪʃənəri; (US)'steɪʃəneri］

n. 文具

例　He forgot to bring any stationery to class and asked a friend for a pen and paper. 他上课忘带文具了，于是找朋友借了一支笔和纸。

statistics［stə'tɪstɪks］

n. 统计学

例　The enterprise relied on statistics to decide its target audience and marketing strategy. 企业依靠统计数据来决定目标客户和市场营销策略。

联　statistical adj. 统计的，统计学的

stereotype［'sterɪəʊtaɪp; 'stɪərɪəʊtaɪp］

n. 陈规，老套；模式化的形象、思想等

例　His perception that all Scottish people were stingy was based on a gross stereotype. 基于一种固有的印象，他认为所有苏格兰人都很吝啬。

记　stereo（坚固的）+ type（类型）→ 成为固定不变的类型 → 模式化的形象

联　stereo n. 立体，立体声 adj. 立体的；stereotypy n. 铅版印刷术；stereomicroscope n. 立体显微镜；stereophonic adj. 立体音响的

stern［stɜ:n］

adj. 苛刻的，严格的；严厉的〈同 strict, severe〉

例　The museum guard gave us a stern warning not to touch the paintings. 博物馆的保安严厉警告我们不要触碰画作。

记　联想记忆：发音很像上海话“死特了” → 死板的 → 苛刻的，严格的

联　cistern n.（抽水马桶的）贮水池；intern n. 实习生

steward［'stjʊəd］

n.（轮船、飞机等的）乘务员；管家

例　The airline steward gave out the lunch on the flight. 空乘人员在飞机上分发了午餐。

stimulus［'stɪmjʊləs］

n.（pl. stimuli）刺激；刺激物

例　His good grade was a stimulus for him to study harder. 他优秀的成绩激励他更努力地读书。

记　stimul（刺激）+ us → 刺激物

联　stimulate v. 刺激，激励；stimulating adj. 使人兴奋的；stimulant n. 兴奋剂，刺激物

stir［stɜ:(r)］

v. 激起，引起；搅动〈同 churn〉

例　If you stir your tea, the sugar will melt more quickly. 如果你搅一搅茶，糖就会融化得更快。

联　stirring adj. 激动人心的，活跃的；stirrer n. 搅拌器，搅拌者





stitch［stɪtʃ］

v. 缝〈同 sew, knit〉

例　She stitched the hole in her husband's shirt. 她将丈夫衬衫上的破洞缝补好了。

straightforward［streɪt'fɔ:wəd］

adj. ①（指人、态度等）坦率的，老实的〈同 honest〉

例　Her criticism of any paper was straightforward and painful. 她针对每篇论文提出的批评都很直接，让人不快。

② 简单的，易懂的〈同 simple, not difficult to do〉

例　The negotiator gave a very straightforward explanation as to why he would not assume any risks. 谈判者简单解释了为什么他不会承担任何风险。

记　组合词：straight（正直的）+ forward（向前的）→ 坦率的

联　straightness n. 正直，率直；straighten v.（使）弄直，伸直；straitened adj. 穷困的，拮据的；strait n. 海峡

21. They waited until the plane was ______ before they stood up.

22. ______ do not take into account individual differences.

23. Ambition is a great ______ for a person to work hard.



第四部分

streamlined［'stri:mlaɪnd］

adj. 流线型的

例　Fish developed their streamlined shape to swim faster. 鱼类进化成了流线型是为了游得更快。

联　streamliner n. 流线型高速列车





stride［straɪd］

n. 大步，一跨步〈同 step, pace〉

例　The child could not keep up with his father's stride. 小孩无法跟上父亲的脚步。

striking［'straɪkɪŋ］

adj. 醒目的，引人注目的；惊人的〈同 dramatic, outstanding〉

例　The girl's beauty is striking. 这个女孩美艳动人。

联　strikingly adv. 醒目地，引人注目地

strive［straɪv］

vi. 努力，奋斗；力求〈同 endeavor, try〉

例　We must strive to finish this report before we leave because it is due tomorrow morning. 我们必须在离开之前完成这份报告，因为截止日期是明天上午。

联　strain v. 拉紧，竭尽全力；struggle v. 斗争；strife n. 纷争，倾轧

stubborn［'stʌbən］

adj. 顽固的，固执的〈同 headstrong, obstinate〉

例　She was very stubborn and would not agree with him no matter what. 她很顽固，无论在什么事情上都不同意他的意见。

联　stubbornness n. 倔强，顽强

studio［'stju:dɪəʊ; (US)'stu:dɪəʊ］

n. 录音室；艺术家工作室

例　The singer recorded her new CD in a studio in London. 这位歌手在伦敦的一家录音棚录制了新CD。

stumble［'stʌmbəl］

vi. 绊倒〈同 trip, fall〉

例　Fred was distracted by his friend, causing him to stumble on a rock. 弗雷德被他的朋友弄得心烦意乱，不小心绊到了石头上。

sturdy［'stɜ:di］

adj.（人）强健的，结实的；（物）稳固的〈同 robust, strong〉

例　The walls of this house are so sturdy that not even an earthquake could knock them down. 这座房子的墙很坚固，连地震都震不倒它。

记　联想记忆：study 中间多出一个 r

联　stutter v. 结巴地说出；stupor n. 昏迷；stout adj. 结实的，矮胖的；stalwart adj. 健壮的，坚定的

subjective［səb'ʤektɪv］

adj. 主观的，个人的

例　His assessment was too subjective to be considered seriously. 他的评价过于主观，不会被认真考虑。

记　subject（主题，主观）+ ive（…的）→ 主观的

联　subject n. 主题 v. 支配，使隶属；objective adj. 客观的；adjective n. 形容词；abject adj. 卑鄙的，可怜的

subordinate［sə'bɔ:dɪnət; (US)sə'bɔ:dənət］

adj. 下级的，从属的〈同 inferior〉

例　The subordinate soldiers did not question the commander. 下属士兵完全服从长官的命令。

记　sub（下面）+ ordin（顺序）+ ate → 顺序在下面 → 从属的

联　insubordinate adj. 不服从的；ordinance n. 法令；coordinate v. 整理，协调；inordinate adj. 过度的，过分的

Lesson 28





音频



预备测验

找出与句子中划线单词意义最相近的词。

1. The symptoms of influenza are fever, headache and muscular pain.

(A) effects

(B) delights

(C) signs

2. The founders of the United States were suspicious of a central government that was very powerful.

(A) in need of

(B) mistrustful of

(C) favorable to

3. The Argentine mountain named Aconcagua is the highest summit outside Central Asia.

(A) volcano

(B) range

(C) peak

4. During hard times, rural people tend to swarm into cities.

(A) throng

(B) retreat

(C) withdraw

5. All of the tenants in the building complained about the lack of hot water.

(A) old people

(B) landlords

(C) occupants



第一部分

subscribe［səb'skraɪb］

v. 订阅

例　The saleswoman wanted me to subscribe to several magazines. 女销售员希望我订几本杂志。

subsidiary［səb'sɪdɪəri］

n. 支流；子公司〈同 branch〉

例　The company's main office is in New York but it has subsidiaries in Los Angeles and Miami. 公司的总部在纽约，但是在洛杉矶和迈阿密都有分公司。

记　sub（下）+ sid（坐）+iary → 坐在下面 → 子公司

联　subside vi. 下沉，平息

subsidize［'sʌbsɪdaɪz］

vt. 补助，资助〈同 finance, fund〉

例　The City Opera is subsidized by individual and corporate donations. 市剧院由个人和公司出资建造。

联　subsidy n. 补助金，津贴

subtle［'sʌtəl］

adj. 微妙的，细微的〈同 slight, delicate〉

例　Subtle humor is often hard to understand. 微妙的幽默通常难懂。

记　sub（下面）+ tle → 在下面的东西 → 微妙的

联　subtlety n. 微妙，狡猾；subtitle n. 副标题

suburb［'sʌbɜ:b］

n. 郊区〈同 outskirts, vicinity〉

例　Many people work in the busy city and live in a quiet suburb. 许多人在繁忙的市里工作，在安静的郊区居住。

联　suburbanization n. 近郊化，郊区建造；suburbanite n. 郊区居民

sue［su:］

v. 提出诉讼，控告〈同 appeal〉

例　If he does not pay me by the first of the month, I will have to sue him. 如果他月初不付我钱，我就只好起诉他了。

联　pursue vt. 追赶，追踪，从事；tissue n. 薄的纱织品，薄纸，棉纸，【生】组织

suffice［sə'faɪs］

v. 足够，有能力；使满足〈同 be enough〉

例　Will one hundred dollars suffice to buy that stereo? 100美元够买这个立体声音响吗？

联　sufficient adj. 充分的，足够的；suffix n. 【语】后缀，下标

suicide［'su:ɪsaɪd; 'sju:ɪsaɪd］

n. 自杀，自毁

例　Some people say smoking cigarettes is a form of suicide. 许多人说吸烟是一种慢性自杀。

suitcase［'su:tkeɪs; 'sju:tkeɪs］

n. 手提箱，衣箱

例　He packed all his clothes for the trip into one suitcase. 他把旅行要带的所有衣服打包放到了一个箱子里。

summit［'sʌmɪt］

n. 山顶，顶点〈同 peak, acme〉

例　The climbers placed their country's flag at the mountain's summit. 登山者把他们国家的旗帜插到了山顶上。





自我检测　从第一部分中选出最适当的词填入空格内。

6. The joke was too ______ for foreigners to understand.

7. The telescope was placed on the ______ in order to have a better view of the stars.

8. She ______ the driver of the car that hit her.

9. Jack's company ______ his business trip.

10. This bank has more than 50 ______ in the city and has the highest number of clients.

11. I am not very thirsty so one glass of water will ______.



第二部分

summon［'sʌmən］

vt. 召唤，传唤；召集〈同 call〉

例　She was summoned to the principal's office for misbehaving. 由于行为失当，她被叫去院长办公室了。

联　summons n. 传票，传唤；monition n. 忠告，警告；admonitory adj. 忠告的

superb［su:'pɜ:b; sju:'pɜ:b］

adj. 极好的，超级的〈同 excellent, wonderful〉

例　This excellent restaurant serves superb steaks. 这家高档的餐厅有优质牛排。

记　super（上等，超越）+ b → 超级的

联　superbly adv. 雄伟地，壮丽地，极好地；super adj. 特级的，极好的；superior adj. 较高的，上级的

superiority［su:ˌpɪərɪ'ɒrəti］

n. 优越，优秀

例　The stars on the general's uniform are a sign of superiority to lower ranking officers. 将军军装上的星星是其比低级别军官卓越的标志。

supersonic［ˌsu:pə'sɒnɪk; ˌsju:pə'sɒnɪk］

adj. 超音速的

例　The supersonic jet flew at a speed twice the speed of sound. 超音速战机以音速两倍的速度飞行。

记　super（超级，超过）+ sonic（声音的）→ 超音速的

联　supersede vt. 代替，取代；superstar n. 超级明星；superstition n. 迷信；sonic adj. 音速的；sonata n. 奏鸣曲；sonorous adj. 洪亮的

supervise［'su:pəvaɪz; 'sju:pəvaɪz］

vt. 监督，指导〈同 administer, direct〉

例　The manager supervised the workers to make sure they did a quality job. 经理监督工人以确保他们的工作质量。

联　supervision n. 监督，管理；supervisor n. 主管，管理人





suppress［sə'pres］

vt. 镇压，抑制〈同 check, restrain〉

例　Bob would be a more attractive person if he did not suppress his impulses toward warmth and affection. 如果鲍勃不去压抑自己对温暖与爱的向往，他会是一个更有吸引力的人。

surge［sɜ:ʤ］

n. 汹涌，澎湃，喷发〈同 outburst, eruption〉

例　A surge of anger swept over her when she saw her boyfriend with another woman. 当看见自己的男朋友和别的女人在一起的时候，她怒火中烧。

联　insurgent adj. 叛乱的；urge v. 敦促；purge v. 肃清，净化；surgeon n. 外科医生；surgery n. 外科，手术

surpass［sə'pɑ:s; (US)sər'pæs］

vt. 超越，胜过〈同 exceed〉

例　Her TOEFL scores surpassed our expectations. 她的托福考试成绩超过了我们的期望。

记　sur（上面）+ pass（经过）→ 从上面经过 → 超越

联　impasse n. 僵局；trespass vt. 侵入，打扰；surmount vt. 战胜，超越；surplus n. 剩余，过剩；surcharge n. 附加费

susceptible［sə'septɪbəl］

adj. 易受影响的；敏感的，过敏的〈同 vulnerable, sensitive〉

例　She was susceptible to crying on rainy days. 她容易在下雨天哭泣。

suspicious［sə'spɪʃəs］

adj.（人或物）可疑的；好猜疑的，怀疑的〈同 questionable, mistrustful〉

例　Bob was suspicious of everyone who came to his door. 鲍勃怀疑每一个来找他的人。

记　sus（在…下面）+ (s)pic（看）+ ious → 在下面看的 → 怀疑的

联　suspicion n. 怀疑；suspect n. 嫌疑犯 v. 怀疑；superstitious adj. 迷信的

自我检测　从第二部分中选出最适当的词填入空格内。

12. The twin sisters were both ______ to illness if they did not eat well.

13. The nursery school（幼儿园）teacher ______ the children to make sure they did not hurt themselves.

14. The judge ______ the witness to court but she had already run away.

15. People knocking on my door at night make me ______ .

16. Since we were in the library, Ray had to ______ his laughter.

17. The choir gave a ______ performance and everyone applauded.



第三部分

swamp［swɒmp］

n. 沼泽，湿地〈同 marsh, bog〉

例　The swamp was full of snakes and alligators. 沼泽里到处都是蛇和短吻鳄。

联　swampy adj. 沼泽的，湿地的

swarm［swɔ:m］

n. 蜂群，一大群〈同 throng, flock〉

例　A swarm of bees attacked the bear that was trying to steal their honey. 一群蜜蜂攻击了一头想要偷蜂蜜的熊。

v. 挤满，密集〈同 teem, crowd〉

例　Her friends swarmed around her when she scored the winning goal. 她打入制胜球时，朋友们都围住了她。

switch［swɪtʃ］

n. 开关，电闸；转换，转变

例　The switch is next to the door. 开关在门的旁边。

v. 转换，转变〈同 exchange〉

例　Please switch off the light when you leave. 走的时候请关灯。

symmetry［'sɪmɪtri］

n. 对称（性），匀称〈同 balance〉

例　The addition of a second tower will give this edifice the symmetry which it now lacks. 再建一座高楼将使这栋大厦呈现出一种对称感，而这是它目前所欠缺的。

sympathetic［ˌsɪmpə'θetɪk］

adj. ① 有同情心的

例　He had a vocation for teaching in poor countries because he is a very sympathetic person. 他选择在贫穷国家从事教育工作，因为他是一个富有同情心的人。

② 赞成的，合意的〈同 approving〉

例　The teacher was sympathetic to the class's plan for a trip to the museum. 老师对班级参观博物馆的计划表示赞同。

记　sym（共同，相同）+ path(y)（感情）+ etic → 与别人有着相同的感情 → 有同情心的

联　sympathize vi. 同情；empathetic adj. 移情作用的；pathetic adj. 可怜的；apathetic adj. 冷漠的

symphony［'sɪmfəni］

n. 交响乐，交响曲

例　The opera singer was accompanied by a symphony at the concert last week. 上周音乐会的歌剧是由交响乐伴奏的。

symposium［sɪm'pəʊzɪəm］

n. 讨论会，座谈会〈同 seminar〉

例　The symposium on peace invited distinguished professors and leading politicians for discussion. 这个关于和平的研讨会邀请了著名的专家和主要的政治家参与讨论。

symptom［'sɪmptəm］

n. 症状；征兆〈同 sign, indication〉

例　One symptom of the disease is a high fever. 这种疾病的症状之一是发高烧。

联　symptomatic adj. 症状的，征兆的

synchronize［'sɪŋkrənaɪz］

v.（使）同步

例　She synchronized her watch with the clock at the railway station. 她照着火车站的时钟调了手表。

记　syn（共同）+ chron（时间）+ ize → 同步

联　synchronization n. 同一时刻，同步；synchronous adj. 同时的，同步的；chronic adj. 慢性的；chronicle n. 编年史；anachronism n. 时代错误

synthesis［'sɪnθɪsɪs］

n. 综合，合成〈同 integration〉

例　Humans need some sunlight for the synthesis of Vitamin D which takes place in the skin. 人体需要点阳光才能在皮肤内合成维生素D。

联　synthetic adj. 合成的，人造的

自我检测　从第三部分中选出最适当的词填入空格内。

18. Scientists have discovered that faces with the most ______ are the most attractive.

19. A ______ of locusts darkened the sky.

20. The school held a weekend ______ which included lectures, discussions and presentations.

21. Alligators live in Florida's coastal ______.

22. Teddy was told to take the medicine for a week even if the ______ had gone away.

23. The ______ of the two top companies made it difficult for competitors to survive.



第四部分

tablet［'tæblɪt］

n. ① 便笺簿〈同 pad〉

例　The university bookstore stocks a large supply of writing tablets. 这家大学书店采购了大量的便笺薄。

② 药片〈同 pill〉

例　The big medicine bottle contained 1,000 tablets. 这个大药瓶装有1000片药。

tackle［'tækəl］

vt. 应付（难事等），处理〈同 undertake〉

例　Don't tackle a project you can't finish. 不要承接你完成不了的项目。

联　tack vt. 钉住；tacky adj. 黏的，俗气的

tactic［'tæktɪk］

n. 战术，用兵学；策略，手段〈同 strategy, policy〉

例　Anne's tactic of confronting her boss directly was successful. 安娜直接对抗上司的策略很成功。

tangle［'tæŋg(ə)l］

n./v.（处于）混乱状态；（使）缠结〈同 mess, snarl〉

例　The insect was tangled up in the spider's web and could not escape. 昆虫被蜘蛛网缠住了，没法逃跑。





tar［tɑ:(r)］

n. 焦油，柏油

例　This cigarette with lower tar is probably less harmful. 吸这种焦油含量低的香烟可能对健康的损害少一点。

tariff［'tærɪf］

n. 关税

例　The government imposed a higher tariff to discourage imports. 政府征收高额关税来限制进口。

联　sheriff n. 县治安官；tiff n./v. 吵嘴；customs n. 进口税，海关

tease［ti:z］

vt. 取笑，逗恼，奚落〈同 ridicule〉

例　He always teased his little sister and made her cry. 他总是戏弄他妹妹，把她弄哭。

temperament［'tempərəmənt］

n. 气质，性情

例　The teacher's patient and sweet temperament made her the children's favorite teacher. 这位老师耐心亲切，这使她成了孩子们最喜欢的老师。

tempo［'tempəʊ］

n.（音乐）速度，拍子〈同 pace〉

例　As the music reached a frenetic tempo the audience lost all decorum and broke into impromptu dancing. 随着音乐节奏变得狂热，观众们也丢掉矜持，即兴跳起舞来。

联　temporal adj. 时间的，暂时的；tempt vt. 诱惑；temple n. 寺，庙

tenant［'tenənt］

n. 承租人，房客〈同 occupant, resident〉

例　The tenants of the office building are mainly small firms. 租用这座办公楼的基本上都是些小公司。

Lesson 29





音频



预备测验

找出与句子中划线单词意义最相近的词。

1. Light from the Sun and distant stars traverses a vacuum in space.

(A) fills

(B) creates

(C) crosses

2. The Rocky Mountain forest belt is known for its ponderosa pines and rugged terrain.

(A) climate

(B) wildlife

(C) land

3. Laurels（月桂树）are valued for their aromatic oils and spices, edible fruits, and timber.

(A) wood

(B) leaves

(C) blossoms

4. The ambassador was given the book as a token of the government's regard for him.

(A) an estimation

(B) a memento

(C) a share

5. The medieval legend of Dr. Faustus has been a recurrent theme in Western literature.

(A) issue

(B) tale

(C) subject



第一部分

tendency［'tendənsɪ］

n. 趋势，倾向〈同 trend, propensity〉

例　A tendency in all human beings is to try to survive. 生存是所有人的本性。

联　tendentious adj. 有倾向性的；tendance n. 伺候

tense［tens］

adj. 紧张的；拉紧的〈同 strained, tight〉

例　The bath relaxed Mary's tense muscles. 玛丽洗了个澡，使紧张的肌肉得到了放松。

联　tension n. 紧张（状态），压力；intense adj. 强烈的，剧烈的；tensile adj. 可拉长的，可伸长的；pretense n. 矫饰，做作；pretension n. 主张，要求

tentative［'tentətɪv］

adj. 试验性的，试探的；暂定的〈同 unconfirmed〉

例　They made tentative plans to have dinner sometime next week. 他们暂时计划下周找个时间一起吃晚饭。

terminate［'tɜ:mɪneɪt］

v. 停止，结束〈同 stop, end〉

例　She became so upset that she terminated the conversation by hanging up. 她变得心烦意乱，然后挂断电话，结束了谈话。

记　termin（结束）+ ate → 停止，结束

联　termination n. 终止；terminal n. 终点 adj. 末端的；terminus n. 终点站；exterminate vt. 根除，灭绝；determination n. 决心，果断

terrace［'terəs］

n. 梯田；阳台

例　The family enjoyed having breakfast outside on the terrace. 这家人喜欢在屋外的阳台上吃早餐。

vt. 使成梯田

例　The roadway was terraced into the side of the mountain. 小路在山腰上蜿蜒盘旋，成梯田状。

记　terr（地）+ ace → 梯田

联　territory n. 领土，领域；territorial adj. 领土的；subterrane n. 地下室；extraterrestrial adj. 地球外的

terrain［tə'reɪn］

n. 地势，地形〈同 land, landform, topography〉

例　The mountainous terrain required people to wear hiking boots. 山区的地形决定了人们需要穿登山靴。

terrific［tə'rɪfɪk］

adj. 极好的〈同 excellent〉

例　Sally's promotion was terrific news for the whole family. 萨利升职了，这对于全家来说真是个大好消息。

记　terr（怕）+ ific → 好得让人怕 → 极好的





terrify［'terɪfaɪ］

vt. 使恐怖，使惊吓〈同 frighten〉

例　The thought of a major potential earthquake terrifies many Southern Californians. 一想到可能会有一场大地震，许多加利福尼亚南部的居民就很害怕。

联　terrifying adj. 恐怖的；terribly adj. 可怕的，十分

testify［'testɪfaɪ］

v. 证明，证实；作证〈同 affirm, witness〉

例　The witness testified against the defendant in court today. 目击证人今天在法庭上作证指控了被告。

testimony［'testɪməni; (US)'testɪməʊni］

n. 证据，【律】证言〈同 evidence〉

例　Her testimony was very believable and led to the criminal's conviction. 她的证词非常有力可信，因此罪犯被判有罪。

记　testi（见证）+ mony → 证言

联　testimonial n. 证明书，推荐；testify v. 证实，证明

6. It was because of Molly's ______ for diligent studying that she became a top student.

7. The judge listened closely to the witness' ______.

8. Tom and Jerry always argued and every time they were in the same room it felt ______.

9. The terrible ghost traveled from house to house ______ little boys and girls.

10. Even though you don't know whether you will be available next month, let's make a ______ schedule at least.

11. She ______ that she had seen him commit the crime.



第二部分

textile［'tekstaɪl］

n. 纺织品

例　The fabric store sold many types of textiles. 纺织品店销售很多种纺织品。

texture［'tekstʃə(r)］

n. 质地；（材料等的）结构〈同 structure〉

例　Burlap has a much coarser texture than linen. 粗麻布比亚麻布的质地粗糙得多。

联　textured adj. 手摸时有感觉的，有织纹的

theft［θeft］

n. 偷窃〈同 stealing〉

例　The prisoner was jailed for theft. 这个囚徒由于偷盗而入狱。





theme［θi:m］

n.（谈话、写作等的）题目；主题〈同 subject〉

例　Love is a recurring theme in popular music these days. 在当今的流行音乐里，爱情是个反复出现的主题。

therapy［'θerəpi］

n. 治疗（法）〈同 treatment〉

例　He had to undergo therapy to fully recover from his broken back. 为了使背伤完全康复，他不得不接受治疗。

联　therapeutic adj. 治疗的；therapist n. 治疗学家

thesis［'θi:sɪs］

n. 论题，论文〈同 dissertation〉

例　Each senior had to write a thesis before graduating from college. 每位大四学生在大学毕业前必须写一篇论文。

联　hypothesis n. 假设；photosynthesis n. 光合作用；synthesis n. 综合，合成

thorn［θɔ:n］

n.【植】刺，棘，荆棘

例　A rose is beautiful but its thorns are sharp. 玫瑰虽然漂亮，但也带着锋利的刺。

联　thorny adj. 有刺的，多刺的

threshold［'θreʃhəʊld］

n. 开始，开端〈同 entrance〉

例　The year 2001 is the threshold of a new millennium. 2001年是新千年的开始。

thrifty［'θrɪfti］

adj. 节省的，节俭的〈同 economical〉

例　A thrifty shopper compares prices before making purchases. 勤俭节约的人在购物时会比较一下价格。

thrill［θrɪl］

v.（使）使激动；（使）发抖

例　She was thrilled to hear that her son was coming back home for Christmas. 听儿子说他要回家过圣诞节，她特别激动。

第三部分

throne［θrəʊn］

n. 王座；君主

例　The king sat on his throne when guests would enter his chamber. 当宾客进入大殿的时候，国王已经坐在了宝座上。

tick［tɪk］

vi. 滴答地响

例　The clock ticked every second. 时钟每秒都滴答作响。

tight［taɪt］

adj. 紧的；绷紧的；紧密的〈同 firm〉

例　The bottle cap was too tight and she had to ask her older brother to help her open it. 瓶盖太紧了，她不得不让她的哥哥帮她打开。





tile［taɪl］

n. 瓦片；瓷砖

例　The white bathroom tiles needed to be cleaned every two days. 浴室的白瓷砖每隔两天就需要清洁一次。

tilt［tɪlt］

n. 倾斜〈同 slant, lean〉

例　The Leaning Tower of Pisa has so much tilt it looks as if it should fall. 比萨斜塔如此地倾斜，看上去就好像快要倒了。

联　gilt adj. 镀金的；lilt v. 轻快地唱；silt n. 淤泥；stilt n. 高跷

timber［'tɪmbə(r)］

n. 木材，木料〈同 wood, lumber, log〉

例　Timber is sold for the construction of new homes. 人们购买木料来建造新房。

timely［'taɪmli］

adj. 及时的，适时的〈同 opportune〉

例　The professor always arrived at class in a timely fashion. 教授总是在上课的时候刚好准时赶到。

timid［'tɪmɪd］

adj. 胆怯的，羞怯的〈同 shy〉

例　The timid student was afraid to talk to his teacher. 这个胆小的学生害怕和老师讲话。

记　tim（胆怯）+ id → 胆怯的

联　timidity n. 胆小，胆怯；intimidate vt. 恐吓，威胁；timorous adj. 胆小的；tumid adj. 肿胀的，肿大的；humid adj. 潮湿的

token［'təʊkən］

n. 象征，记号〈同 symbol〉

例　Please accept this gift as a token of gratitude for your friendship. 请接受这份礼物，以表达我对你的情谊的感谢之情。

toss［tɒs; (US)tɔ:s］

n./v. 投，掷〈同 throw〉

例　The basketball players tossed the ball around in practice. 这些篮球运动员在不断练习投球。

18. The president had a ______ schedule during his visit and could not meet friends for dinner.

19. His gift of a DVD player was ______; I had just bought a new TV.

21. The waiter placed some paper under the table's legs to adjust the ______.

22. The rose was a ______ of her love for him.

23. The rebellion overthrew the king's ______ and established a new form of government.



第四部分

tow［təʊ］

v. 拖引，牵引〈同 pull, drag〉

例　The car broke down and had to be towed to the garage. 这辆车发生了故障，只好被拖到修理厂去。

联　tower n. 塔，城堡；towering adj. 高耸的，杰出的





tract［trækt］

n. 广阔的地面，大片（土地）〈同 area, region〉

例　The king granted William Penn a tract of land in the New World. 国王分封给威廉·佩恩将军位于新大陆的一大片土地。

联　traction n. 牵引；tractor n. 拖拉机

trademark［'treɪdmɑ:k］

n. 商标〈同 brand〉

例　The company put its trademark on all its products. 这家公司给旗下所有产品加上了本公司的商标。

tragic［'træʤɪk］

adj. 悲惨的；悲剧的〈同 dreadful, deplorable〉

例　The tragic accident took the lives of five people. 这场不幸的事故夺走了五个人的生命。

记　来自名词 tragedy（n. 悲剧；悲惨的事）

联　tragedian n. 悲剧演员；traffic n. 交通

trait［treɪt］

n. 特征，特性〈同 quality, attribute〉

例　The color of one's eyes is a genetic trait. 一个人眼睛的颜色是遗传特征。

联　trail n. 踪迹，痕迹；trailblazer n. 先驱者，开拓者；portrait n. 肖像，人像；portraiture n. 肖像画法

transaction［træn'zækʃən］

n. 交易〈同 deal〉

例　Opening a savings accout is a simple transaction. 开通一个储蓄账户是一项简单的交易。

transient［'trænzɪənt］

adj. 短暂的，瞬时的〈同 ephemeral, transitory〉

例　The transient breeze provided some relief from the summer heat, but we were soon perspiring again. 这一小阵微风给炎热的夏天带来一丝凉爽，但我们很快又流汗了。

联　transistor n. 晶体管；intransigent adj. 不妥协的，不让步的

transition［træn'zɪʃən］

n. 转变，过渡〈同 passage, change〉

例　Spring is a transition from winter into summer. 春天是从冬天到夏天的过渡季节。

联　transitional adj. 变迁的，过渡的；transit n./v. 经过，运输

transplant［træns'pla:nt］

v. 移植〈同 transfer, graft〉

例　The doctor transplanted a heart into the patient. 医生给病人移植了心脏。

traverse［træ'vɜ:s］

v. 横贯，横越〈同 cross, bridge〉

例　She was an experienced traveler who had traversed both Africa and Europe in her twenties. 她是一位经验丰富的旅行者，她曾在二十几岁时就穿越了非洲和欧洲。

记　tra（横）+ verse（转）→ 横过

联　travesty n. 滑稽模仿

Lesson 30





音频



预备测验

找出与句子中划线单词意义最相近的词。

1. After listening to the testimony, the members of the jury delivered their verdict.

(A) sentence

(B) decision

(C) cross examination

2. Many fossils are uncovered by chance on the surface of the earth.

(A) altered

(B) ruined

(C) revealed

3. The bud of a water lily opens at sunset since its opening is triggered by the decreased light.

(A) alleviated

(B) endured

(C) set off

4. Urban renewal programs strive to upgrade areas that are becoming slums.

(A) reproach

(B) improve

(C) fortify

5. A turbulent storm was a major factor in the defeat of the Spanish Armada.

(A) noxious

(B) violent

(C) mysterious



第一部分

trench［trentʃ］

n. 沟，壕沟〈同 ditch, canal〉

例　The soldiers dug a trench to avoid gunfire. 战士们挖战壕来防御炮火攻击。

联　entrenched adj.（权利、传统等）确立的，牢固的

tribe［traɪb］

n. 部落，部族

例　Everyone in the tribe participates in a weekly ritual. 部落里的每个人都参加每周一次的仪式。

联　tribal adj. 部落的，宗族的

tribute［'trɪbju:t］

n. ① 贡品；贡税〈同 tax, levy〉

例　The defeated country was forced to pay a tribute to the victor. 战败国被迫向战胜国交纳贡品。

② 颂词，殷勤〈同 praise, compliment〉

例　The actress gave tribute to her director when she accepted her Oscar. 在接受奥斯卡金像奖的时候，这位女演员向导演表达了感激之情。

trifle［'traɪfəl］

n. 琐事；少量〈同 little〉

例　The cheap picture cost only a trifle. 只花了一点钱就买了这幅便宜的画。

联　trifling adj. 不重要的

trigger［'trɪgə(r)］

vt. 引发，引起，触发〈同 set off, initiate〉

例　The attack triggered a full-scale war. 这次攻击引发了全面的战争。

triple［'trɪpəl］

n./adj. 三倍数（的）

例　Nine is the triple of three. 9是3的三倍。

trivial［'trɪvɪəl］

adj. 微不足道的，琐碎的〈同 insignificant, trifling〉

例　The new textbook is quite good, though it does contain a few trivial errors. 尽管里面有点小错误，这本新教科书还是不错的。

tuck［tʌk］

vt. 把…塞进（一个狭小容器或空洞等）

例　All the boys in this class are required to tuck their shirts into their pants. 这个班里的所有男孩被要求把衬衫下摆塞到裤子里。





tug［tʌg］

v. 用力拖，吃力地搬运〈同 pull〉

例　They tugged on the rope to pull the truck out of the mud. 他们用力拽着绳子，想把卡车从泥里拉出来。

tuition［tju:'ɪʃən; (US)'tu:'ɪʃn］

n. 学费

例　He had to pay the school tuition before he could attend class. 他必须交了学费，然后才能上课。

自我检测　从第一部分中选出最适当的词填入空格内。

6. College ______ vary greatly, mostly depending on whether it is a state or private school.

7. The soldiers paid ______ to their general at his funeral.

8. The ______ filled up with water when it rained.

9. They argued about everything, even the most ______ of topics.

10. The national team's victory ______ celebrations throughout the country.

11. The professor hated answering questions that were based on ______.



第二部分

tumble［'tʌmbəl］

vi. 跌倒〈同 topple, fall〉

例　He tumbled off his horse. 他从马上摔了下来。

记　tum（肿）+ ble → 摔肿了 → 跌倒

联　fumble v. 摸索，搜寻；humble adj. 低声下气的；jumble v. 掺杂；crumble v. 弄碎；grumble v. 诉苦，抱怨





turbulent［'tɜ:bjʊlənt］

adj. 吵闹的；狂暴的，（空气等）流动得剧烈而不稳定的〈同 disorderly, violent〉

例　Since the 1930s, aircraft manufacturers have tried to build airplanes with frictionless wings so that the air passing over them would not become turbulent. 从20世纪30年代起，飞机制造者就开始尝试建造一种有平滑机翼的飞机，这样飞机在穿过气流时就不会产生强烈的震荡。

记　turb（搅动）+ ulent → 搅得厉害 → 狂暴的

联　turbulence n. 骚乱；turbid adj. 浑浊的；turbine n. 涡轮；tumultuous adj. 喧嚣的；riotous adj. 暴动的，骚乱的

turnover［'tɜ:nəʊvə(r)］

n. 营业额；人员更替率

例　This department has the highest turnover rate in the company. 这个部门是公司人员流动率最高的部门。

tutor［'tju:tə(r); (US)'tu:tər］

vt. 辅导；当…的家庭教师〈同 guide, direct〉

例　Ted wants someone to tutor him before the exam. 泰德希望有人能在考前辅导他。

n. 家庭教师〈同 coach〉

例　The tutor would explain his mistakes to him. 家庭教师会对他犯错的地方进行讲解。

联　tutorial n. 个别指导

twinkle［'twɪŋkəl］

v. 闪烁；（使）闪光〈同 glitter〉

例　You could stay up all night trying to count all the stars that twinkle in the sky. 你可以整夜不睡，试着数清天上所有闪烁的星星。

ultraviolet［ˌʌltrə'vaɪələt］

adj. 紫外线的

例　We cannot see ultraviolet light in our atmosphere. 我们看不到空气中的紫外线。

unanimous［ˌju:'nænɪməs］

adj. 全体意见一致的〈同 uniform, agreed〉

例　Janet was elected chairwoman by a unanimous decision of the board. 经董事会一致同意，珍妮特当选为主席。

uncover［ˌʌn'kʌvə(r)］

v. 发现，揭示〈同 reveal, expose〉

例　The newspaper article uncovered the truth behind the scandal. 报纸上的这篇文章揭示了丑闻背后的真相。

underestimate［ˌʌndər'estɪmeɪt］

vt. 低估〈同 undervalue〉

例　The value of our house was underestimated by at least two thousand dollars. 我们房子的价值被低估了至少两千美元。

联　underrate vt. 低估，看轻；estimate v. 估计；overestimate v. 评价过高

underlying［ˌʌndə'laɪɪŋ］

adj. 基础的；在下面的〈同 fundamental, elementary〉

例　Lack of money was the underlying reason that I didn't go on vacation. 我没去度假的根本原因是没钱。

联　underlie vt. 位于…之下，成为…的基础

14. His parents hired a private ______ to prepare him for the upcoming exam.

16. They are trying to find the ______ significance of these supposedly random acts of violence.

17. The poor management style of the company explains the high employee ______.



第三部分

undermine［ˌʌndə'maɪn］

vt. 渐渐破坏，暗地里破坏〈同 weaken, impair〉

例　The recent corruption scandals have undermined many people's faith in the city government. 最近的腐败丑闻使很多人对市政府失去了信心。

unemployment［ˌʌnɪm'plɔɪmənt］

n. 失业；失业人数

例　Unemployment has increased this year because of the poor national economy. 由于国内经济形势不景气，今年的失业人数有所增加。

联　unemployed adj. 失业的

unfold［ʌn'fəʊld］

v. 展开；显露，展示

例　The questions people asked Mark and Sara at the dinner party unfolded the plans for their secret wedding. 在晚宴上，人们对马克和萨拉的提问使他们的秘密婚礼计划公开了。

unify［'ju:nɪfaɪ］

vt. 统一，使成一体〈同 integrate, unite〉

例　The American Civil War unified the north and south. 美国内战统一了南方和北方。

联　unity n. 综合，一致

untie［ʌn'taɪ］

v. 解开；松开

例　She untied her shoes before taking them off. 她解开鞋带，脱掉了鞋。





update［ʌp'deɪt］

vt. 修正，校正；更新

例　His boss told him he wanted to be updated on any progress on a daily basis. 老板告诉他，他要知道每天的最新进展。

upgrade［ˌʌp'greɪd］

vt. 使升级，提升〈同 improve, advance〉

例　The manufacturer has done everything possible to upgrade his product, with the result that it is now of excellent quality. 制造商想尽一切办法升级产品，如今产品质量已非常上乘。

记　up（向上）+ grade（等级）→ 向上提高等级 → 使升级

联　upgrowth n. 生长，发育；upsoar vi. 高飞，上升；upheaval n. 动乱，剧变

uphold［ʌp'həʊld］

vt. 维护，支持（决定等）〈同 support, maintain〉

例　The Supreme Court upheld the lower court's ruling. 最高法院维持了下级法院的判决。

记　up + hold（举）→ 举起来 → 支持

联　upholster vt. 为（椅子）装垫子；upbraid vt. 责备；behold vt. 把…视为

vapor［'veɪpə(r)］

n. 水汽，水蒸气〈同 steam〉

例　In old horror movies, the monsters frequently appear amidst clouds of vapor. 在以前的恐怖片中，怪物总是在水汽氤氲中出现。

联　vaporize v.（使）蒸发；evaporate v.（使）蒸发，消失；evaporation n. 蒸发（作用）

vegetarian［ˌveʤɪ'tərɪən］

n. 素食者

例　Consuming enough protein is especially important for vegetarians. 摄入足量的蛋白质对素食者来说尤为重要。

自我检测　从第三部分中选出最适当的词填入空格内。

第四部分

vegetation［ˌveʤɪ'teɪʃən］

n. 植物，草木，植被〈同 plants〉

例　The rainforest has a great diversity of vegetation. 雨林里有各种各样的植物。

联　vegetable n. 蔬菜；vegetarian n. 素食者

veil［veɪl］

vt. 隐藏，遮蔽〈同 cover, hide〉

例　Veiled in shadow, he managed to slip unnoticed through the gateway. 他躲在阴影里，趁人不备设法穿过通道溜走了。

vein［veɪn］

n. 静脉；血管

例　The nurse found a prominent vein in my arm for injection. 护士在我胳膊上找到了可以进行注射的清晰的血管。

联　veining n. 脉络分布

vent［vent］

n. 通风孔；出烟孔〈同 outlet〉

例　The vent released poisonous gas out of the laboratory. 通风口可以把实验室里的有毒气体释放出去。

ventilate［'ventɪleɪt］

vt. 使通风〈同 aerate〉

例　He ventilated the bedroom as he painted its walls. 他刷墙的时候保持卧室通风。





联　ventilation n. 通风

verbal［'vɜ:bəl］

adj. 口头的〈同 spoken〉

例　It is best to live in the US to improve your verbal English. 要想提高英语口语水平，最好的办法是去美国生活。

verdict［'vɜ:dɪkt］

n. 判决，结论〈同 conclusion〉

例　The jury took five days to reach a verdict. 陪审团花了五天时间作出判决。

记　ver（真实）+ dict（说）→ 认真地说 → 判决

联　verity n. 真实；verify vt. 检验；veritable adj. 真正的；veracity n. 诚实

verge［vɜ:ʤ］

vi. 濒临

例　He had taken over an old company verging on liquidation. 他接管了一家行将破产的老公司。

记　来自古法语 verge（杆，棍）

联　veridical adj. 诚实的；verse n. 诗

versatile［'vɜ:sətaɪl; (US)'vɜ:sətl］

adj. 多才多艺的〈同 talented, skilled〉

例　Leonardo da Vinci was a versatile genius who excelled in many different fields of art and science. 列奥拉多·达芬奇是一个多才多艺的天才，精通艺术和科学等多个领域。

verse［vɜ:s］

n. 诗，韵文〈同 poetry〉

例　The poet wrote verses every night before going to sleep. 这位诗人每天睡觉前都要写诗。

联　universe n. 宇宙，世界；converse vi. 谈话，交谈；diverse adj. 不同的，变化多的；adverse adj. 不利的，敌对的，相反的；reverse adj. 相反的，倒转的 vt. 颠倒，倒转

Lesson 31





音频



预备测验

找出与句子中划线单词意义最相近的词。

1. At the zenith of her career in the 1930's Dorothy Thompson was one of the best known journalists in the United States.

(A) completion

(B) pinnacle

(C) outset

2. The check was marked void.

(A) payable

(B) valid

(C) canceled

3. In a desert an oasis is a welcome relief to weary travelers.

(A) homeless

(B) hungry

(C) tired

4. For most people the decision to wed is generally surrounded by social constraints.

(A) marry

(B) emigrate

(C) choose a job

5. My uncle volunteers his services to worthy causes.

(A) asserts

(B) offers

(C) blasts



第一部分

versus［'vɜ:səs］

prep. 对，对抗（指诉讼、比赛等中），与…相对

例　The headline for the final game read“Brazil versus Germany”. 决赛的标题是“巴西对阵德国”。

vest［vest］

n. 背心

例　He wore the vest as part of his three-piece suit. 他穿着背心，作为他的三件套中的一件。





veto［'vi:təʊ］

vt. 否决；禁止〈同 deny, prohibit〉

例　My parents vetoed my plan to go to a hill station; instead they said I should study at home. 父母否决了我去避暑山庄的计划，说我应该待在家里。

vicinity［vɪ'sɪnɪti］

n. 附近，接近〈同 proximity, nearness〉

例　Living in the vicinity of New York, Bob was near many museums. 鲍勃住在纽约附近，离许多博物馆都很近。

记　vicin（邻近）+ ity → 邻近（地区）→ 附近

联　vanity n. 空虚

vicious［'vɪʃəs］

adj. 恶毒的；道德败坏的，堕落的〈同 evil, depraved〉

例　 Snakes can be very vicious if you get too close to their eggs. 如果你太接近蛇蛋，蛇会变得非常凶恶。

记　vic（= vice 邪恶的）+ ious → 邪恶的 → 恶毒的

联　vice n. 恶习，恶行；vicissitude n. 荣辱兴衰；vivacious adj. 活泼的，快活的；voracious adj. 狼吞虎咽的；veracious adj. 说实话的，诚实的

vigor［'vɪgə(r)］

n. 精力，活力〈同 strength, energy〉

例　Having a great deal of vigor, Michael was able to excel in all sports. 迈克尔精力十分旺盛，他的所有体育项目成绩都很优秀。

记　vig（生命）+ or → 生命力 → 活力

联　vigorous adj. 精力旺盛的；vigilant adj. 警惕的，清醒的；invigorate vt. 鼓舞；vigorously adv. 精力旺盛地

violate［'vaɪəleɪt］

vt. 亵渎（圣物），冒犯；违反〈同 break〉

例　He violated the law when he stole the money from the store. 当他从商店里偷走钱财，他已经触犯了法律。

violence［'vaɪələns］

n. 暴力；强烈〈同 force〉

例　The violence of the storm terrified the sailors. 凶猛的风暴吓坏了水手们。

联　violent adj. 猛烈的，激烈的，强烈的

virgin［'vɜ:ʤɪn］

n. 处女

例　Mary was a virgin until she got married. 玛丽结婚之前是处女。

adj. 未经使用的，处于原来状态的；初榨的〈同 unused〉

例　Virgin olive oil is very popular in Italy. 初榨橄榄油在意大利很受欢迎。

virtual［'vɜ:tjʊəl; 'vɜ:tʃʊəl］

adj. 实质上的

例　Pollution will cause the virtual destruction of the planet. 污染能导致星球真正毁灭。

联　virtually adv. 事实上，实质上

自我检测　从第一部分中选出最适当的词填入空格内。

6. Her father ______ Kendall's request to marry his daughter, because they are really not well-matched.

7. She arrived at work every day with great ______ and enthusiasm.

8. The police put on their bulletproof ______ before work.

9. There is not much ______ wilderness left in the world today.

10. The company ______ the agreement we had with them and we should sue them.

11. Kidnapping is a ______ crime.



第二部分

virus［'vaɪərəs］

n. 病毒〈同 germ〉

例　The virus was killed with antibiotics. 抗生素杀死了病毒。

visualize［'vɪzjʊəlaɪz; 'vɪʒʊəlaɪz］

v. 使可见；想像，设想〈同 imagine〉

例　The inventor of the Internet visualized a world networked together. 互联网的发明者使世界联网为一体成为现实。

vocal［'vəʊkəl］

adj. 嗓音的；歌唱的

例　Her vocal skills as a child were evidence that she would become a great singer. 作为一个小孩，她的歌唱技巧可以证明她将成为一个伟大的歌唱家。

vocation［vəʊ'keɪʃən］

n. 职业〈同 career, profession〉

例　He chose medicine as his vocation and committed himself to curing diseases. 他选择进入医药行业工作，致力于治病救人。

联　vocational adj. 职业的；avocation n.（个人）副业，业余爱好

void［vɔɪd］

n. 空白，空虚〈同 emptiness, space〉

例　Her death left a void in her husband's life. 她去世后她丈夫的生活很空虚。

adj. 无效的〈同 canceled, invalid〉

例　The student's report was void of any reason and he failed. 学生的报告缺少理由，未被准许。

联　devoid adj. 全无的，缺乏的

volunteer［ˌvɒlən'tɪə(r)］

n. 自愿者，志愿者

例　The volunteers cleaned up the street without getting paid. 志愿者们无偿清扫街道。

v. 自愿（做…）〈同 offer〉

例　People who volunteer their services to the army were called volunteers. 志愿在军队服役的人称为志愿兵。

vulgar［'vʌlgə(r)］

adj. 粗鲁的，庸俗的；下流的〈同 rude, indecent〉

例　His vulgar words were very impolite to say in front of guests. 他在客人面前说粗话是很不礼貌的。

记　vulg（庸俗）+ ar → 庸俗的

vulnerable［'vʌlnərəbəl］

adj. 易受攻击的；易受伤害的〈同 defenseless, susceptible〉

例　Small animals are often vulnerable to attack. 小型动物通常易受攻击。

记　vulner（伤）+ able → 易受伤的

联　invulnerable adj. 不会受伤害的；vulnerary n. 伤药

wallet［'wɒlɪt］

n. 皮夹，钱夹

例　He kept all his money in his wallet. 他把所有的钱都放在钱包里。





warehouse

n. 仓库，货栈〈同 depot, storehouse〉

例　The warehouse stored rice and grain. 仓库存储米和粮食。

自我检测　从第二部分中选出最适当的词填入空格内。

12. His ______ and all his money were stolen by a thief.

13. People went to the ______ to buy goods at a cheap price.

14. The tongue is a ______ organ.

15. The doctor told the patient the ______ is contagious and he should stay home.

16. ______ language is prohibited at school.

17. Elderly people living alone are especially ______.



第三部分

warfare［'wɔ:fə(r)］

n. 战争；斗争

例　The Art of War is a book on warfare.《孙子兵法》是一部关于战争的书籍。

warrant［'wɒrənt; (US)'wɔ:rənt］

n. 授权书，委托书；许可证

例　The police had a warrant to enter their house and search for the missing people. 警察带着搜查证进入他们的房子，搜查失踪的人。

联　warranty n. 授权，担保，保证

waterfall［'wɔ:təfɔ:l］

n. 瀑布〈同 falls〉

例　The large waterfall was exploited to make electricity. 巨大的瀑布被利用起来发电。

waterproof［'wɔ:təpru:f］

adj. 防水的〈同 impermeable, tight〉

例　She put her camera in a waterproof bag so it wouldn't get wet. 她把相机放进防水包里防止被打湿。

联　watertight adj. 防水的





whim［wɪm; (US)hwɪm］

n. 随意，冲动〈同 fancy, caprice, impulse〉

例　He has a whim for reading suddenly. 他突然心血来潮想看书。

联　whimsical adj. 反复无常的，古怪的；whimmy adj. 异想天开的，心血来潮的

weary［'wɪəri］

adj. 疲倦的；厌倦的〈同 tired, exhausted〉

例　The weary workers walked slowly toward the train station after work. 下班后，疲倦的工人们步履缓慢地朝火车站走去。

记　来自名词 wear（磨损，消耗）+ y → 身体被磨损的 → 疲倦的

联　wearing adj. 使人厌烦的；wearable adj. 可穿用的；wearisome adj. 使疲倦的；weariless adj. 不疲倦的，不厌烦的；weariness n. 疲倦

weave［wi:v］

vt. 编织，组合〈同 braid, knit〉

例　A loom is used to weave cloth. 织布机用是来织布的。

联　weaverbird n.【动】织巢鸟之一种；weaver n. 织布者，织工

wed［wed］

v. 娶，嫁，（与…）结婚〈同 marry〉

例　He put one knee on the ground and asked her to wed him. 他单膝跪地，向她求婚。

联　wedding n. 婚礼

wedge［weʤ］

n. 楔；使分裂的东西

例　The quarrel drove a wedge between him and his relatives. 吵架使他和他的亲人之间产生了裂痕。

v. 楔入，挤进

例　He wedged himself through the crowd to get a glimpse of the movie star. 他挤进人群瞥见了那位电影明星。

联　wedge-shaped adj. 楔形的

wholesome［'həʊlsəm］

例　The food we got at school was simple but wholesome. 我们在学校买的食物虽然简单，但是有益健康。

自我检测　从第三部分中选出最适当的词填入空格内。

18. People ______ thread into cloth and straw into hats.

19. She had a sudden ______ to take a short vacation after working the whole night.

20. The US now is preparing itself against chemical ______ .

21. He ______ himself through the narrow window.

22. This rain jacket is ______ and will keep you dry during the rainy season.

23. After years of living together, they will finally ______ this Sunday at the church.



第四部分

wildlife［'waɪldlaɪf］

n. 野生动植物〈同 animal〉

例　The conservation research project will concentrate on the wildlife habitats in the forest.（动物）保护研究项目将关注森林野生动物的习性。

wither［'wɪðə(r)］

v.（使）枯萎，凋谢〈同 shrivel, shrink〉

例　I forgot to water my plant and it withered. 我忘给植物浇水，它都枯萎了。

记　with（和…一起）+ er（可以记为“饿”）→ 和饿在一起久了就会枯萎 → 枯萎

联　dither vi. 发抖

withhold［wɪð'həʊld］

v. 保留，抑制〈同 hold, keep〉

例　The bank withheld the deposit until he paid back his debt. 银行冻结了他的财产，直到他偿还完借款。

wreath［ri:θ］

n. 花圈，花环

例　The bride wore a wreath on her head at the wedding. 婚礼上，新娘头戴花环。

wrench［rentʃ］

n./v. 猛扭，猛拉〈同 twist〉

例　With a powerful wrench, I removed the lid from the pickle jar. 我用了个强有力的扳手，打开了泡菜坛上的盖子。

联　wreck n. 残骸，失事 vt. 破坏





wrinkle［'rɪŋkəl］

n. 皱纹，褶皱〈同 crease, furrow〉

例　The shirt has many wrinkles and should be ironed. 衬衫上有许多褶皱，应该熨一下。

yell［jel］

n./v. 大叫，呼喊〈同 shout〉

例　The patient let out a yell of pain when the doctor touched his broken bone. 当医生碰到病人的骨折处时，病人发出了痛苦的叫声。

youngster［'jʌŋstə(r)］

n. 年轻人，少年〈同 youth〉

例　The youngster listened respectfully to his grandfather's stories. 年轻人恭敬地听着祖父的故事。

zenith［'zenɪθ; (US)'zɪ:nɪθ］

n. 顶点，顶峰〈同 pinnacle, peak〉

例　Bill Clinton reached the zenith of his career in 1992. 1992年，比尔·克林顿到达了事业的顶峰。

联　zenithal adj. 顶点的，绝顶的

zone［zəʊn］

n. 区域；地带〈同 region, district〉

例　The factory was built in an industrial zone. 那座工厂建在工业园区。

联　ozone n.【化】臭氧

27. The fallen leaf ______ in the sun.

28. Alice ______ her back when she picked up the heavy box.

前言

本丛书专为哪些人编写？

◎ 准备参加TOEFL、IELTS、GRE、GMAT等考试，但英语水平或词汇量不足，难以直接复习备考，需要实实在在、循序渐进提高词汇量及英文水平的人——本丛书词汇从“Vocabulary Basic”开始，难度逐级提高，直到“Vocabulary 23000”。

◎ 准备参加大学英语四级考试的人——“Vocabulary Basic”包括了《大学英语教学大纲》规定的英语四级应掌握的全部核心词汇。

◎ 准备参加大学英语六级考试的人——“Vocabulary Basic”+“Vocabulary 6000”，包括了《大学英语教学大纲》规定的英语六级应掌握的全部核心词汇。

◎ 准备参加TOEFL、研究生入学等考试的人——“Vocabulary Basic”+“Vocabulary 6000”+“Vocabulary 12000”，包含了TOEFL、研究生入学考试应掌握的全部核心词汇。

◎ 以上所有类型的读者均可首先学习或最后总结学习“Vocabulary 23000”。该书采用“词根词缀”记忆法，为读者构建词汇学习之框架，同时结合“近形”和“同根”记忆法，帮助读者轻松、快速地扩大词汇量。

本丛书有何特点？

◎ 以“课”为单元，每课包括4个部分或3～5个Group，各部分虽只有10个左右的主词，但由其衍生出来的同义、反义、形近、同根、同类词等的量非常之大。这样既可方便读者安排学习进度（每天1～2课），又能够保证其3个月内词汇量迅速达到20000以上。

◎ 每个单词均附有国际音标、词性说明、中文释义、英文例句及译文。

◎ 列出各单词的同义词，帮助读者迅速扩大词汇量。配合联想记忆法，举一反三，事半功倍。

◎ 根据词义精心设计了助记插图，既便于读者更好地理解单词，又为学习增加了趣味性。

◎ 前三册每一部分后均附有习题，以加深读者对所学单词的印象；全四册每一课后均有综合复习，便于读者自我检测对所学单词的了解程度，并增强活用单词的能力。

◎ 附赠MP3录音，可在网络上免费下载，其中包含书中的所有主词和英文例句。录音由英音外教朗读，发音纯正地道，配合学习，效果更佳。

词汇量的增加不可一蹴而就，但是若能采用系统的方法，还是可以缩短扩大词汇量所需的时间。为此，我们特别为全国广大的英语学习者编写了这套词汇丛书。从最基本的“Vocabulary Basic”到足以应付留学考试之需的“Vocabulary 23000”，读者只要按部就班、循序渐进地学习本丛书，必可在最短的时间内取得最大的成效。无论您目前是在校求学或已步入社会，都会发现本系列书籍即是您苦寻已久、增强英文实力的最佳利器。学校老师更可采用本系列书籍作为辅助教材，以弥补平时上课内容之不足。

编者



Lesson 1





音频



预备测验

找出与句子中划线单词意义最相近的词。

1. It is seldom acceptable to abbreviate words in formal writing.

(A) omit

(B) explain

(C) shorten

2. Although they had never met before the party, Dick and Jane felt a strong affinity for each other.

(A) affability towards

(B) attraction to

(C) dislike of

3. Male lions remain aloof from the day-to-day activities of their families.

(A) upwind of

(B) separate from

(C) exhausted from

4. Frequent minor ailments kept her home from work.

(A) irritations

(B) young children

(C) sicknesses

5. In the autumn, the northern mountains are ablaze with shades of red, yellow, and orange.

(A) radiant

(B) abloom

(C) decorated



第一部分

abbreviate［ə'bri:vɪeɪt］

vt. ①缩短〈同　shorten, abridge〉

例　The President was asked to abbreviate his speech since the students crammed in the room without air-conditioning were running out of patience. 校长被要求缩短演讲时间，因为在没有空调的房间里，挤在一起的学生们正在失去耐心。

②缩写

例　“Mister”is usually abbreviated as“Mr.”. Mister通常被缩写成Mr.。

联　abbreviated adj. 简短的；abbreviation n. 缩写，缩写词

ablaze［ə'bleɪz］

adj. 着火的，燃烧的；闪耀的〈同　burning; bright〉

例　After the firewood was ablaze, he felt warm. 柴火点着之后，他才感到暖和。

记　a+blaze（火焰）→着火的

联　blaze n. 火焰 v. 燃烧；发怒；blazing adj. 炽烧的，闪耀的；laze v. 偷懒，混日子；glaze n. 釉；plaza n. 广场；购物中心





abort［ə'bɔ:t］

n.中止计划（或任务）〈同　failure, stop〉

例　The minister ordered a general abort in stamp production when he learned there was a mistake on the newly issued stamp. 在得知新发行的邮票上有错误后，部长命令全面中止邮票的生产。

联　abortive adj. 流产的；失败的；abortion n. 流产；失败

abrasion［ə'breɪʒən］

n.磨（擦）破；表面磨损〈同　scratch; friction〉

例　She fell and suffered an abrasion on her left hand. 她摔倒了，擦伤了左手。

联　abrasive adj. 研磨的

absenteeism［ˌæbsən'ti:ɪzm］

n. 旷课；旷工〈同　absence〉

例　The rate of absenteeism at this school is so high that punishments were introduced for nonattendance. 这所学校的缺勤率太高了，因此学校针对缺勤者采取了惩罚措施。

联　absentee n. 缺席者；absent adj. 不在的，缺席的；absence n. 缺席

absolute［'æbsəlu:t］

adj. ①完全的〈同　total, complete〉

例　After he quit his old job a feeling of absolute freedom befell him. 辞去之前的工作之后，他有一种完全自由的感觉。

②绝对的〈同　definite, certain〉

例　The captain of a ship has the absolute right to jettison cargo when necessary. 船长有绝对的权力在必要时抛弃货物。

记　ab+solute（溶解）→不溶解的→不能变的→绝对的

联　absolution n. 赦免，赦罪；solute n. 溶解物，溶质；salute v. 敬礼；resolute adj. 坚决的

abut［ə'bʌt］

v. 邻接，毗邻〈同　be next to, border on〉

例　The library abuts the old museum. 图书馆毗邻老博物馆。

联　abet vt. 教唆；debut v. 初进社交界；首次演出

accidental［ˌæksɪ'dentəl］

adj. 意外的，偶然的〈同　unexpected, unforeseen〉

例　The accidental encounter with an old friend, whom he hadn't seen for two years, made him very excited. 偶然遇到一位两年未见的老朋友，这让他非常兴奋。

联　accidentally adv. 偶然地，意外地；accident n. 意外事件，事故

acclaim［ə'kleɪm］

n. 赞誉，赞许〈同　recognition, praise〉

例　The best-selling author's new book was greeted with great acclaim. 那位畅销书作家的新书受到了广泛称赞。

vt. 喝彩，欢呼；称赞〈同　hail; praise〉

例　Spectators acclaimed the winner of the competition. 观众们为比赛获胜者欢呼。

记　ac+claim（=clam 叫喊）→不断叫喊→欢呼

联　acclaimed adj. 受赞誉的；acclamation n. 欢呼，喝彩；claim n./v. 主张，要求；declaim v. 演说；exclaim v. 呼喊，大声说；proclaim vt. 宣布，声明；reclaim v. 要求归还

accredit［ə'kredɪt］

vt. 授权〈同　authorize, commission〉

例　Diplomatic negotiations generally take place in embassies where ambassadors are accredited. 外交谈判通常在其大使被授权的大使馆进行。

自我检测　从第一部分中选出最适当的词填入空格内。

6. The ______ from wind and weather made the house look very old.

7. The title was too long, so they had to ______ it.

8. The crowd ______ the winning team.

9. The school was ______ after it began to hire teachers with Master's Degrees.

10. Breaking the new dish was ______; I did not mean to do it.

11. The dictator had ______ power.



第二部分

acronym［'ækrənɪm］

n. 用大写字母表示的缩写词〈同　abbreviation〉

例　AIDS is an acronym for Acquired Immune Deficiency Syndrome. AIDS是“获得性免疫缺陷综合征”的缩写。

actual［'æktʃʊəl］

adj. 实际的，现行的〈同　real, true〉

例　Our actual expenses for food and clothes last year were much lower than we thought. 去年，我们在吃穿上的实际开支远远低于预期。

联　actually adv. 实际上，事实上；actuate vt. 开动；促使；activate vt. 刺激，使活动；actively adv. 活跃地，积极地

addict

［ə'dɪkt］vt. 使沉溺，使上瘾（be addicted to）〈同　indulge in, be devoted to〉

例　Realizing that she was addicted to cigarettes, Janet decided to quit. 珍妮特意识到自己吸烟上瘾了，因此决定戒烟。

［'ædɪkt］n. 上瘾者

例　The drug addict was required to get medical help. 那个瘾君子被要求接受药物治疗。

联　addictive adj.（使人）上瘾的；addiction n. 沉溺，上瘾；addicted adj. 沉溺的，上瘾的；abdicate v. 放弃，退位；predict v. 预言；dictate v. 口授，听写

additive［'ædətɪv］

n. 添加剂〈同　addition, supplement〉

例　The scientists had to use certain additives to make the drug more powerful. 为了增强药物的药效，科学家们不得不使用特定的添加剂。

联　additional adj. 另外的，附加的，额外的；in addition to 除…之外

adept［ə'dept］

adj. 熟练的，擅长的〈同　competent, skilled〉

例　Mr. Bao is known to be an adept writer. 鲍先生是一位出色的作家。

adjunct［'æʤʌŋkt］

n. 附件，附属〈同　addition, accessory〉

例　I hoped that I would find the computer course a useful adjunct to my other studies. 我希望计算机课对我学习其他课程有辅助作用。

adobe［ə'dəʊbi; ə'dəʊb］

n. 泥砖，土坯〈同　clay, brick〉

例　Adobe is a type of brick made of clay baked in the sun. 泥砖是一种用黏土制成的、在太阳下烤晒而成形的砖。

adorn［ə'dɔ:n］

vt. 装饰〈同　decorate, embellish〉

例　She adorned her hair with flowers. 她把花戴在头发上当装饰。

联　adornment n. 装饰；装饰品；unadorned adj. 未装饰的，朴实的





advisable［əd'vaɪzəbəl］

adj. 适当的；明智的；可取的〈同　suitable; sensible〉

例　It is not advisable for you to go to school while you are still sick. 你还在生病，不应该去学校。

记　advise（提建议）+able（能…的）→能提建议的→可取的

联　advisor n. 顾问；advisory adj. 劝告的；visible adj. 可见的

affinity［ə'fɪnəti］

n. ①紧密关系〈同　connection, relationship〉

例　She felt an affinity with all who suffered; their pains were her pains. 她能与所有遭受痛苦的人产生情感共鸣；他们的痛苦就是她的痛苦。

②吸引；喜爱〈同　attraction; liking〉

例　Many girls have a strong affinity for chocolate candy. 许多女孩特别喜欢巧克力糖。

自我检测　从第二部分中选出最适当的词填入空格内。

12. The ______ time of departure was two hours later than expected.

13. He added an adage as an ______ to his essay.

14. He had an ______ for his old car, so he really didn't want to sell it.

15. ______ are substances that are added to other substances to preserve them or increase their effectiveness.

16. The law firm's name, TLC, was an ______ for Tender Loving Care.

17. Having started when he was five, Paul was an ______ pool player.



第三部分

aggregate［'ægrɪgət］

n. ①总数〈同　total, sum〉

例　The aggregate of all the gifts was over $700. 所有礼物的累计价值超过了700美元。

②聚集体〈同　combination〉

例　Society is an aggregate of individuals. 社会是个人的集合体。

记　ag+greg（团体）+ate→成为团体→聚集体

联　aggregation n. 集合，群体；gregarious adj. 爱社交的；aggravate v. 加重，使恶化；congregate v. 集合，聚集；segregate v. 隔离

agile［'æʤaɪl］

adj. 敏捷的，活泼轻快的〈同　nimble, quick〉

例　The agile kid climbed up the tree in no time. 那个敏捷的孩子很快就爬到了树上。

记　ag（做）+ile→能够做的→敏捷的

联　agility n. 敏捷，活泼；agitate v. 搅动；煽动；agitated adj. 焦虑的，激动的；fragile adj. 易碎的

ailment［'eɪlmənt］

n. 疾病（尤指轻病、小病）〈同　illness, affliction〉

例　A feeble body is always prone to minor ailments. 虚弱的身体往往容易患一些小病。

联　disease n. 疾病；unsoundness n. 不健全

ajar［ə'ʤɑ:(r)］

adj.（门、窗等）微开的〈同　half-open〉

例　She left the door ajar so that she could hear what they were saying. 她把门半开着，这样就能够听到他们在说什么。





akin［ə'kɪn］

adj. 同族的；类似的〈同　related; similar〉

例　His taste in music seems akin to mine. 他在音乐上的品位似乎与我类似。

alignment［ə'laɪnmənt］

n. 排列成行；联合，结盟〈同　arrangement; association〉

例　All four wheels must be in perfect alignment. 四个轮子都必须完全对齐。

联　align v. 结盟；alight vi. 落下

allegory［'ælɪgəri; (US)'ælɪgɔ:ri］

n. 寓言〈同　parable, fable〉

例　Orwell's Animal Farm is an allegory which uses a farm to illustrate philosophical ideas. 奥威尔的《动物庄园》是一个寓言故事，它用一座农场来说明哲学理念。

alliteration［əˌlɪtə'reɪ∫ən］

n. 头韵

例　“Sally sells sea shells by the seashore”is an alliteration.“Sally sells sea shells by the seashore”这句话压头韵。

allowance［ə'laʊəns］

n. 津贴；补助〈同　stipend, subsidy〉

例　She was given an allowance of five dollars per week. 她每周获得五美元的补贴。

allude［ə'lu:d］

vi. 暗指，影射，间接提到〈同　imply, hint〉

例　He's sensitive about his size, so let's not allude to it. 他对自己的体重非常敏感，所以我们还是别提起它。

第四部分

aloft［ə'lɒft］

adv. 在高处；在空中

例　The spacecraft stayed aloft for two weeks. 太空飞船在空中停留了两周。

aloof［ə'lu:f］

adj. 远离的；冷淡的，漠不关心的〈同　distant, remote; indifferent〉

例　After he dropped out of school, the relationship between him and his friend became aloof. 他辍学之后，与朋友的关系变得日益疏远。

altitude［'æltɪtju:d］

n.（海拔）高度〈同　elevation, height〉

例　The pilot announced that our altitude was 30,000 feet. 飞行员宣布，我们处于30,000英尺的高空中。

记　alt（来自altus，高）+itude→（海拔）高度

联　altimeter n. 高度计；altruism n. 利他主义；altruistic adj. 利他的，无私心的；latitude n. 纬度；platitude n. 陈词滥调

ambience［'æmbɪəns］

n. 周围环境，气氛〈同　atmosphere, environment〉

例　The small park possesses a pleasant ambience that appeals to young people. 这个小公园环境优雅怡人，吸引着年轻人。

联　ambient adj. 周围的；ambition n. 雄心；ambitious adj. 雄心勃勃的；ambiguous adj. 模棱两可的

ambivalent［æm'bɪvələnt］

adj. 有矛盾情绪的，举棋不定的〈同　mixed, contradictory〉

例　He was ambivalent because he wanted to eat a lot of cake, but was determined to lose weight. 他非常矛盾，因为他想吃许多蛋糕，但已经下决定心要减肥了。

联　ambivalence n. 矛盾心理

amble［'æmbəl］

vi. 漫步，缓行〈同　ramble, roam〉

例　The old man ambled through the park. 那位老人缓步穿过公园。

联　scramble vt. 搅乱，使混杂

amenable［ə'mi:nəbəl］

adj. 顺从的；应服从的〈同　submissive, tractable〉

例　He was amenable to any suggestions which came from those he looked up to. 对于他尊敬的人给出的建议，他都会接受。

amenity［ə'mi:nəti］

n. ①［常作复数］生活福利设施，便利设施

例　There are a lot of amenities in the city such as libraries, cinemas, and hospitals. 城市里有许多便利设施，如图书馆、电影院和医院等。

②（地方、气候等）舒适，宜人〈同　comfort〉

例　We went to Hawaii to enjoy the amenity of a warm climate. 我们去夏威夷享受那里温暖宜人的气候。

联　amity n. 和睦；enmity n. 敌意

amid［ə'mɪd］

prep. 在…中〈同　among〉

例　On the floor, amid many books, were two small envelopes. 地板上的一堆书中间有两个小信封。

联　pyramid n. 金字塔；金字塔现象，越到上面越狭窄的现象

amnesia［æm'ni:zjə; (US)æm'ni:ʒə］

n. 健忘症；记忆缺失

例　After the car accident, he could not identify any of his friends because of amnesia. 车祸发生后，他因为失忆，根本认不出他的任何朋友。

记　a+mnes（记忆）+ia（病）→没有记忆的病→记忆缺失

联　amnesty n. 大赦；anemia n. 贫血症；aphasia n. 失语症；malaria n. 疟疾；insomnia n. 失眠，失眠症
