Lesson 24





音频



预备测验

找出与句子中划线单词意义最相近的词。

1. The first watermill was horizontal and resembled a rudimentary turbine（涡轮）.

(A) a flat

(B) a rusty

(C) an unsophisticated

2. It is risky to keep wild animals as pets because there is no effective rabies vaccine for immunizing wildlife.

(A) disadvantageous

(B) impossible

(C) hazardous

3. The process of respiration consists of two independent actions, inhaling and exhaling.

(A) breathing

(B) drinking

(C) eating

4. Ships passing on the high seas exchange salutes by lowering and raising their flags once.

(A) information

(B) ceremonies

(C) greetings

5. Millions of bison roamed over the prairies from Canada to Central Mexico.

(A) grazed

(B) wandered

(C) hunted



第一部分

repulse［rɪ'pʌls］

vt. ①击退〈同　repel, drive back〉

例　The army repulsed the enemies. 军队击退了敌军。

②拒绝，排斥；使厌恶〈同　refuse; disgust〉

例　The sight of two dogs fighting repulsed her. 看到两条狗打架让她心生反感。

记　re（反）+pulse（推）→推出去→击退

联　repulsive adj. 排斥的；令人厌恶的；pulse n. 脉搏；脉冲；impulse n. 推动；刺激；convulse vt. 震动；使抽筋

reputed［rɪ'pju:tɪd］

adj. 名誉好的，被称为…的，有…名气的〈同　known as, famous〉

例　The professor was reputed to be an expert after the publication of his theories. 那名教授出版了自己的理论之后，便被誉为专家。

联　disrepute n. 坏名声，不光彩

residue［'rezɪdju:; (US)-du:］

n. 剩余，残余，渣滓〈同　remainder, remains〉

例　Even though she tried to clean the floor, a residue of dirt remained. 虽然她努力清洁地板，但地板上仍有污垢的残渣。

联　residual adj. 剩余的，残留的

resolute［'rezəlu:t］

adj. 坚决的，毅然的〈同　firm, determined〉

例　The workers are resolute to finish the job on time. 工人们坚决按时完成工作。

联　resolve vt. 解决；resolution n. 分辨率

respiration［ˌrespə'reɪ∫ən］

n. 呼吸〈同　breathing〉

例　A bad cold can make respiration difficult. 重感冒可能造成呼吸困难。

联　respiratory adj. 呼吸的

responsive［rɪ'spɒnsɪv］

adj. 响应的，作出响应的〈同　reactive〉

例　The teacher enjoyed the responsive students. 老师喜欢积极响应的学生。

记　respons（反应）+ive→有反应的→响应的

联　respondent adj. 回答的 n. 回答者；response n. 回答，响应；responsibility n. 责任，职责；responsible adj. 负责的





retool［ri:'tu:l］

vt. 将机械重新整备，重组〈同　reorganize, reconstitute〉

例　After someone defaced Tom's chair, the carpenter had to retool it. 有人弄坏了汤姆的椅子，木匠不得不对它进行改装。

联　tooling n. 加工；toolbox n. 工具箱；retort v. 反驳

retract［rɪ'trækt］

vt. ①缩回，撤回〈同　retreat〉

例　The politician had to retract his offensive statements. 那名政客不得不收回其无礼的言论。

②收回，取消〈同　withdraw, cancel〉

例　Please retract your false accusation. 请收回你的诬告。

记　re（回）+tract（拉）→拉回去→缩回

联　tract n. 一片土地；attract v. 吸引；abstract adj. 抽象的；contract n. 合同 v.（使）收缩；detract v. 贬低；distract vt. 使混乱；使分心；extract v. 抽取；protract vt. 延长；subtract v. 减少

revere［rɪ'vɪə(r)］

vt. 尊崇，尊敬〈同　worship, venerate〉

例　Einstein was a preeminent scientist who was revered by everyone, even his rivals. 爱因斯坦是一位杰出的科学家，受到了所有人的尊敬，包括他的对手。

记　re（一再）+vere（害怕，敬畏）→不断敬畏→尊敬

联　revered adj. 尊敬的；irreverent adj. 不尊敬的；irreverence n. 不尊敬；persevere v. 坚持；reverse v. 颠倒，倒转；reversal n. 颠倒，反转；adore v. 崇拜，爱慕

revitalization［ri:ˌvaɪtəlaɪ'zeɪ∫ən; -lɪ'z-］

n. 新生，复兴〈同　rebirth, reinvigoration〉

例　The president passed new policies that aimed at the revitalization of the troubled economy. 总统批准了旨在复兴经济困境的新政策。

自我检测　从第一部分中选出最适当的词填入空格内。

6. The office had to ______ all its computers after the computer virus had infected them.

7. If you don't dry it, the rain will leave a ______ on the paint of the car.

8. People ______ the saint.

9. When they saw the victim was ______, their fears that she was dead passed.

10. We saw the turtle's head ______ into its shell.

11. Our soldiers ______ the enemy.



第二部分

rhetoric［'retərɪk］

n. 修辞；修辞学〈同　eloquence〉

例　All writers, by necessity, must be skilled in rhetoric. 所有作家不可避免地必须精通修辞学。

记　来自Rhetor（古希腊的修辞学教师、演说家）

联　rhetorical adj. 修辞的

riddle［'rɪdəl］

n. 谜语〈同　puzzle, enigma〉

例　The newspapers have a section on riddles for people's amusement. 报纸上有一个刊登谜语的版块，以供读者消遣。

v. 出谜；迷惑

例　The inconsistent evidence at the crime scene riddled investigators. 犯罪现场相互矛盾的证据给调查人员出了一个难题。

rift［rɪft］

n. 裂缝；断裂，长峡谷〈同　break; crack〉

例　The family argument created a rift between the father and son. 家庭纠纷使父亲与儿子产生了不和。

联　drift n. 冲洗；漂流物 v.（使）漂流；driftwood n. 流木，浮木；snowdrift n. 随风飘飞的雪；rifle n. 步枪 vt. 洗劫，抢劫；rife adj. 流行的，普遍的；gift n. 礼物；lift v. 举起；升起

rigidity［rə'ʤɪdəti］

n. 僵化，死板〈同　stiffness〉

例　The drawback of institutionalization is that it can turn into a kind of organizational rigidity that produces paralysis. 制度化的缺点是，它可能变成某种组织僵化，进而造成瘫痪。

rinse［rɪns］

v. 用清水冲洗；漱〈同　cleanse with water, flush〉

例　The cook rinsed the vegetables before cutting them to make the salad. 厨师先清洗蔬菜，然后把它们切碎来制作沙拉。





risky［'rɪski］

adj. 危险的，冒险的〈同　hazardous, dangerous〉

例　Because of advances in medical technology, heart surgery is not as risky as it formerly was. 由于医疗技术的进步，心脏手术不再像以前那样充满风险。

联　risk n./vt. 冒险；frisky adj. 活泼的，欢闹的；briskness n. 敏捷，活泼

rite［raɪt］

n. 仪式〈同　ceremony, ritual〉

例　People entreat the gods for blessing through various sacred rites. 人们通过各种宗教仪式来祈求神的保佑。

联　trite adj. 陈词滥调的；ride v. 骑；ripe adj. 熟的；kite n. 风筝；cite vt. 引用；bite v. 叮咬；site n. 位置

rivalry［'raɪvəlri］

n. 竞争；敌对状态〈同　competition, contest〉

例　Since these two teams have played each other for the championship for five consecutive years, they have built up an intense rivalry. 这两支队伍连续五年都在争夺冠军的比赛中相遇，因此，双方展开了激烈的争夺。

roam［rəʊm］

vi. 漫游，漫步〈同　wander, ramble〉

例　He had to put up a fence to keep his cattle from roaming onto his neighbor's farm. 为了防止自己的牛跑到邻居家的农场上，他不得不树立起栅栏。

roost［ru:st］

n. 栖息处，鸟巢〈同　perch〉

例　Many bats favor isolated or secure roosts, such as caves, crevices in cliff faces or tree hollows. 许多蝙蝠都喜欢隔离的或安全的栖息地，例如山洞、悬崖一侧的裂缝或树洞等。

v.（使）栖息〈同　alight, perch〉

例　The chicken roosted under the tree and out of the sun. 鸡栖息在树荫下面，躲避阳光。

联　boost v. 推进；rooster n. 公鸡；roster n. 花名册；roast v. 烤

自我检测　从第二部分中选出最适当的词填入空格内。

12. The birds made a ______ inside a tree in order to lay their eggs.

13. Going to casinos can be financially ______ for people who can not control their excitement.

14. The ______ in Winston Churchill's speeches inspired a whole nation.

15. ______ all the shampoo out of your hair when you wash it.

16. A strong ______ between two teams can very easily turn into violence between their fans.

17. Sherlock Holmes was a master at solving ______.



第三部分

roughly［'rʌfli］

adv. 概略地；大致地〈同　approximately, more or less〉

例　The opera should begin at roughly 7:30 pm. 歌剧应该在晚上7:30左右开演。

roundabout［'raʊndəbaʊt］

adj. 间接的；转弯抹角的〈同　indirect, circuitous〉

例　He never spoke directly but always in a roundabout way. 他从不直接说，而总是以一种拐弯抹角的方式说出来。

rubbery［'rʌbəri］

adj. 橡胶似的，有弹力的〈同　elastic, flexible〉

例　People who eat squid say it is very rubbery. 吃鱿鱼的人说它非常有弹性。

rubble［'rʌbəl］

n.（一堆）碎石，瓦砾

例　Before the new housing project could be built, it was necessary to tear down the old houses and remove the rubble. 在新住宅项目开建之前，必须推倒旧房子，并清除碎石。

联　pebble n. 小圆石，小鹅卵石

rudimentary［ˌru:dɪ'mentəri］

adj. 基本的；初步的，发展未完全的〈同　elementary; primary, undeveloped〉

例　The alphabet is rudimentary knowledge for students. 字母表是学生们要掌握的基础知识。

记　rudi（无知的，粗鲁的）+ment+ary→无知状态→初步的

联　rudiment n. 基本，初步；erudite adj. 深奥的；inchoate adj. 初步的，未形成的；incipient adj. 初始的；primeval adj. 原始

rugged［'rʌgɪd］

adj. 高低不平的；崎岖的〈同　uneven, rough〉

例　Most of British Columbia is mountainous, with long, rugged ranges running north and south. 不列颠哥伦比亚省的大部分地区都是山区，多是自北向南蜿蜒崎岖的山脉。

记　rug（=wrinkle 皱）+ed→起皱的→高低不平的

联　rug n. 小地毯；ragged adj. 破烂的；jagged adj. 锯齿状的；logged adj. 笨拙的；harsh adj. 粗糙的；苛刻的

rumble［'rʌmbəl］

n. 隆隆声，辘辘行驶声〈同　thunder〉

例　The avalanche's rumble was heard down in the valley. 在山谷里能够听到雪崩的隆隆声。

v. 发出低沉的隆隆声〈同　roar, growl〉

例　The baby tiger rumbled at the man who approached. 小虎崽对接近它的那个人低声咆哮。





rustic［'rʌstɪk］

adj. 乡村的，乡下风格的〈同　rural〉

例　A rustic life is supposed to be a tranquil one. 乡下生活应该是安静的。

记　rust（乡村）+ic→乡村的

联　rusticity n. 乡村风味；rust n. 锈 v.（使）生锈；rusticate v.（使）定居乡村；过乡村生活；rusty adj. 生锈的；rural adj. 乡下的，田园的；bucolic adj. 田园的，乡村的

ruthless［'ru:θlɪs］

adj. 无同情心的，残忍的〈同　unmerciful, heartless〉

例　The bank robbers were ruthless and left no survivors. 银行劫匪非常残忍，没有留下任何活口。

记　ruth（仁慈）+less→不仁慈的→残忍的

联　ruthful adj. 令人同情的；rustless adj. 不锈的

saga［'sɑ:gə］

n. 英雄传奇〈同　legend〉

例　The saga of a lone man confronting the turbulent oceans in a small boat is an exploit we find laudable. 一个人单身一人乘一条小船面对狂暴的大海，这样的传奇事迹在我们看来是值得称赞的壮举。

联　sage adj. 智慧的；sag v. 下陷，下垂；消沉；sagacity n. 聪慧，洞察力；sagacious adj. 有洞察力的，有远见的

18. It is almost impossible to learn multiplication without knowing the ______ steps of addition.

19. The Star Wars movies are based on a ______ about the struggle between good and evil.

20. The time it took him to finish the run was ______ one hour.

21. The bomb left the whole town in ______.

22. If there is too much traffic on this street, you should take a ______ route.

23. The ______ tyrant caused the deaths of millions of people.



第四部分

sake［seɪk］

n. 缘故；原因〈同　purpose〉

例　The greedy man would do anything for money's sake. 为了钱，那个贪婪的人可以做任何事情。

联　forsake vt. 遗弃

salient［'seɪlɪənt］

adj. 显著的，突出的〈同　conspicuous, noticeable〉

例　Mike has two salient characteristics: an unusually prominent nose and extremely large ears. 迈克有两个突出的特点：一个异常高挺的鼻子和超大的耳朵。

记　sal（跳）+ient→跳起来→突出的

联　salience n. 显著，突出；sapient adj. 睿智的；自以为聪明的；alien adj. 外国的，相异的；prominent adj. 突出的，卓越的

saline［'seɪlaɪn; (US)'seɪli:n］

adj. 含盐的，咸的〈同　salty〉

例　The slightly saline taste of this mineral water is pleasant. 这种矿泉水略带咸味的口味非常好喝。

联　salinity n. 盐分，盐度；saltiness n. 盐度；desalination n. 脱盐作用；saliva n. 口水，唾液

salute［sə'lu:t; sə'lju:t］

n. 致敬〈同　greeting〉

例　The soldier gave a salute and the officer returned it. 士兵敬礼，军官还礼。





sanctimonious［ˌsæŋktɪ'məʊnɪəs］

adj. 假装诚实的，伪装虔诚的〈同　hypocritical〉

例　You do not have to be so sanctimonious to prove that you are devout. 你不必如此虚伪地证明自己是虔诚的。

记　来自名词sanctimonial（修女）

联　sanctify vt. 使神圣化；sanction n./vt. 批准，同意；制裁

sanctuary［'sæŋktjʊəri; (US)-ʊeri］

n. ①圣所，圣殿〈同　holy place〉

例　The exiled king sought sanctuary in the church. 那个被流放的国王到教堂寻求庇护。

②避难所；动物保护区〈同　shelter, refuge〉

例　The beautiful garden was her sanctuary from the world. 那个美丽的花园是她逃离这个世界的避难所。

记　sanct（神圣）+uary（地方）→圣所

联　sanctum n. 圣地；密室

sandy［'sændi］

adj. 沙的，多沙的

例　The children liked to go to the sandy beach and build sand castles. 孩子们喜欢去沙滩盖沙堡。

sanitation［ˌsænɪ'teɪ∫ən］

n.（公共、环境的）卫生，卫生设施〈同　health, hygiene〉

例　The city's Department of Sanitation oversees garbage removal. 那座城市的公共卫生部负责监督垃圾清运。

记　sanit（健康的）+ation→与健康有关的→卫生

联　sanitary adj. 卫生的，清洁的；sanity n. 心智健全；sane adj. 健全的

sap［sæp］

n. 树液，汁液〈同　fluid〉

例　Rising sap carries water and minerals from the roots. 上升的树液从根部带走了水和矿物质。

vt. 使衰竭〈同　drain, exhaust〉

例　Fasting quickly sapped his strength. 禁食迅速折损了他的力量。

联　sapphire n. 蓝宝石

sarcastic［sɑ:'kæstɪk］

adj. 讽刺的，挖苦的〈同　ironic, cynical〉

例　“Don't hurry!”was her husband's sarcastic comment as she slowly dressed.“别着急！”是每次她慢慢打扮的时候，她丈夫的挖苦话。

联　sarcasm n. 挖苦，讽刺；satire n. 讽刺文学，讽刺

Lesson 25





音频



预备测验

找出与句子中划线单词意义最相近的词。

1. Trees, shrubs, flowers, and grass give character and variety to parks.

(A) vines

(B) vegetables

(C) bushes

(D) weeds

2. In anatomical diagrams, the aorta is frequently depicted in scarlet.

(A) light blue

(B) bright red

(C) black

(D) purple

3. Penguins do not suffer from the cold in Antarctica because their feathers secrete a protective oil.

(A) hide

(B) warm

(C) produce

(D) absorb

4. Mary is a silly girl.

(A) foolish

(B) eccentric

(C) popular

(D) well-known

5. To take Highway 70 East is a shortcut to Oklahoma City.

(A) direct route

(B) narrow path

(C) banner

(D) raid



第一部分

satire［'sætaɪə(r)］

n. 讽刺；讽刺文学〈同　lampoonery, caricature〉

例　The newspaper's goofy cartoon of the president was a political satire. 报纸上刊登的关于总统的滑稽漫画，是一种政治讽刺作品。

联　satiric adj. 讽刺的，挖苦的；satirist n. 讽刺作家

scapegoat［'skeɪpgəut］

n. 替罪羊，代人受过的人〈同　victim〉

例　The innocent manager was made the scapegoat for the corrupt dealings of her employees. 那名无辜的经理成了其下属员工舞弊交易的替罪羊。

scarlet［'skɑ:lɪt］

adj. 猩红的，鲜红的〈同　bright red〉

例　The knight's sword was scarlet after the battle. 战斗结束后，那名骑士的剑变成了猩红色。

scavenger［'skævɪnʤə(r)］

n. 清道夫，食腐动物

例　The raccoon is a scavenger and searches through the trash for food. 浣熊是食腐动物，会在垃圾中寻找食物。

联　scavenge v.（动物）以（垃圾、腐肉）为食，（在废弃物中）搜寻（有用之物）；avenge v.（替…）报仇；revenge n./v. 报仇，复仇；vengeful adj. 复仇的

scotch［'skɒtʃ］

v. 镇压，粉碎〈同　put an end to〉

例　Our picnic plans were scotched when the rain started. 开始下雨了，所以我们的野餐计划泡汤了。

联　oppress vt. 镇压，压制；depress vt. 压制；inspire v. 激励；thwart vt. 阻碍，反对；foil vt. 阻止，挫败





scour［'skaʊə(r)］

vt. 冲刷，擦掉〈同　scrub, rub〉

例　You'll have to scour those old cooking pots before you use them. 在用那些旧锅之前，你必须把它们洗刷干净。

联　scourer n. 擦洗者；洗刷用具；scout v. 侦察；scrub v. 擦洗；polish v. 擦亮

scramble［'skræmbəl］

vt. 搅乱，使混杂〈同　jumble, mix〉

例　The magician scrambled the cards that I had chosen with the rest of the deck. 魔术师把我挑选的扑克牌与剩余的牌洗乱。

记　分割记忆；scr（看做scale，攀登）+amble（快走）→总是催人快走，搞得人心烦意乱→搅乱

联　crumble v. 弄碎，粉碎；crumple v. 弄皱，压皱；scrabble v. 乱写，乱涂；amble vi. 缓行，漫步

scruple［'skru:pəl］

n. 踌躇；顾忌〈同　hesitation〉

例　She has moral and religious scruples which prevent her from eating meat. 她有道德与宗教方面的顾虑，让她不能吃肉。

联　scrupulously adv. 小心翼翼地；unscrupulous adj. 肆无忌惮的，无道德的

scuba［'sku:bə］

n. 水中呼吸器

例　He bought a scuba for the diving trip. 为了这次潜水之旅，他买了一个水中呼吸器。

seasoning［'si:zənɪŋ］

n. 调味品，调料〈同　flavoring, spice〉

例　She added seasoning to the chicken before she put it in the oven. 她给鸡撒上作料，然后把它放进了烤炉。

联　seasonal adj. 季节的，季节性的；unseasonably adv. 不合时令地，不合时宜地

6. He bought a bottle of ______ to flavor the barbeque meat.

7. The strong water current ______ the land on the river bank.

8. The comic play was a ______ of the corrupt corporate world.

9. The bad son had no ______ about stealing and selling his mother's jewelry to buy his new bike.

10. The carpet at the murder scene was ______.

11. Divers use ______ when they want to reach deep parts of the ocean or stay underwater for a prolonged period of time.



第二部分

seclusion［sɪ'klu:∫ən］

n. 独处，隐居〈同　solitude, isolation〉

例　A hermit likes to live in seclusion. 隐士喜欢住在隐蔽的地方。

记　se（分开）+clus（关闭）+ion→自我封闭，与别人分开→隐居

联　seclude vt. 使隔绝；secluded adj. 隐遁的，隔绝的；seclusive adj. 好隐居的；reclusion n. 隐居；conclusion n. 结论；exclusion n. 拒绝，排除

secrete［sɪ'kri:t］

vt. 分泌〈同　produce, excrete〉

例　The snake secreted the poison when it bit him. 蛇咬他的时候便分泌出毒液。

联　secretin n. 分泌素；secret n. 秘密

sect［sekt］

n. 宗派，教派〈同　party, faction〉

例　A small sect broke off from the main group to practice their own beliefs. 为了他们自己的信仰，一个小的派别从主组织中分裂了出去。

联　insect n. 昆虫；transect vt. 横断；intersect v. 横截，横断；dissect v. 解剖；section n. 部分；sectarian adj. 宗派的；sector n. 扇形面；地区

secular［'sekjʊlə(r)］

adj. 世俗的，尘世的〈同　earthly, worldly〉

例　The church leaders decided not to interfere in secular matters. 宗教领袖决定不干涉世俗事务。

记　sec（=second 秒，引伸为“现世”）+ular→尘世的

联　secularize vt. 使世俗化；auricular adj. 耳的，耳状的；temporal adj. 现世的，世俗的

sedentary［'sedəntəri; (US)'sedənteri］

adj. ①（指人或动物）土生的，不移徙的

例　Most Algonquin Indian tribes except those of the north were sedentary and carried on agriculture with varying degrees of intensity. 除北方的部落外，大多数阿尔冈昆印第安部落都是定居的部落，并从事一定强度的农业生产。

②（指工作）坐着做的（不需运动的）〈同　unmoving, motionless〉

例　Because he had a sedentary occupation, he decided to visit a gymnasium weekly. 由于他从事一个久坐不动的职业，因此他决定每周都去体育馆健身。

记　sed（坐）+ent+ary→久坐的→不移徙的

联　sedative adj. 镇痛的；sediment n. 沉积物；sedimentary adj. 沉积的；sedition n. 骚乱；sedan n. 私家轿车，轿子





sediment［'sedɪmənt］

n. 沉积物，沉淀物〈同　deposit, precipitate〉

例　The sediment in your orange juice is orange pulp. 橘子汁内的沉淀物是橘子的果肉。

记　sedi（坐）+ment→坐下去的东西→沉淀物

联　sedimentary adj. 沉积的，沉淀性的

seduce［sɪ'dju:s; (US)sɪ'du:s］

vt. 勾引，诱惑〈同　tempt, entice〉

例　The glamor of the big city seduced the country boy. 大城市的魅力诱惑着那个乡下男孩。

联　seduction n. 诱惑；seductive adj. 诱人的

seedling［'si:dlɪŋ］

n. 秧苗，树苗

例　The seedling was removed from the pot and placed in the ground. 幼苗被从花盆里移出，然后种在了地里。

seismic［'saɪzmɪk］

adj. 地震的；由地震引起的

例　The Richter scale is a measurement of seismic disturbances. 里氏震级是对地震扰动的测量单位。

记　seism（地震）+ic→地震的

联　seismograph n. 地震仪；seismology n. 地震学

sensational［sen'seɪ∫ənəl］

adj. 极好的，绝妙的；引起轰动的〈同　exceptional; spectacular〉

例　Everyone clapped after the class president's sensational speech at the graduation ceremony. 班长在毕业典礼上做了精彩的演讲，演讲结束后，所有人都热烈鼓掌。

记　来自名词sensation（知觉，轰动［的事］；sens［感觉］+ation→感觉）+al→引起轰动的

联　sensation n. 知觉；轰动；sensible adj. 明智的；感觉到的；sensitive adj. 敏感的；sensor n. 传感器；sensual adj. 肉体的；色情的；世俗的；sensuous adj. 感官的；给人美感的

自我检测　从第二部分中选出最适当的词填入空格内。

12. Bookkeeping（簿记）is a ______ occupation.

13. The ______ destruction of the earthquake cost the city millions of dollars for reconstruction.

14. The ______ population advocates a scientific teaching of evolution and creation.

15. The acid that a horse's stomach ______ can break down the structure of grass.

16. Benedict Arnold, ______ by offers of money, betrayed his country to the enemy.

17. The archeologists dug into the river ______ in search of prehistoric bones.



第三部分

sensory［'sensəri］

adj. 感觉的，感官的〈同　perceptive〉

例　Sharks have sensory organs that can detect faint electrical fields from other fish. 鲨鱼长有感觉器官，可以探测到其他鱼类微弱的电场。

serrated［sə'reɪtɪd; (US)se'reɪtɪd］

adj. 锯齿状的〈同　jagged, serrulated〉

例　The beech tree is one of many plants that have serrated leaves. 许多种植物长有锯齿状的叶子，山毛榉树是其中之一。

记　serr（=saw 锯子）+ated→锯齿状的

联　serration n. 锯齿状；serried adj. 密集的；serial adj. 连续的，系列的；serous adj. 如水的；浆液的；serum n. 浆液，血清；notched adj. 有凹口的，锯齿状的

sewerage［'su:ərɪʤ］

n. 排水系统

例　The city's sewerage system was built one hundred years ago, and needs to be updated. 这座城市的排水设施始建于100年前，需要进行翻新。

联　sewer n. 下水道；裁缝师

sheath［∫i:ð］

n. 鞘，外壳〈同　holder, scabbard〉

例　He bought a sheath along with the sword so no one would hurt themselves on his sword. 他买了一把剑，带有一个剑鞘，这样就不会有人被他的剑弄伤了。





shiver［'∫ɪvə(r)］

n./v. 颤抖〈同　quiver, tremble〉

例　She shivered in the cold air. 她在寒风中瑟瑟发抖。

shortcut［'∫ɔ:tkʌt］

n. 捷径〈同　a direct route〉

例　They took a shortcut to get to the airport faster. 为了更快地到达机场，他们抄了一条近路。

shriek［∫ri:k］

v. 尖声叫喊〈同　scream〉

例　She shrieked at the sight of the mouse. 她一看到老鼠便尖叫起来。

n. 尖叫，尖声

例　We heard the shrieks from next door and called the police. 我们听到了隔壁的尖叫声，然后报了警。

联　shrill adj. 尖声的；yell n./v. 喊叫；wail v. 哀号；growl n./v. 咆哮；roar n./v. 轰鸣；咆哮

shrivel［'∫rɪvəl］

v.（使）枯萎〈同　wither, shrink〉

例　She ought to pick the lettuce before it shrivels and dies. 她应该在莴苣枯死之前把它摘走。

shrub［∫rʌb］

n. 灌木；灌木丛〈同　bush〉

例　Shrubs can make a cute border around the lawn but they do not provide any privacy because of their low height. 灌木可以沿草坪形成一个可爱的边界，但它们无法保证任何私密性，因为它们太矮了。

shuffle［'∫ʌfəl］

vt. 洗牌〈同　disorder, jumble〉

例　She shuffled the deck at the beginning of every new card game. 每一局扑克牌开始之前，她都要洗牌。

联　shuffle the deck 洗牌

自我检测　从第三部分中选出最适当的词填入空格内。

18. I crept ______ into bed.

19. ______ should be pruned to keep them looking neat.

20. The ______ was installed at the turn of the century.

21. Since we were running late, we asked the local people if they knew a ______ to Brooklyn.

22. Whales use sonar as a natural ______ mechanism.

23. The gunshots in the theater made everyone run out ______.



第四部分

sidestep［'saɪdstep］

v. 横跨一步躲闪；回避（困难）〈同　avoid, evade〉

例　The player sidestepped his opponent and kicked the ball into the net. 那名球员晃开了对手，把球踢进了球门。

silly［'sɪli］

adj. 愚蠢的；糊涂的；傻的〈同　foolish, stupid〉

例　The circus clown was very silly. 那个马戏团的小丑非常可笑。

silt［sɪlt］

n. 淤泥

例　The harbor channel must be dredged annually to remove the silt. 必须每年对海港航道进行疏浚，以清除航道中的淤泥。

联　sill n. 基石；门槛；窗台；sift v. 筛，过滤；silk n. 丝绸；tilt v.（使）倾斜；wilt n./v. 枯萎；slit v. 撕裂；gilt adj. 镀金的；lilt v. 轻快地唱

simplicity［sɪm'plɪsɪti］

n. ①简单〈同　easiness〉

例　The simplicity of that book makes it suitable for children. 那本书简单易懂，适合孩子阅读。

②朴素〈同　plainness〉

例　A room in a hospital should be furnished with simplicity. 医院里的房间必须简单装修。

sinuous［'sɪnjʊəs］

adj. 蜿蜒的，迂回的〈同　curving, twisting〉

例　Snakes move by the sinuous motion of the muscles in their bodies. 蛇通过身体肌肉的弯曲动作向前移动。





skimp［skɪmp］

v. 节省，节俭；吝啬〈同　stint, spare〉

例　They were forced to skimp on necessities in order to make their limited supplies last the winter. 为了使他们有限的物资能够维持一个冬天，他们不得不节约使用生活必需品。

skyrocket［skaɪ'rɒkɪt］

vi. 猛涨，突增〈同　rise quickly, soar〉

例　Sales skyrocketed after the release of the new advertisements. 新广告推出之后，商品销量暴涨。

记　sky+rocket（火箭）→像火箭一样一飞冲天→猛涨，突增

联　skyscraper n. 摩天大楼；skyphone n. 空中电话；skymotel n.（机场附近供乘客住宿的）航空汽车旅馆

slab［slæb］

n.（四边形的厚物质）板，片〈同　a broad〉

例　Talc, a soft mineral with a variety of uses, is sold in slabs or in powdered form. 云母是一种用途广泛的软矿石，通常以板或粉末的形式出售。

slander［'slɑ:ndə(r); (US)'slændər］

n./v. 诽谤〈同　defamation; malign〉

例　Unless you can prove your allegations, your remarks constitute slander. 除非你能证明你的主张，否则你的话就构成了诽谤。

联　slanderous adj. 诽谤性的；slant v.（使）倾斜，歪向；slender adj. 苗条的

slash［slæ∫］

vt. 大量削减〈同　cut, reduce largely〉

例　Prices have been slashed by 50%. 价格大幅下跌了50%。

Lesson 26





音频



预备测验

找出与句子中划线单词意义最相近的词。

1. Jonquils bear from three to six flowers on a stalk about a foot high.

(A) plant

(B) leaf

(C) stem

2. The lizard called the Gila monster is ordinarily sluggish and clumsy.

(A) lethargic

(B) amorphous

(C) ludicrous

3. Records indicate that the tortoise（龟）can live longer than any animal with a spine.

(A) tail

(B) mouth

(C) backbone

4. Floors and walls must be specially constructed to make a buiding soundproof.

(A) solid and sturdy

(B) officially complete

(C) impermeable to noise

5. Bread has been a staple of the human diet since prehistoric times.

(A) great delicacy

(B) basic part

(C) fastener



第一部分

slime［slaɪm］

n. 黏土；黏液〈同　mud; saliva〉

例　Please take your shoes off before you come in so you don't get any slime on the carpet. 进门之前请脱鞋，以免在地毯上留下泥巴。

联　slimy adj. 黏糊糊的；（分泌）黏液的

slippery［'slɪpəri］

adj.（指物体表面）滑的，光滑的〈同　smooth〉

例　Drive carefully, the roads are wet and slippery. 小心开车，因为道路又湿又滑。

记　来自动词slip(p)（滑）+ery→光滑的

联　slip n. 滑倒；纸片 v. 滑动，滑倒；slipper n. 拖鞋；slipshod adj. 随便的；马虎的，草率的；slithery adj. 光滑的；滑溜的；lubricious adj. 滑的，光滑的；淫荡的

sloth［sləʊθ］

n. 树懒；怠惰，懒惰〈同　laziness, indolence〉

例　The sloth is a creature commonly found on trees in Central and South American jungles. 树懒是中南美洲丛林里的一种常见动物，它们一般生活在树上。

联　slothful adj. 迟钝的，懒惰的

sluggish［'slʌgɪ∫］

adj. 行动迟缓的；不活泼的；缓慢的〈同　slow, lethargic〉

例　It was a sluggish day at the office and no one wanted to work. 办公室里一整天都死气沉沉，没有人想工作。

记　slug（蛞蝓：一种行动物缓慢的蠕虫）+gish→像蛞蝓那样动作缓慢→行动迟缓的

联　sluggard n. 偷懒者，懒鬼；waggish adj. 诙谐的；smug adj. 自命不凡的；snug adj. 暖和的，安逸的；torpid adj. 迟缓的，迟钝的；蛰伏的

sly［slaɪ］

adj. 狡猾的〈同　wily, cunning〉

例　She was sly in card games and never lost. 在玩扑克牌的时候，她非常狡猾，从来没输过。

smelting［'smeltɪŋ］

n. 冶炼

例　They separated the precious metals by smelting. 他们通过冶炼来离析出稀有金属。

smog［smɒg］

n. 烟雾〈同　pollution, haze〉

例　The smog from the morning traffic made it difficult to breathe. 早晨交通产生的烟雾，让人呼吸都困难。

smother［'smʌðə(r)］

vt. ①使窒息〈同　suffocate, asphyxiate〉

例　He smothered the lady by holding a pillow over her face. 他把一个枕头蒙在那个女人的脸上，使她窒息而死。

②熄灭；覆盖〈同　extinguish, cover〉

例　Please smother the campfire before you leave in order to prevent any forest fires. 为了避免引起森林火灾，请在离开之前盖熄篝火。

snippet［'snɪpɪt］

n. 小片，片断；摘录〈同　piece; fragment〉

例　He threw snippets of bread for the birds to eat. 他扔了几片面包，喂给鸟儿吃。

snobbish［'snɒbɪ∫］

adj. 势利眼的，谄上傲下的〈同　haughty〉

例　The snobbish diner talked to the waitress as though she were stupid. 那个势利眼的用餐者，把女服务员当成傻瓜一样和她说话。

记　来自名词snob（势利小人）+bish→势利眼的

联　snobbery n. 势利；snub vt. 怠慢，不理睬

6. The ______ fox excaped the dogs chasing it.

7. The city was so severely polluted that it was covered in ______ almost every day.

8. After she mopped（用拖把拖）the stairs, she put a sign to warn people it was ______.

9. The forest rangers ______ the fire with dirt.

10. The ______ on the rocks in the cave made them slippery to walk on.

11. He earned a reputation as a ______ for not finishing his work on time.



第二部分

snowflake［'snəʊfleɪk］

n. 雪花

例　The children could see the snowflakes on the window after the snowfall. 下雪之后，孩子们能看到落在窗户上的雪花。

联　flake n. 薄片 vt. 使成薄片





sociable［'səʊ∫əbəl］

adj. 好交际的，友善的〈同　gregarious, friendly〉

例　Because Mary is sociable, she introduced herself to everyone at the party. 因为玛丽喜好交际，因此她在聚会上把自己介绍给所有人。

记　soci（同伴）+able→与同伴交往→好交际的

联　society n. 社会；socialism n. 社会主义；socialite n. 社会名流；extrovert n. 性格外向者；gregarious adj. 爱社交的；群居的

solder［'səʊldə(r); (US)'sɒdər］

vt. 焊接，焊在一起〈同　seam〉

例　The construction workers soldered the two metal poles together. 建筑工人们把两根金属杆焊接在一起。

联　soldier n. 军人，士兵

solicit［sə'lɪsɪt］

vt. 恳求，乞求〈同　plead for, beg〉

例　The volunteers went out to solicit funds for indigent families. 志愿者们为贫困家庭募集资金。

记　soli（=sole 唯一，全部）+cit（引出）→引出某人做事→恳求

联　solicitation n. 恳求，要求；solicitor n. 律师，法律顾问；solicitous adj. 热切的，挂念的；solitary adj. 孤独的；soliloquy n. 独白

soothe［su:ð］

vt. 使（某人情绪）平静，安慰；使（痛苦、疼痛）缓和或减轻〈同　quiet; alleviate〉

例　The medicine soothed the child's toothache. 那种药物缓解了那个小孩的牙疼。

联　soothing adj. 抚慰的，使人宽心的；appease vt. 平息，安抚；pacify vt. 抚慰；comfort vt. 安慰；relieve vt. 减轻

soundproof［'saʊndpru:f］

adj. 隔音的，防音的〈同　impermeable to noise, insulative〉

例　The band recorded the music for their album in a soundproof studio. 那个乐队在一个隔音的录音棚为他们的唱片录制音乐。

souvenir［ˌsu:və'nɪə(r); (US)'su:vənɪər］

n. 纪念品〈同　reminder, memento〉

例　The young couple bought a souvenir of their honeymoon in Florida. 那对年轻的夫妇在佛罗里达州度蜜月时买了一个纪念品。

记　分割记忆；sou（看做south，南方）+venir（来的东西）→从南方带回来的东西→纪念品

联　resservoir n. 水库，蓄水池

spaceship［'speɪs∫ɪp］

n. 宇宙飞船

例　Many people reported seeing an alien spaceship in the sky last night. 许多人称，昨天晚上看到天空中有一艘外星飞船。

联　spacecraft n. 宇宙飞船；space shuttle n.（往返于地球和太空站之间运载人和物资的）航天飞机

sparse［spɑ:s］

adj. 稀少的；稀疏的〈同　scarce, scattered〉

例　Information coming out of the disaster area is sparse. 来自受灾地区的信息非常少。

联　sparsely adv. 稀疏地，稀少地

spawn［spɔ:n］

v. ①产卵，大量生育〈同　generate, breed〉

例　The insects in the house spawned millions more in a couple of weeks. 那栋房子里的昆虫在几周之内又产下了数百万个卵。

②造成，酿成〈同　create〉

例　The new economic freedom has spawned hundreds of new small businesses. 新经济自由政策催生了数百家新兴的小型企业。

联　span n. 跨度，范围

第三部分

spear［spɪə(r)］

n. 矛，枪〈同　pike〉

例　The spear was a common weapon used by Native Americans to hunt animals. 矛是印第安人用来打猎的一种常用武器。

v.（用矛）刺；戳（洞）〈同　pierce, puncture〉

例　He speared the animal in the heart and it fell down dead instantly. 他用矛刺中了那只动物的心脏，于是它立即倒在地上死去了。

speck［spek］

n. 斑点〈同　particle, fleck〉

例　He wiped the specks that the rain had made on the car window. 他擦掉了雨水在车窗上留下的斑点。

联　flyspeck n. 蝇粪留下的污点，污点





speedy［'spi:di］

adj. 快的，迅速的〈同　fast, rapid〉

例　The pizza parlor promises a speedy delivery. 那家比萨饼店保证迅速送达。

spine［spaɪn］

n. 脊骨；书脊；刺〈同　backbone, vertebrate〉

例　An invertebrate is an animal with no spine. 无脊椎动物是指没有脊椎的动物。

联　spinal adj. 脊骨的，脊髓的；spinal cord 脊髓；spined adj. 有脊骨的，有脊柱的；spiny adj. 多刺的，刺状的；spinet n. 小型立式钢琴；spinach n. 菠菜

spit［spɪt］

v. 吐（唾沫），喷吐

例　Many people think it is impolite to spit in public. 许多人认为在公共场合吐痰是不礼貌的。

spite［spaɪt］

n. 恶意；怨恨〈同　malice; resentment〉

例　The rival teams carried spite for each other. 两支敌对的队伍对彼此充满了敌意。

联　in spite of 不顾，不管

sprawl［sprɔ:l］

vi. 散乱地延伸；四肢摊开着坐、卧或倒下〈同　extend, stretch〉

例　Janet's pet cat likes to sprawl out in front of the fireplace to sleep. 珍妮特的宠物猫喜欢懒散地趴在壁炉前睡觉。

n. 扩展，蔓延

例　Urban sprawl caused severe loss of arable lands. 城市扩张造成了耕地的严重减少。

联　scrawl v. 潦草地写；crawl v. 爬；extend v. 延伸；expand v. 扩大；spread v. 伸展；传播

sprinkle［'sprɪŋkl］

v. 洒，喷洒〈同　spray〉

例　She sprinkled her garden with water every morning. 她每天早上都给花园洒水。

n. 稀疏的小雨〈同　light rain, drizzle〉

例　The sprinkle of rain today helped cool down the summer heat. 今天少量的降雨帮助缓解了夏季的炎热。

sprout［spraʊt］

vi. 长出，萌芽〈同　germinate, shoot up〉

例　The plants sprouted from the ground a week after I planted seeds. 这些植物在我播种一周之后，从地里发出了芽。

联　spout v. 喷出；lout n. 粗人；pout v. 撅嘴，板脸；tout v. 极力赞扬；兜售

squarely［'skweə(r)li］

adv. 坚实地，坚固地〈同　solidly〉

例　The boxer punched him squarely on the face and he fell straight down. 那名拳击手直接猛击他的脸，结果他径直倒了下去。

20. The people ______ on the beach in their bathing suits.

21. The ostrich can't fly but it is a ______ bird.

22. After using the expensive hair treatment, the bald man imagined new hair had ______ on his head.

第四部分

squash［skwɒ∫］

n. 南瓜

例　Her mother prepared oven-baked squash for dinner. 她妈妈准备了烘焙的南瓜作为晚餐。

v. 压碎，挤压；镇压〈同　crush; depress〉

例　The dictator squashed all public demonstrations. 那个独裁者镇压了所有公共集会和示威。

squirt［skwɜ:t］

vi. 喷出，喷射〈同　spray, eject〉

例　She called a plumber when she saw water squirting out of the pipes. 她发现水喷出了管子，于是找来水管工修理。





stagecoach［'steɪʤkəʊtʃ］

n. 公共马车

例　The stagecoach was a common mode of transportation during the wild west. 在狂野西部时代，公共马车是一种常见的交通工具。

联　coach n. 教练；四轮大马车

stalk［stɔ:k］

vt. 隐伏跟踪（猎物）〈同　follow〉

例　The hunter carefully stalked the deer. 猎人小心跟踪那头鹿。

n. 茎，柄，梗〈同　stem〉

例　A flower or a leaf may have a stalk. 一朵花或一片叶子都会有梗。

联　stall n. 货摊；畜栏；stalwart adj. 坚定的；stack n.（一）堆；stale adj. 不新鲜的；陈腐的；Stalin 斯大林

stamina［'stæmɪnə］

n. 体力，耐力〈同　endurance, perseverance〉

例　I doubt that she has the stamina to run the full distance of the marathon. 我怀疑她是否有体力跑完马拉松全程。

联　staminal adj. 精力的；stammer v. 口吃，结巴

standing［'stændɪŋ］

adj. 固定的，常设的〈同　fixed〉

例　The standing timber was not cut for environmental reasons. 出于环保原因，没有砍伐活立木。

n. 身份，名望〈同　status, fame〉

例　The intelligent student's standing in the class was ranked as number one. 那名聪明的学生在班里排名第一。

联　long-standing adj. 长期存在的；outstanding adj. 杰出的，显著的

stanza［'stænzə］

n.（诗的）节，段

例　Stanzas and lines are used to measure poems. 诗节和诗行用来为诗歌定界。

staple［'steɪpəl］

n. 主要产品，日常必需品〈同　basic part, basic elements〉

例　Shortages mean that even staples like bread are difficult to find. 短缺意味着即使面包等主食都很难找到。

adj. 主要的，常用的〈同　main, principal〉

例　Rice is a staple Chinese food. 大米是中国的一种主要食品。

starch［stɑ:tʃ］

n. 淀粉；淀粉食物

例　Rice and wheat are a good source of starch. 大米和小麦是很好的淀粉来源。

stardom［'stɑ:dəm］

n. 明星的身份或地位〈同　fame, notoriety〉

例　There are many actors in Hollywood who are dying for a chance at stardom. 好莱坞有许多演员渴望成名的机会。

Lesson 27





音频



预备测验

找出与句子中划线单词意义最相近的词。

1. Because gymnasts exercise regularly, they have supple bodies.

(A) aching

(B) humble

(C) limber

2. There are fossil remains of dinosaurs in the rocky strata of every continent.

(A) layers

(B) areas

(C) peaks

3. True cedars, members of the pine family, are stately trees one hundred-twenty to one hundred-fifty feet tall.

(A) great

(B) evergreen

(C) majestic

4. Inuits（因纽特人）depend mainly on fishing and hunting for their sustenance.

(A) training

(B) luxuries

(C) livelihood

5. Disease and rust stunt a plant's growth and lead to the destruction of the plant.

(A) enhance

(B) moderate

(C) hinder



第一部分

stark［stɑ:k］

adj. 光秃秃的；荒凉的〈同　bare, desolate〉

例　The walls look so stark and dreary, we decided to cover them with prints and posters. 那些墙壁看起来光秃秃的，死气沉沉，所以我们决定在上面挂上图片和海报。

记　联想记忆：和start（开始）一起记

联　spark n. 火花；lark v. 戏耍 n. 百灵鸟；bark n. 树皮 vi. 狗吠；stiff adj. 硬 的，僵直的；supple adj. 柔软的，柔韧的

stash［stæ∫］

vt. 藏；存放

例　Instead of putting money into new plants and machinery, the businessmen had stashed their earnings abroad. 商人们没有把钱投到新工厂和机械设备上，而是把他们的收入藏到海外。

stately［'steɪtli］

adj. 庄严的，堂皇的〈同　dignified, majestic〉

例　The president gave a stately welcome to the foreign prime minister. 总统隆重欢迎外国总理。

stature［'stætʃə(r)］

n. 身高，身材；声望，地位〈同　height; status〉

例　A tall stature is usually a requisite to become a professional basketball player. 高个子通常是成为一名职业篮球运动员的必要条件。





steadfast［'stedfɑ:st］

adj. 坚定的，坚信的〈同　constant; resolute〉

例　To be steadfast is to be like a rock. 要做到坚定不移，就要像石头一样。

记　stead（=stand 站）+fast→站得稳的→坚定的

联　steady adj. 稳固的；staunch adj. 坚定的

stellar［'stelə(r)］

adj. 星的，星球的〈同　of the stars〉

例　The actress gave a stellar performance in the play and received many bouquets. 那名女演员在剧中做出了精彩的表演，获得了许多赞扬。

联　interstellar adj. 星际的

sterile［'steraɪl; (US)'sterəl］

adj. ①贫瘠的；不育的〈同　barren, infertile〉

例　The sterile couple decided to adopt a baby. 那对无法生育的夫妇决定收养一个孩子。

②消过毒的

例　The doctor only used sterile needles to avoid infecting people with unwanted diseases. 为了防止患者感染有害的疾病，医生只会使用无菌注射器。

联　sterilize vt. 消毒，使无菌；sterilizer n. 杀菌者，杀虫剂；stereo n. 立体声系统，立体声 adj. 立体的；fertile adj. 肥沃的；infertile adj. 贫瘠的，不毛的；barren adj. 不孕的；贫瘠的

stifle［'staɪfəl］

vt. ①使窒息〈同　suffocate, smother〉

例　They were stifled by the smoke. 他们被烟给呛死了。

②扼杀，抑制〈同　suppress, repress〉

例　The police were alerted about the criminal and stifled his plans. 警方察觉了罪犯的犯罪意图，于是扼杀了他的阴谋。

联　muffle v. 裹住 n. 围裹，蒙住；trifle n. 琐事 v. 虚度（光阴）；smother v.（使）窒息，闷死

stipend［'staɪpend］

n. 薪水；奖学金；养老金〈同　allowance; pension〉

例　The university offered the best students a monthly stipend. 大学为最优秀的学生每月发放奖学金。

记　stip（点）+end（结束）→结束那一点工作，领到报酬→薪水

联　stipe n. 柄，叶柄；stipendiary n. 领薪金者

stipulate［'stɪpjʊleɪt］

vt. 约定，规定〈同　detail, specify〉

例　If the contract was framed by a good lawyer, it will stipulate exactly when, where, and how payment is to be made. 如果合同是由一名出色的律师草拟的，里面会明确规定付款的时间、地点和方式。

记　stip（点）+ulate→点明→规定

联　stipulation n. 规定，条款；stipulator n. 订契约的人；stipple n./v. 点画

自我检测　从第一部分中选出最适当的词填入空格内。

6. The astronaut had always been fascinated by the ______ sky.

7. The thief ______ the stolen money in a safe place.

8. The contract ______ that any dispute that could not be resolved would be brought to court.

9. The needle is ______, so you should be safe.

10. They moved into a ______ apartment, but within a week, it was completely decorated.

11. The people felt ______ by the government's harsh rules.



第二部分

stocky［'stɒki］

adj.（人或动物）矮而结实的，粗壮的〈同　strong, stout〉

例　The stocky construction worker lifted the lumber with ease. 那名健壮的建筑工人轻松地搬起了那块木材。

记　stock（树桩）+y→像树桩一样→粗壮的

联　stock n. 树干；库存；股票 v. 存货；stockyard n. 围栏；stodgy adj.（食物）油腻的；枯燥乏味的；stoke v. 添加燃料于炉火中；sticky adj. 黏的





stout［staʊt］

adj. 结实的，勇敢坚定的〈同　stocky, sturdy〉

例　The stout man liked to eat. 那个肥胖的人就喜欢吃。

strand［strænd］

n.（绳、线之）一股〈同　thread〉

例　The strands of thread were twisted together to make rope. 几股线被拧在一起做成一根绳子。

strata［'strɑ:tə］

n. 地层〈同　layer〉

例　The different strata of the Earth tell a history of their own. 地球的不同地层各自代表了一段历史。

联　stratum n. 地层（单数）；阶层

strenuous［'strenjʊəs］

adj. 费力的；艰辛的〈同　arduous, laborious〉

例　After a strenuous day of work, Bill slept for 12 hours. 一天的紧张工作之后，比尔睡了12个小时。

记　stren（=strength 力量）+uous→用力量的→费力的

联　tenuous adj. 纤细的；sinuous adj. 蜿蜒的，迂回的；strain n. 过度的疲劳，紧张 v. 拉紧；尽力；arduous adj. 费力的；vigorous adj. 精力旺盛的

stringent［'strɪnʤənt］

adj. 严厉的〈同　strict, rigorous〉

例　I think these regulations are too stringent. 我认为这些规定太严格了。

记　来自名词string（线，绳）+ent→像用绳限制住似的→严厉的

联　stringency n. 严格；紧迫；astringent adj. 收缩的；string n. 线，细绳；stringy adj. 有筋的，多纤维的；contingent adj. 意外的；视情况而定的；tangent n. 切线

stuffy［'stʌfi］

adj. 不通风的，闷气的〈同　suffocating〉

例　The elevator in the office building is always stuffy when people are crowded into it. 人们挤进办公大楼的电梯，使得电梯里总是闷热不堪。

记　来自动词stuff（填满）+y→填满的→不通风的

联　stuff n. 物质；原料 v. 填满，填充；stuffing n. 填塞料；fluffy adj. 有绒毛的，蓬松的；huffy adj. 愤怒的；ventilated adj. 通风的

stunning［'stʌnɪŋ］

adj. 让人惊叹的，极好的〈同　brilliant, astonishing〉

例　When we reached the mountain peak, we saw a stunning view of the sunset. 我们到达山顶后，看到了美丽的落日景观。

联　stun vt. 使晕倒，打晕；使震惊

stunt［stʌnt］

n. 惊人表演，绝技；特技〈同　feat〉

例　The stunt is so reckless that someone will surely get hurt. 这种特技太鲁莽了，肯定会有人受伤的。

vt. 阻碍…发育，妨碍…生长〈同　hinder, bar〉

例　This tree is not as large as the others; something must have stunted its growth. 这棵树没有其他树长得那么高大；肯定有什么原因妨碍了它的成长。

联　stuntman n. 特技演员；stunning adj. 漂亮的；stint v. 限制，节制

subside［səb'saɪd］

vi. 平息，减退〈同　die down, appease〉

例　The waves subsided when the winds ceased to blow. 风停了之后，海浪也渐渐平息。

记　sub（下面）+side（坐）→坐下去→平息

联　subsidence n. 下沉；subsidy n. 补助金，津贴

12. The students' anxiety about the test ______ when they were told it was canceled.

13. The 10-mile run was a bit too ______ for the first day of physical exercise.

14. The dress is simple and elegant, but you could vamp it up（翻新）for evening wear with some ______ jewelry.

15. It was difficult to knock out Mike Tyson because he was so ______.

第三部分

subsist［səb'sɪst］

vi. 活下去；生存〈同　exist, live〉

例　The poor farmer's family subsists on potatoes. 那个贫穷的农民家庭吃土豆果腹。

联　subsistence n. 生存，生活；subsidy n. 补助金，津贴；subsidize vt. 资助，发给…津贴；existence n. 存在；consistence n. 一致性

substantiate［səb'stæn∫ɪeɪt］

vt. 证实，加强〈同　authenticate, prove〉

例　The new evidence substantiated the defendant's guilt. 新的证据证明被告有罪。

记　substant（事实，物质）+iate→用事实来证明→证实

联　unsubstantiated adj. 未被证实的；substance n. 物质；substantial adj. 坚固的；实质的；substitute n. 代用品，替代品；substitutable adj. 可代替的，可取代的

substantive［'sʌbstəntɪv］

adj. 真实的，有实质的〈同　substantial〉

例　Although the delegates were aware of the importance of the problem, they just could not agree on the substantive issues. 虽然代表们意识到了问题的重要性，但他们就是无法就实质性问题达成一致。

联　substantiate vt. 证明，证实；substantial adj. 坚固的；实质的；可观的

subterranean［ˌsʌbtə'reɪnɪən］

adj. 地下的，地表下的〈同　underground, subsurface〉

例　Hitler committed suicide in his subterranean chamber when the Red Army stormed Berlin.（苏联）红军攻克柏林的时候，希特勒在他的地下室里自杀了。

记　sub（下面）+terr（地）+anean→地下的

联　terrain n. 地形，地势；terrace n. 梯田；terrestrial n. 陆地；territorial adj. 领土的；subsurface adj. 表面下的，地下的

subversive［səb'vɜ:sɪv］

adj. 颠覆性的，破坏性的〈同　undermining, destructive〉

例　Although the general backed the president, he had the subversive intention of usurping his power. 虽然将军支持总统，但他怀着篡夺总统权力的破坏性意图。

记　来自动词subvert（颠覆，推翻；sub［下面］+vert［转］→在下面转→推翻）+sive→颠覆性的

联　avert vt. 避开；convert v.（使）转变；（使）改变信仰；divert v.（使）转向；invert v. 翻转；pervert vt. 使变坏；误用；submissive adj. 顺从的

succinct［sək'sɪŋkt］

adj. 简明的，简洁的〈同　concise, laconic〉

例　Her succinct letter was one page long and stayed on one topic. 她简洁的来信只有一张纸，一直在谈论一个话题。

记　suc（下面）+cinct（=gird 束起）→原指把下面的衣服束起来以利于干活→简明的

联　succinctly adv. 简洁地，简便地；succulent adj. 多汁的

succumb［sə'kʌm］

vi. 屈服，屈从〈同　yield, surrender〉

例　Besieged by debts, the corporation finally had to succumb to bankruptcy. 那家债务缠身的公司最终不得不屈服，被迫破产。

记　suc（下面）+cumb（躺）→躺到下面去→屈服

联　recumbent adj. 斜躺的；incumbent n. 任职者；incumbency n. 任期；encumber vt. 阻碍

sumptuous［'sʌmptjʊəs］

adj. 奢侈的，华丽的〈同　luxurious, magnificent〉

例　The 10-course dinner that the master chef prepared last night was absolutely sumptuous. 昨天晚上，主厨准备的有十道菜的晚餐实在太奢侈了。

记　sumpt（拿，取）+uous→（把钱）拿出去→奢侈的

联　consumption n. 消费；consumptive adj. 消费的，消耗性的；sumptuary adj. 节省费用的；presumptuous adj. 专横的，傲慢的；sump n. 污水坑，水坑；bumptious adj. 自负的，傲慢的

sunlight［'sʌnlaɪt］

n. 日光，阳光

例　Plants need sunlight to live and grow. 植物需要阳光才能生存和生长。

联　sunlit adj. 被日光（阳光）照射了的；sunshine n. 阳光；sunflower n.【植】向日葵；sunrise n. 日出；sunset n. 日落，晚年；sunburn n. 晒斑，晒黑；sundial n.（通过太阳知道时间的）日规，日晷；sunglasses n. 太阳镜





superfluous［ˌsju:'pɜ:flʊəs］

adj. 多余的〈同　unnecessary, excess〉

例　After I was full, the extra food she offered was superfluous. 我吃饱了之后，她额外上的那些食物便多余了。

记　super（超过）+flu（流）+ous→流得过多→多余的

联　superfluity n. 多余，额外；supercilious adj. 自大的，傲慢的；mellifluous adj. 优美流畅的；affluent adj. 富裕的；confluent adj. 汇流的

18. The laboratory results gave a ______ basis to the scientist's theory.

19. After years of courtship, she finally ______ to his request for marriage.

20. When writing, avoid using ______ words.

21. The political group planted bombs in the White House, destroyed the Pentagon's computer files and engaged in various other ______ activities.

22. The beggar ______ on people's goodwill alone.

23. In a murder case, fingerprints are ______ evidence.



第四部分

superintendent［ˌsju:pərɪn'tendənt］

n. 主管，负责人〈同　director, supervisor〉

例　The superintendent interviewed applicants for the teaching job. 那名负责人面试了申请教师岗位的求职者。

记　super（在…上面）+intend（关心）+ent→在上面关心的人→主管

联　superintend v. 监督，管理；supervisor n. 主管人；supermarket n. 超级市场

supernatural［ˌsju:pə'nætʃərəl］

adj. 超自然的，神奇的

例　Many people believe supernatural things like ghosts exist solely in movies. 许多人认为，鬼魂等超自然的东西只存在于电影里。

supplant［sə'plɑ:nt］

vt. 排挤；取代〈同　replace, substitute〉

例　E-mail has supplanted mailing letters. 电子邮件已经取代了邮寄信件。

记　sup（下面）+plant（种植）→在下面种植→取代

联　suppliant adj. 恳求的 n. 恳求者；supple adj. 柔软的 v.（使）变柔软；supplement n. 补充

supple［'sʌpl］

adj. 柔软的，灵活的；柔顺的〈同　limber; pliant〉

例　He cut down the supple tree to make a bow for hunting. 他砍倒那棵柔韧的树，来制作打猎用的弓。

记　可能是supplicate（恳求，求饶）的变体

联　supplement n./vt. 增补，补充；supply v. 供应；scruple n. 顾忌，顾虑；topple v.（使）倒塌；stipple v. 点画，点刻

surcharge［'sɜ:tʃɑ:ʤ］

n. 增付的费用，附加费

例　The restaurant added a 15% surcharge for groups of guests larger than ten. 酒店对超过十人的团体客人额外收取15%的附加费。

surmount［sə'maʊnt］

vt. 克服；登上；越过〈同　overcome; climb〉

例　The fact that Abraham Lincoln was able to surmount the handicap of limited education does not mean that everyone should quit school. 亚伯拉罕·林肯能够克服受教育不足的障碍，并不意味着所有人都应该辍学。

记　sur（超过）+mount（登上）→登上；克服

联　insurmountable adj. 难克服的；mount n. 山丘 v. 爬上；amount n. 总数 vt.（to）总计，等于；surmise n./v. 猜度；surpass vt. 超越，胜过；surplus n. 剩余，过剩

sustenance［'sʌstɪnəns］

n. 食物，生计〈同　food; livelihood〉

例　In the tropics, the natives find sustenance easy to obtain, due to all the fruit trees. 在热带地区，因为到处都是果树，当地人发现很容易便能获得食物。

记　sus（在…下面）+ten（拿住）+ance→在下面支持的东西→食物

联　sustain vt. 支撑，承受；sustention n. 支撑，维持

syllable［'sɪləbəl］

n. 音节

例　“Hello”is a two-syllable word. Hello是一个双音节词。

symbiosis［ˌsɪmbaɪ'əʊsɪs; ˌsɪmbɪ-］

n. 共生（关系），共栖

例　Coral reefs owe their brilliant colors to algae that live in symbiosis with coral polyps. 珊瑚礁绚丽的色彩归因于与珊瑚共生的藻类。

联　symbiotic adj. 共栖的，共生的

symbolize［'sɪmbəlaɪz］

v. 象征〈同　represent; signify〉

例　The eagle symbolizes strength and freedom for Americans. 鹰代表着美国人的力量与自由。

联　symbol n. 符号，记号；象征

音频



预备测验

找出与句子中划线单词意义最相近的词。

1. This is my third time to be tardy this year.

(A) bland

(B) late

(C) effective

2. By their nature, fish and aquatic invertebrates are more intimately bound to their environment than are terrestrial animals.

(A) airborne

(B) tree-dwelling

(C) land

3. The main features of the telegraph were developed by two inventors, but it was Samuel Morse who successfully synthesized their ideas.

(A) financed

(B) publicized

(C) integrated

4. When the glaciers thawed after the last ice age, the five Great Lakes of North America were formed.

(A) advanced

(B) evaporated

(C) melted

5. The moist air of the Pacific Ocean brings a temperate climate to the West Coast of the United States.

(A) chilly

(B) moderate

(C) wet



第一部分

symmetrical［sɪ'metrɪkəl］

adj. 对称的〈同　proportionally balanced, even〉

例　Human bodies are not bilaterally symmetrical since they have a spleen on only one side. 人体并非左右对称的，由于人只在单侧有一个脾脏。

记　来自名词symmetry（对称；sym［共同］+metry［测量］→两边的测量数据相同→对称）+cal→对称的

联　symmetry n. 对称；asymmetric adj. 不对称的；metric adj. 公制的；lopsided adj. 倾向一方的，不平衡的

synonym［'sɪnənɪm］

n. 同义词

例　He sought a synonym to help explain the word's meaning. 他找到了一个同义词，帮助解释那个单词的意思。

联　synonymous adj. 同义的

synthesize［'sɪnθəsaɪz］

vt. 综合；合成〈同　integrate, combine〉

例　Mary synthesized her report from interviews with dozens of people. 玛丽通过采访数十人，整合出她的报道。

记　syn（共同）+thesize（=thesis 放）→放在一起→合成

联　synthetic adj. 合成的，人造的；synthesizer n.【电子】合成器；synthesis n. 综合，合成；photosynthesis n. 光合作用；combine v.（使）联合，（使）结合；merge v. 合并，并入；integrate v.（使）成整体，（使）一体化

syrup［'sɪrəp］

n. 糖浆，果汁

例　Americans usually add syrup to the top of their pancakes. 美国人通常在薄烤饼上涂上糖浆。

tableland［'teɪbəllænd］

n. 高原〈同　plateau〉

例　You can get a panoramic view of the city from the tableland. 从高地可以俯瞰整个城市的全景。

taboo［tə'bu:］

n./adj. 禁忌（的），忌讳（的）〈同　prohibited, ban〉

例　A taboo is something that people do not usually or openly talk about. 禁忌是人们通常不会谈论或公开谈论的东西。

联　bamboo n. 竹

tactile［'tæktaɪl; (US)-təl］

adj. 触觉的；可触觉的〈同　tangible, perceptible〉

例　His calloused hands had lost their tactile sensitivity. 他双手长满了老茧，对触觉不敏感了。

联　tactless adj. 不老练的

tag［tæg］

vt. 给…加标签；添加，附加〈同　attach, append〉

例　The cashier tagged a surcharge onto the bill. 出纳在账单上添上了一笔附加费。

n. 标签，货签〈同　label〉

例　The tag on the shirt says it costs 20 dollars. 衬衫的标签上写着其价格是20美元。





taint［teɪnt］

n. 污点〈同　stain, blot〉

例　The one incident was a permanent taint on his reputation. 那件事是他名誉上永久的污点。

vt. 污染；玷污〈同　contaminate; blemish〉

例　The water was tainted with waste from the factory. 水被工厂排放的废物污染了。

记　tain（拿住；弄脏）+t→污染

联　stain v. 玷污，染色；tainted adj. 感染的；taintless adj. 无污点的；attaint n. 污点 vt. 玷污

talkative［'tɔ:kətɪv］

adj. 多话的〈同　garrulous, loquacious〉

例　He was very shy as a boy, but became more talkative as he got older. 他小的时候非常腼腆，但长大后变得健谈多了。

记　来自动词talk（说话）+ative→多话的

联　garrulous adj. 饶舌的，多嘴的；loquacious adj. 多话的；glib adj. 油嘴滑舌的；volubleadj. 健谈的，饶舌的；taciturn adj. 沉默寡言的

6. He wrote his name on the luggage ______ and put it on his suitcase.

7. Her remarks were ______ with prejudice.

8. The ______ man was continuously interrupting everyone else.

9. She likes to eat ice cream topped with nuts and chocolate ______.

10. A circle is perfectly ______.

11. Please use a thesaurus, not an encyclopedia to look for ______.



第二部分

tally［'tæli］

v.（使）符合〈同　agree, correspond〉

例　The two statements do not tally at all. 这两份声明根本不一致。

n. 记录；记账〈同　count〉

例　The final tally of the votes indicated that the incumbent won. 选举的最终票数显示，现任者获得选举的胜利。

记　分割记忆：tall（高）+ally（联盟）→高级联盟→符合

联　dally v. 玩弄；rally v. 集合；恢复；ally v.（使）结盟 n. 同盟国；sally n./vi. 突击；tarry v. 等待

tardy［'tɑ:di］

adj. 迟到的；缓慢的〈同　late; slow〉

例　He was tardy for the meeting and ran all the way there. 他开会迟到了，一路跑到那里。

联　tardiness n. 迟到；缓慢

tarnish［'tɑ:nɪ∫］

n. 晦暗，污点〈同　discoloration〉

例　The tarnish on her silverware was difficult to remove. 她银器上的污点很难清除。

vt. 使失去光泽；玷污〈同　darken; stain〉

例　The accident tarnished John's driving record. 那次事故破坏了约翰良好的驾驶记录。

记　tarn（隐藏）+ish→隐藏光泽→使失去光泽

联　tannish adj. 浅棕色的，淡褐色的

tavern［'tævən］

n. 小酒店；客栈〈同　bar〉

例　The teammates met at the tavern for a drink after the game. 比赛结束后，队员们聚在酒馆里喝酒。

tectonics［tek'tɒnɪks］

n.【地】构造学

例　Tectonics is the scientific study of the deformation of the rocks that make up the Earth's crust and the forces that produce such deformation. 构造地质学是关于构成地壳的岩石的变化以及造成这种变化的力的科学研究。

tedium［'ti:dɪəm］

n. 单调乏味〈同　drudgery, boredom〉

例　We hope this radio will help overcome the tedium of your stay in the hospital. 我们希望这台收音机能够帮助你消除住院期间的无聊。

联　tedious adj. 单调乏味的，沉闷的

temperate［'tempərɪt］

adj. ①（气候等）温和的〈同　moderate, gentle〉

例　The United States is mostly in the North Temperate Zone. 美国大部分都处在北温带。

②（欲望、饮食等）适度的，有节制的〈同　moderate, self-restrained〉

例　Noted for his temperate appetite, he seldom gains weight. 他以适度饮食而出名，体重很少会增加。

记　temper（脾气）+ate→脾气（不坏）→有节制的

联　intemperate adj. 不加节制的；temperance n. 节制，自制；戒酒，禁酒；temperature n. 温度；temper n. 脾气，性情；tempera n. 蛋彩画；tempest n. 暴风雨；moderate adj. 适度的，适中的

tenement［'tenəmənt］

n.（穷人）公寓〈同　apartment〉

例　The government was trying to renovate the shabby tenement for the poor. 政府正努力对贫困者的破旧房屋进行翻修。

tentacle［'tentəkəl］

n. 触角，触须，触手

例　The tentacles of the giant octopus capsized the ship. 巨型章鱼的触手弄翻了那条船。





terminology［ˌtɜ:mɪ'nɒləʤi］

n. 用辞，术语〈同　terms, vocabulary〉

例　He cannot understand the terminology in the machine's manual. 他无法理解设备使用手册中的术语。

记　term（术语）+inology→术语

联　terminological adj. 术语的；terminal adj. 终结的 n. 终端；terminus n. 终点

第三部分

terminus［'tɜ:mɪnəs］

n.（火车、 汽车的）终点站〈同　last station, terminal〉

例　After we reached the railroad terminus, we continued our journey into the wilderness on horseback. 抵达火车的终点站后，我们继续骑马深入荒野。

termite［'tɜ:maɪt］

n. 白蚁

例　Termites are insects that feed on wood. 白蚁是以木头为食的昆虫。

terrestrial［tɪ'restrɪəl］

adj. 地球（上）的；陆地的〈同　terraneous〉

例　Humans are an example of terrestrial animals. 人类是陆栖动物的一个例子。

thaw［θɔ:］

n. 解冻

例　After the winter there is a thaw when the snow melts away. 冬天结束后有一个解冻期，雪开始融化。

v.（使）解冻，（使）融化〈同　melt, defrost〉

例　The frozen fish thawed when I placed it in the warm water. 我把冷冻的鱼放到温水里后，它便开始解冻。

thigh［θaɪ］

n. 大腿

例　The soccer player had strong thighs from all his exercise. 经过训练，那名足球运动员的大腿变得非常强壮。

thrifty［'θrɪfti］

adj. 节省的，节俭的〈同　economical, frugal〉

例　A thrifty shopper compares prices before making major purchases. 节俭的购物者在进行大规模采购之前，会进行比价。

thunderstorm［'θʌndəstɔ:m］

n. 雷雨

例　The thunderstorm this morning made the sky turn black. 今天上午的雷雨让天空变得一片漆黑。





tint［tɪnt］

vt. 给…着色；微染〈同　dye, color〉

例　He tinted his car windows in order to block out the sunlight. 为了遮挡阳光，他给汽车窗户染了色。

n. 色彩〈同　tinge, color〉

例　The wallpaper has a slight yellow tint. 壁纸有一种轻微的黄色调。

topography［tə'pɒgrəfi］

n. 地形，地形学

例　Before the generals gave the order to attack, they made a complete study of the topography of the region. 将军们下达攻击的命令之前，他们对该地区的地形进行了全面研究。

联　topographical adj. 地形学的

topsoil［'tɒpsɔɪl］

n. 表层土

例　The topsoil should be fertilized so plants can grow well. 应该对表层土施肥，植物才能长得更好。

第四部分

torch［tɔ:tʃ］

n. 火把；火炬

例　The men used a torch to see where they were walking inside the cave. 人们燃起火把来看清楚他们在山洞里所走的路线。





tornado［tɔ:'neɪdəʊ］

n. 旋风，龙卷风〈同　cyclone, windstorm〉

例　Hurricanes often make tornadoes. 飓风通常会形成龙卷风。

联　hurricane n. 飓风；cyclone n. 旋风，龙卷风

torpor［'tɔ:pə(r)］

n. 迟钝，不活泼〈同　lethargy, inertia〉

例　In mid-winter, bears enter the deep torpor of true hibernation. 在隆冬时节，熊会进入真正的冬眠的深度蛰伏期。

联　torporific adj. 引起麻痹的，导致迟钝的；stupor n. 昏迷

torrent［'tɒrənt; (US)'tɔ:r-］

n. ①连发，迸发〈同　outburst〉

例　After trying to defraud the public, Lefty was faced with a torrent of charges. 莱弗提试图欺骗公众，后来他面临大量指控。

②骤雨；急流，洪流〈同　downpour; flood〉

例　Heavy rain was coming down in a torrent. 暴雨倾盆而下。

联　torrential adj. 奔流的；torrential rain 豪雨，大雨

tortuous［'tɔ:tjʊəs］

adj. 曲折的，转弯抹角的〈同　sinuous, twisting〉

例　Because this road is so tortuous, it is unwise to go faster than twenty miles an hour on it. 这条路迂回曲折，在上面以超过每小时20英里的速度行驶是不明智的。

touching［'tʌtʃɪŋ］

adj. 动人的，令人感伤的〈同　moving, affecting〉

例　The touching movie made me cry. 那部感人的电影让我流泪。

记　来自动词touch（感动）+ing→动人的

联　touchy adj. 暴躁的，易怒的；touched adj. 被感动的；touchdown n. 着地，降落；touchstone n. 试金石，标准；affecting adj. 感人的；moving adj. 感人的；pathetic adj. 令人同情的

tournament［'tʊənəmənt］

n. 比赛，锦标赛〈同　contest, competition〉

例　The World Cup is a month-long soccer tournament with teams from a number of countries participating. 世界杯是为期一个月的足球比赛，有来自多个国家的队伍参加。

联　tour n./v. 旅游；tourist n. 旅行者；tourism n. 游览；tornado n. 龙卷风

towering［'taʊərɪŋ］

adj. 高耸的；杰出的〈同　lofty; outstanding〉

例　They had to look up to talk to the towering giant. 他们得抬起头来，才能跟那个高大的巨人说话。

toxic［'tɒksɪk］

adj. 有毒的，中毒的〈同　poisonous, noxious〉

例　The primary advantage of plants grown without insecticides is that they have no toxic residues to endanger humans or pets. 不使用杀虫剂种植的植物，其主要优势是不含对人类或宠物有害的有毒残留物。

记　tox（毒）+ic→有毒的

联　toxin n. 毒素；nontoxic adj. 无毒的；toxication n. 中毒；intoxicate vt. 使陶醉；detoxify v.（使）解毒；tonic adj. 滋补的 n. 滋补品；virulent adj. 剧毒的；恶毒的

tramp［træmp］

v. 跋涉；踏，践踏〈同　trudge〉

例　He tramped down the mountain on the way home. 他徒步走下山回家。

n. 沉重的脚步（声）；长途步行〈同　excursion〉

例　She's out on a tramp through the forest. 她要进行一次穿越森林的徒步旅行。

Lesson 29





音频



预备测验

找出与句子中划线单词意义最相近的词。

1. A number of different types of underwater craft were developed during the eighteenth century.

(A) pumps

(B) submarines

(C) flotation devices

2. Fine freshwater pearls are found in the main stream and the tributaries of the Mississippi River.

(A) banks

(B) deltas

(C) branches

3. Grandma Moses, a popular painter, spent her life in a tranquil little farming community.

(A) a lovely

(B) a serene

(C) an isolated

4. Last week's fire underscores the necessity of observing safety rules.

(A) decreases

(B) emphasizes

(C) indicates

5. Every year each household in the United States discards approximately a ton of trash.

(A) filler

(B) garbage

(C) paper



第一部分

trample［'træmpəl］

v. 踩踏；蹂躏〈同　step on; tramp〉

例　The horses trampled the flowers. 马踩踏了那些花。

记　来自动词tramp（踩踏）+le→踩踏

联　tread v. 踏，踩碎；践踏；ample adj. 充足的，丰富的；amble vi.（马）缓行；从容漫步；rumple v. 弄皱；crumple v. 弄皱，压皱；崩溃





tranquil［'træŋkwɪl］

adj. 宁静的，安静的〈同　serene, pacific〉

例　It is not easy to remain tranquil when events suddenly change your life. 如果有事情突然改变了你的生活，这时要保持平静是很难的。

记　tran（=trans 穿过，越）+quil（静心）→宁静的

联　tranquility n. 宁静；tranquilize v. 使平静；平静下来

transcend［træn'send］

vt. 超出，超越〈同　surpass, exceed〉

例　The speed of airplanes transcends that of any previous form of transportation. 飞机的速度超过了之前的任何交通方式。

联　transcendent adj. 卓越的，出众的；【宗】（神）超然的；transcendence n. 卓越，出类拔萃；transgress v. 越界，违法；transect v. 横切，横断；transact v. 办理，交易

translucent［træns'lu:sənt］

adj. 半透明的；透明的

例　We could not recognize the people in the next room because of the translucent curtains which separated us. 我们认不出隔壁房间的人，因为半透明的窗帘把我们隔开了。

记　trans（穿过）+luc（明亮）+ent→光线能穿过→半透明的

联　transparent adj. 透明的；lucent adj. 明亮的；透明的；lucid adj. 明晰的；清醒的；pellucid adj. 透明的，清澈的；diaphanous adj.（布）半透明的；精致的

transmute［træns'mju:t］

v.（使）变化，（使）改变〈同　convert, transform〉

例　The worm was transmuted into a butterfly. 那只虫子蜕变成了一只蝴蝶。

trash［træ∫］

n. 垃圾，废物〈同　garbage, rubbish〉

例　Her household chore was to empty the trash every day. 她的家务事就是每天倒垃圾。

treacherous［'tretʃərəs］

adj. ①背叛的，背信弃义的，不忠的〈同　disloyal, traitorous〉

例　The king was betrayed by the treacherous soldier. 国王被那个不忠的士兵背叛了。

②不可靠的；暗藏危险的〈同　dangerous, risky〉

例　Be careful driving home because the road is quite treacherous when it is icy. 开车回家要小心，因为路面结冰之后很危险。

记　来自名词treachery（阴险，背叛；treach［=trick 诡计］+ery→使用诡计→背叛）+ous→背叛的

联　treachery n. 背叛，变节；treasure n. 财宝，财富；insidious adj. 阴险的，暗中为害的；perfidious adj. 背信弃义的

tread［tred］

v. 踏，践踏；行走（on）〈同　trample; step on〉

例　The children were amused by the acrobat who treaded the tight rope. 孩子们被那名走钢索的杂技演员逗乐了。

联　treadmill n. 踏车

treason［'tri:zən］

n. 叛逆罪，叛国罪〈同　betrayal, perfidy〉

例　The traitor was charged with treason. 那名叛徒被控叛国罪。

trespass［'trespəs］

v. 侵犯，闯入私人领地〈同　encroach, invade〉

例　She seems to be an easygoing person, but anyone who attempts to trespass her rights will soon find that she knows how to take care of herself. 她看起来是一个很随和的人，但如果有人试图侵犯她的权利，那个人很快就会发现，她很清楚如何维护自己的权利。

联　trespasser n. 侵犯（他人土地）者

自我检测　从第一部分中选出最适当的词填入空格内。

6. The hike along the mountain edge was more ______ than anybody had imagined.

7. The children ______ on private property out of curiosity and ran away at the sound of gunfire.

8. Quartz may be ______, transparent, or opaque, and it may be colorless or colored.

9. The herd of wild cattle _______ the farmer's crops.

10. Don't ______ on the new grass.

11. The project hopes to _______ the energy from the waterfall into electricity.



第二部分

tributary［'trɪbjʊtəri; (US)-teri］

adj. 辅助的，支流的

例　Some of the first settlers of America refused to be considered part of a tributary colony of England and fought for their freedom. 美洲第一批移民中，有些人拒绝被视为英国的附属殖民地的一部分，并为了自由而进行了抗争。

n. 支流〈同　branch〉

例　The Ohio River is a tributary of the Mississippi River. 俄亥俄河是密西西比河的支流。

trickle［'trɪkəl］

vi. 滴；流出〈同　dribble, drip〉

例　Blood trickled down her face. 血顺着她的脸往下滴。

trilogy［'trɪləʤi］

n. 三部剧，三部曲〈同　three-part novel〉

例　The Star Wars trilogy has become a classic story. 《星球大战》三部曲已经成为经典故事。

troupe［tru:p］

n. 剧团；群，队

例　The troupe of actors will present six different plays during the season. 在演出季，这群演员将带来六部不同的剧目。

记　来自名词troop（部队）

联　group n. 团体

trustworthy［'trʌstwɜ:ði］

adj. 可信赖的〈同　dependable, reliable〉

例　The boss could always tell his secrets to his trustworthy assistant. 老板经常把他的秘密告诉自己信任的助理。

记　组合词：trust（信赖）+worthy（值得的）→可信赖的

联　trustful adj. 信任他人的；distrust vt. 不信任；entrust vt. 委托；trustee n. 托管人；trusty adj. 可信赖的；tryst n. 约会，幽会

turnpike［'tɜ:npaɪk］

n. 公路，收费高速公路〈同　toll highway〉

例　You should be sure you have money to pay for the tolls if you take the turnpike. 如果你选择走收费高速公路，你得确保自己有足够的钱支付通行费。

twig［twɪg］

n. 细枝，嫩枝

例　Some insects will mimic a twig when in danger. 有些昆虫在面临危险时会伪装成树枝的样子。

联　wig n. 假发；swig v. 大喝，痛饮

twine［twaɪn］

v. 搓；编织；（使）缠绕〈同　twist, intertwine〉

例　The python is a snake that twines around its prey before swallowing it. 巨蟒是一种蛇，它会先缠绕猎物，然后再将其吞下。





tycoon［taɪ'ku:n］

n. 大企业家，大亨〈同　magnate, entrepreneur〉

例　John D. Rockefeller was a prominent tycoon. 约翰·D. 洛克菲勒是一位杰出的企业界大亨。

tyrannical［tɪ'rænɪkəl］

adj. 暴虐的，残暴的〈同　dictatorial, domineering, authoritarian〉

例　The tyrannical king was merciless and let no one stand in his way. 那个残暴的国王非常冷酷无情，绝不允许任何人阻挡他的道路。

记　来自名词tyranny（暴虐，残暴）+cal→残暴的

联　tyrant n. 暴君；tyrannize v. 施行暴政；tyro n. 新手

第三部分

ultimatum［ˌʌltɪ'meɪtəm］

n. 最后通牒〈同　last offer〉

例　Since they have ignored our ultimatum, our only recourse is to declare war. 既然他们对我们的最后通牒视而不见，我们唯一的手段就是宣战。

ultrasonic［ˌʌltrə'sɒnɪk］

adj. 超音速的，超声（波）的〈同　supersonic〉

例　Bats use ultrasonic waves to locate flying insects at night. 蝙蝠利用超声波在夜间定位飞行的昆虫。

记　ultra（超出，超过）+sonic（音速的）→超音速的

联　ultrasonics n. 超音波学；sonic adj. 声音的；sonata n. 奏鸣曲；sonorous adj. 洪亮的；supersonic adj. 超声波的；dissonant adj. 不和谐的；resonant adj. 回响的，共鸣的

unanimity［ˌju:nə'nɪməti］

n. 全体一致，一致同意〈同　concord, consensus, harmony〉

例　We were surprised by the unanimity with which our proposals were accepted by the different groups. 我们的提案竟然被不同群体一致同意接受，这令我们很是吃惊。

联　unanimous adj. 全体意见一致的

unbiased［ʌn'baɪəst］

adj. 没有偏见的〈同　impartial, fair〉

例　The unbiased mediator helped solve the contract dispute. 那名公正的调停者帮助解决了合同纠纷。

unbridgeable［ʌn'brɪʤbəl］

adj. 不能架桥的；不可逾越的〈同　impassable, insurmountable〉

例　The differences between the wife and husband were unbridgeable, so they decided to file for divorce. 这对夫妻之间有无法逾越的分歧，所以他们决定申请离婚。





unbridled［ʌn'braɪdəld］

adj. 放纵的，无约束的〈同　uncontrolled, wild〉

例　His unbridled anger eventually drove his wife away. 他无法抑制的愤怒最终逼走了他的妻子。

unbroken［ʌn'brəʊkən］

adj. 完整的；持续的〈同　uninterrupted, intact〉

例　The longest unbroken border in the world is that between Canada and the United States. 世界上最长的连续边界线在加拿大与美国之间。

underdeveloped［ˌʌndədɪ'veləpt］

adj. 不发达的〈同　backward, undeveloped〉

例　Our country has spent billions of dollars to help the underdeveloped areas improve their standard of living. 我们国家投入数十亿美元，帮助欠发达地区提高生活标准。

undergraduate［ˌʌndə'grædjʊɪt］

n.（尚未取得学位的）大学生

例　Most undergraduates take four years to earn a degree. 大多数本科生都要花四年时间才能取得学位。

联　graduate n.（大学的）毕业生；研究生；postgraduate n. 研究生

underscore［ˌʌndə'skɔ:(r)］

vt. 画线于…下；强调〈同　emphasize, stress〉

例　When we take notes, our teacher wants us to underscore items that are especially important. 我们在记笔记的时候，老师希望我们在特别重要的条目下画线。

联　underline vt. 画线于…下；强调；underbred adj. 没教养的；undergird vt. 巩固，加强；underpin vt. 巩固，加强

自我检测　从第三部分中选出最适当的词填入空格内。

18. Because of his high scores, he was the only ______ permitted into the graduate-level laboratory project.

19. The prospective jurors（陪审员）need to be uninformed of the case in order to have an ______ opinion.

20. The boat used ______ radar to identify submarines.

21. The many ______ industries represent a great potential of opportunities for the country.

22. The thief gave him an ______ to either give him his money or be shot.

23. There is rarely a case where ______ is reached between two rival parties.



第四部分

undertaking［ˌʌndə'teɪkɪŋ］

n. 任务；事业〈同　project; enterprise〉

例　A dinner party for thirty people is a large undertaking. 30人的晚宴可是一项大工程。

underwater［ˌʌndə'wɔ:tə(r)］

adj. 在水下的，在水中的〈同　submarine, submerged〉

例　Atlantis became an underwater city after it was completely flooded. 亚特兰蒂斯被彻底淹没后，成为一个水下城市。

undo［ʌn'du:］

v. ①解开，松开〈同　free, loosen〉

例　He undid his shoelaces and took his shoes off before walking inside. 他解开鞋带，脱下鞋，然后走了进去。

②使恢复原状；取消，抹掉〈同　reverse; annul〉

例　lt will take months to undo the damage caused by the disgruntled employee. 要挽回心怀不满的员工造成的损失，需要几个月的时间。

联　undoing n. 解开；毁灭；undone adj. 未完成的；解开的；unfasten v. 解开，放松

unearth［ʌn'ɜ:θ］

vt. 发掘，挖出；揭露；发现〈同　dig up; discover〉

例　The digging of the scientists unearthed a buried city. 科学家们的挖掘发现了一座被埋葬的城市。

记　un（不）+earth（地）→不在地下→挖出

联　unearthly adj. 非尘世的，神秘的；earthly adj. 现世的，俗世的；earthy adj. 泥土的；朴实的；earthenware n. 土器，陶器

unfair［ˌʌn'feə(r)］

adj. 不公平的〈同　unjust, biased〉

例　The defendant argued with the judge that the decision was unfair. 被告与法官辩论，称判决不公平。

unmatched［ˌʌn'mætʃt］

adj. 无可匹敌的〈同　unequaled, unparalleled, peerless〉

例　The company's record sales this month were unmatched by any of its competitors. 该公司本月的唱片销量是其任何一个竞争对手都无法匹敌的。

unpack［ˌʌn'pæk］

v. 打开包裹（或行李等）〈同　unwrap, unfold〉

例　She unpacked her clothes from her suitcase when she arrived at the hotel room. 她到了酒店房间后，便从行李箱里取出自己的衣服。





unprecedented［ʌn'presɪdentɪd］

adj. 前所未有的，空前的〈同　unexampled, unparalleled〉

例　George's consumption of 10,677 hot dogs was unprecedented; no one had ever eaten so many before. 乔治吃掉了10,677个热狗，真是史无前例；之前从没有人能吃这么多。

记　un（没有）+precedent（先例；pre［前的］+ced［走］+ent→走在前面的东西→先例）+ed→前所未有的

联　precedent n. 先例；antecedent adj. 在先的，先行的；precede v. 先于；procedure n. 程序；proceed vi. 前进；进行

unravel［ʌn'rævəl］

v. ①弄清楚（秘密）〈同　discover, solve〉

例　The detective unraveled the mystery. 侦探解开了谜团。

②拆开；解开；松开〈同　unwind, untangle〉

例　Anne unraveled the old sweater because she needed the yarn. 安妮拆了那件旧毛衣，因为她需要纱线。

记　un（不）+ravel（纠缠）→使不再纠缠在一起→解开

联　rave v. 咆哮；disentangle v. 解脱，解开纠结；unsnarl vt. 解开（纠纷等）；清理；unknot vt. 解开（结子）

unrestrained［ˌʌnrɪ'streɪnd］

adj. 无限制的〈同　free, unbridled〉

例　The unrestrained pollution has prompted the government to spend billions of dollars for environmental protection. 无限制的污染促使政府投入数十亿美元用于环境保护。

自我检测　从第四部分中选出最适当的词填入空格内。

24. Snowfall in April in that city is ______.

26. It was a large ______ for her mother to be solely responsible for the large wedding party.

27. The birthday girl was so anxious to ______ her presents that she just ripped them open.

28. With a smoking gun in his hand and a dead body on the ground, it was too late and the crime could not be ______.

29. The student's mathematical skills were ______ by anyone and she won first place in the math contest.

预备测验

找出与句子中划线单词意义最相近的词。

1. Woods are important in the conservation of water and wildlife.

(A) Swamps

(B) Canyons

(C) Forests

2. The economy of this nation has come to a stop since the upheaval.

(A) bump

(B) vendor

(C) violent disturbance

3. In order to maintain physical wellbeing, a person should eat wholesome food and get sufficient exercise.

(A) healthful

(B) fresh

(C) well cooked

4. The compact dictionaries published in recent years are not as unwieldy as some of the older editions.

(A) complete

(B) tiresome

(C) cumbersome

5. Once upon a time, the Spanish, French, Dutch, and English all vied for North American territory.

(A) arrived on

(B) competed for

(C) disposed of



第一部分

unscrupulous［ʌn'skru:pjʊləs］

adj. 肆无忌惮的；无道德原则的〈同　unprincipled, immoral〉

例　The unscrupulous student cheated on the test. 那名肆无忌惮的学生竟然在考试中作弊。

记　un（不）+scrupulous（小心的）→肆无忌惮的

联　scrupulous adj. 小心谨慎的；scruple n./v. 顾忌，迟疑；unscrewed adj. 未扭紧的；scrutiny n. 详细审查





unsophisticated［ˌʌnsə'fɪstɪkeɪtɪd］

adj. 不懂世故的，单纯的〈同　naive, innocent〉

例　A child's view of the world is usually unsophisticated. 孩子的世界观通常非常单纯。

unwieldy［ʌn'wi:ldi］

adj. 笨拙的；（因太大、太重、形状奇特等而）不易被移动的，笨重的〈同　awkward; heavy〉

例　The unwieldy package was expensive to mail overseas. 向海外邮寄这个笨重的包裹，价格非常昂贵。

记　un（不）+wieldy（支配的，控制的）→不可控制的→笨重的

联　wield vt. 使用；awkward adj. 笨拙的；clumsy adj. 笨拙的；ungainly adj. 难看的；笨手笨脚的；cumbersome adj. 笨重的；unmanageable adj. 无法控制的

upheaval［ʌp'hi:vəl］

n. 剧变，动乱〈同　disturbance, explosion〉

例　The recent layoffs have caused a great upheaval within the corporation. 最近的裁员在公司内造成了动荡。

upright［'ʌpraɪt］

adj. ①垂直的；直立的〈同　vertical; erect〉

例　He was sitting upright in his hospital bed, propped up by pillows. 他用枕头支撑着身体，直直地坐在医院的病床上。

②正直的；诚实的〈同　honest〉

例　The upright politician refused to accept the bribe. 那名正直的政治家拒绝接受贿赂。

uproar［'ʌprɔ:(r)］

n. 喧嚣，骚动〈同　commotion, turmoil〉

例　The car crash caused an uproar throughout the neighborhood. 车祸在整个社区造成了骚动。

uproot［ˌʌp'ru:t］

v. ①连根拔起，拔除〈同　pull up, displace〉

例　It is easier to destroy weeds with a chemical than to uproot them by hand. 用化学药品除去杂草，比用手拔草要容易得多。

②根除，灭绝；赶出家园，被迫移开〈同　abolish, eradicate〉

例　After a year of unsuccessful business, the manager uprooted the company and moved the offices to another city. 经过一年不成功的经营，公司负责人对公司进行了彻底重建，并将办公室搬到了另外一个城市。

upside-down［ˌʌpsaɪd'daʊn］

adj. 颠倒的〈同　inverted〉

例　Bats like to sleep upside-down. 蝙蝠喜欢倒挂着睡觉。

utilitarian［ˌjʊtɪlɪ'teərɪən］

adj. 功利的；实利的〈同　practical, useful〉

例　She was not a utilitarian shopper and always wasted money on things that were unnecessary or worthless. 她并不是实用主义的购物者，经常把钱浪费在不需要或没有价值的东西上。

记　来自名词utility（效用，功用）+arian→功利的

联　utilize vt. 利用

utmost［'ʌtməʊst］

adj. 极度的；最大程度的；最远的〈同　extreme, greatest〉

例　Jack's employer gave his utmost recommendation for Jack's application. 杰克的雇主对他的申请进行了极力推荐。

自我检测　从第一部分中选出最适当的词填入空格内。

6. Many families were ______ from their homes by the flood.

7. I have the ______ respect for his accomplishments.

8. The ______ businessman was convicted of corporate fraud.

9. The controversial movie caused an ______ of public criticism.

10. He prefers ______ automobiles to showy ones.

11. The pie fell ______ on the floor.



第二部分

vanity［'vænɪti］

n. 虚荣，自负〈同　conceit, arrogance〉

例　The vanity of the rich friends was evident in their conversation about who had the most money. 这些富有的朋友们在谈论谁最有钱时，他们的虚荣心表现得一览无余。

varnish［'vɑ:nɪ∫］

vt. 涂上清漆，粉饰〈同　lacquer, glaze〉

例　The wooden porch was varnished to protect it from bad weather. 木制门廊被涂了漆，以保护其免受恶劣天气的侵蚀。

n. 清漆

例　The carpenter used a whole bottle of varnish for the wooden boat he built. 木匠在他建造的木船上涂了一整瓶清漆。

venom［'venəm］

n. ①（蛇的）毒液〈同　poison〉

例　He tied a rope around the snake bite so the venom wouldn't reach his heart. 他在被蛇咬的伤口周围绑上了一根绳子，这样毒液就不会进入他的心脏了。

②恶意，怨恨〈同　spite, malice〉

例　They spoke of their enemies with venom. 他们用恶毒的话谈论敌人。

联　venomed adj. 恶毒的，含有恶意的；venomous adj. 有毒的；venous adj. 静脉的

vertebrate［'vɜ:tɪbreɪt; -brət］

n./adj. 脊椎动物（的）

例　Vertebrates are animals that have a spinal column. 脊椎动物是长有脊柱的动物。

联　invertebrate n./adj. 无脊椎动物（的）

vestige［'vestɪʤ］

n. 痕迹，遗迹，残余〈同　remnant, remains〉

例　We discovered vestiges of early Indian life in the cave. 我们在山洞里发现了早期印第安人生活的痕迹。

联　investigation n. 调查；investigate v. 调查；investigative adj. 研究的；vest n. 背心

viable［'vaɪəbəl］

adj. ①可行的，切实可行的〈同　feasible, practicable〉

例　After high expenses and no profit for a year, the company's only viable solution was to file for bankruptcy. 经过一年的高开支和零利润，这家公司唯一可行的解决方案就是申请破产。

②能活下去的〈同　alive, growing〉

例　The infant, though born prematurely, is viable and has a good chance to survive. 那个婴儿虽然是早产，但依然能够存活，生存下来的机会很大。

记　via（道路）+(a)ble→有路可走→可行的

联　viability n. 生存能力；发育能力

vibrant［'vaɪbrənt］

adj. 活泼的；生气勃勃的〈同　lively, energetic〉

例　His mother advised he get enough sleep so he can be vibrant in the morning for his interview. 他妈妈建议他保持充足的睡眠，这样在参加上午面试的时候他才能精神饱满。





vie［vaɪ］

v. 竞争〈同　compete, rival〉

例　Light vies with darkness. 光明与黑暗针锋相对。

联　via prep. 通过，经由；vice n. 恶习，恶行

vigilance［'vɪʤɪləns］

n. 警戒，警惕〈同　watchfulness, caution〉

例　Constant vigilance is necessary in order to avoid car accidents. 为了避免车祸，始终保持警觉是很有必要的。

viscosity［vɪs'kɒsəti］

n. 黏度，黏性〈同　viscidity, stickiness〉

例　The mechanic's hands were always dirty, mostly because of the viscosity of oil. 那名技工的双手总是很脏，这很大程度上是由于油的黏性。

联　viscous adj. 黏滞的，黏性的

12. Put another coat of ______ on that table to protect it.

13. The ______ of the palace that was burnt down was preserved as a part of a historical museum.

14. The sink was stopped up by the ______ of the food that was put in it.

15. She liked to flirt because the responses she got appealed to her ______.

16. Two athletes ______ for first place in the competition.

17. Because of the poisonous snakes, they exercised ______ when they went walking in the jungle.



第三部分

virtue［'vɜ:tju:］

n. 美德〈同　merit, goodness〉

例　Mr. Bao is the incarnation of virtue; he has never done anything wrong since he was born. 鲍先生就是美德的化身；他自从出生以来，从未做过任何错事。

联　virtually adv. 事实上，实质上；virtuosity n. 艺术鉴别力

vista［'vɪstə］

n. 景色〈同　outlook, view〉

例　The vista from the top of the mountain is majestic. 从山顶看到的景色非常雄伟壮丽。

记　vis（看）+ta→看到的东西→景色

联　visa n. 签证 vt. 签准；签发（护照）

volatile［'vɒlətaɪl; (US)-təl］

adj. ①挥发性的〈同　evaporable〉

例　Alcohol is an example of a volatile liquid. 酒精是一种典型的挥发性液体。

②可变的，不稳定的〈同　unstable, changeable〉

例　The boss was very volatile in the morning and all his employees would avoid him then. 老板在早上的时候情绪非常不稳定，所以所有员工在那个时间都避开他。

voracious［və'reɪ∫əs］

adj. 狼吞虎咽的，贪婪的〈同　greedy, insatiable〉

例　The wolf is a voracious animal; its hunger is never satisfied. 狼是一种贪婪的动物；它的饥饿永远得不到满足。

记　vor（吃）+acious→吃得多的→贪婪的

联　vociferous adj. 大声的，嘈杂的

walkout［'wɔ:kaʊt］

n. 罢工〈同　strike〉

例　After the walkout, the workers and the company officials held negotiations to resolve the situation. 罢工结束后，工人们和公司领导进行了谈判，以解决当前的问题。

wane［weɪn］

vi. 减少；衰落〈同　decline, dwindle〉

例　The fame of celebrities often starts to wane. 名人的名气经常会开始减弱。

联　wade v. 跋涉，涉水；cane n. 手杖，藤条；lane n. 小巷；pane n. 窗格玻璃；sane adj. 健全的；bane n. 毒药；祸害

warrior［'wɒrɪə(r); (US)'wɔ:rɪər］

n. 战士，勇士〈同　fighter, combatant〉

例　The warrior fought bravely on the battleground. 那位战士在战场上英勇奋战。

记　war（战争）+rior→战斗的人→战士

联　warship n. 军舰，战船；wartime n. 战时；warworn adj. 疲于战争的





wary［'weəri］

adj. 小心翼翼的，机警小心的〈同　cautious, discreet〉

例　Marilyn's mother told her to be wary of strangers. 玛丽莲的妈妈告诉她要提防陌生人。

联　warily adv. 留心地，小心地，警惕地

weird［wɪəd］

adj. 怪诞的，奇异的〈同　queer, strange〉

例　She looked weird with that horrible makeup on her face. 她脸上糟糕的妆容让她看起来非常奇怪。

联　wield vt. 挥舞；weld v. 焊接；uncanny adj. 离奇的；eerie adj. 怪诞的，可怕的

well-being［'welbi:ɪŋ］

n. 安宁；福利〈同　welfare, benefit〉

例　The many foreign investments improved the well-being of the country's economy. 众多国外投资促进了该国经济的健康发展。

第四部分

whim［wɪm; (US)hwɪm］

n. 心血来潮；怪念头〈同　impulse, caprice〉

例　People were uncertain about her whim to marry that rich old fellow. 人们无法确信她要嫁给那个有钱老男人的怪念头。

联　whimsical adj. 反复无常的；古怪的；whimmy adj. 异想天开的；心血来潮的

wholesale［'həʊlseɪl］

adj. ①批发的

例　A rise in the wholesale prices precedes a sharp increase in the retail level. 批发价格上涨之后，零售价格也开始大幅上涨。

②大规模的〈同　large-scale〉

例　Many people were angered by the wholesale slaughter of birds. 许多人被大批捕杀鸟类的行为激怒了。

记　whole（完整，未被破坏）+sale（出售）→批发的

联　wholesaler n. 批发商；retail n./v. 零售；salesclerk n. 店员；salesman n. 售货员，推销员

wholesome［'həʊlsəm］

adj. 身心健康的；朝气蓬勃的〈同　healthful, beneficial〉

例　Janet is not really pretty, but her sparkling personality and wholesome charm make her very attractive. 珍妮特其实并不漂亮，但她活泼的个性和朝气蓬勃的魅力让她非常迷人。

wildlife［'waɪldlaɪf］

n. 野生动植物〈同　wilding〉

例　The forest was preserved as a national park for the sake of the rare wildlife in it. 那片森林被评为国家公园，以保护里面的稀有野生动植物。

witty［'wɪti］

adj. 机智的；风趣的〈同　clever; humorous〉

例　The politician always started his speeches with a witty joke in order to get the audience smiling. 为了引观众发笑，那个政治家的演讲总会以一个诙谐的笑话开场。

woods［wʊdz］

n. 森林，树林〈同　forest, woodland〉

例　The man liked to go to the woods on the weekends to hunt for deer. 那个男人喜欢周末去树林里猎鹿。

联　cottonwood n.【植】三叶杨，棉白杨；softwood n. 软木材

wring［rɪŋ］

vt. 绞，拧，扭〈同　twist, squeeze〉

例　I wrung the water out of the sponge and wiped the counter. 我拧出海绵里的水，然后用它擦柜台。

联　wringer n. 绞干器；wrinkle n. 皱纹；wrench n. 扳手 v. 猛扭，绞痛；writhe v.（因巨痛而）扭动身体

yardstick［'jɑ:dstɪk］

n. 码尺；准绳〈同　standard〉

例　He used a yardstick to measure the size of the room. 他用码尺来测量房间的大小。

联　yardman n. 园丁；yardmeasure n. 码尺；matchstick n. 火柴杆；stickpin n. 领带夹

zenith［'zenɪθ］

n. 顶点，顶峰〈同　pinnacle, peak〉

例　Bill Clinton reached the zenith of his career in 1992. 1992年，比尔·克林顿达到了职业的巅峰。





zigzag［'zɪgzæg］

adj. ①曲折的〈同　sinuous〉

例　Life today is nervous, sharp, and zigzag. 如今的生活紧张、快速、曲折。

②锯齿形的，Z字形的〈同　jagged〉

例　Our journey lay through the zigzag path through the woods. 我们的行程是沿一条蜿蜒的小路穿过树林。

记　字母“Z”和中文“之”形似，给人以曲折的直观感觉

联　crooked adj. 弯曲的，扭曲的；crank n. 曲柄；jagged adj. 凹口的，锯齿状的；serrated adj. 锯齿状的；indented adj. 锯齿状的

(B) imaginary

(C) striped



42. The North American fur trade waned in the early 1800's mainly due to the diminishing number of fur-bearing animals.

(A) staggered

(B) ceased

(C) declined



43. In the period between 1941 and 1946, labor leader John L. Lewis called at least nine walkouts of his 400,000 soft-coal miners in order to win new contracts.

(A) meetings

(B) strikes

(C) outings



44. The Cheyenne Indians were considered spectacular riders and fierce warriors.

(A) hunters

(B) defenders

(C) fighters



45. The venom of coral snakes is especially potent and the mortality rate among humans who have been bitten is high.

(A) rattles

(B) teeth

(C) poison



46. The conservation research project will concentrate on wildlife habitats in the forest.

(A) tropical

(B) wilding

(C) regional



47. At the zenith of her career in the 1930's Dorothy Thompson was one of the best-known journalists in the United States.

(A) completion

(B) pinnacle

(C) outset



48. A playwright of note, Cornelia Otis Skinner was also the author of witty essays and light verse.

(A) humorous

(B) lenthy

(C) practical



Exercise 3　从第二栏中选出第一栏各词的同义词。
