Lesson 51





音频



Group 170: tempo, tempor=time “时间；时间引起的现象”

temporary［'tempərəri］

adj. 短暂的，暂时的

解　lasting for a short time only; used for the time being; not permanent

例　Although bad times may seem never-ending, they are temporary just like everything else. 虽然糟糕的境遇似乎无休无止，但是它们和所有事情一样，都是暂时的。

extemporize［ɪk'stempəraɪz］

v. 即兴（发言、创作、演奏或演说）

解　to perform without preparation; provide something roughly for an immediate need

例　He is the kind of speaker who is more effective when he extemporizes than when he reads from a prepared script. 他是那种作即兴演说比照着事先准备好的演说稿念有感染力的演讲者。

构　ex (=out) + tempor (=time) + ize

extemporaneous［ɪkˌstempə'reɪnjəs］

adj. ① 即席的，即兴的 ② 临时的，权宜的

解　① carried out or performed with little or no preparation; impromptu ② provided, made, or adapted as an expedient; makeshift

例　He was surprised to have spoken so eloquently in the extemporaneous speech. 他惊讶地发现自己在作即兴演讲时竟然如此地富有表现力。

tempo［'tempəʊ］

n. （音乐）速度，拍子

解　the speed at which a composition is to be played

例　Professional dancers can naturally move to the rhythm and tempo of the music. 专业舞蹈家会自然地跟着音乐的节拍和旋律起舞。



Group 171: tend, tent, tens=stretch “伸展”

tension［'tenʃən］

n. ① 紧张 ② 张力

解　① mental, emotional, or nervous strain ② a force tending to stretch or elongate sth.

例　The tension of the bow gives speed to the arrow. 弓的张力使箭产生速度。

extensive［ɪk'stensɪv］

adj. 广大的，广阔的，广泛的

解　of great extent; far-reaching; large

例　Your script has some excellent ideas, but it will need extensive revision if it is to be used as the class play. 你的剧本中有一些非常棒的点子，但是如果要把它用做班级戏剧的剧本，你还需要作大量的修改。

构　ex (=out) + tens (=to stretch) + ive

distend［dɪ'stend］

v. （使）膨胀，胀大

解　to stretch out; to swell out; to expand

例　The balloon distended almost to the bursting point. 气球膨胀得快要爆炸了。

同　distention n. 膨胀；延伸





intensify［ɪn'tensɪfaɪ］

vt. 加强，强化

解　to increase in extent or intensity; to make more intense, stronger, or more marked

例　The heat of the sunny day intensified when the clouds evaporated. 云散去后，天空晴朗，气温也升高了。

同　intense adj. 激烈的；intensity n. 紧张；强烈，剧烈

ostensible［ɒs'tensəbəl; -sɪbəl］

adj. 表面上的，伪装的

解　according to appearances; apparent; pretended

例　My ostensible purpose for going to the library was to study, but I was really reading magazines. 我去图书馆表面上是为了学习，但实际上是看杂志。

ostentatious［ˌɒsten'teiʃəs］

adj. 做作的，虚荣的，炫耀的

解　done for unnecessary display; liking to attract notice; showy

例　The real hero is modest, never ostentatious. 真正的英雄很谦逊，从来不炫耀。

同　ostentation n. 夸示，炫耀

pretentious［prɪ'tenʃəs］

adj. 自负的，夸耀的；自抬身价的

解　making claims to excellence or importance

例　The pretentious artist claimed his paintings had made millions even when they had not earned him a single penny. 这位艺术家自抬身价，声称他的画作已经给他带来了数百万元的收入，而实际上它们没有为他赚来分文。

同　pretension n. 自命不凡；pretense n. 借口；虚假，自负

构　pre (=before) + tent (=to stretch) + ious



Group 172: viv, vit=live; life “活泼的；生命”

revive［rɪ'vaɪv］

v. 苏醒，复活，复兴

解　to come or bring back to consciousness, strength, health or an earlier state

例　The lifeguard tried to revive the woman who was drowning. 救生员努力让溺水的女士苏醒过来。

近　revise v. 修改

构　re (=again) + viv (=to live, life) + e

revitalize［ri:'vaɪtəlaɪz］

v. 使复活，使新生，使重新充满活力

解　to give new life or vigor to

例　The President released a new plan to revitalize the troubled economy. 总统颁布了一项新的计划来使陷入低谷的经济复苏。

同　revitalization n. 新生，复兴

survival［sə'vaɪvəl］

n. 幸存

解　living

例　Survival is the most basic instinct in animals. 生存是动物最基本的本能。

vitality［vaɪ'tæləti］

n. 活力，生命力，体力

解　vital force; power to live

例　One's vitality can be lessened by illness. 生病会削弱人的体力。





vitalize［'vaɪtəlaɪz］

v. ① 赋予…生命 ② 给予…活力 ③ 鼓舞

解　① to give life to ② to put vitality into

③ to make more energetic, lively, or enterprising

例　The cartoonist vitalized the drawing of a mouse called Mickey into one of the most famous icons in the world. 这位漫画家将一只名叫米奇的老鼠画得栩栩如生，使它成为了世界上最著名的漫画形象之一。

vitiate［'vɪʃɪeɪt］

v. ① 削弱，损害，使无效 ② 使（在道德方面）败坏

解　① to reduce the value or impair the quality of ② to corrupt morally

例　Fraud will vitiate the contract. 欺诈会使合同失效。

convivial［kən'vɪvɪəl］

adj. 欢宴的，欢乐的

解　merry; festive

例　The convivial celebrators of the victory sang their college songs. 庆祝胜利的人们欢快地唱起了他们大学的校歌。

构　con (=together) + viv (=to live) + ial



其他与“活泼的，生机勃勃的”意义有关的词汇

activate v. 激发，使活泼；加速反应

animated adj. 有生命的，活泼的；栩栩如生的

animation n. 兴奋，活跃

brisk adj. 轻快的，活泼的

sprightly adj. 愉快的，活泼的

vibrant adj. 振动的；明快的，生机勃勃的

exuberant adj. （人）充满活力的；（植物）茂盛的

racy adj. 活泼的，生动的
